Name: Aberrate
Short Description: Subject becomes an aberration.

Name: Ability Rip
Short Description: Rips a supernatural ability from one creature and transfer it to another.

Name: Ablative Armor
Short Description: Reduce damage from next attack by 5 + caster level (max 15).

Name: Aboleth Curse
Short Description: Subject's skin undergoes a horrible transformation.

Name: Abolish Shadows
Short Description: Shadow creatures take 1d6/level damage, shadow and darkness spells might be dispelled.
Medium Description: Shadow creatures take 1d6/level damage, shadow and darkness spells might be dispelled.

Name: Absorb Mind
Short Description: You gain 25% chance of knowing information in a brain eaten.

Name: Absorb Strength
Short Description: You gain 1/4 of a creature's Str and Con when he eats it.

Name: Absorb Weapon
Effect: One touched weapon not in another creature's possession
Short Description: Hides a weapon inside your arm.

Name: Absorption
Short Description: You absorb 1d4+6 spell levels directed at you.

Name: Abyssal Army
Effect: Two or more summoned creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Summons demons to fight for you.

Name: Abyssal Might
Short Description: You gain +2 to Str, Con, Dex, and SR.

Name: Accelerated Movement
Short Description: Swift. Balance, Climb, Hide, Move Silently, and Tumble at normal speed with no penalty on skill check.

Name: Accuracy
Effect: One thrown weapon/level touched or one projectile weapon touched
Short Description: Doubles ranged weapon's range increments.

Name: Acid Arrow
Short Description: Ranged touch attack; 2d4 damage for 1 round +1 round/three levels.
Medium Description: Ranged touch attack; 2d4 acid damage for 1 round +1 round/three levels.
Long Descripton: A magical arrow of acid springs from your hand and speeds to its target. You must succeed on a ranged touch attack to hit your target. The arrow deals 2d4 points of acid damage with no splash damage. For every three caster levels (to a maximum of 18th), the acid, unless somehow neutralized, lasts for another round, dealing another 2d4 points of damage in that round.

Name: Acid Breath
Short Description: Cone of acid deals 1d6 damage/level.
Medium Description: 1d6/caster level acid damage in a cone.

Name: Acid Dart
Short Description: Energy bolt deals 1d3 acid damage.
Long Descripton: You fire a small dart made of acid at the target, requiring a successful ranged touch attack. The spell deals 1d3 acid damage and no splash damage.

Name: Acid Fog
Effect: Fog spreads in 20-ft. radius, 20 ft. high
Short Description: Fog deals acid damage.
Medium Description: Fog deals 2d6 acid damage per round.
Long Descripton: Acid fog creates a billowing mass of misty vapors similar to that produced by a solid fog spell. In addition to slowing creatures down and obscuring sight, this spell's vapors are highly acidic. Each round on your turn, starting when you cast the spell, the fog deals 2d6 points of acid damage to each creature and object within it.

Name: Acid Glove
Short Description: Touch attack deals 1d6 acid damage.
Long Descripton: Your hand is coated with a thin layer of acid, which you can use to damage creatures, requiring a successful melee touch attack. The spell deals 1d6 acid damage.

Name: Acid Rain
Duration: 1 full round and 1 round/level; see text
Short Description: 20-ft.-radius cylinder deals 7d6 acid damage

Name: Acid Sheath
Short Description: Sheath of acid damages those who attack you, improves acid spell damage.
Medium Description: Sheath of acid damages those who attack you (2/caster level, max 30), lets you make touch attacks.

Name: Acid Splash
Short Description: Orb deals 1d3 acid damage.
Long Descripton: You fire a small orb of acid at the target. You must succeed on a ranged touch attack to hit your target. The orb deals 1d3 points of acid damage.

Name: Acid Storm
Short Description: Deals 1d6/level acid damage in 20-ft radius.
Medium Description: Deals 1d6/level acid damage (Max 15d6) in 20-ft radius.

Name: Acidic Curse
Short Description: See Text

Name: Acorn of Far Travel
Short Description: Makes an acorn feel like a forest to the user and a spell.

Name: Adamantine Weapon
Short Description: Transform weapon into adamantine.

Name: Addiction
Short Description: Subject becomes addicted to a drug.

Name: Aerial Alacrity
Short Description: +30 ft. fly speed, +1 AC and Reflex saves while flying, maneuverability improves by one category.

Name: Aerial Alarm
Short Description: Wards and area for 2 hours/level

Name: Aerial Summoning Dance
Short Description: You and four aarakocra summon a Large air elemental.

Name: Affliction
Short Description: Infects evil subject with chosen affliction.

Name: Aganazzar's Scorcher
Effect: 5-ft.-wide path to close range (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)
Short Description: Deal 1d8/2 levels (max 5d8) fire damage to a line.

Name: Aid
Short Description: +1 on attack rolls and saves against fear, 1d8 temporary hp +1/level (max +10).
Long Descripton: Aid grants the target a +1 morale bonus on attack rolls and saves against fear effects, plus temporary hit points equal to 1d8 + caster level (to a maximum of 1d8+10 temporary hit points at caster level 10th).

Name: Aid, Mass
Effect: One or more creatures, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Allies gain +1 on attack rolls, +1 against fear, 1d8 temporary hp +1/level (max +15).

Name: Aiming at the Target
Duration: Concentration, up to 20 minutes; see text
Short Description: Grants a +10 circumstance bonus to Concentration checks for a spell you are concentrating on already.

Name: Aiming Line
Short Description: Create an aiming line for +2 bonus to hit with touch attacks, target gains the same benefit vs. you.
Long Descripton: You create a faint illusory line between yourself and one creature within range, which requires a successful ranged touch attack. This line causes no damage and does not illuminate an area. The spell ends if you no longer have line of effect between yourself and the target.[lf][lf]Any ranged touch attacks you make against the target gain a +2 circumstance bonus to hit, and concealment for these attacks is treated as one category less. If the target is an invisible creature, the line pinpoints the square for you (negating the need to choose a square to attack). Because the line is a visible illusion, it has no effect in darkness unless you can otherwise see in darkness (such as with darkvision) or if you cannot see the line because you are blind.[lf][lf]Because the spell also indicates a direct line to you, the target gains the same benefits against you that you do against it. The target may attempt to disbelieve the illusion as normal, but successful disbelief has no effect on the spell's benefits (the translucent outline of the revealed illusion works just as well as the illusion itself).

Name: Air Breathing
Short Description: Subjects can breathe air freely.

Name: Air Walk
Short Description: Subject treads on air as if solid (climb at 45-degree angle).
Long Descripton: The subject can tread on air as if walking on solid ground. Moving upward is similar to walking up a hill. The maximum upward or downward angle possible is 45 degrees, at a rate equal to one-half the air walker's normal speed.[lf][lf]A strong wind (21+ mph) can push the subject along or hold it back. At the end of its turn each round, the wind blows the air walker 5 feet for each 5 miles per hour of wind speed. The creature may be subject to additional penalties in exceptionally strong or turbulent winds, such as loss of control over movement or physical damage from being buffeted about.[lf][lf]Should the spell duration expire while the subject is still aloft, the magic fails slowly. The subject floats downward 60 feet per round for 1d6 rounds. If it reaches the ground in that amount of time, it lands safely. If not, it falls the rest of the distance, taking 1d6 points of damage per 10 feet of fall. Since dispelling a spell effectively ends it, the subject also descends in this way if the air walk spell is dispelled, but not if it is negated by an antimagic field.[lf][lf]You can cast air walk on a specially trained mount so it can be ridden through the air. You can train a mount to move with the aid of air walk (counts as a trick; see Handle Animal skill) with one week of work and a DC 25 Handle Animal check.

Name: Airy Water
Short Description: Turn normal water into a breathable substance; negate underwater movement and melee attack penalties.

Name: Alarm
Effect: 20-ft.-radius emanation centered on a point in space
Short Description: Wards an area for 2 hours/level.
Long Descripton: Alarm sounds a mental or audible alarm each time a creature of Tiny or larger size enters the warded area or touches it. A creature that speaks the password (determined by you at the time of casting) does not set off the alarm. You decide at the time of casting whether the alarm will be mental or audible.[lf][lf]Mental Alarm: A mental alarm alerts you (and only you) so long as you remain within 1 mile of the warded area. You note a single mental "ping" that awakens you from normal sleep but does not otherwise disturb concentration. A silence spell has no effect on a mental alarm.[lf][lf]Audible Alarm: An audible alarm produces the sound of a hand bell, and anyone within 60 feet of the warded area can hear it clearly. Reduce the distance by 10 feet for each interposing closed door and by 20 feet for each substantial interposing wall.[lf][lf]In quiet conditions, the ringing can be heard faintly as far as 180 feet away. The sound lasts for 1 round. Creatures within a silence spell cannot hear the ringing.[lf][lf]Ethereal or astral creatures do not trigger the alarm.

Name: Alarm, Greater
Effect: 25-ft.-radius emanation centered on a point in space
Short Description: As the Alarm spell, and it works on creatures on neighboring planes.

Name: Alert Bebilith
Short Description: Summons bebilith to deal with a demon.

Name: Algid Enhancement
Short Description: Grant bonuses to creatures of the cold subtype.

Name: Alicorn Lance
Short Description: Gain a unicorn's horn that can be a ranged touch attack to strike a foe once as a free action for 3d6 force damage.

Name: Align Fang
Short Description: Natural weapon becomes good, evil, lawful, or chaotic.

Name: Align Fang, Mass
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: This spell functions like align fang, except that it affects multiple allies at a distance.

Name: Align Weapon
Effect: Weapon touched or fifty projectiles (all of which must be in contact with each other at the time of casting)
Short Description: Weapon becomes good, evil, lawful, or chaotic.
Long Descripton: Align weapon makes a weapon good, evil, lawful, or chaotic, as you choose. A weapon that is aligned can bypass the damage reduction of certain creatures. This spell has no effect on a weapon that already has an alignment.[lf][lf]You can't cast this spell on a natural weapon, such as an unarmed strike.[lf][lf]When you make a weapon good, evil, lawful, or chaotic, align weapon is a good, evil, lawful, or chaotic spell, respectively.

Name: Align Weapon, Mass
Effect: One weapon/level, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Allies' weapons become good, evil, lawful, or chaotic.

Name: Aligned Aura
Effect: 20-ft.-radius emanation or 60-ft.-radius burst, centered on you
Short Description: Grant combat bonuses to like-aligned allies and impose penalties on creatures of opposing alignment.

Name: Allegro
Effect: Creatures within a 20-ft. radius burst, centered on you
Short Description: You and your allies gain +30 ft. speed for 1 minute/level.

Name: Alter Self
Short Description: Assume form of a similar creature.
Long Descripton: You assume the form of a creature of the same type as your normal form. The new form must be within one size category of your normal size. The maximum HD of an assumed form is equal to your caster level, to a maximum of 5 HD at 5th level. You can change into a member of your own kind or even into yourself.[lf][lf]You retain your own ability scores. Your class and level, hit points, alignment, base attack bonus, and base save bonuses all remain the same. You retain all supernatural and spell-like special attacks and qualities of your normal form, except for those requiring a body part that the new form does not have (such as a mouth for a breath weapon or eyes for a gaze attack).[lf][lf]You keep all extraordinary special attacks and qualities derived from class levels, but you lose any from your normal form that are not derived from class levels.[lf][lf]If the new form is capable of speech, you can communicate normally. You retain any spell-casting ability you had in your original form, but the new form must be able to speak intelligibly (that is, speak a language) to use verbal components and must have limbs capable of fine manipulation to use somatic or material components.[lf][lf]You acquire the physical qualities of the new form while retaining your own mind. Physical qualities include natural size, mundane movement capabilities (such as burrowing, climbing, walking, swimming, and flight with wings, to a maximum speed of 120 feet for flying or 60 feet for non-flying movement), natural armor bonus, natural weapons (such as claws, bite, and so on), racial skill bonuses, racial bonus feats, and any gross physical qualities (presence or absence of wings, number of extremities, and so forth). A body with extra limbs does not allow you to make more attacks (or more advantageous two-weapon attacks) than normal.[lf][lf]You do not gain any extraordinary special attacks or special qualities not noted above under physical qualities, such as darkvision, low-light vision, blindsense, blindsight, fast healing, regeneration, scent, and so forth.[lf][lf]You do not gain any supernatural special attacks, special qualities, or spell-like abilities of the new form. Your creature type and subtype (if any) remain the same regardless of your new form. You cannot take the form of any creature with a template, even if that template doesn't change the creature type or subtype.[lf][lf]You can freely designate the new form's minor physical qualities (such as hair color, hair texture, and skin color) within the normal ranges for a creature of that kind. The new form's significant physical qualities (such as height, weight, and gender) are also under your control, but they must fall within the norms for the new form's kind. You are effectively disguised as an average member of the new form's race. If you use this spell to create a disguise, you get a +10 bonus on your Disguise check.[lf][lf]When the change occurs, your equipment, if any, either remains worn or held by the new form (if it is capable of wearing or holding the item), or melds into the new form and becomes nonfunctional. When you revert to your true form, any objects previously melded into the new form reappear in the same location on your body they previously occupied and are once again functional. Any new items you wore in the assumed form and can't wear in your normal form fall off and land at your feet; any that you could wear in either form or carry in a body part common to both forms at the time of reversion are still held in the same way. Any part of the body or piece of equipment that is separated from the whole reverts to its true form.

Name: Alustriel's Banner
Effect: Figment of a banner and sound of a trumpet or horn
Short Description: Create a minor image of a banner that is illuminated to guide and light.

Name: Amanuensis
Short Description: Copy nonmagical text.

Name: Amber Sarcophagus
Short Description: Trap target in stasis sphere w/ hardness 5 and 10 hp/caster level.

Name: Ambient Song
Short Description: Masks bardic music effects as other sounds.

Name: Amorphous Form
Short Description: Subject becomes puddle-like and can slip through cracks quickly.

Name: Amplify
Effect: 20-ft.-radius emanation centered on a creature, object, or point in space
Short Description: Lowers Listen DC by 20.

Name: Analyze Dweomer
Effect: One object or creature per caster level
Saving Throw: None or Will negates; see text
Short Description: Reveals magical aspects of subject.
Long Descripton: You discern all spells and magical properties present in a number of creatures or objects. Each round, you may examine a single creature or object that you can see as a free action. In the case of a magic item, you learn its functions, how to activate its functions (if appropriate), and how many charges are left (if it uses charges). In the case of an object or creature with active spells cast upon it, you learn each spell, its effect, and its caster level.[lf][lf]An attended object may attempt a Will save to resist this effect if its holder so desires. If the save succeeds, you learn nothing about the object except what you can discern by looking at it. An object that makes its save cannot be affected by any other analyze dweomer spells for 24 hours.[lf][lf]Analyze dweomer does not function when used on an artifact.

Name: Analyze Portal
Effect: A quarter circle emanating from you to the extreme of the range.
Short Description: Detects and analyzes portals within 60 ft.

Name: Analyze Touchstone
Effect: A quarter circle emanating from you to the extreme of the range
Short Description: Find a nearby planar touch-stone and discover its properties.

Name: Anarchic Storm
Short Description: Chaotic-aligned rain falls in 20-ft. radius.

Name: Anarchic Water
Short Description: Makes chaotic-aligned anarchic water.

Name: Anathema
Effect: One creature of the same faith as the spellcaster
Short Description: Break the divine link between your god and lower-ranked members of your faith.

Name: Ancient Knowledge
Short Description: Gain a +5 insight bonus on a single Knowledge check.

Name: Angelskin
Short Description: The subject gains damage reduction 5/evil.

Name: Anger of the Noonday Sun
Effect: All sighted creatures within a 20-ft.-radius burst centered on you
Short Description: Blinds creatures within 20 ft.

Name: Angry Ache
Short Description: Subject takes -2/4 levels (max -10) penalty on attack rolls.

Name: Animal Growth
Effect: Up to one animal (Gargantuan or smaller) per two levels, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: One animal/two levels doubles in size.
Long Descripton: A number of animals grow to twice their normal size and eight times their normal weight. This alteration changes each animal's size category to the next largest, grants it a +8 size bonus to Strength and a +4 size bonus to Constitution (and thus an extra 2 hit points per HD), and imposes a -2 size penalty to Dexterity. The creature's existing natural armor bonus increases by 2. The size change also affects the animal's modifier to AC and attack rolls and its base damage. The animal's space and reach change as appropriate to the new size, but its speed does not change.[lf][lf]The spell also grants each subject damage reduction 10/magic and a +4 resistance bonus on saving throws. If insufficient room is available for the desired growth, the creature attains the maximum possible size and may make a Strength check (using its increased Strength) to burst any enclosures in the process. If it fails, it is constrained without harm by the materials enclosing it - the spell cannot be used to crush a creature by increasing its size.[lf][lf]All equipment worn or carried by an animal is similarly enlarged by the spell, though this change has no effect on the magical properties of any such equipment.[lf][lf]Any enlarged item that leaves the enlarged creature's possession instantly returns to its normal size.[lf][lf]The spell gives no means of command or influence over the enlarged animals.[lf][lf]Multiple magical effects that increase size do not stack.

Name: Animal Messenger
Short Description: Sends a Tiny animal to a specific place.
Long Descripton: You compel a Tiny animal to go to a spot you designate. The most common use for this spell is to get an animal to carry a message to your allies. The animal cannot be one tamed or trained by someone else, including such creatures as familiars and animal companions.[lf][lf]Using some type of food desirable to the animal as a lure, you call the animal to you. It advances and awaits your bidding. You can mentally impress on the animal a certain place well known to you or an obvious landmark. The directions must be simple, because the animal depends on your knowledge and can't find a destination on its own. You can attach some small item or note to the messenger. The animal then goes to the designated location and waits there until the duration of the spell expires, whereupon it resumes its normal activities.[lf][lf]During this period of waiting, the messenger allows others to approach it and remove any scroll or token it carries. The intended recipient gains no special ability to communicate with the animal or read any attached message (if it's written in a language he or she doesn't know, for example).

Name: Animal Shapes
Effect: Up to one willing creature per level, all within 30 ft. of each other
Short Description: One ally/level polymorphs into chosen animal.
Long Descripton: As polymorph, except you polymorph up to one willing creature per caster level into an animal of your choice; the spell has no effect on unwilling creatures. All creatures must take the same kind of animal form. Recipients remain in the animal form until the spell expires or until you dismiss it for all recipients. In addition, an individual subject may choose to resume its normal form as a full-round action; doing so ends the spell for that subject alone. The maximum HD of an assumed form is equal to the subject's HD or your caster level, whichever is lower, to a maximum of 20 HD at 20th level.

Name: Animal Trance
Effect: Animals or magical beasts with Intelligence 1 or 2
Short Description: Fascinates 2d6 HD of animals.
Long Descripton: Your swaying motions and music (or singing, or chanting) compel animals and magical beasts to do nothing but watch you. Only a creature with an Intelligence score of 1 or 2 can be fascinated by this spell. Roll 2d6 to determine the total number of HD worth of creatures that you fascinate. The closest targets are selected first until no more targets within range can be affected.[lf][lf]A magical beast, a dire animal, or an animal trained to attack or guard is allowed a saving throw; an animal not trained to attack or guard is not.

Name: Animalistic Power
Short Description: Subject gains +2 bonus to Str, Dex, and Con.

Name: Animate Breath
Short Description: Your breath weapon becomes an elemental.

Name: Animate City
Short Description: City structures attack, slow down enemies.

Name: Animate Dead
Short Description: Creates undead skeletons and zombies.
Long Descripton: This spell turns the bones or bodies of dead creatures into undead skeletons or zombies that follow your spoken commands.[lf][lf]The undead can follow you, or they can remain in an area and attack any creature (or just a specific kind of creature) entering the place. They remain animated until they are destroyed. (A destroyed skeleton or zombie can't be animated again.)[lf][lf]Regardless of the type of undead you create with this spell, you can’t create more HD of undead than twice your caster level with a single casting of animate dead. (The desecrate spell doubles this limit)[lf][lf]The undead you create remain under your control indefinitely. No matter how many times you use this spell, however, you can control only 4 HD worth of undead creatures per caster level. If you exceed this number, all the newly created creatures fall under your control, and any excess undead from previous castings become uncontrolled. (You choose which creatures are released.) If you are a cleric, any undead you might command by virtue of your power to command or rebuke undead do not count toward the limit.[lf][lf]Skeletons: A skeleton can be created only from a mostly intact corpse or skeleton. The corpse must have bones. If a skeleton is made from a corpse, the flesh falls off the bones. [lf][lf]Zombies: A zombie can be created only from a mostly intact corpse. The corpse must be that of a creature with a true anatomy.

Name: Animate Dead Familiar
Short Description: Revives your dead familiar as an undead familiar.

Name: Animate Dread Warrior
Short Description: Transform dead skilled warrior into undead monster you control.

Name: Animate Fire
Short Description: Turn campfire into Small fire elemental.

Name: Animate Instrument
Short Description: Your instrument animates and plays by itself.
Medium Description: Your instrument animates and plays by itself, freeing you to perform other actions.

Name: Animate Legion
Effect: One or more corpses, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart.
Short Description: Creates skeletons or zombies.

Name: Animate Objects
Effect: One Small object per caster level; see text
Short Description: Objects attack your foes.
Long Descripton: You imbue inanimate objects with mobility and a semblance of life. Each such animated object then immediately attacks whomever or whatever you initially designate.[lf][lf]An animated object can be of any non-magical material. You may animate one Small or smaller object or an equivalent number of larger objects per caster level. A Medium object counts as two Small or smaller objects, a Large object as four, a Huge object as eight, a Gargantuan object as sixteen, and a Colossal object as thirty-two. You can change the designated target or targets as a move action, as if directing an active spell.[lf][lf]This spell cannot animate objects carried or worn by a creature.[lf][lf]Animate objects can be made permanent with a permanency spell.

Name: Animate Plants
Effect: One Large plant per three caster levels or all plants within range; see text
Short Description: One or more trees animate and fight for you.
Long Descripton: You imbue inanimate plants with mobility and a semblance of life. Each animated plant then immediately attacks whomever or whatever you initially designate as though it were an animated object of the appropriate size category. You may animate one Large or smaller plant, or an equivalent number of larger plants, per three caster levels. A Huge plant counts as two Large or smaller plants, a Gargantuan plant as four, and a Colossal plant as eight. You can change the designated target or targets as a move action, as if directing an active spell.[lf][lf]Use the statistics for animated objects, except that plants smaller than Large usually don't have hardness.[lf][lf]Animate plants cannot affect plant creatures, nor does it affect nonliving vegetable material.[lf][lf]Entangle: Alternatively, you may imbue all plants within range with a degree of mobility, which allows them to entwine around creatures in the area. This usage of the spell duplicates the effect of an entangle spell. Spell resistance does not keep creatures from being entangled. This effect lasts 1 hour per caster level.

Name: Animate Rope
Effect: One ropelike object, length up to 50 ft. + 5 ft./level; see text
Short Description: Makes a rope move at your command.
Long Descripton: You can animate a nonliving ropelike object. The maximum length assumes a rope with a 1-inch diameter.[lf][lf]Reduce the maximum length by 50% for every additional inch of thickness, and increase it by 50% for each reduction of the rope's diameter by half.[lf][lf]The possible commands are "coil" (form a neat, coiled stack), "coil and knot," "loop," "loop and knot," "tie and knot," and the opposites of all of the above ("uncoil," and so forth). You can give one command each round as a move action, as if directing an active spell.[lf][lf]The rope can enwrap only a creature or an object within 1 foot of it - it does not snake outward - so it must be thrown near the intended target. Doing so requires a successful ranged touch attack roll (range increment 10 feet). A typical 1- inch-diameter hempen rope has 2 hit points, AC 10, and requires a DC 23 Strength check to burst it. The rope does not deal damage, but it can be used as a trip line or to cause a single opponent that fails a Reflex saving throw to become entangled. A creature capable of spell-casting that is bound by this spell must make a DC 15 Concentration check to cast a spell. An entangled creature can slip free with a DC 20 Escape Artist check.[lf][lf]The rope itself and any knots tied in it are not magical.[lf][lf]This spell grants a +2 bonus on any Use Rope checks you make when using the transmuted rope.[lf][lf]The spell cannot animate objects carried or worn by a creature.

Name: Animate Siege Weapon
Effect: One siege weapon of up to gargantuan size
Short Description: Siege weapon attacks your foes

Name: Animate Snow
Effect: Up to a 20-ft. cube of snow
Short Description: Turns snow into creatures to fight for you.

Name: Animate Water
Effect: Up to a 5-ft. cube of water
Short Description: Turn quantity of water into Small water elemental.

Name: Animate Wood
Effect: One Small or smaller wooden object
Short Description: This spell imbues a Small or smaller wooden object with mobility and a semblance of life.

Name: Anticipate Teleportation
Effect: 5-ft./level radius emanation from willing touched creature
Short Description: Delays teleporting creatures 1 round within range.

Name: Anticipate Teleportation, Greater
Effect: 5-ft./level radius emanation from willing touched creature
Short Description: As anticipate teleportation, except for three rounds and types of creatures.

Name: Anticold Sphere
Short Description: Mobile energy field provides immunity to cold.

Name: Antidragon Aura
Effect: One creature/2 levels, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Allies gain bonus to AC and saves against dragons.

Name: Antifire Sphere
Short Description: Creatures within sphere gain immunity to fire damage.

Name: Antilife Shell
Short Description: 10-ft. field hedges out living creatures.
Long Descripton: You bring into being a mobile, hemispherical energy field that prevents the entrance of most types of living creatures.[lf][lf]The effect hedges out animals, aberrations, dragons, fey, giants, humanoids, magical beasts, monstrous humanoids, oozes, plants, and vermin, but not constructs, elementals, outsiders, or undead.[lf][lf]This spell may be used only defensively, not aggressively. Forcing an abjuration barrier against creatures that the spell keeps at bay collapses the barrier.

Name: Antimagic Aura
Short Description: Antimagic field that affects one creature.

Name: Antimagic Field
Short Description: Negates magic within 10 ft.
Long Descripton: An invisible barrier surrounds you and moves with you. The space within this barrier is impervious to most magical effects, including spells, spell-like abilities, and supernatural abilities. Likewise, it prevents the functioning of any magic items or spells within its confines.[lf][lf]An antimagic field suppresses any spell or magical effect used within, brought into, or cast into the area, but does not dispel it. Time spent within an antimagic field counts against the suppressed spell's duration.[lf][lf]Summoned creatures of any type and incorporeal undead wink out if they enter an antimagic field. They reappear in the same spot once the field goes away. Time spent winked out counts normally against the duration of the conjuration that is maintaining the creature. If you cast antimagic field in an area occupied by a summoned creature that has spell resistance, you must make a caster level check (1d20 + caster level) against the creature's spell resistance to make it wink out. (The effects of instantaneous conjurations are not affected by an antimagic field because the conjuration itself is no longer in effect, only its result.)[lf][lf]A normal creature can enter the area, as can normal missiles. Furthermore, while a magic sword does not function magically within the area, it is still a sword (and a masterwork sword at that). The spell has no effect on golems and other constructs that are imbued with magic during their creation process and are thereafter self-supporting (unless they have been summoned, in which case they are treated like any other summoned creatures). Elementals, corporeal undead, and outsiders are likewise unaffected unless summoned. These creatures' spell-like or supernatural abilities, however, may be temporarily nullified by the field. Dispel magic does not remove the field.[lf][lf]Two or more antimagic fields sharing any of the same space have no effect on each other. Certain spells, such as wall of force, prismatic sphere, and prismatic wall, remain unaffected by antimagic field (see the individual spell descriptions). Artifacts and deities are unaffected by mortal magic such as this. [lf][lf]Should a creature be larger than the area enclosed by the barrier, any part of it that lies outside the barrier is unaffected by the field.

Name: Antimagic Ray
Short Description: Target loses all magical powers.

Name: Antipathy
Effect: One location (up to a 10-ft. cube/level) or one object
Short Description: Object or location affected by spell repels certain creatures.
Long Descripton: You cause an object or location to emanate magical vibrations that repel either a specific kind of intelligent creature or creatures of a particular alignment, as defined by you. The kind of creature to be affected must be named specifically. A creature subtype is not specific enough. Likewise, the specific alignment to be repelled must be named.[lf][lf]Creatures of the designated kind or alignment feel an overpowering urge to leave the area or to avoid the affected item.[lf][lf]A compulsion forces them to abandon the area or item, shunning it and never willingly returning to it while the spell is in effect. A creature that makes a successful saving throw can stay in the area or touch the item but feels uncomfortable doing so. This distracting discomfort reduces the creature's Dexterity score by 4 points.[lf][lf]Antipathy counters and dispels sympathy.

Name: Antiplant Shell
Short Description: Keeps animated plants at bay.
Long Descripton: The antiplant shell spell creates an invisible, mobile barrier that keeps all creatures within the shell protected from attacks by plant creatures or animated plants. As with many abjuration spells, forcing the barrier against creatures that the spell keeps at bay strains and collapses the field.

Name: Anyspell
Short Description: You can read and prepare up to a 2nd-level arcane spell from a scroll or spellbook in a 3rd-level domain spell slot.

Name: Anyspell, Greater
Short Description: As anyspell, but you can read and prepare any arcane spell up to 5th level in a 6th-level domain spell slot.

Name: Apocalypse from the Sky
Short Description: All in a 10-mile radius/level take 10d6 damage.
Medium Description: All in a 10-mile radius/level take 10d6 fire, acid, or sonic damage.

Name: Apparition
Short Description: Cause foes to become shaken when seeing subject disfigured creature.

Name: Appraising Touch
Short Description: Grants a bonus on Appraise skill checks.

Name: Aquatic Escape
Short Description: Take the form of a fish.
Medium Description: Turn into a fish, swim speed 30', Listen+4, Spot+4, Swim+13.

Name: Arc of Lightning
Short Description: Line of electricity between two creatures (1d6/level damage).
Medium Description: Line of lightning between 2 creatures deals 1d6/level (max 15d6) electricity damage to all in the line.

Name: Arcana Form
Short Description: Become incorporeal and cast spells with your hit points and constitution.

Name: Arcane Bolt
Effect: Up to five creatures, no two of which can be more than 15 ft. apart
Short Description: Launch force bolts (1 + 1/two levels above 1st) at targets for 1d6 + 1 each.

Name: Arcane Eye
Short Description: Invisible floating eye moves 30 ft./round.
Long Descripton: You create an invisible magical sensor that sends you visual information. You can create the arcane eye at any point you can see, but it can then travel outside your line of sight without hindrance. An arcane eye travels at 30 feet per round (300 feet per minute) if viewing an area ahead as a human would (primarily looking at the floor) or 10 feet per round (100 feet per minute) if examining the ceiling and walls as well as the floor ahead. It sees exactly as you would see if you were there.[lf][lf]The eye can travel in any direction as long as the spell lasts. Solid barriers block its passage, but it can pass through a hole or space as small as 1 inch in diameter. The eye can't enter another plane of existence, even through a gate or similar magical portal.

Name: Arcane Lock
Effect: The door, chest, or portal touched, up to 30 sq. ft./level in size
Short Description: Magically locks a portal or chest.
Long Descripton: An arcane lock spell cast upon a door, chest, or portal magically locks it. You can freely pass your own arcane lock without affecting it; otherwise, a door or object secured with this spell can be opened only by breaking in or with a successful dispel magic or knock spell. Add 10 to the normal DC to break open a door or portal affected by this spell. (A knock spell does not remove an arcane lock; it only suppresses the effect for 10 minutes.)

Name: Arcane Lock, Improved
Effect: Door, chest, or portal touched, up to 30 sq. ft./level in size
Short Description: As arcane lock, except you may attune 1 additional individual per level.

Name: Arcane Mark
Effect: One personal rune or mark, all of which must fit within 1 sq. ft.
Short Description: Inscribes a personal rune (visible or invisible).
Long Descripton: This spell allows you to inscribe your personal rune or mark, which can consist of no more than six characters. The writing can be visible or invisible. An arcane mark spell enables you to etch the rune upon any substance without harm to the material upon which it is placed. If an invisible mark is made, a detect magic spell causes it to glow and be visible, though not necessarily understandable.[lf][lf]See invisibility, true seeing, a gem of seeing, or a robe of eyes likewise allows the user to see an invisible arcane mark. A read magic spell reveals the words, if any. The mark cannot be dispelled, but it can be removed by the caster or by an erase spell.[lf][lf]If an arcane mark is placed on a living being, normal wear gradually causes the effect to fade in about a month.[lf][lf]Arcane mark must be cast on an object prior to casting instant summons on the same object (see that spell description for details).

Name: Arcane Seal
Effect: The door, chest, or portal touched, up to 30 sq. ft./level in size
Short Description: Magically seals a door, portal or chest.

Name: Arcane Sight
Short Description: Magical auras become visible to you.
Medium Description: See arcane/divine auras plus max strength to 120' w/o concentration. DC 15+spell level Spellcraft to determine school for spells, 15 + 1/2 CL for nonspell effects.
Long Descripton: This spell makes your eyes glow blue and allows you to see magical auras within 120 feet of you. The effect is similar to that of a detect magic spell, but arcane sight does not require concentration and discerns aura location and power more quickly.[lf][lf]You know the location and power of all magical auras within your sight. An aura's power depends on a spell's functioning level or an item's caster level, as noted in the description of the detect magic spell. If the items or creatures bearing the auras are in line of sight, you can make Spellcraft skill checks to determine the school of magic involved in each. (Make one check per aura; DC 15 + spell level, or 15 + one-half caster level for a nonspell effect.)[lf][lf]If you concentrate on a specific creature within 120 feet of you as a standard action, you can determine whether it has any spellcasting or spell-like abilities, whether these are arcane or divine (spell-like abilities register as arcane), and the strength of the most powerful spell or spell-like ability the creature currently has available for use.[lf][lf]Arcane sight can be made permanent with a permanency spell.

Name: Arcane Sight, Greater
Short Description: As arcane sight, but also reveals magic effects on creatures and objects.
Long Descripton: This spell makes your eyes glow blue and allows you to see magical auras within 120 feet of you. The effect is similar to that of a detect magic spell, but arcane sight does not require concentration and discerns aura location and power more quickly.[lf][lf]You know the location and power of all magical auras within your sight. An aura's power depends on a spell's functioning level or an item's caster level, as noted in the description of the detect magic spell. If the items or creatures bearing the auras are in line of sight, you can make Spellcraft skill checks to determine the school of magic involved in each. (Make one check per aura; DC 15 + spell level, or 15 + one-half caster level for a nonspell effect.)[lf][lf]If you look at a specific creature within 120 feet of you, you can determine whether it has any spellcasting or spell-like abilities, whether these are arcane or divine (spell-like abilities register as arcane), and the strength of the most powerful spell or spell-like ability the creature currently has available for use.[lf][lf]This spell cannot be made permanent with a permanency spell.

Name: Archon's Focus
Short Description: Your mind goes into overdrive and you can cast an additional spell of lower level per round, provided any material components are in hand before casting.
Long Descripton: Your mental focus sharpens drastically, permitting you to safely rush the casting of spells that do not overly stress your magical potential. Beginning with the round after this spell is cast, each round you may cast one spell as a free action that provokes attacks of opportunity and cannot be cast defensively. It is not a quickened spell and does not count toward the regular limit of one quickened spell per round.[lf][lf][lf][lf]This secondary spell is cast as if your caster level were eight levels lower than normal. Spells (including metamagic-enhanced spells) which would be unavailable to a caster of this level are likewise unavailable when using this ability. Spells with a casting time longer than 1 standard action cannot be cast using archon's focus.[lf][lf][lf][lf]Archon's focus only increases your mental speed, not your physical dexterity. As a result, spells which use material components or focus items cannot be cast unless those items were present in your hands prior to casting. If you have already cast another spell that did not require material components or focus items during the round, it is acceptable to ready the components for your second spell during the casting of the first.

Name: Arctic Haze
Effect: Fog spreads in a 30-ft. radius, 20 ft. high
Short Description: Fog obscures vision and deals 4 cold damage/round.

Name: Armageddon
Effect: 2 or more summoned creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Summon 2d4 avorals rnd 1, a ghaele eladrin rnd 3, and an astral deva rnd 5.

Name: Armor Enhancement
Short Description: Armor or shield gains special ability with +3 bonus market price modifier.

Name: Armor Enhancement, Greater
Short Description: Armor or shield gains special ability with +5 bonus market price modifier.

Name: Armor Enhancement, Lesser
Short Description: Armor or shield gains special ability with +1 bonus market price modifier.

Name: Armor Lock
Short Description: Target's armor becomes restrictive, slowing movement to 10 ft.
Medium Description: Target's (non-natural) armor slows movement to 10 ft.

Name: Armor of Darkness
Short Description: Shroud grants deflection bonus, darkvision, and other effects.
Medium Description: Shadowy shroud provides +4 deflection bonus +1/three levels (max +8) to AC and +2 bonus on saves against holy good, or light effects.
Long Descripton: The shroud grants the subject a +4 deflection bonus to Armor Class plus an additional +1 for every three caster levels above 7th (for a total of +5 at 10th level, +6 at 13th, +7 at 16th, to a maximum of +8 at 19th level.). The subject can see through the armor as if it did not exist and is also afforded darkvision with a range of 60 feet. Finally, the subject gains a +2 saving throw bonus against any holy, good, or light spells or effects.[lf][lf]Undead creatures that are subjects of armor of darkness also gain +4 turn resistance.

Name: Arms of Plenty
Short Description: Grow two additional arms.

Name: Arrow Mind
Short Description: Immediate. You threaten nearby squares with your bow and fire without provoking attacks of opportunity.

Name: Arrow of Bone
Effect: One projectile or thrown weapon touched
Short Description: Creates a killer missile or thrown weapon, or deals 3d6 +1 (max +20) damage on successful save.
Medium Description: Creates a killer missile or thrown weapon, or deals 3d6 +1 (max +20) cold damage on successful save.

Name: Arrow Storm
Short Description: Swift. You make one ranged attack against each foe within one range increment.

Name: Arrowsplit
Short Description: Transform a masterwork arrow or bolt mid-flight into 1d4+1 masterwork missiles.

Name: Ashen Union
Saving Throw: Fortitude half and Fortitude partial; see text
Short Description: Drains moisture from a creature, possibly killing it and destroying its body.

Name: Ashstar
Short Description: Hovering construct dehydrates a wounded creature.

Name: Aspect of the Earth Hunter
Short Description: Change into bulette and gain some of its abilities.

Name: Aspect of The Werebeast
Short Description: Gain bonuses from hybrid animal form.

Name: Aspect of the Wolf
Short Description: You change into a wolf and gain some of its abilities.

Name: Assassin's Darkness
Short Description: Globe of pure darkness blocks all sight but your own.
Medium Description: Globe of darkness blocks all sight but your own. Creatures seeing in magical darkness are unaffected.

Name: Assay Spell Resistance
Short Description: Gain +10 bonus to caster level checks for spell resistance against one creature.

Name: Astral Hospice
Short Description: While on the Astral Plane, open a portal to a demiplane so natural healing can occur.

Name: Astral Projection
Effect: You plus one additional willing creature touched per two caster levels
Short Description: Projects you and companions onto Astral Plane.
Long Descripton: By freeing your spirit from your physical body, this spell allows you to project an astral body onto another plane altogether.[lf][lf]You can bring the astral forms of other willing creatures with you, provided that these subjects are linked in a circle with you at the time of the casting. These fellow travelers are dependent upon you and must accompany you at all times. If something happens to you during the journey, your companions are stranded wherever you left them.[lf][lf]You project your astral self onto the Astral Plane, leaving your physical body behind on the Material Plane in a state of suspended animation. The spell projects an astral copy of you and all you wear or carry onto the Astral Plane. Since the Astral Plane touches upon other planes, you can travel astrally to any of these other planes as you will. To enter one, you leave the Astral Plane, forming a new physical body (and equipment) on the plane of existence you have chosen to enter.[lf][lf]While you are on the Astral Plane, your astral body is connected at all times to your physical body by a silvery cord. If the cord is broken, you are killed, astrally and physically. Luckily, very few things can destroy a silver cord. When a second body is formed on a different plane, the incorporeal silvery cord remains invisibly attached to the new body. If the second body or the astral form is slain, the cord simply returns to your body where it rests on the Material Plane, thereby reviving it from its state of suspended animation. Although astral projections are able to function on the Astral Plane, their actions affect only creatures existing on the Astral Plane; a physical body must be materialized on other planes.[lf][lf]You and your companions may travel through the Astral Plane indefinitely. Your bodies simply wait behind in a state of suspended animation until you choose to return your spirits to them. The spell lasts until you desire to end it, or until it is terminated by some outside means, such as dispel magic cast upon either the physical body or the astral form, the breaking of the silver cord, or the destruction of your body back on the Material Plane (which kills you).

Name: Atonement
Components: V, S, M, F, DF, XP
Short Description: Removes burden of misdeeds from subject.
Long Descripton: This spell removes the burden of evil acts or misdeeds from the subject. The creature seeking atonement must be truly repentant and desirous of setting right its misdeeds. If the atoning creature committed the evil act unwittingly or under some form of compulsion, atonement operates normally at no cost to you. However, in the case of a creature atoning for deliberate misdeeds and acts of a knowing and willful nature, you must intercede with your deity (requiring you to expend 500 XP) in order to expunge the subject's burden. Many casters first assign a subject of this sort a quest (see geas/quest) or similar penance to determine whether the creature is truly contrite before casting the atonement spell on its behalf.[lf][lf]Atonement may be cast for one of several purposes, depending on the version selected.[lf][lf]Reverse Magical Alignment Change: If a creature has had its alignment magically changed, atonement returns its alignment to its original status at no cost in experience points.[lf][lf]Restore Class: A paladin who has lost her class features due to committing an evil act may have her paladinhood restored to her by this spell.[lf][lf]Restore Cleric or Druid Spell Powers: A cleric or druid who has lost the ability to cast spells by incurring the anger of his or her deity may regain that ability by seeking atonement from another cleric of the same deity or another druid. If the transgression was intentional, the casting cleric loses 500 XP for his intercession. If the transgression was unintentional, he does not lose XP.[lf][lf]Redemption or Temptation: You may cast this spell upon a creature of an opposing alignment in order to offer it a chance to change its alignment to match yours. The prospective subject must be present for the entire casting process. Upon completion of the spell, the subject freely chooses whether it retains its original alignment or acquiesces to your offer and changes to your alignment. No duress, compulsion, or magical influence can force the subject to take advantage of the opportunity offered if it is unwilling to abandon its old alignment. This use of the spell does not work on outsiders or any creature incapable of changing its alignment naturally.[lf][lf]Though the spell description refers to evil acts, atonement can also be used on any creature that has performed acts against its alignment, whether those acts are evil, good, chaotic, or lawful.[lf][lf]Note: Normally, changing alignment is up to the player. This use of atonement simply offers a believable way for a character to change his or her alignment drastically, suddenly, and definitively.

Name: Attract Fine Vermin
Short Description: Attract a normal vermin to you.
Long Descripton: You give off a faint scent that is undetectable to humanoids but attractive to normal (not monstrous) vermin. 1d10 rounds after casting this spell, one Fine vermin (at least 1/4 inch long) of a type common to the area arrives and crawls or flies into your square. The vermin has no hostile intent toward you and will crawl or fly onto your hand if you extend it. The creature is not compelled to remain, is not under your control, and unless fed or captured it probably leaves within a minute of its arrival.[lf][lf]Typical vermin that might appear include flies, spiders, bees, wasps, ants, centipedes, beetles, praying mantises, or scorpions.

Name: Attune Form
Short Description: Grant target creature temporary protection against overtly damaging planar traits.

Name: Augment Familiar
Short Description: Your familiar becomes more powerful.

Name: Augment Object
Effect: Object of up to 200 cubic ft./level
Short Description: Doubles an object's hardness, adds 20 to the break DC, and grants a save as a magic item.

Name: Augury
Short Description: Learns whether an action will be good or bad.
Long Descripton: An augury can tell you whether a particular action will bring good or bad results for you in the immediate future.[lf][lf]The base chance for receiving a meaningful reply is 70% + 1% per caster level, to a maximum of 90%; this roll is made secretly. A question may be so straightforward that a successful result is automatic, or so vague as to have no chance of success. If the augury succeeds, you get one of four results:[lf][lf] Weal (if the action will probably bring good results).[lf][lf] Woe (for bad results).[lf][lf] Weal and woe (for both).[lf][lf] Nothing (for actions that don't have especially good or bad results).[lf][lf]If the spell fails, you get the "nothing" result. A cleric who gets the nothing result has no way to tell whether it was the consequence of a failed or successful augury.[lf][lf]The augury can see into the future only about half an hour, so anything that might happen after that does not affect the result. Thus, the result might not take into account the long-term consequences of a contemplated action. All auguries cast by the same person about the same topic use the same dice result as the first casting.

Name: Aura Against Flame
Short Description: Ignores 10 fire damage/attack and extinguish fires.

Name: Aura of Cold, Greater
Short Description: Intense cold deals 2d6 damage to creatures within 10 ft.
Medium Description: Intense cold deals 2d6 damage to creatures within 10 ft.

Name: Aura of Cold, Lesser
Short Description: Intense cold deals 1d6 damage to creatures within 5 ft.
Medium Description: Intense cold deals 1d6 damage to creatures within 5 ft.

Name: Aura of Evasion
Short Description: All within 10 ft. gain evasion against breath weapons.

Name: Aura of Glory
Short Description: Bonus on Charisma-based skill checks, cure allies, and bolster them against fear.

Name: Aura of Terror
Short Description: You gain an aura of fear, or your frightful presence becomes more effective.

Name: Aura of the Sun
Short Description: Fills an area with light that damages undead and hampers magical darkness.

Name: Aura of Vitality
Effect: One creature/3 levels, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Targets receive a +4 morale bonus to Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution scores.

Name: Avalanche of Devastation
Short Description: Rolling bludgeoning damage deals 8d6 in 40-ft. long segments of a code per round of concentration.
Medium Description: Rolling bludgeoning damage deals 8d6 in 40-ft. long segments of a cone per round of concentration.

Name: Avascular Mass
Saving Throw: Fortitude partial and Reflex negates; see text
Short Description: Reduce foe to half hp and stun foe for 1 round by purging blood vessels, which can trap creatures in 20-ft. radius from victim.

Name: Avasculate
Short Description: Reduce foe to half hp and stun foe for 1 round by purging blood vessels.

Name: Avoid Planar Effects
Effect: One creature/level in a 20-ft.-radius burst centered on you
Short Description: Provides temporary protection against overtly damaging planar traits.

Name: Awaken
Short Description: Animal or tree gains human intellect.
Long Descripton: You awaken a tree or animal to humanlike sentience. To succeed, you must make a Will save (DC 10 + the animal's current HD, or the HD the tree will have once awakened).[lf][lf]The awakened animal or tree is friendly toward you. You have no special empathy or connection with a creature you awaken, although it serves you in specific tasks or endeavors if you communicate your desires to it.[lf][lf]An awakened tree has characteristics as if it were an animated object, except that it gains the plant type and its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores are each 3d6. An awakened plant gains the ability to move its limbs, roots, vines, creepers, and so forth, and it has senses similar to a human's.[lf][lf]An awakened animal gets 3d6 Intelligence, +1d3 Charisma, and +2 HD. Its type becomes magical beast (augmented animal). An awakened animal can't serve as an animal companion, familiar, or special mount.[lf][lf]An awakened tree or animal can speak one language that you know, plus one additional language that you know per point of Intelligence bonus (if any).

Name: Awaken Construct
Short Description: Awakens a humanoid-shaped construct to humanlike sentience.

Name: Awaken Sand
Short Description: A region of sand forms into a Huge, sentient creature.

Name: Awaken Sin
Short Description: Subject faces its sins, takes 1d6 nonlethal damage/level (10d6 max).

Name: Awaken Undead
Effect: All mindless undead within a circle 25 ft. in radius + 5 ft./2 levels
Short Description: Grant sentience to otherwise mindless undead.

Name: Awaken, Mass
Effect: One animal or tree/3 levels, no two of which may be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: As awaken, but multiple creatures.

Name: Axiomatic Creature
Effect: One corporeal creature of lawful or neutral alignment that is native to the Material Plane.
Short Description: Transforms creature into an axiomatic creature.

Name: Axiomatic Storm
Short Description: Lawful-aligned rain falls in 20-ft. radius.

Name: Axiomatic Water
Short Description: Makes lawful-aligned axiomatic water.

Name: Ayailla's Radiant Burst
Short Description: Blind evil creatures and do 1d6/2 levels damage (max 5d6)
Medium Description: Blind evil creatures and do 1d6/2 levels divine damage (max 5d6)

Name: Babau Slime
Short Description: Secrete a body-covering acid that damages foes' weapons.
Medium Description: Secrete a body-covering acid that does 1d8 acid damage to weapons of foes.

Name: Backbiter
Duration: 1 round/level or until discharged, whichever comes first
Short Description: Cause two handed or reach weapon to strike is wielder.

Name: Backblast
Duration: 10 min./level (D) or until expended; see text
Short Description: Grants fire resistance 10 and functions like spell turning with respect to spells with the fire descriptor that are targeted on you.

Name: Backlash
Short Description: Subject takes damage if it uses spells against another creature.

Name: Balancing Lorecall
Short Description: You gain a +4 bonus on Balance checks and can balance on impossible surfaces if you have 5 or more ranks in Balance.

Name: Baleful Polymorph
Saving Throw: Fortitude negates, Will partial; see text
Short Description: Transforms subject into harmless animal.
Long Descripton: As polymorph, except that you change the subject into a Small or smaller animal of no more than 1 HD. If the new form would prove fatal to the creature the subject gets a +4 bonus on the save.[lf][lf]If the spell succeeds, the subject must also make a Will save. If this second save fails, the creature loses its extraordinary, supernatural, and spell-like abilities, loses its ability to cast spells (if it had the ability), and gains the alignment, special abilities, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores of its new form in place of its own. It still retains its class and level (or HD), as well as all benefits deriving therefrom (such as base attack bonus, base save bonuses, and hit points). It retains any class features (other than spellcasting) that aren't extraordinary, supernatural, or spell-like abilities.[lf][lf]Incorporeal or gaseous creatures are immune to being polymorphed, and a creature with the shapechanger subtype can revert to its natural form as a standard action.

Name: Baleful Transposition
Effect: Two creatures of up to Large size
Short Description: Two subjects switch places.

Name: Ball Lightning
Short Description: Energy ball deals 1d6/level electricity damage.
Medium Description: Energy ball deals 1d6/level (max 15d6) electricity damage.

Name: Balor Nimbus
Short Description: Your flaming body damages foes in grapple.
Medium Description: Your flaming body deals 6d6 fire damage to foes in grapple.

Name: Bands of Steel
Short Description: Bands immobilize or entangle target.

Name: Bane
Short Description: Enemies take -1 on attack rolls and saves against fear.
Long Descripton: Bane fills your enemies with fear and doubt. Each affected creature takes a -1 penalty on attack rolls and a -1 penalty on saving throws against fear effects.[lf][lf]Bane counters and dispels bless.

Name: Banishment
Effect: One or more extraplanar creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Banishes 2 HD/level of extraplanar creatures.
Long Descripton: A banishment spell is a more powerful version of the dismissal spell. It enables you to force extraplanar creatures out of your home plane. As many as 2 Hit Dice of creatures per caster level can be banished.[lf][lf]You can improve the spells chance of success by presenting at least one object or substance that the target hates, fears, or otherwise opposes. For each such object or substance, you gain a +1 bonus on your caster level check to overcome the targets spell resistance (if any), the saving throw DC increases by 2. [lf][lf]Certain rare items might work twice as well as a normal item for the purpose of the bonuses (each providing a +2 bonus on the caster level check against spell resistance and increasing the save DC by 4).

Name: Barghest's Feast
Short Description: Destroy target corpse, potentially preventing its return to life.

Name: Barkskin
Short Description: Grants +2 (or higher) enhancement to natural armor.
Long Descripton: Barkskin toughens a creatures skin. The effect grants a +2 enhancement bonus to the creatures existing natural armor bonus. This enhancement bonus increases by 1 for every three caster levels above 3rd, to a maximum of +5 at caster level 12th.  [lf]The enhancement bonus provided by barkskin stacks with the targets natural armor bonus, but not with other enhancement bonuses to natural armor. A creature without natural armor has an effective natural armor bonus of +0.    [lf]Lvl 3+2  [lf]Lvl 6+3  [lf]Lvl 9+4  [lf]Lvl 12+5

Name: Bastion of Good
Effect: 20 ft. radius spherical emination centered on caster
Short Description: Create a simultaneous globe of invulnerability, lesser and magic circle against evil against evil creatures.

Name: Battering Ram
Short Description: Deals 1d6 damage plus bull rush.
Medium Description: Deals 1d6 force damage plus bull rush.

Name: Battle Hymn
Short Description: Allies can reroll one Will save/round.

Name: Battle Line
Effect: Up to two contiguous 5 ft. squares/level, maximum 10 squares (S)
Short Description: Creates an area of doom on the battlefield.

Name: Battlefield Fortification
Effect: Trench or berm to 5 feet long per two caster levels.
Short Description: Create trench or berm.

Name: Battlefield Illumination
Short Description: Improve light in 80-ft.-radius cylinder

Name: Battlemagic Perception
Short Description: Sense and counter spellcasting within 100 feet.

Name: Battletide
Effect: You and up to one creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Targets have attack penalties and you gain a partial action each round.

Name: Bear's Endurance
Short Description: Subject gains +4 to Con for 1 min./level.
Long Descripton: The affected creature gains greater vitality and stamina. The spell grants the subject a +4 enhancement bonus to Constitution, which adds the usual benefits to hit points, Fortitude saves, Constitution checks, and so forth.[lf][lf]Hit points gained by a temporary increase in Constitution score are not temporary hit points. They go away when the subjects Constitution drops back to normal. They are not lost first as temporary hit points are.

Name: Bear's Endurance, Mass
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: As bear's endurance, affects one subject/ level.
Long Descripton: Mass bear's endurance works like bear's endurance, except that it affects multiple creatures.

Name: Bear's Heart
Short Description: One ally/level +4 Strength and +1d4/level hit points.

Name: Beast Claws
Short Description: Your hands become slashing natural weapons.

Name: Beastland Ferocity
Short Description: Subject fights without penalty while disabled or dying.

Name: Beastmask
Short Description: Animals and beasts think subject is one of them.

Name: Bedevil
Short Description: Summon a mischievous spirit to torment your enemy.

Name: Befoul
Effect: Water in a volume of 100 ft./level by 100 ft./level by 10 ft./level (S)
Short Description: Large amount of water becomes poisonous.

Name: Beget Bogun
Short Description: You create a Tiny nature servant.

Name: Belker Claws
Short Description: One touch/level deals 2d12 damage.
Medium Description: One touch/level deals 2d12 damage.

Name: Benediction
Short Description: Subject gains bonus on saves, can make one reroll.
Medium Description: Subject gains a +2 luck bonus on saves, can reroll one attack roll, save, skill check, or ability check.

Name: Benign Transposition
Effect: Two willing creatures of up to Large size
Short Description: Two willing subjects switch places.

Name: Bestow Curse
Short Description: -6 to an ability score; -4 on attack rolls, saves, and checks; or 50% chance of losing each action.
Long Descripton: You place a curse on the subject. Choose one of the following three effects.[lf][lf]1) -6 decrease to an ability score (minimum 1).[lf][lf]2) -4 penalty on attack rolls, saves, ability checks, and skill checks.[lf][lf]3) Each turn, the target has a 50% chance to act normally; otherwise, it takes no action.[lf][lf]You may also invent your own curse, but it should be no more powerful than those described above.[lf][lf]The curse bestowed by this spell cannot be dispelled, but it can be removed with a break enchantment, limited wish, miracle, remove curse, or wish spell.[lf][lf]Bestow curse counters remove curse.

Name: Bestow Curse, Greater
Short Description: As bestow curse, but more severe penalties.

Name: Bestow Wound
Short Description: Caster transfers 1 hp/level of wounds to another.

Name: Bewildering Mischance
Short Description: Target must take the lower of two rolls for each save, attack roll, and skill check.
Medium Description: Target must take the lower of two rolls for each save, attack roll, and skill check.

Name: Bewildering Substitution
Short Description: Seemingly swap one ally with one enemy.
Medium Description: Seemingly swap one ally with one enemy.

Name: Bewildering Visions
Short Description: Subject is sickened or nauseated.
Medium Description: Subject is sickened or nauseated.

Name: Bigby's Striking Fist
Short Description: Hand deals 1d6 nonlethal damage/2 levels (max 5d6) and knocks subject back.

Name: Bigby's Tripping Hand
Short Description: Hand trips subject.

Name: Bind Item
Effect: One object no larger than 3 ft. across
Short Description: See Text

Name: Binding
Short Description: Utilizes an array of techniques to imprison a creature.
Long Descripton: A binding spell creates a magical restraint to hold a creature. The target gets an initial saving throw only if its Hit Dice equal at least one-half your caster level.    [lf]You may have as many as six assistants help you with the spell. For each assistant who casts suggestion, your caster level for this casting of binding increases by 1. For each assistant who casts dominate animal, dominate person, or dominate monster, your caster level for this casting of binding increases by a number equal to one-third of that assistant's level, provided that the spell's target is appropriate for a binding spell. Since the assistants' spells are cast simply to improve your caster level for the purpose of the binding spell, saving throws and spell resistance against the assistants' spells are irrelevant. Your caster level determines whether the target gets an initial Will saving throw and how long the binding lasts. All binding spells are dismissible.    [lf]Regardless of the version of binding you cast, you can specify triggering conditions that end the spell and release the creature whenever they occur. These triggers can be as simple or elaborate as you desire, but the condition must be reasonable and have a likelihood of coming to pass. The conditions can be based on a creature's name, identity, or alignment but otherwise must be based on observable actions or qualities. Intangibles such as level, class, Hit Dice, or hit points don't qualify. Once the spell is cast, its triggering conditions cannot be changed. Setting a release condition increases the save DC (assuming a saving throw is allowed) by 2.    [lf]If you are casting any of the first three versions of binding (those with limited durations), you may cast additional binding spells to prolong the effect, since the durations overlap. If you do so, the target gets a saving  throw at the end of the first spell's duration, even if your caster level was  high enough to disallow an initial saving throw. If the creature succeeds on  this save, all the binding spells it has received are broken.    [lf]The binding spell has six versions. Choose one of the following versions when you cast the spell.    [lf]Chaining: The subject is confined by restraints that generate an antipathy spell affecting all creatures who approach the subject, except you. The duration is one year per caster level. The subject of this form of binding is confined to the spot it occupied when it received the spell.    [lf]Slumber: This version causes the subject to become comatose for as long as one year per caster level. The subject does not need to eat or drink while slumbering, nor does it age. This form of binding is more difficult to cast than chaining, making it slightly easier to resist. Reduce the spell's save DC by 1.    [lf]Bound Slumber: This combination of chaining and slumber lasts for as long as one month per caster level. Reduce the save DC by 2.    [lf]Hedged Prison: The subject is transported to or otherwise brought within a confined area from which it cannot wander by any means. The effect is permanent. Reduce the save DC by 3.    [lf]Metamorphosis: The subject assumes gaseous form, except for its head or face. It is held harmless in a jar or other container, which may be transparent if you so choose. The creature remains aware of its surroundings and can speak, but it cannot leave the container, attack, or use any of its powers or abilities. The binding is permanent. The subject does not need to breathe, eat, or drink while metamorphosed, nor does it age. Reduce the save DC by 4.    [lf]Minimus Containment: The subject is shrunk to a height of 1 inch or even less and held within some gem, jar, or similar object. The binding is permanent. The subject does not need to breathe, eat, or drink while contained, nor does it age. Reduce the save DC by 4.    [lf]You can't dispel a binding spell with dispel magic or a similar effect, though an antimagic field or Mage's disjunction affects it  normally. A bound extraplanar creature cannot be sent back to its home plane  due to dismissal, banishment, or a similar effect.    [lf]Components: The components for a binding spell vary according to the version of the spell, but they always include a continuous chanting utterance read from the scroll or spellbook page containing the spell, somatic gestures, and materials appropriate to the form of binding used. These components can include such items as miniature chains of special metals, soporific herbs of the rarest sort (for slumber bindings), a bell jar of the finest crystal, and the like.    [lf]In addition to the specially made props suited to the specific type of binding (cost 500 gp), the spell requires opals worth at least 500 gp for each HD of the target and a vellum depiction or carved statuette of the subject to be captured.

Name: Binding Snow
Short Description: Snow freezes, impeding movement.

Name: Binding Winds
Short Description: Sound cannot penetrate to or from target and -2 on ranged attacks.

Name: Bite of the King
Effect: One living creature of a size that does not exceed yours
Short Description: Swallow enemies whole.

Name: Bite of the Werebear
Short Description: You become enhanced such as that of a brown bear.

Name: Bite of the Wereboar
Short Description: You become enhanced such as that of a boar.

Name: Bite of the Wererat
Short Description: You become enhanced such as that of a dire rat.

Name: Bite of the Weretiger
Short Description: You become enhanced such as that of a tiger

Name: Bite of the Werewolf
Short Description: You become enhanced such as that of a wolf.

Name: Black Bag
Short Description: Creates extradimensional bag of torture tools.

Name: Black Blade of Disaster
Short Description: Floating magic weapon deals damage and may disintegrate targets.
Medium Description: Floating magic weapon disintegrates subjects, Dealing 2d6/level (max 40d6) disintegrate damage.

Name: Black Lightning
Short Description: Ray that deals 1d6/2 levels (Max 10d6) damage, half of which is Electrical energy and the other half is Negative energy.
Medium Description: Ray that deals 1d6/2 levels (Max 10d6) damage, half electricity and half evil/profane energy.
Long Descripton: You launch crackling black lightning at the target creature, dealing 1d6 points of damage per 2 caster levels (maximum 10d6). Half the damage is electricity damage, but the rest is evil energy from the lower planes which is not affected by resistance to electricity (evil creatures, creatures native to evil planes, and creatures immune to death effects are not affected by the profane energy).

Name: Black Mulching
Short Description: See Text

Name: Black Sand
Short Description: Creates a 20-ft.-radius area of black sand.

Name: Black Tentacles
Short Description: Tentacles grapple all within 15 ft. spread.
Long Descripton: This spell conjures a field of rubbery black tentacles, each 10 feet long. These waving members seem to spring forth from the earth, floor, or whatever surface is underfoot including water. They grasp and entwine around creatures that enter the area, holding them fast and crushing them with great strength.[lf][lf]Every creature within the area of the spell must make a grapple check, opposed by the grapple check of the tentacles. Treat the tentacles attacking a particular target as a Large creature with a base attack bonus equal to your caster level and a Strength score of 19. Thus, its grapple check modifier is equal to your caster level +8. The tentacles are immune to all types of damage.[lf][lf]Once the tentacles grapple an opponent, they may make a grapple check each round on your turn to deal 1d6+4 points of bludgeoning damage. The tentacles continue to crush the opponent until the spell ends or the opponent escapes.[lf][lf]Any creature that enters the area of the spell is immediately attacked by the tentacles. Even creatures who aren't grappling with the tentacles may move through the area at only half normal speed.

Name: Blackfire
Saving Throw: Fortitude partial and Reflex negates; see text
Short Description: Negative energy fire burns at the life force of a living creature dealing 1d4 constitution damage/round.
Medium Description: Negative energy fire burns at the life force of a living creature dealing 1d4 Con damage/round.

Name: Blacklight
Effect: A 20-ft.-radius emanation centered on a creature, object or point in space.
Short Description: Creates a 20-ft. radius of supernatural darkness you can see through.
Long Descripton: You create an area of total darkness.  The darkness is impenetrable to normal vision and darkvision, but you can see normally within the blacklit area.  Creatures outside the spell's area, even you, cannot see through it.[lf][lf]You can cast the spell on a point in space, but the effect is stationary unless you cast it on a mobile object.  You can cast the spell on a creature, and the effect then radiates from the creature and moves as it moves.  Unattended objects and points in space do not get saving throws or benefit from spell resistance.[lf][lf]Blacklight counters or dispels any light spell of equal or lower level, such as daylight.  The 3rd-level cleric spell daylight counters or dispels blacklight.

Name: Blackstaff
Short Description: Greatly enhances staff or quarterstaff

Name: Blackwater Taint
Short Description: Desecrate water, deal 1d6/2 levels negative energy damage, bestow a negative level.

Name: Blackwater Tentacle
Short Description: Create blackwater tentacle that attacks your foe.

Name: Blade Barrier
Effect: Wall of whirling blades up to 20 ft. long/ level, or a ringed wall of whirling blades with a radius of up to 5 ft. per two levels; either form 20 ft. high
Saving Throw: Reflex half or Reflex negates; see text
Short Description: Wall of blades deals 1d6/level damage.
Medium Description: Wall of blades deals 1d6/level (max 15d6) force damage.
Long Descripton: An immobile, vertical curtain of whirling blades shaped of pure force springs into existence. Any creature passing through the wall takes 1d6 points of damage per caster level (maximum 15d6), with a Reflex save for half damage.[lf][lf]If you evoke the barrier so that it appears where creatures are, each creature takes damage as if passing through the wall. Each such creature can avoid the wall (ending up on the side of its choice) and thus take no damage by making a successful Reflex save.[lf][lf]A blade barrier provides cover (+4 bonus to AC, +2 bonus on Reflex saves) against attacks made through it.

Name: Blade of Blood
Short Description: Weapon deals +1d6, or +3d6 if you take 5 points of damage.

Name: Blade of Pain and Fear
Short Description: Creates blade of gnashing teeth.

Name: Blade Storm
Short Description: Swift. You make melee attacks against every foe you threaten.

Name: Blade Thirst
Short Description: Slashing weapon glows and gains +3 enhancement bonus.

Name: Bladebane
Short Description: Slashing weapon becomes a bane weapon.

Name: Blades of Fire
Effect: Up to two melee weapons you are wielding
Short Description: Your melee weapons deal +1d8 fire damage for 1 round (swift).

Name: Bladesong
Short Description: Causes weapon to have an extra touch attack to daze opponent.

Name: Bladeweave
Short Description: Swift. Your melee attack dazes your opponent.

Name: Blasphemy
Effect: Nonevil creatures in a 40-ft.-radius spread centered on you
Saving Throw: None or Will negates; see text
Short Description: Kills, paralyzes, weakens, or dazes nonevil subjects.
Long Descripton: Any nonevil  creature within the area of a blasphemy spell suffers the following ill  effects.       [lf]     HD      Effect       [lf]        [lf] Equal to    caster level             [lf] Dazed           [lf]        [lf] Up to    caster level -1             [lf] Weakened,    dazed           [lf]        [lf] Up to    caster level -5             [lf] Paralyzed,    weakened, dazed           [lf]        [lf] Up to    caster level -10             [lf] Killed,    paralyzed, weakened, dazed              [lf] The effects  are cumulative and concurrent.    [lf] No saving  throw is allowed against these effects.    [lf]Dazed:   The creature can take no actions for  1 round, though it defends itself normally.
