[lf]Weakened: The creature's  Strength score decreases by 2d6 points for 2d4 rounds.    [lf]Paralyzed: The creature is  paralyzed and helpless for 1d10 minutes.    [lf]Killed:   Living creatures die. Undead  creatures are destroyed.    [lf] Furthermore,  if you are on your home plane when you cast this spell, nonevil extraplanar  creatures within the area are instantly banished back to their home planes.  Creatures so banished cannot return for at least 24 hours. This effect takes  place regardless of whether the creatures hear the blasphemy. The  banishment effect allows a Will save (at a -4 penalty) to negate.    [lf] Creatures  whose Hit Dice exceed your caster level are unaffected by blasphemy.

Name: Blast of Flame
Short Description: 60-ft. cone of fire (1d6/level damage).
Medium Description: 60-ft. cone of fire deals 1d6/level (max 10d6) damage.

Name: Blast of Force
Short Description: Ray deals 1d6 damage/2 caster levels (max 5d6).
Medium Description: Ray deals 1d6 force damage/2 caster levels (max 5d6) and may knock down opponent.

Name: Blast of Sand
Short Description: Cone deals 1d6 damage/level.
Medium Description: Cone blast deals 1d6/level (max 10d6) damage.

Name: Blast Rod
Short Description: Infused rod stores 1d8/level destructive energy.

Name: Blaze of Light
Short Description: 60ft. cone of light dazzles creatures.

Name: Bleed
Short Description: Touched creature takes Con damage from piercing or slashing weapons; repeated use imposes a -4 penalty on certain Fort saves.
Medium Description: Touched creature takes Con damage from piercing or slashing weapons; repeated use imposes a -4 penalty on certain Fort saves.

Name: Bless
Effect: The caster and all allies within a 50-ft. burst, centered on the caster
Short Description: Allies gain +1 on attack rolls and saves against fear.
Long Descripton: Bless fills your allies with courage. Each ally gains a +1 morale bonus on attack rolls and on saving throws against fear effects.[lf][lf]Bless counters and dispels bane.

Name: Bless Water
Short Description: Makes holy water.
Long Descripton: This transmutation imbues a flask (1 pint) of water with positive energy, turning it into holy water.

Name: Bless Weapon
Short Description: Weapon strikes true against evil foes.
Long Descripton: This transmutation makes a weapon strike true against evil foes. The weapon is treated as having a +1 enhancement bonus for the purpose of bypassing the damage reduction of evil creatures or striking evil incorporeal creatures (though the spell doesn't grant an actual enhancement bonus). The weapon also becomes good, which means it can bypass the damage reduction of certain creatures. (This effect overrides and suppresses any other alignment the weapon might have.) Individual arrows or bolts can be transmuted, but affected projectile weapons (such as bows) don't confer the benefit to the projectiles they shoot.[lf][lf]In addition, all critical hit rolls against evil foes are automatically successful, so every threat is a critical hit. This last effect does not apply to any weapon that already has a magical effect related to critical hits, such as a keen weapon or a vorpal sword.

Name: Bless Weapon, Swift
Short Description: Weapon strikes true against evil foes for 1 round (swift).

Name: Blessed Aim
Short Description: +2 bonus for allies' ranged attacks.

Name: Blessed Sight
Short Description: Perceive all evil auras as detect evil within 120 ft immediately.

Name: Blessing Of Bahamut
Short Description: You gain damage reduction 10/magic.

Name: Blight
Short Description: Withers one plant or deals 1d6/level damage to plant creature.
Medium Description: Withers one plant or deals 1d6/level (max 15d6) damage to plant creature.
Long Descripton: This spell withers a single plant of any size. An affected plant creature takes 1d6 points of damage per level (maximum 15d6) and may attempt a Fortitude saving throw for half damage. A plant that isn't a creature doesn't receive a save and immediately withers and dies.[lf][lf]This spell has no effect on the soil or surrounding plant life.

Name: Blinding Beauty
Short Description: Permanently blind any who look at you.

Name: Blinding Breath
Short Description: Your breath weapon blinds targets.

Name: Blinding Color Surge
Short Description: Blind subject for 1 round, gain invisibility.
Medium Description: Blind subject for 1 round, gain invisibility even if target unaffected.

Name: Blinding Glory
Effect: 100 ft/level radius burst centered on you.
Short Description: Create light as daylight in a 100 ft/level radius burst that blinds evil creatures.

Name: Blinding Spittle
Short Description: Ranged touch attack makes subject blind.

Name: Blindness/Deafness
Short Description: Makes subject blind or deaf.
Long Descripton: You call upon the powers of unlife to render the subject blinded or deafened, as you choose.

Name: Blindsight
Short Description: Grants blindsight to a range of 30 ft.

Name: Blindsight, Greater
Short Description: Grants blindsight to a range of 60 ft.

Name: Blink
Short Description: You randomly vanish and reappear for 1 round/level.
Long Descripton: You blink back and forth between the Material Plane and the Ethereal Plane. You look as though you're winking in and out of reality very quickly and at random.[lf][lf]Blinking has several effects, as follows.[lf][lf]Physical attacks against you have a 50% miss chance, and the Blind-Fight feat doesn't help opponents, since you're ethereal and not merely invisible. If the attack is capable of striking ethereal creatures, the miss chance is only 20% (for concealment).[lf][lf]If the attacker can see invisible creatures, the miss chance is also only 20%. (For an attacker who can both see and strike ethereal creatures, there is no miss chance.) Likewise, your own attacks have a 20% miss chance, since you sometimes go ethereal just as you are about to strike.[lf][lf]Any individually targeted spell has a 50% chance to fail against you while you're blinking unless your attacker can target invisible, ethereal creatures. Your own spells have a 20% chance to activate just as you go ethereal, in which case they typically do not affect the Material Plane.[lf][lf]While blinking, you take only half damage from area attacks (but full damage from those that extend onto the Ethereal Plane). You strike as an invisible creature (with a +2 bonus on attack rolls), denying your target any Dexterity bonus to AC.[lf][lf]You take only half damage from falling, since you fall only while you are material.[lf][lf]While blinking, you can step through (but not see through) solid objects. For each 5 feet of solid material you walk through, there is a 50% chance that you become material. If this occurs, you are shunted off to the nearest open space and take 1d6 points of damage per 5 feet so traveled. You can move at only three-quarters speed (because movement on the Ethereal Plane is at half speed, and you spend about half your time there and half your time material.)[lf][lf]Since you spend about half your time on the Ethereal Plane, you can see and even attack ethereal creatures. You interact with ethereal creatures roughly the same way you interact with material ones.[lf][lf]An ethereal creature is invisible, incorporeal, and capable of moving in any direction, even up or down. As an incorporeal creature, you can move through solid objects, including living creatures.[lf][lf]An ethereal creature can see and hear the Material Plane, but everything looks gray and insubstantial. Sight and hearing on the Material Plane are limited to 60 feet.[lf][lf]Force effects and abjurations affect you normally. Their effects extend onto the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, but not vice versa. An ethereal creature can't attack material creatures, and spells you cast while ethereal affect only other ethereal things. Certain material creatures or objects have attacks or effects that work on the Ethereal Plane. Treat other ethereal creatures and objects as material.

Name: Blink, Greater
Short Description: As blink, but you control the timing.

Name: Blistering Radiance
Saving Throw: None and Fortitude partial; see text
Short Description: Dazzles sighted creatures and causes 2d6 fire damage/round.

Name: Blizzard
Short Description: Temperature drops and powerful blizzard reduces visibility to zero.

Name: Blockade
Short Description: Fill 5-ft. square with enormous block of wood.
Medium Description: Fill 5' square with 2000 lb block of wood. Can be stacked. Floats.

Name: Blood Frenzy
Effect: Any creature with the rage ability
Short Description: Grants extra use of rage.

Name: Blood of the Martyr
Short Description: Take Damage and Heal another at least 20 HP.
Medium Description: Take damage and Heal another at least 20 HP.

Name: Blood Sirocco
Effect: Cone-shaped emanation centered on you or on a point in space
Short Description: Wind bowls over foes and draws away their blood.

Name: Blood Snow
Short Description: Area of fallen snow drains 1d2 points of Con/round and causes nausea.

Name: Blood to Water
Effect: Up to five living creatures, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: 2d6 Constitution damage to subjects.

Name: Blood Wind
Effect: One creature with Intelligence 4 or higher
Short Description: Subject uses natural weapons as thrown weapons.
Medium Description: Subject may take a full attack action to use all of its natural weapons as if they were a thrown weapons with a 20ft range increment.

Name: Bloodbriars
Short Description: Wraps target in invisible briars that deal 1d8 points of damage per round if movement is attempted.

Name: Bloodfreeze Arrow
Short Description: Masterwork arrow or bolt deals extra 2d6 cold damage and paralyzes target.

Name: Bloodhound
Short Description: You gain an immediate retry if you fail a Survival check while tracking.

Name: Bloodspear
Short Description: Makes one spear into a wounding weapon.

Name: Bloodstar
Short Description: Hovering construct wounds foe each time foe is damaged.
Medium Description: Hovering construct deals 1 point Con damage to foe each time foe is wounded.

Name: Blunt Weapon
Effect: All piercing and slashing weapons within a 20-ft. radius burst
Short Description: Halves base damage of slashing or piercing weapons.

Name: Blur
Short Description: Attacks miss subject 20% of the time.
Medium Description: Attacks have 20% miss chance. True seeing counteracts, see invisibility doesn't.
Long Descripton: The subjects outline appears blurred, shifting and wavering. This distortion grants the subject concealment (20% miss chance).[lf][lf]A see invisibility spell does not counteract the blur effect, but a true seeing spell does.[lf][lf]Opponents that cannot see the subject ignore the spells effect (though fighting an unseen opponent carries penalties of its own).

Name: Bodak Birth
Short Description: Transforms a willing subject into a bodak.

Name: Bodak's Glare
Short Description: You slay a creature, which turns into a bodak 24 hours later.

Name: Body Blades
Short Description: You attack as if armed, deal bonus damage, harm grapplers.
Medium Description: Sprout spikes, deal 1d6 piercing damage (crit x2) to grapplers, or use as light melee weapon. +4 Escape Artist from net, rope, grapple, or entanglement.

Name: Body Blaze
Short Description: Cause a miniature wall of fire to rise from where you tread.

Name: Body Harmonic
Short Description: Piercing tone deals 1d10 damage to one ability/round.

Name: Body Of The Sun
Short Description: Your body emanates fire, dealing 1d4/2 levels (Max 5d4) damage.
Medium Description: Your body emanates flame, dealing 1d4/2 levels (max 5d4) fire damage.

Name: Body of War
Short Description: You change into warforged titan, gain some abilities.

Name: Body Outside Body
Short Description: Create duplicates of you that are friendly to you and your friends and obey even suicidal orders.

Name: Body Ward
Duration: 1 min./level or until expended; see text
Short Description: Subject is protected against ability damage to Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution;
Medium Description: Subject is protected against 5 points of ability damage to Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution; repeated use for different scores also increases damage absorbed.

Name: Boiling Oil
Duration: 1 round and 1 round/3 levels; see text
Short Description: 10-ft. cylinder deals 4d6 damage, +2d6 damage per round for 1 round/3 levels.
Medium Description: 10-ft. cylinder deals 4d6 fire damage, +2d6 damage per round for 1 round/3 levels (max 6 rounds).

Name: Bolster Aura
Short Description: Subject's aura strengthens as if it had 1 HD/ two caster levels more than it actually does.
Medium Description: Subject's aura strengthens as if it had 1 HD/ two caster levels more than it actually does.

Name: Bolt of Conjuring
Short Description: See Text

Name: Bolt of Glory
Short Description: Positive energy ray deals extra damage to evil outsiders and undead.
Medium Description: Energy ray deals positive energy damage to evil outsiders and undead.
Long Descripton: You must succeed on a ranged touch attack with the ray to strike a target. A creature struck takes varying damage, depending on its nature  or its home plane of existence and your level:    [lf]Creature's Origin/Nature    Value Max Damage  [lf]Material Plane, Elemental Plane, neutral outsider   1d12/2 levels 7d12  [lf]Negative Energy Plane, evil outsider, undead creature    1d12/level  15d12  [lf]Positive Energy Plane, good outsider --

Name: Bolts of Bedevilment
Short Description: One ray/round, dazes 1d3 rounds.
Long Descripton: This spell grants you the ability to make one ray attack per round. You must succeed on a ranged touch attack with the ray to strike a target. A living creature struck by the ray is dazed for 1d3 rounds if it fails its save.

Name: Bombardment
Short Description: Falling rocks deal 1d8 damage/level and bury targets.
Medium Description: Falling rocks deal 1d8/level damage (max 20d8) and bury targets who suffocate if they cannot climb out.

Name: Bone Chill
Short Description: Corporeal undead are held by a thick layer of frost.

Name: Bone Talisman
Short Description: Turns a bone into a turning attempt, or as an undead  bane weapon (Club, Dagger, or Spear).

Name: Bone Tattoo
Short Description: See Text

Name: Boneblade
Effect: One bone that becomes a blade
Short Description: Turns a bone into a magic weapon.

Name: Boneblast
Effect: One creature that has a skeleton
Saving Throw: Fortitude half or Fortitude negates; see text
Short Description: 1d3 Con damage to subject.
Medium Description: Subject takes 1d3 Con damage as 1 bone breaks.

Name: Bonefiddle
Effect: One creature that has a skeleton or exoskeleton
Short Description: Target takes 3d6 sonic damage/round and -20 penalty on Move Silently checks.

Name: Boreal Wind
Effect: Gust of wind (20 ft. wide, 20 ft. high) emanating out from you to the extreme of the range
Short Description: Gust of cold wind deals 1d4 cold damage/level and knocks creatures back.
Medium Description: Gust of cold wind deals 1d4/level damage (max 15d4) and knocks creatures back.

Name: Bottle of Smoke
Short Description: Uncorking bottle creates fast horse made of smoke.

Name: Brain Spider
Effect: Up to eight living creatures within range
Short Description: Listen to thoughts of up to eight other creatures.
Long Descripton: For the duration of the spell, as a standard action, you can eavesdrop on the thoughts of up to eight other creatures at once, hearing as desired:    [lf]A creature's surface thoughts.  [lf]Individual trains of thought in whatever order you desire.  [lf]One nugget of information per caster level from all the minds regarding one particular topic, thing, or being.  [lf]The thoughts and memories of one creature of  the group in detail.    [lf]Once per round, if you do not perform a detailed study of  one creature's mind, you can attempt (as a standard action)  to implant a suggestion in the mind of any one of the affected  creatures. The creature can make another Will saving throw  to resist the suggestion, using the save DC of the brain spider.  (Creatures with special resistance to enchantment spells  can use this resistance to keep from being affected by the  suggestion.) Success on this saving throw does not negate the  other effects of the brain spider for that creature.

Name: Brambles
Short Description: Wooden weapon grows spikes that deal +1 damage/caster level (max +10).
Medium Description: Wooden weapon grows spikes that deals +1/level (max +10) piercing + bludgeoning damage.

Name: Branch to Branch
Short Description: You gain +10 competence bonus on Climb checks in trees and can brachiate through forest.

Name: Break Enchantment
Effect: Up to one creature per level, all within 30 ft. of each other
Short Description: Frees subjects from enchantments, alterations, curses, and petrification.
Long Descripton: This spell frees victims from enchantments, transmutations, and curses. Break enchantment can reverse even an instantaneous effect. For each such effect, you make a caster level check (1d20 + caster level, maximum +15) against a DC of 11 + caster level of the effect. Success means that the creature is free of the spell, curse, or effect. For a cursed magic item, the DC is 25.[lf][lf]If the spell is one that cannot be dispelled by dispel magic, break enchantment works only if that spell is 5th level or lower. [lf][lf]If the effect comes from some permanent magic item break enchantment does not remove the curse from the item, but it does frees the victim from the items effects.

Name: Breath Flare
Short Description: Your breath weapon dazzles targets.

Name: Breath of the Jungle
Effect: Mist spreads in a 40 ft. radius, 20 ft. high
Short Description: Mist increases DC of saves vs. poison & disease
Medium Description: Mist increases DC of saves vs. poison & disease

Name: Breath Weapon Admixture
Short Description: Your breath weapon also deals a second type of damage.
Medium Description: Breath weapon deals a second damage type (cold, acid, electricity, fire, or sonic).

Name: Breath Weapon Substitution
Short Description: Your breath weapon deals a different kind of damage than normal.
Medium Description: Substitute acid, cold, electricity, or fire damage in place of your normal breath weapon damage.

Name: Briar Web
Short Description: Area slows creatures and thorns deal 1 point of damage/5 ft. moved.
Medium Description: Area slows creatures and thorns deal 1 point of piercing damage/5 ft. moved.

Name: Bridge of Sound
Effect: One bridge of sound 5ft. wide, 1 in. think, and up to 10ft./level long
Short Description: Create a ribbon-like, weightless, unbreakable, invisible bridge of sound.

Name: Brilliant Aura
Effect: Weapons carried by one creature/2 levels, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Allies' weapons become brilliant energy, ignoring armor.
Medium Description: Allies' weapons become brilliant energy, ignoring armor.

Name: Brilliant Blade
Effect: One melee or thrown weapon, or fifty projectiles (all of which must be in contact with each other at the time of casting)
Short Description: Weapon or group of projectiles gain the brilliant energy quality.

Name: Brilliant Emanation
Effect: 100 ft. radius emanation +10 ft. radius per level.
Short Description: Make evil creatures blind or suffer -1 to attacks.

Name: Brilliant Energy Arrow
Short Description: Masterwork arrow or bolt radiates light and ignores armor.

Name: Bristle
Short Description: Armor spikes attack with wearer.

Name: Brumal Stiffening
Short Description: Brittle weapon's hardness reduced by 5.

Name: Bull's Strength
Short Description: Subject gains +4 to Str for 1 min./level.
Long Descripton: The subject becomes stronger. The spell grants a +4 enhancement bonus to Strength, adding the usual benefits to melee attack rolls, melee damage rolls, and other uses of the Strength modifier.

Name: Bull's Strength, Mass
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: As bull's strength, affects one subject/level.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like bull's strength, except that it affects multiple creatures.

Name: Buoyant Lifting
Effect: One willing creature/level, no two of which are more than 20 ft. apart
Short Description: Underwater creatures rise to surface.

Name: Burial Blessing
Short Description: Prevents a corpse from rising as undead.

Name: Burning Blood
Short Description: Your blood deals energy damage to nearby creatures when you are struck.
Medium Description: Your blood deals breath weapon energy damage (1 x caster level) to nearby creatures when you are struck.

Name: Burning Blood, Foe's
Short Description: Subject creature's blood deals 1d8 acid and 1d8 fire damage per round.
Medium Description: Subject creature's blood deals 1d8 acid + 1d8 fire damage per round.

Name: Burning Hands
Short Description: 1d4/level fire damage (max 5d4).
Long Descripton: A cone of searing flame shoots from your fingertips. Any creature in the area of the flames takes 1d4 points of fire damage per caster level (maximum 5d4). Flammable materials burn if the flames touch them. A character can extinguish burning items as a full-round action.

Name: Burning Sword
Short Description: Weapon gains flaming burst special ability.

Name: Burrow
Short Description: Grow claws and gain burrow speed of 30 ft.

Name: Burrow, Mass
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart.
Short Description: As burrow but affects 1/level subjects.

Name: Burrowing Bony Digits
Effect: Up to 5 creatures, no two of which can be more than 15ft. apart
Short Description: Shoot the fingers form a dismembered hand and watch them burrow into the flesh of those they hit.
Medium Description: Shoot the fingers form a dismembered hand and watch them burrow into the flesh of those they hit.

Name: Buzzing Bee
Short Description: Bee gives subject -10 penalty on Move Silently and Concentration checks.

Name: Cacophonic Burst
Short Description: A burst of low noise which deals sonic damage.
Medium Description: A burst of low noise deals 1d6/level (max 15d6) sonic damage within 20 ft.

Name: Cacophonic Shield
Short Description: Immobile shield blocks sound, deflects missiles, deals 1d6+1/level and deafens intruders.

Name: Call Avalanche
Short Description: Avalanche of ice and snow falls from the sky, burying subjects.
Medium Description: Avalanche of ice deals 8d6 crushing damage. Buried subjects take 1d6 nonlethal damage/min while conscious, or 1d6 lethal damage/min if unconscious.

Name: Call Dretch Horde
Short Description: Summons 2d4 dretches.

Name: Call Faithful Servants
Effect: 1d4 lantern archons, coure eladrins, or musteval guardinals.
Short Description: 1d4 lantern archons, coure eladrins, or musteval guardinals serve for one year.

Name: Call Kolyarut
Short Description: A kolyarut aids you in punishing an oath-breaker.

Name: Call Lemure Horde
Short Description: Summons 2d4 lemures.

Name: Call Lightning
Effect: One or more 30-ft.-long vertical lines of lightning
Short Description: Calls down lightning bolts (3d6 per bolt) from sky.
Medium Description: Calls down 1 lightning bolt (3d6 electricity damage) every 1 round/level (max 10 rounds).
Long Descripton: Immediately upon completion of the spell, and once per round thereafter, you may call down a 5-foot-wide, 30-foot-long, vertical bolt of lightning that deals 3d6 points of electricity damage. The bolt of lightning flashes down in a vertical stroke at whatever target point you choose within the spells range (measured from your position at the time). Any creature in the target square or in the path of the bolt is affected.[lf][lf]You need not call a bolt of lightning immediately; other actions, even spellcasting, can be performed. However, each round after the first you may use a standard action (concentrating on the spell) to call a bolt. You may call a total number of bolts equal to your caster level (maximum 10 bolts).[lf][lf]If you are outdoors and in a stormy area a rain shower, clouds and wind, hot and cloudy conditions, or even a tornado (including a whirlwind formed by a djinni or an air elemental of at least Large size)each bolt deals 3d10 points of electricity damage instead of 3d6.[lf][lf]This spell functions indoors or underground but not underwater.

Name: Call Lightning Storm
Effect: One or more 30-ft.-long vertical lines of lightning
Short Description: As call lightning, but 5d6 damage per bolt.
Medium Description: As call lightning, but 5d6 electricity damage per bolt.
Long Descripton: Immediately upon completion of the spell, and once per round thereafter, you may call down a 5-foot-wide, 30-foot-long, vertical bolt of lightning that deals 5d6 points of electricity damage. The bolt of lightning flashes down in a vertical stroke at whatever target point you choose within the spells range (measured from your position at the time). Any creature in the target square or in the path of the bolt is affected.[lf][lf]You need not call a bolt of lightning immediately; other actions, even spellcasting, can be performed. However, each round after the first you may use a standard action (concentrating on the spell) to call a bolt. You may call a total number of bolts equal to your caster level (maximum 15 bolts).[lf][lf]If you are outdoors and in a stormy areaa rain shower, clouds and wind, hot and cloudy conditions, or even a tornado (including a whirlwind formed by a djinni or an air elemental of at least Large size)each bolt deals 5d10 points of electricity damage instead of 5d6.[lf][lf]This spell functions indoors or underground but not underwater.

Name: Call Marut
Short Description: A marut aids you in pursuing one seeking to cheat time.

Name: Call Mount
Short Description: Call your special mount, even if you have already called it today.

Name: Call Nightmare
Short Description: Summons a nightmare.

Name: Call Zelekhut
Short Description: A zelekhut aids you in hunting a fugitive.

Name: Calm Animals
Effect: Animals within 30 ft. of each other
Short Description: Calms (2d4 + level) HD of animals.
Long Descripton: This spell soothes and quiets animals, rendering them docile and harmless. Only ordinary animals (those with Intelligence scores of 1 or 2) can be affected by this spell. All the subjects must be of the same kind, and no two may be more than 30 feet apart. The maximum number of Hit Dice of animals you can affect is equal to 2d4 + caster level. A dire animal or an animal trained to attack or guard is allowed a saving throw; other animals are not.[lf][lf]The affected creatures remain where they are and do not attack or flee. They are not helpless and defend themselves normally if attacked. Any threat breaks the spell on the threatened creatures.

Name: Calm Earth
Short Description: Protects an area from earthquakes and lava.  Also slows earth subtype creatures.

Name: Calm Emotions
Short Description: Calms creatures, negating emotion effects.
Long Descripton: This spell calms agitated creatures. You have no control over the affected creatures, but calm emotions can stop raging creatures from fighting or joyous ones from reveling. Creatures so affected cannot take violent actions (although they can defend themselves) or do anything destructive. Any aggressive action against or damage dealt to a calmed creature immediately breaks the spell on all calmed creatures.[lf][lf]This spell automatically suppresses (but does not dispel) any morale bonuses granted by spells such as bless, good hope, and rage, as well as negating a bard's ability to inspire courage or a barbarian's rage ability. It also suppresses any fear effects and removes the confused condition from all targets. While the spell lasts, a suppressed spell or effect has no effect. When the calm emotions spell ends, the original spell or effect takes hold of the creature again, provided that its duration has not expired in the meantime.

Name: Caltrops
Short Description: Creates caltrops in 5-ft.-by-5-ft. square, + 5-ft. square/2 levels beyond 1st (max 5).

Name: Camel's Tenacity
Effect: Creature or creatures touched (up to one/level)
Short Description: Travel without food or water.

Name: Camouflage
Short Description: Grants +10 bonus on Hide checks.

Name: Camouflage, Mass
Effect: Any number of creatures, no two of which can be more than 60 ft. apart
Short Description: As camouflage, but affects all in range.

Name: Candlelight
Short Description: Cast a 5-foot radius light from the point touched.

Name: Capricious Zephyr
Saving Throw: None or Reflex partial; see text
Short Description: A ball of air pushes targets around and trips them.

Name: Cast in Stone
Saving Throw: None and Fortitude negates; see text
Short Description: Petrifying gaze attack.

Name: Castigate
Short Description: Verbal rebuke damages those whose alignment differs from yours.
Medium Description: Verbal rebuke damages those whose alignment differs from yours.

Name: Cat's Grace
Short Description: Subject gains +4 to Dex for 1 min./level.
Long Descripton: The transmuted creature becomes more graceful, agile, and coordinated. The spell grants a +4 enhancement bonus to Dexterity, adding the usual benefits to AC, Reflex saves, and other uses of the Dexterity modifier.

Name: Cat's Grace, Mass
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: As cat's grace, affects one subject/level.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like cat's grace, except that it affects multiple creatures.

Name: Catapult
Effect: One held object, weighing up to 5 lb.
Short Description: Magically propel an object from your hand.
Medium Description: Range attack to throw object 30', no ability bonus to attack roll, 1d6 +CL/3 (max +5) damage.

Name: Cause Fear
Effect: One living creature with 5 or fewer HD
Short Description: One creature of 5 HD or less flees for 1d4 rounds.
Long Descripton: The affected creature becomes frightened. If the subject succeeds on a Will save, it is shaken for 1 round. Creatures with 6 or more Hit Dice are immune to this effect.[lf][lf]Cause fear counters and dispels remove fear.

Name: Celebration
Short Description: Intoxicate Subjects.

Name: Celerity
Short Description: Take a standard action immediately, but be dazed for a round.
Medium Description: Take a standard action immediately, but be dazed for a round.

Name: Celerity, Greater
Short Description: Take a full-round action immediately, but be dazed for a round.
Medium Description: Take a full-round action immediately, but be dazed for a round.

Name: Celerity, Lesser
Short Description: Take a move action immediately, but be dazed for a round.
Medium Description: Take a move action immediately, but be dazed for a round.

Name: Celestial Aspect
Short Description: Gain armblade (+1 flaming/holy longsword) or fire eyes (2d6 fire at 60 ft.) or horns (1d8+1-1/2 Str + dismissal) or wings (100 ft. fly (good))

Name: Celestial Blood
Short Description: Gain acid, cold, and electricity resistance 10, +4 to saves versus poison, and DR 10/evil.

Name: Celestial Brilliance
Short Description: 120 ft emanation of light, bright to 60 feet (double penalty to light sensitive, 1d6 damage to undead, 2d6 damage to evil outsiders and sensitive undead within 60 feet)
Medium Description: 120 ft emanation of light, bright to 60 ft (2X penalty to light-sensitive, 1d6 energy damage to undead, 2d6 to evil outsiders and sensitive undead).

Name: Censure Elementals
Short Description: Deal 2d4 + 1/level damage each round to elementals.
Medium Description: Deal 2d4 + 1/level (max +15) damage each round to elementals.

Name: Chaav's Laugh
Short Description: Good creatures gain +2 on attacks and saves versus fear and gain 1d8+1/level temporary hit points, while evil creatures save or suffer -2 on attacks and saves versus fear.

Name: Chain Contingency
Short Description: As contingency except up to three spells.

Name: Chain Lightning
Effect: One primary target, plus one secondary target/level (each of which must be within 30 ft. of the primary target)
Short Description: 1d6/level damage; 1 secondary bolt/level each deals half damage.
Medium Description: 1d6/level (max 20d6) electricity damage; 1 secondary bolt/level each deals half damage.
Long Descripton: This spell creates an electrical discharge that begins as a single stroke commencing from your fingertips. Unlike lightning bolt, chain lightning strikes one object or creature initially, then arcs to other targets.[lf][lf]The bolt deals 1d6 points of electricity damage per caster level (maximum 20d6) to the primary target. After it strikes, lightning can arc to a number of secondary targets equal to your caster level (maximum 20). The secondary bolts each strike one target and deal half as much damage as the primary one did (rounded down).[lf][lf]Each target can attempt a Reflex saving throw for half damage. You choose secondary targets as you like, but they must all be within 30 feet of the primary target, and no target can be struck more than once. You can choose to affect fewer secondary targets than the maximum.

Name: Chain Missile
Effect: One creature, plus another creature/2 levels (each of which must be within 30 ft. of the primary target)
Short Description: 1d4+1/2 levels damage; 1d4+1 damage to 1 secondary target/2 levels.
Medium Description: 1d4+1/2 levels force damage; 1d4+1 damage to 1 secondary target/2 levels.

Name: Chain of Chaos
Short Description: Creates plague of insanity passed by touch.

Name: Chain of Eyes
Short Description: You send magical sensor to infiltrate an area.

Name: Chains of Vengeance
Short Description: See Text

Name: Chalkboard
Effect: Figment of chalkboard up to 10 10 ft. square
Short Description: Creates opaque plane you can write on.

Name: Changestaff
Short Description: Your staff becomes a treant on command.
Long Descripton: You change a specially prepared quarterstaff into a Huge treantlike creature, about 24 feet tall. When you plant the end of the staff in the ground and speak a special command to conclude the casting of the spell, your staff turns into a creature that looks and fights just like a treant. The staff-treant defends you and obeys any spoken commands. However, it is by no means a true treant; it cannot converse with actual treants or control trees. If the staff-treant is reduced to 0 or fewer hit points, it crumbles to powder and the staff is destroyed. Otherwise, the staff returns to its normal form when the spell duration expires (or when the spell is dismissed), and it can be used as the focus for another casting of the spell. The staff-treant is always at full strength when created, despite any wounds it may have incurred the last time it appeared.[lf][lf]Focus: The quarterstaff, which must be specially prepared. The staff must be a sound limb cut from an ash, oak, or yew, then cured, shaped, carved, and polished (a process requiring twenty-eight days).[lf][lf]You cannot adventure or engage in other strenuous activity during the shaping and carving of the staff.

Name: Changestones
Short Description: Prepared stones become liths.

Name: Channel Celestial
Short Description: Gain supernatural and spell-like abilities, spells, mental stats-5, and skills of a willing celestial of 12 HD or less.

Name: Channel Celestial, Greater
Short Description: Gain supernatural and spell-like abilities, spells, mental stats -5, and skills of a willing celestial of 12 HD or less.

Name: Channeled Pyroburst
Short Description: Deal fire damage, amount and radius based on casting time.
Medium Description: Fire damage per 2 caster levels to targets depending cast time (swift, std, full, 2-rds). Dmg 1d4, 1d6, 1d8, 1d10 to 1 target, 10', 15', 20' radius, respectively.

Name: Chaos Hammer
Short Description: Damages and staggers lawful creatures.
Medium Description: 1d8/two levels (max 5d8) damage to lawful creatures. 1d6/two levels (max 10d6) to lawful outsiders, half damage to nonlawful, nonchaotic. Slows creatures 1d6 rounds.
Long Descripton: You unleash chaotic power to smite your enemies. The power takes the form of a multicolored explosion of leaping, ricocheting energy. Only lawful and neutral (not chaotic) creatures are harmed by the spell.[lf][lf]The spell deals 1d8 points of damage per two caster levels (maximum 5d8) to lawful creatures (or 1d6 points of damage per caster level, maximum 10d6, to lawful outsiders) and slows them for 1d6 rounds (see slow spell).  A successful Will save reduces the damage by half and negates the slow effect.[lf][lf]The spell deals only half damage against creatures who are neither lawful nor chaotic, and they are not slowed. Such a creature can reduce the damage by half again (down to one-quarter) with a successful Will save.

Name: Charge of the Triceratops
Short Description: Subject grows horns and skull plate, gains gore attack.

Name: Charm Animal
Short Description: Makes one animal your friend.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like charm person, except that it affects a creature of the animal type.[lf][lf][lf][lf]This charm makes an animal creature regard you as its trusted friend and ally (treat the targets attitude as friendly). If the creature is currently being threatened or attacked by you or your allies, however, it receives a +5 bonus on its saving throw.[lf][lf]The spell does not enable you to control the charmed animal as if it were an automaton, but it perceives your words and actions in the most favorable way. You can try to give the subject orders, but you must win an opposed Charisma check to convince it to do anything it wouldnt ordinarily do. (Retries are not allowed.) An affected creature never obeys suicidal or obviously harmful orders, but it might be convinced that something very dangerous is worth doing.  Any act by you or your apparent allies that threatens the charmed person breaks the spell. You must speak the animal's language to communicate your commands, or else be good at pantomiming.

Name: Charm Monster
Short Description: Makes monster believe it is your ally.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like charm person, except that the effect is not restricted by creature type or size.[lf][lf]This charm makes a creature regard you as its trusted friend and ally (treat the targets attitude as friendly). If the creature is currently being threatened or attacked by you or your allies, however, it receives a +5 bonus on its saving throw.[lf][lf]The spell does not enable you to control the charmed creature as if it were an automaton, but it perceives your words and actions in the most favorable way. You can try to give the subject orders, but you must win an opposed Charisma check to convince it to do anything it wouldn't ordinarily do. (Retries are not allowed.) An affected creature never obeys suicidal or obviously harmful orders, but it might be convinced that something very dangerous is worth doing.  Any act by you or your apparent allies that threatens the charmed creature breaks the spell. You must speak the person's language to communicate your commands, or else be good at pantomiming.

Name: Charm Monster, Mass
Effect: One or more creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: As charm monster, but all within 30 ft.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like charm monster, except that mass charm monster affects a number of creatures whose combined HD do not exceed twice your level, or at least one creature regardless of HD. If there are more potential targets than you can affect, you choose them one at a time until you choose a creature with too many HD.[lf][lf]This charm makes a creature regard you as its trusted friend and ally (treat the targets attitude as friendly). If the creature is currently being threatened or attacked by you or your allies, however, it receives a +5 bonus on its saving throw.[lf][lf]The spell does not enable you to control the charmed creature as if it were an automaton, but it perceives your words and actions in the most favorable way. You can try to give the subject orders, but you must win an opposed Charisma check to convince it to do anything it wouldnt ordinarily do. (Retries are not allowed.) An affected creature never obeys suicidal or obviously harmful orders, but it might be convinced that something very dangerous is worth doing.  Any act by you or your apparent allies that threatens the charmed creature breaks the spell. You must speak the persons language to communicate your commands, or else be good at pantomiming.

Name: Charm Person
Short Description: Makes one person your friend.
Medium Description: Makes one humanoid friendly. Creature gets +5 to save if threatened or attacked.
Long Descripton: This charm makes a humanoid creature regard you as its trusted friend and ally (treat the targets attitude as friendly). If the creature is currently being threatened or attacked by you or your allies, however, it receives a +5 bonus on its saving throw.[lf][lf]The spell does not enable you to control the charmed person as if it were an automaton, but it perceives your words and actions in the most favorable way. You can try to give the subject orders, but you must win an opposed Charisma check to convince it to do anything it wouldn't ordinarily do. (Retries are not allowed.) An affected creature never obeys suicidal or obviously harmful orders, but it might be convinced that something very dangerous is worth doing.  Any act by you or your apparent allies that threatens the charmed person breaks the spell. You must speak the person's language to communicate your commands, or else be good at pantomiming.

Name: Charm Person, Mass
Effect: One or more creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: As charm person, but all within 30 feet.

Name: Charnel Fire
Saving Throw: None or Will negates; see text
Short Description: Consumes one corpse or undead creature.

Name: Cheat
Short Description: Caster rerolls when determining the success of a game of chance.

Name: Checkmate's Light
Short Description: Grants a weapon +1 enhancement bonus, +1 moral bonus to all within its light, and is axiomatic.

Name: Chill Metal
Effect: Metal equipment of one creature per two levels, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart; or 25 lb. of metal/level, none of which can be more than 30 ft. away from any of the rest
Short Description: Cold metal damages those who touch it.
Medium Description: Chilled metal deals cold damage to those who touch it.
Long Descripton: Chill metal makes metal extremely cold. Unattended, nonmagical metal gets no saving throw. Magical metal is allowed a saving throw against the spell. An item in a creatures possession uses the creatures saving throw bonus unless its own is higher.  [lf]A creature takes cold damage if its equipment is chilled. It takes full damage if its armor is affected or if it is holding, touching, wearing, or carrying metal weighing one-fifth of its weight. The creature takes minimum damage (1 point or 2 points; see the table) if its not wearing metal armor and the metal that its carrying weighs less than one-fifth of its weight.  [lf]On the first round of the spell, the metal becomes chilly and uncomfortable to touch but deals no damage. The same effect also occurs on the last round of the spells duration. During the second (and also the next-to-last) round, icy coldness causes pain and damage. In the third, fourth, and fifth rounds, the metal is freezing cold, causing more damage, as shown on the table below.    [lf]RoundMetal TemperatureDamage  [lf]1ColdNone  [lf]2Icy1d4  [lf]3-5Freezing2d4  [lf]6Icy1d4  [lf]7ColdNone      [lf]Any heat intense enough to damage the creature negates cold damage from the spell (and vice versa) on a point-for-point basis. Underwater, chill metal deals no damage, but ice immediately forms around the affected metal, making it more buoyant.  Chill metal counters and dispels heat metal.

Name: Chill of the Grave
Short Description: Ray causes cold damage.
Medium Description: Ray causes +1d10 cold damage at caster levels 1, 4, 7, 10.

Name: Chill Touch
Effect: Creature or creatures touched (up to one/level)
Saving Throw: Fortitude partial or Will negates; see text
Short Description: One touch/level deals 1d6 damage and possibly 1 Str damage.
Medium Description: One touch/level deals 1d6 negative energy damage and maybe 1 Str damage.
Long Descripton: A touch from your hand, which glows with blue energy, disrupts the life force of living creatures. Each touch channels negative energy that deals 1d6 points of damage. The touched creature also takes 1 point of Strength damage unless it makes a successful Fortitude saving throw. You can use this melee touch attack up to one time per level.[lf][lf]An undead creature you touch takes no damage of either sort, but it must make a successful Will saving throw or flee as if panicked for 1d4 rounds +1 round per caster level.

Name: Choir
Saving Throw: Will disbelief (if interacted with); see text
Short Description: Creates illusory accompanists; +2 on Perform checks.

Name: Choke
Effect: One creature up to size Large (see text)
Short Description: Target takes 1d4 points of damage each round from strangling hands.
Medium Description: Target takes 1d4 points of force damage each round from strangling hands.

Name: Choking Sands
Short Description: Touched creature begins to suffocate on sand.

Name: Choose Destiny
Short Description: Gain two chances for success on every action.

Name: Circle Dance
Short Description: Indicates direction to known target.

Name: Circle of Death
Effect: Several living creatures within a 40-ft.-radius burst
Short Description: Kills 1d4/level HD of creatures.
Long Descripton: A circle of death snuffs out the life force of living creatures, killing them instantly.[lf][lf]The spell slays 1d4 HD worth of living creatures per caster level (maximum 20d4). Creatures with the fewest HD are affected first; among creatures with equal HD, those who are closest to the bursts point of origin are affected first. No creature of 9 or more HD can be affected, and Hit Dice that are not sufficient to affect a creature are wasted.

Name: Circle of Nausea
Effect: An emanation extending in a 20-ft.-radius around a 2-ft.-radius circle on the ground with the caster in the center
Short Description: Foes are denied all actions or take -2 penalty on attacks, saving throws, and skill checks.

Name: City Lights
Short Description: Absorb nearby light to release as blinding flare.

Name: City Stride
Effect: You and touched objects or touched willing creatures
Short Description: Teleport between two cities.

Name: City's Might
Short Description: Gain enhancement to Str and Con, damage reduction, while in city.

Name: Clairaudience/Clairvoyance
Short Description: Hear or see at a distance for 1 min./level.
Medium Description: Hear or see at any locale known to you or obvious. Can see 10' radius from sensor in nonmagical darkness.
Long Descripton: Clairaudience/clairvoyance creates an invisible magical sensor at a specific location that enables you to hear or see (your choice) almost as if you were there. You don't need line of sight or line of effect, but the locale must be a known place familiar to you or an obvious one. Once you have selected the locale, the sensor doesn't move, but you can rotate it in all directions to view the area as desired. Unlike other scrying spells, this spell does not allow magically or supernaturally enhanced senses to work through it. If the chosen locale is magically dark, you see nothing. If it is naturally pitch black, you can see in a 10-foot radius around the center of the spells effect. Clairaudience/clairvoyance functions only on the plane of existence you are currently occupying.

Name: Clarity of Mind
Short Description: Grants +4 bonus on saves against charm, compulsion, and glamer spells; reduces glamer miss chance by 10%.

Name: Claws of Darkness
Short Description: Your hands become reach melee touch attacks that deal 1d8 cold damage plus slow.
Medium Description: Your hands make reach melee touch attacks that deal 1d8 cold damage and slow down opponents.

Name: Claws of the Bear
Short Description: Your hands become weapons dealing 1d8 damage.

Name: Claws of the Bebilith
Short Description: Caster gains claws based on her size.
Medium Description: Caster gains claws that deal damage based on her size.

Name: Claws of the Savage
Short Description: Subject gains claws that deal damage based on size.

Name: Clear Mind
Short Description: +4 on saves against mind-affecting spells and abilities.

Name: Clearstone
Effect: Stone or stone object touched, up to 1 cu. ft./level
Short Description: Makes rock or stone transparent.

Name: Clenched Fist
Short Description: Large hand provides cover, pushes, or attacks your foes.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like interposing hand, except that the hand can interpose itself, push, or strike one opponent that you select. The floating hand can move as far as 60 feet and can attack in the same round. Since this hand is directed by you, its ability to notice or attack invisible or concealed creatures is no better than yours.[lf][lf]The hand attacks once per round, and its attack bonus equals your caster level + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (for a wizard, cleric, or sorcerer, respectively), +11 for the hands Strength score (33), 1 for being Large. The hand deals 1d8+11 points of damage on each attack, and any creature struck must make a Fortitude save (against this spells save DC) or be stunned for 1 round. Directing the spell to a new target is a move action.[lf][lf]The clenched fist can also interpose itself as interposing hand does, or it can bull rush an opponent as forceful hand does, but at a +15 bonus on the Strength check.[lf][lf]Clerics who cast this spell name it for their deities.

Name: Climb Walls
Short Description: The subject gets a +10, +20@5th, or +30@9th enhancement bonus on Climb checks.

Name: Cloak of Bravery
Short Description: You and your allies gain a bonus on saves against fear.

Name: Cloak of Bravery, Greater
Short Description: As cloak of bravery, except very large area.

Name: Cloak of Chaos
Effect: One creature/level in a 20-ft.-radius burst centered on you
Short Description: +4 to AC, +4 resistance, and SR 25 against lawful spells.
Long Descripton: A random pattern of color surrounds the subjects, protecting them from attacks, granting them resistance to spells cast by lawful creatures, and causing lawful creatures that strike the subjects to become confused. This abjuration has four effects.[lf][lf]First, each warded creature gains a +4 deflection bonus to AC and a +4 resistance bonus on saves. Unlike protection from law, the benefit of this spell applies against all attacks, not just against attacks by lawful creatures.[lf][lf]Second, each warded creature gains spell resistance 25 against lawful spells and spells cast by lawful creatures.[lf][lf]Third, the abjuration blocks possession and mental influence, just as protection from law does.[lf][lf]Finally, if a lawful creature succeeds on a melee attack against a warded creature, the offending attacker is confused for 1 round (Will save negates, as with the confusion spell, but against the save DC of cloak of chaos).

Name: Cloak of Dark Power
Short Description: Protects subject from effects of sunlight, grants +4 resistance bonus on saves against light or darkness effects.

Name: Cloak of Shade
Short Description: Touched creature gains protection from heat and sun.

Name: Cloak of the Sea
Short Description: Gain blur, freedom of movement, and water breathing while in water.

Name: Cloak Pool
Short Description: Hide a color pool on the Astral Plane from view.

Name: Clone
Short Description: Duplicate awakens when original dies.
Long Descripton: This spell makes an inert duplicate of a creature. If the original individual has been slain, its soul immediately transfers to the clone, creating a replacement (provided that the soul is free and willing to return). The original's physical remains, should they still exist, become inert and cannot thereafter be restored to life. If the original creature has reached the end of its natural life span (that is, it has died of natural causes), any cloning attempt fails.[lf][lf]To create the duplicate, you must have a piece of flesh (not hair, nails, scales, or the like) with a volume of at least 1 cubic inch that was taken from the original creature's living body. The piece of flesh need not be fresh, but it must be kept from rotting. Once the spell is cast, the duplicate must be grown in a laboratory for 2d4 months.[lf][lf]When the clone is completed, the original's soul enters it immediately, if that creature is already dead. The clone is physically identical with the original and possesses the same personality and memories as the original. In other respects, treat the clone as if it were the original character raised from the dead, including the loss of one level or 2 points of Constitution (if the original was a 1st-level character). If this Constitution adjustment would give the clone a Constitution score of 0, the spell fails. If the original creature has lost levels since the flesh sample was taken and died at a lower level than the clone would otherwise be, the clone is one level below the level at which the original died.[lf][lf]The spell duplicates only the originals body and mind, not its equipment.[lf][lf]A duplicate can be grown while the original still lives, or when the original soul is unavailable, but the resulting body is merely a soulless bit of inert flesh, which rots if not preserved.

Name: Close Wounds
Short Description: Cure 1d4 +1/level (max +5) damage, even on another's turn (immediate).

Name: Clothier's Closet
Effect: One or more sets of clothes
Short Description: Conjure several sets of clothing.

Name: Cloud Chariot
Effect: You and other touched willing creatures
Short Description: Subjects fly at 600 miles an hour for 10 minutes.

Name: Cloud of Bewilderment
Short Description: Generates a nauseating 10-ft. cone.

Name: Cloud of Knives
Short Description: Release one knife/round, 1d6 damage +1/3 levels (max +5).
Medium Description: Release one knife/round for 1d6 damage +1/3 levels (max +5). Ranged attack to hit with an attack bonus of your caster level + your key ability modifier.

Name: Cloud of the Achaierai
Short Description: Cloud deals 2d6 damage plus confusion.

Name: Cloud Spear
Short Description: Cloud spear deals 1d8 +1/2 levels piercing damage and may inflict a gaseous form effect.

Name: Cloud Wings
Short Description: Increase the subject's fly speed by 30 feet.

Name: Cloud-walkers
Short Description: Targets can walk on clouds, flying at high altitudes.

Name: Cloudburst
Short Description: Rain obscures vision, extinguishes fires, and hampers missiles.

Name: Cloudkill
Effect: Cloud spreads in 20-ft. radius, 20 ft. high
Short Description: Kills 3 HD or less; 4-6 HD save or die, 6+ HD take Con damage.
Long Descripton: This spell generates a bank of fog, similar to a fog cloud, except that its vapors are yellowish green and poisonous. These vapors automatically kill any living creature with 3 or fewer HD (no save). A living creature with 4 to 6 HD is slain unless it succeeds on a Fortitude save (in which case it takes 1d4 points of Constitution damage on your turn each round while in the cloud).[lf][lf]A living creature with 6 or more HD takes 1d4 points of Constitution damage on your turn each round while in the cloud (a successful Fortitude save halves this damage). Holding ones breath doesn't help, but creatures immune to poison are unaffected by the spell.[lf][lf]Unlike a fog cloud, the cloudkill moves away from you at 10 feet per round, rolling along the surface of the ground.[lf][lf]Figure out the clouds new spread each round based on its new point of origin, which is 10 feet farther away from the point of origin where you cast the spell.[lf][lf]Because the vapors are heavier than air, they sink to the lowest level of the land, even pouring down den or sinkhole openings. It cannot penetrate liquids, nor can it be cast underwater.

Name: Clutch of Orcus
Short Description: Deals 1d3 damage/round and paralyzes foe with concentration.

Name: Cobra's Breath
Short Description: Cone of Poison deals 1d3 Con damage once.

Name: Cocoon
Short Description: Paralyzes and drains levels from target.

Name: Cocoon of Life
Short Description: Preserves a corpse and reincarnates with no loss of level.

Name: Cold Fire
Effect: One fire source (up to a 20-ft. cube) or one creature; see text
Short Description: Fire becomes blue and white, emits cold.

Name: Cold Snap
Short Description: You lower temperature in area.

Name: Coldscream
Short Description: Deal 1d6/level (max 10d6) sonic and cold (half each) damage in a cone.
Medium Description: Cone deals 1d6/level (max 10d6) sonic and cold damage (half each).

Name: Color Spray
Short Description: Knocks unconscious, blinds, and/or stuns 1d6 weak creatures.
Medium Description: Stuns creatures 5+ HD 1 rd, also blinds 3-4 HD another 1d4 rounds, also knocks unconscious 2 HD living creatures another 2d4 rounds.
Long Descripton: A vivid cone of clashing colors springs forth from your hand, causing creatures to become stunned, perhaps also blinded, and possibly knocking them unconscious.[lf][lf]Each creature within the cone is affected according to its Hit Dice.[lf][lf]2 HD or less: The creature is unconscious, blinded, and stunned for 2d4 rounds, then blinded and stunned for 1d4 rounds, and then stunned for 1 round. (Only living creatures are knocked unconscious.)[lf][lf]3 or 4 HD: The creature is blinded and stunned for 1d4 rounds, then stunned for 1 round.[lf][lf]5 or more HD: The creature is stunned for 1 round.[lf][lf]Sightless creatures are not affected by color spray.

Name: Column of Ice
Effect: One column of ice, 10-ft. radius and 5 ft./level in height
Short Description: Column of ice erupts from ground, lifting anything in its area into the air.

Name: Coma
Short Description: You put a living creature in a coma.

Name: Combust
Effect: Touched creature or combustible object that weighs no more than 25 lb./level
Short Description: Target takes 1d8/level (max 10d8) fire damage.
Medium Description: Target takes 1d8/level (max 10d8) fire damage.

Name: Cometfall
Short Description: Comet falls atop foes, damaging them and knocking them prone.

Name: Cometstrike
Short Description: Three comets per round strike targets, each dealing 3d6 bludgeoning damage and 1d4/level cold damage.
Medium Description: 3 comets per round strike targets, each dealing 3d6 bludgeoning and 1d4/level (max 10d4) cold damage.

Name: Command
Short Description: One subject obeys selected command for 1 round.
Long Descripton: You give the subject a single command, which it obeys to the best of its ability at its earliest opportunity. You may select from the following options.[lf][lf]Approach: On its turn, the subject moves toward you as quickly and directly as possible for 1 round. The creature may do nothing but move during its turn, and it provokes attacks of opportunity for this movement as normal.[lf][lf]Drop: On its turn, the subject drops whatever it is holding. It can't pick up any dropped item until its next turn.[lf][lf]Fall: On its turn, the subject falls to the ground and remains prone for 1 round. It may act normally while prone but takes any appropriate penalties.[lf][lf]Flee: On its turn, the subject moves away from you as quickly as possible for 1 round. It may do nothing but move during its turn, and it provokes attacks of opportunity for this movement as normal.[lf][lf]Halt: The subject stands in place for 1 round. It may not take any actions but is not considered helpless.[lf][lf]If the subject can't carry out your command on its next turn, the spell automatically fails.

Name: Command Plants
Effect: Up to 2 HD/level of plant creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Sway the actions of one or more plant creatures.
Long Descripton: This spell allows you some degree of control over one or more plant creatures. Affected plant creatures can understand you, and they perceive your words and actions in the most favorable way (treat their attitude as friendly). They will not attack you while the spell lasts. You can try to give a subject orders, but you must win an opposed Charisma check to convince it to do anything it wouldnt ordinarily do. (Retries are not allowed.) A commanded plant never obeys suicidal or obviously harmful orders, but it might be convinced that something very dangerous is worth doing.[lf][lf]You can affect a number of plant creatures whose combined level or HD do not exceed twice your level.

Name: Command Undead
Short Description: Undead creature obeys your commands.
Long Descripton: This spell allows you some degree of control over an undead creature. Assuming the subject is intelligent, it perceives your words and actions in the most favorable way (treat its attitude as friendly). It will not attack you while the spell lasts. You can try to give the subject orders, but you must win an opposed Charisma check to convince it to do anything it wouldn't ordinarily do. (Retries are not allowed.) An intelligent commanded undead never obeys suicidal or obviously harmful orders, but it might be convinced that something very dangerous is worth doing.[lf][lf]A nonintelligent undead creature gets no saving throw against this spell. When you control a mindless being, you can communicate only basic commands, such as come here, go there, fight, stand still, and so on. Nonintelligent undead won't resist suicidal or obviously harmful orders.[lf][lf]Any act by you or your apparent allies that threatens the commanded undead (regardless of its Intelligence) breaks the spell.[lf][lf]Your commands are not telepathic. The undead creature must be able to hear you.

Name: Command, Greater
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: As command, but affects one subject/level.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like command, except that up to one creature per level may be affected, and the activities continue beyond 1 round. At the start of each commanded creatures action after the first, it gets another Will save to attempt to break free from the spell. Each creature must receive the same command.

Name: Commune
Short Description: Deity answers one yes-or-no question/level.
Long Descripton: You contact your deity or agents thereof and ask questions that can be answered by a simple yes or no. (A cleric of no particular deity contacts a philosophically allied deity.) You are allowed one such question per caster level. The answers given are correct within the limits of the entity's knowledge. Unclear is a legitimate answer, because powerful beings of the Outer Planes are not necessarily omniscient. In cases where a one-word answer would be misleading or contrary to the deitys interests, a short phrase (five words or less) may be given as an answer instead.[lf][lf]The spell, at best, provides information to aid character decisions. The entities contacted structure their answers to further their own purposes. If you lag, discuss the answers, or go off to do anything else, the spell ends.

Name: Commune with City
Short Description: Learn about city.

Name: Commune with Earth
Effect: the ground or terrain, plants, minerals, bodies of water, people, general animal population, presence of woodland creatures, presence of powerful unnatural creatures, or even the general state of the natural setting.
Short Description: Learn about terrain for 1 mile/level.

Name: Commune with Greater Spirit
Short Description: As commune with lesser spirit, except this spell can contact any spirit creature regardless of Hit Dice, and you can ask one question per caster level.

Name: Commune with Lesser Spirit
Short Description: Ask questions to a local spirit about local events.

Name: Commune with Nature
Effect: the ground or terrain, plants, minerals, bodies of water, people, general animal population, presence of woodland creatures, presence of powerful unnatural creatures, or even the general state of the natural setting.
Short Description: Learn about terrain for 1 mile/level.
Long Descripton: In outdoor settings, the spell operates in a radius of 1 mile per caster level. In natural underground settingscaves, caverns, and the likethe radius is limited to 100 feet per caster level. The spell does not function where nature has been replaced by construction or settlement, such as in dungeons and towns.

Name: Comprehend Languages
Short Description: You understand all spoken and written languages.
Medium Description: Touch creature or writing to understand language, but you cannot speak or write them.
Long Descripton: You can understand the spoken words of creatures or read otherwise incomprehensible written messages. In either case, you must touch the creature or the writing. The ability to read does not necessarily impart insight into the material, merely its literal meaning. The spell enables you to understand or read an unknown language, not speak or write it.[lf][lf]Written material can be read at the rate of one page (250 words) per minute. Magical writing cannot be read, though the spell reveals that it is magical. This spell can be foiled by certain warding magic (such as the secret page and illusory script spells). It does not decipher codes or reveal messages concealed in otherwise normal text.[lf][lf]Comprehend languages can be made permanent with a permanency spell.

Name: Concurrent Infusions
Short Description: Cast three 1st-level infusions simultaneously.

Name: Conditional Spell
Short Description: See Text

Name: Conduit Of Life
Short Description: Heal 2dl0+1/caster level (max. 10) points of damage to yourself while channeling positive energy.
Medium Description: Heal 2dl0+1/caster level (max. 10) points of damage to yourself while channeling positive energy.

Name: Cone of Cold
Short Description: 1d6/level cold damage.
Medium Description: 1d6/level (max 15d6) cold damage in a cone.
Long Descripton: Cone of cold creates an area of extreme cold, originating at your hand and extending outward in a cone. It drains heat, dealing 1d6 points of cold damage per caster level (maximum 15d6).

Name: Cone of Dimness
Short Description: Cone temporarily convinces creatures that they are blind.

Name: Confound
Short Description: Gain a on attack rolls against subject and impose a penalty on its attack rolls against you
Medium Description: Gain a +2 circumstance bonus on attack rolls against subject and impose a -2 penalty on its attack rolls against you; subject cannot make attacks of opportunity[lf][lf]against you; repeated use extends benefits to allies.

Name: Confusion
Effect: All creatures in a 15-ft. radius burst
Short Description: For 1 round/level, subject will attack caster 10%, act normally 10%, babble 30%, flee 20%, attack nearest creature 30%.
Long Descripton: This spell causes the targets to become confused, making them unable to independently determine what they will do.  Roll on the following table at the beginning of each subjects turn each round to see what the subject does in that round.    [lf]d%Behavior  [lf]01-10Attack caster with melee or ranged weapons (or close with caster if attack is not possible).  [lf]11-20Act normally.  [lf]21-50Do nothing but babble incoherently.  [lf]51-70Flee away from caster at top possible speed.  [lf]71-100Attack nearest creature (for this purpose, a familiar counts as part of the subjects self).    [lf]A confused character who can't carry out the indicated action does nothing but babble incoherently. Attackers are not at any special advantage when attacking a confused character. Any confused character who is attacked automatically attacks its attackers on its next turn, as long as it is still confused when its turn comes. Note that a confused character will not make attacks of opportunity against any creature that it is not already devoted to attacking (either because of its most recent action or because it has just been attacked).

Name: Confusion, Lesser
Short Description: One creature is confused for 1 round.
Long Descripton: This spell causes the targets to become confused, making them unable to independently determine what they will do.  Roll on the following table at the beginning of each subjects turn each round to see what the subject does in that round.    [lf]d%Behavior  [lf]01-10Attack caster with melee or ranged weapons (or close with caster if attack is not possible).  [lf]11-20Act normally.  [lf]21-50Do nothing but babble incoherently.  [lf]51-70Flee away from caster at top possible speed.  [lf]71-100Attack nearest creature (for this purpose, a familiar counts as part of the subjects self).    [lf]A confused character who can't carry out the indicated action does nothing but babble incoherently. Attackers are not at any special advantage when attacking a confused character. Any confused character who is attacked automatically attacks its attackers on its next turn, as long as it is still confused when its turn comes. Note that a confused character will not make attacks of opportunity against any creature that it is not already devoted to attacking (either because of its most recent action or because it has just been attacked).

Name: Conjure Greater Midnight Construct
Short Description: As conjure lesser midnight construct, except conjure a greater midnight construct instead with more essentia options.

Name: Conjure Ice Beast I
Short Description: Conjures ice creature to fight for you.

Name: Conjure Ice Beast II
Effect: One or more conjured ice creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Conjures ice creature to fight for you.

Name: Conjure Ice Beast III
Effect: One or more conjured ice creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Conjures ice creature to fight for you.

Name: Conjure Ice Beast IV
Effect: One or more conjured ice creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Conjures ice creature to fight for you.

Name: Conjure Ice Beast IX
Effect: One or more conjured ice creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Conjures ice creature to fight for you.

Name: Conjure Ice Beast V
Effect: One or more conjured ice creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Conjures ice creature to fight for you.

Name: Conjure Ice Beast VI
Effect: One or more conjured ice creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Conjures ice creature to fight for you.

Name: Conjure Ice Beast VII
Effect: One or more conjured ice creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Conjures ice creature to fight for you.

Name: Conjure Ice Beast VIII
Effect: One or more conjured ice creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Conjures ice creature to fight for you.

Name: Conjure Ice Object
Effect: One object of up to 5 lb./level
Short Description: Conjures an object made of ice.

Name: Conjure Lesser Midnight Construct
Short Description: Create a lesser midnight construct.

Name: Conjure Midnight Construct
Short Description: As conjure lesser midnight construct, except conjure a midnight construct instead with more essentia options.

Name: Conjurer's Toolbelt
Effect: Conjures an unattened, nonmagical object weighing no more than 1 lb. and being no longer than 1 cubic foot in size.
Short Description: Creates a tool.
Medium Description: Creates a tool.

Name: Consecrate
Short Description: Fills area with positive energy, making undead weaker.
Long Descripton: This spell blesses an area with positive energy. Each Charisma check made to turn undead within this area gains a +3 sacred bonus. Every undead creature entering a consecrated area suffers minor disruption, giving it a -1 penalty on attack rolls, damage rolls, and saves. Undead cannot be created within or summoned into a consecrated area.[lf][lf]If the consecrated area contains an altar, shrine, or other permanent fixture dedicated to your deity, pantheon, or aligned higher power, the modifiers given above are doubled (+6 sacred bonus on turning checks, -2 penalties for undead in the area). You cannot consecrate an area with a similar fixture of a deity other than your own patron.[lf][lf]If the area does contain an altar, shrine, or other permanent fixture of a deity, pantheon, or higher power other than your patron, the consecrate spell instead curses the area, cutting off its connection with the associated deity or power. This secondary function, if used, does not also grant the bonuses and penalties relating to undead, as given above.[lf][lf]Consecrate counters and dispels desecrate.

Name: Consecrate Battlefield
Short Description: Fills large area with positive energy, making undead weaker.

Name: Constricting Chains
Short Description: Chains (AC 20 hp 5/level (max 100), DR 10/magic, energy immune) entangle target and deal 3d6 nonlethal damage. Strength check DC 32 break or Escape Artist DC 40 (1 minute) to get free.
Medium Description: Chains (AC 20, 5HP/level [max 100], DR 10/magic, energy immune) entangle target and deal 3d6 nonlethal damage. DC32 Str check to break or DC40 Escape Artist (1 minute) to free.

Name: Construct Energy Ward
Short Description: As resist energy, except that the target must be a construct.

Name: Construct Energy Ward, Greater
Short Description: As protection from energy, except that the target must be a construct.

Name: Construct Essence
Short Description: As lesser construct essence, but grants more qualities of the construct type.

Name: Construct Essence, Greater
Short Description: Grants a living construct all the benefits of the construct type.

Name: Construct Essence, Lesser
Short Description: Grants a living construct qualities of the construct type.

Name: Construct Essence, Mass Lesser
Effect: One living construct/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Grants many living constructs qualities of the construct type.

Name: Consume Likeness
Short Description: Caster steals the appearance of a dead person, adding +10 on Disguise checks.

Name: Consumptive Field
Short Description: Draw life from all creatures in 30-ft. radius with -1 or fewer hit points that fail save.

Name: Consumptive Field, Greater
Short Description: Draw life from all creatures in 30-ft. radius with 9 or fewer hit points that fail save.

Name: Contact Other Plane
Short Description: Lets you ask question of extraplanar entity.
Long Descripton: You send your mind to another plane of existence (an Elemental Plane or some plane farther removed) in order to receive advice and information from powers there. (See the accompanying table for possible consequences and results of the attempt.) The powers reply in a language you understand, but they resent such contact and give only brief answers to your questions. (All questions are answered with yes, no, maybe, never, irrelevant, or some other one-word answer.)  [lf]You must concentrate on maintaining the spell (a standard action) in order to ask questions at the rate of one per round. A question is answered by the power during the same round. For every two caster levels, you may ask one question.  [lf]Contact with minds far removed from your home plane increases the probability that you will incur a decrease to Intelligence and Charisma, but the chance of the power knowing the answer, as well as the probability of the entity answering correctly, are likewise increased by moving to distant planes.  [lf]Once the Outer Planes are reached, the power of the deity contacted determines the effects. (Random results obtained from the table are subject to the personalities of individual deities.)  [lf]On rare occasions, this divination may be blocked by an act of certain deities or forces.    [lf]Plane Contacted  Avoid Int/Cha Decrease  True Answer  Dont Know  Lie  Random Answer  [lf]Elemental Plane  DC 7/1 week  01-34  35-62  63-83  84-100  [lf]Elemental Plane (appropriate)    (DC 7/1 week)  (01-68)  (69-75)  (76-98)  (99-100)  [lf]Positive/Negative Energy Plane  DC 8/1 week  01-39  40-65  66-86  87-100  [lf]Astral Plane    DC 9/1 week  01-44  45-67  68-88  89-100  [lf]Outer Plane, demideity    DC 10/2 weeks  01-49  50-70  71-91  92-100  [lf]Outer Plane, lesser deity    DC 12/3 weeks  01-60  61-75  76-95  96-100  [lf]Outer Plane, intermediate deity    DC 14/4 weeks  01-73  74-81  82-98  99-100  [lf]Outer Plane, greater deity    DC 16/5 weeks  01-88  89-90  91-99  100    [lf]Avoid Int/Cha Decrease: You must succeed on an Intelligence check against this DC to avoid a decrease in Intelligence and Charisma. If the check fails, your Intelligence and Charisma scores each fall to 8 for the stated duration, and you become unable to cast arcane spells. If you lose Intelligence and Charisma, the effect strikes as soon as the first question is asked, and no answer is received. (The entries in parentheses are for questions that pertain to the appropriate Elemental Plane.)  [lf]Results of a Successful Contact: d% is rolled for the result shown on the table:  [lf]True Answer: You get a true, one-word answer. Questions that cannot be answered in this way are answered randomly.  [lf]Dont Know: The entity tells you that it doesn't know.  [lf]Lie: The entity intentionally lies to you.  [lf]Random Answer: The entity tries to lie but doesn't know the answer, so it makes one up.

Name: Contagion
Short Description: Infects subject with chosen disease.
Long Descripton: The subject contracts a disease selected from the table below, which strikes immediately (no incubation period). The DC noted is for the subsequent saves (use contagions normal save DC for the initial saving throw).    [lf]DiseaseDC  Damage  [lf]Blinding sickness  16  1d4 Str (1)  [lf]Cackle fever  16  1d6 Wis  [lf]Filth fever  12  1d3 Dex and 1d3 Con  [lf]Mindfire  12  1d4 Int  [lf]Red ache  15  1d6 Str  [lf]Shakes  13  1d8 Dex  [lf]Slimy doom  14  1d4 Con    [lf]1 Each time a victim takes 2 or more points of Strength damage from blinding sickness, he or she must make another Fortitude save (using the disease's save DC) or be permanently blinded.

Name: Contagion, Mass
Short Description: As contagion, but 20-ft. radius.

Name: Contagious Fog
Effect: Cloud spreads in a 20-ft. radius, 20 ft. high.
Short Description: 20-ft.-radius cloud of fog inflicts disease.

Name: Contagious Touch
Short Description: You infect one creature per round with chosen disease.

Name: Contingency
Short Description: Sets trigger condition for another spell.
Long Descripton: You can place another spell upon your person so that it comes into effect under some condition you dictate when casting contingency. The contingency spell and the companion spell are cast at the same time. The 10-minute casting time is the minimum total for both castings; if the companion spell has a casting time longer than 10 minutes, use that instead.[lf][lf]The spell to be brought into effect by the contingency must be one that affects your person and be of a spell level no higher than one-third your caster level (rounded down, maximum 6th level).[lf][lf]The conditions needed to bring the spell into effect must be clear, although they can be general. In all cases, the contingency immediately brings into effect the companion spell, the latter being "cast" instantaneously when the prescribed circumstances occur. If complicated or convoluted conditions are prescribed, the whole spell combination (contingency and the companion magic) may fail when called on.
