The companion spell occurs based solely on the stated conditions, regardless of whether you want it to.[lf][lf]You can use only one contingency spell at a time; if a second is cast, the first one (if still active) is dispelled.

Name: Contingent Energy Resistance
Short Description: Energy damage triggers a resist energy spell.

Name: Continual Flame
Short Description: Makes a permanent, heatless torch.
Long Descripton: A flame, equivalent in brightness to a torch, springs forth from an object that you touch. The effect looks like a regular flame, but it creates no heat and doesn't use oxygen. A continual flame can be covered and hidden but not smothered or quenched.[lf][lf]Light spells counter and dispel darkness spells of an equal or lower level.

Name: Control Currents
Short Description: Changes current direction and speed.

Name: Control Darkness and Shadow
Short Description: Manipulate existing areas of darkness and shadow.

Name: Control Deathless
Effect: Up to 2 HD of deathless creatures/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Deathless don't attack you while under your command.

Name: Control Elemental
Effect: One elemental with HD no greater than twice your caster level
Short Description: Gain control of an elemental creature

Name: Control Plants
Effect: Up to 2 HD/level of plant creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Control actions of one or more plant creatures.
Long Descripton: This spell enables you to control the actions of one or more plant creatures for a short period of time. You command the creatures by voice and they understand you, no matter what language you speak. Even if vocal communication is impossible  the controlled plants do not attack you. At the end of the spell, the subjects revert to their normal behavior.[lf][lf]Suicidal or self-destructive commands are simply ignored.

Name: Control Sand
Effect: Dust or sand in a volume of 10 ft./level wide by 10 ft./level long by 2 ft./level deep (S)
Short Description: Raise or lower the level of sand.

Name: Control Snow and Ice
Effect: Ice and snow in a volume of 10 ft./level by 10 ft./level by 2
Short Description: Raise or lower ice or snow.

Name: Control Temperature
Effect: 20 cu. ft./level emanation, centered on you
Short Description: Raise or lower temperature by one band/5 levels.

Name: Control Undead
Effect: Up to 2 HD/level of undead creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Undead don't attack you while under your command.
Long Descripton: This spell enables you to command undead creatures for a short period of time. You command them by voice and they understand you, no matter what language you speak. Even if vocal communication is impossible the controlled undead do not attack you. At the end of the spell, the subjects revert to their normal behavior.[lf][lf]Intelligent undead creatures remember that you controlled them.

Name: Control Water
Effect: Water in a volume of 10 ft./level by 10 ft./level by 2 ft./level (S)
Short Description: Raises or lowers bodies of water.
Long Descripton: Depending on the version you choose, the control water spell raises or lowers water.[lf][lf]Lower Water: This causes water or similar liquid to reduce its depth by as much as 2 feet per caster level (to a minimum depth of 1 inch). The water is lowered within a squarish depression whose sides are up to caster level x 10 feet long. In extremely large and deep bodies of water, such as a deep ocean, the spell creates a whirlpool that sweeps ships and similar craft downward, putting them at risk and rendering them unable to leave by normal movement for the duration of the spell. When cast on water elementals and other water-based creatures, this spell acts as a slow spell (Will negates). The spell has no effect on other creatures.[lf][lf]Raise Water: This causes water or similar liquid to rise in height, just as the lower water version causes it to lower. Boats raised in this way slide down the sides of the hump that the spell creates. If the area affected by the spell includes riverbanks, a beach, or other land nearby, the water can spill over onto dry land.[lf][lf]With either version, you may reduce one horizontal dimension by half and double the other horizontal dimension.

Name: Control Weather
Effect: 2-mile-radius circle, centered on you; see text
Short Description: Changes weather in local area.
Long Descripton: You change the weather in the local area. It takes 10 minutes to cast the spell and an additional 10 minutes for the effects to manifest. You can call forth weather appropriate to the climate and season of the area you are in.    [lf]SeasonPossible Weather  [lf]Spring  Tornado, thunderstorm, sleet storm, or hot weather  [lf]Summer  Torrential rain, heat wave, or hailstorm  [lf]Autumn  Hot or cold weather, fog, or sleet  [lf]Winter  Frigid cold, blizzard, or thaw  [lf]Late winter  Hurricane-force winds or early spring (coastal area)    [lf]You control the general tendencies of the weather, such as the direction and intensity of the wind. You cannot control specific applications of the weatherwhere lightning strikes, for example, or the exact path of a tornado. When you select a certain weather condition to occur, the weather assumes that condition 10 minutes later (changing gradually, not abruptly). The weather continues as you left it for the duration, or until you use a standard action to designate a new kind of weather (which fully manifests itself 10 minutes later). Contradictory conditions are not possible simultaneously.  [lf]Control weather can do away with atmospheric phenomena (naturally occurring or otherwise) as well as create them.  [lf]A druid casting this spell doubles the duration and affects a circle with a 3-mile radius.

Name: Control Winds
Short Description: Change wind direction and speed.
Long Descripton: You alter wind force in the area surrounding you. You can make the wind blow in a certain direction or manner, increase its strength, or decrease its strength. The new wind direction and strength persist until the spell ends or until you choose to alter your handiwork, which requires concentration. You may create an eye of calm air up to 80 feet in diameter at the center of the area if you so desire, and you may choose to limit the area to any cylindrical area less than your full limit.[lf][lf]Wind Direction: You may choose one of four basic wind patterns to function over the spells area.[lf][lf] A downdraft blows from the center outward in equal strength in all directions.[lf][lf] An updraft blows from the outer edges in toward the center in equal strength from all directions, veering upward before impinging on the eye in the center.[lf][lf] A rotation causes the winds to circle the center in clockwise or counterclockwise fashion.[lf][lf] A blast simply causes the winds to blow in one direction across the entire area from one side to the other.[lf][lf]Wind Strength: For every three caster levels, you can increase or decrease wind strength by one level. Each round on your turn, a creature in the wind must make a Fortitude save or suffer the effect of being in the windy area.[lf][lf]Strong winds (21+ mph) make sailing difficult.[lf][lf]A severe wind (31+ mph) causes minor ship and building damage.[lf][lf]A windstorm (51+ mph) drives most flying creatures from the skies, uproots small trees, knocks down light wooden structures, tears off roofs, and endangers ships.[lf][lf]Hurricane force winds (75+ mph) destroy wooden buildings, sometimes uproot even large trees, and cause most ships to founder.[lf][lf]A tornado (175+ mph) destroys all nonfortified buildings and often uproots large trees.

Name: Convert Wand
Short Description: Transform wand of a particular spell and caster level into an appropriate cure wand of the same spell and caster level.

Name: Conviction
Short Description: Subject gains +2 or higher save bonus.

Name: Conviction, Mass
Short Description: Allies gain +2 or higher save bonus.

Name: Corona of Cold
Short Description: Aura of cold protects you, damages others.

Name: Corporeal Instability
Short Description: Transform a target creature into an amorphous mass.

Name: Corpse Candle
Short Description: Incorporeal hand and candle reveals hidden creatures and objects.

Name: Corrosive Grasp
Short Description: You deal 1d8 acid damage with one touch/level

Name: Corrupt Weapon
Short Description: Weapon strikes true against good foes.
Long Descripton: This transmutation makes a weapon strike true against good foes. The weapon is treated as having a +1 enhancement bonus for the purpose of bypassing the damage reduction of good creatures or striking good incorporeal creatures (though the spell doesn't grant an actual enhancement bonus). The weapon also becomes evil, which means it can bypass the damage reduction of certain creatures. (This effect overrides and suppresses any other alignment the weapon might have.) Individual arrows or bolts can be transmuted, but affected projectile weapons (such as bows) don't confer the benefit to the projectiles they shoot.[lf][lf]In addition, all critical hit rolls against good foes are automatically successful, so every threat is a critical hit. This last effect does not apply to any weapon that already has a magical effect related to critical hits, such as a keen edge or a vorpal sword.

Name: Countermoon
Short Description: Stop a lycanthrope from changing form, even after death, for 12 hours.

Name: Crabwalk
Short Description: Subject gains +2 to AC and Attacks when charging.

Name: Crack Ice
Short Description: Shatters ice structures or ice creatures.

Name: Crawling Darkness
Short Description: Cloud of tentacles provides concealment, skill bonuses, and several defenses.

Name: Creaking Cacophony
Short Description: Spell causes deafness and shankened and applies a sonic weakness to subjects.

Name: Create Crossroads and Backroad
Short Description: Links two locations by magical path.

Name: Create Deathless
Short Description: Create undying soldier.

Name: Create Fetch
Short Description: Craft a temporary duplicate of yourself that follows telepathic orders.

Name: Create Food and Water
Effect: Food and water to sustain three humans or one horse/level for 24 hours
Short Description: Feeds three humans (or one horse)/level.
Long Descripton: The food that this spell creates is simple fare of your choice highly nourishing, if rather bland. Food so created decays and becomes inedible within 24 hours, although it can be kept fresh for another 24 hours by casting a purify food and water spell on it. The water created by this spell is just like clean rain water, and it doesn't go bad as the food does.

Name: Create Greater Deathless
Short Description: Create undying councilor.

Name: Create Greater Undead
Short Description: Create shadows, wraiths, spectres, or devourers.
Long Descripton: A much more potent spell than animate dead, this evil spell allows you to create more powerful sorts of undead: shadows, wraiths, spectres, and devourers. The type or types of undead you can create is based on your caster level, as shown on the table below.    [lf]Caster LevelUndead Created  [lf]15th or lowerShadow  [lf]16th - 17thWraith  [lf]18th - 19thSpectre  [lf]20th or higherDevourer    [lf]You may create less powerful undead than your level would allow if you choose. Created undead are not automatically under the control of their animator. If you are capable of commanding undead, you may attempt to command the undead creature as it forms.  [lf]This spell must be cast at night.

Name: Create Magic Tattoo
Short Description: Subject receives a magic tattoo with various effects.

Name: Create Spirit Idol
Short Description: Keeps a fallen elf away from Dolurrh and allows necromancers to call on his wisdom in the future.

Name: Create Trap
Short Description: Creates a CR 1 trap.

Name: Create Undead
Short Description: Creates ghouls, ghasts, mummies, or mohrgs.
Long Descripton: A much more potent spell than animate dead, this evil spell allows you to create more powerful sorts of undead: ghouls, ghasts, mummies, and mohrgs. The type or types of undead you can create is based on your caster level, as shown on the table below.  [lf]  Caster LevelUndead Created  [lf]11th or lowerGhoul  [lf]12th - 14thGhast  [lf]15th - 17thMummy  [lf]18th or higherMohrg    [lf]You may create less powerful undead than your level would allow if you choose. Created undead are not automatically under the control of their animator. If you are capable of commanding undead, you may attempt to command the undead creature as it forms.  [lf]This spell must be cast at night.

Name: Create Water
Short Description: Creates 2 gallons/level of pure water.
Long Descripton: This spell generates wholesome, drinkable water, just like clean rain water. Water can be created in an area as small as will actually contain the liquid, or in an area three times as large possibly creating a downpour or filling many small receptacles.[lf][lf]Note: Conjuration spells cant create substances or objects within a creature. Water weighs about 8 pounds per gallon. One cubic foot of water contains roughly 8 gallons and weighs about 60 pounds.

Name: Creeping Cold
Short Description: Creature feels chill that increases with each round.
Medium Description: Creature takes 1d6 cumulative cold damage that increases with each round (2d6, 3d6).

Name: Creeping Cold, Greater
Short Description: As creeping cold, but longer duration and more damage.
Medium Description: As creeping cold, but accumulates 1 extra round (2 at level 15).

Name: Creeping Darkness
Effect: Cloud spreads in a 20-ft.-radius, 20 ft. high (S)
Short Description: Create a mobile darkness and silence effect.

Name: Creeping Doom
Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)/ 100 ft.; see text
Effect: One swarm of centipedes per two levels
Short Description: Swarms of centipedes attack at your command.
Long Descripton: When you utter the spell of creeping doom, you call forth a mass of centipede swarms (one per two caster levels, to a maximum of ten swarms at 20th level), which need not appear adjacent to one another.[lf][lf]You may summon the centipede swarms so that they share the area of other creatures. The swarms remain stationary, attacking any creatures in their area, unless you command the creeping doom to move (a standard action). As a standard action, you can command any number of the swarms to move toward any prey within 100 feet of you. You cannot command any swarm to move more than 100 feet away from you, and if you move more than 100 feet from any swarm, that swarm remains stationary, attacking any creatures in its area (but it can be commanded again if you move within 100 feet).

Name: Crescendo
Effect: The caster and all allies within a 30-ft. sphere
Short Description: Grants increasing bonus on attack rolls.

Name: Crisis of Confidence
Short Description: Target loses commander rating, aura; can't add Cha to rally checks.

Name: Critical Strike
Short Description: Swift. For 1 round you gain +1d6 damage, doubled threat range, and +4 on attack rolls to confirm critical hits.

Name: Cross of Lightning
Effect: Four bolts, 5-ft. wide to medium range (100ft.+10 ft./level) or 10-ft. wide to 50 ft.+5 ft./level
Short Description: As lightning bolt, except four lightning bolts that lauch 90 degrees apart from each other.

Name: Crown of Brilliance
Short Description: Holy light blinds or dazzles foes, repels light-sensitive creatures, and damages undead.

Name: Crown of Despair
Short Description: All creatures that see you must save or be paralyzed.

Name: Crown of Flame
Short Description: Aura burns evil outsiders, undead, and fey for 2d6 points of damage/round.
Medium Description: Aura burns evil outsiders, undead, and fey for 2d6 points of good-aligned damage/round.

Name: Crown Of Glory
Short Description: You gain +4 Charisma and enthrall those who hear you.
Long Descripton: You are imbued with an aura of celestial authority, inspiring awe in all lesser creatures that behold your terrible perfection and righteousness. You gain a +4 enhancement bonus to your Charisma score for the duration of the spell.[lf][lf]All creatures with fewer than 8 HD or levels cease whatever they are doing and are compelled to pay attention to you. Any such creature that wants to take hostile action against you must make a successful Will save to do so. Any creature that does not make this saving throw the first time it attempts a hostile action is enthralled for the duration of the spell (as the enthrall spell), as long as it is in the spell's area, nor will it try to leave the area on its own. Creatures with 8 HD or more may pay attention to you, but are not affected by this spell.[lf][lf]When you speak, all listeners telepathically understand you, even if they do not understand your language. While the spell lasts, you can make up to three suggestions to creatures of less than 8 HD in range, as if using the suggestion, mass spell (Will save negates): creatures with 8 HD or more aren't affected by this power. Only creatures within range at the time a suggestion is given are subject to it.

Name: Crown of Glory 2
Effect: You and one creature/level in a 20-ft.-radius burst centered on you
Short Description: You gain +4 Charisma and inspire your allies.

Name: Crown Of Might
Short Description: Gain +2 Strength, discharge to gain +8 bonus for 1 round.

Name: Crown of Protection
Short Description: +1 deflection bonus to AC, +1 resistance bonus on saves; discharge to gain +4 for 1 round.

Name: Crown of Veils
Short Description: Gain +2 to Disguise and Hide, discharge to gain +8.
Medium Description: Gain +2 to Disguise and Hide, discharge to gain +8 on Disguise OR Hide.

Name: Cruel Disappointment
Saving Throw: Will disbelief (if interacted with) and Will negates; see text
Short Description: Fools subject for 1 round, then -4 penalty on attacks, saves, and checks.

Name: Crumble
Short Description: 1d8/level (bypassing hardness) to manufactured object or stucture.

Name: Crunchy Snow
Short Description: -20 penalty on Move Silently checks in area.

Name: Crushing Despair
Short Description: Subjects take -2 on attack rolls, damage rolls, saves, and checks.
Long Descripton: An invisible cone of despair causes great sadness in the subjects. Each affected creature takes a -2 penalty on attack rolls, saving throws, ability checks, skill checks, and weapon damage rolls.[lf][lf]Crushing despair counters and dispels good hope.

Name: Crushing Fist of Spite
Saving Throw: Reflex half or Reflex negates; see text
Short Description: Fist deals 1d6 damage/level each round.
Medium Description: Fist deals 1d6 force damage/level each round.

Name: Crushing Hand
Short Description: Large hand provides cover, pushes, or crushes your foes.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like interposing hand, except that the hand can interpose itself, push, or crush one opponent that you select.[lf][lf]The crushing hand can grapple an opponent like grasping hand does. Its grapple bonus equals your caster level + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (for a wizard, cleric, or sorcerer, respectively), +12 for the hands Strength score (35), +4 for being Large. The hand deals 2d6+12 points of damage (lethal, not nonlethal) on each successful grapple check against an opponent.[lf][lf]The crushing hand can also interpose itself as interposing hand does, or it can bull rush an opponent as forceful hand does, but at a +18 bonus.[lf][lf]Directing the spell to a new target is a move action.[lf][lf]Clerics who cast this spell name it for their deities.

Name: Crushing Sphere
Short Description: Force globe traps and crushes subject for 3d6 points of nonlethal damage per round.

Name: Cry of Ysgard
Short Description: 2d4 bariaur defenders of Ysgard (but no more than 4) serve you for up to one year.

Name: Cure Critical Wounds
Short Description: Cures 4d8 damage +1/level (max +20).
Long Descripton: When laying your hand upon a living creature, you channel positive energy that cures 4d8 points of damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +20).[lf][lf]Since undead are powered by negative energy, this spell deals damage to them instead of curing their wounds. An undead creature can apply spell resistance, and can attempt a Will save to take half damage.

Name: Cure Critical Wounds, Mass
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Saving Throw: Will half (harmless) or Will half; see text
Short Description: Cures 4d8 damage +1/level for many creatures.
Long Descripton: You channel positive energy to cure 4d8 points of damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +40) in each selected creature.[lf][lf]Like other cure spells, mass cure light wounds deals damage to undead in its area rather than curing them. Each affected undead may attempt a Will save for half damage.

Name: Cure Light Wounds
Short Description: Cures 1d8 damage +1/level (max +5).
Long Descripton: When laying your hand upon a living creature, you channel positive energy that cures 1d8 points of damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +5).[lf][lf]Since undead are powered by negative energy, this spell deals damage to them instead of curing their wounds. An undead creature can apply spell resistance, and can attempt a Will save to take half damage.

Name: Cure Light Wounds, Mass
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Saving Throw: Will half (harmless) or Will half; see text
Short Description: Cures 1d8 damage +1/level for many creatures.
Long Descripton: You channel positive energy to cure 1d8 points of damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +25) in each selected creature.[lf][lf]Like other cure spells, mass cure light wounds deals damage to undead in its area rather than curing them. Each affected undead may attempt a Will save for half damage.

Name: Cure Minor Wounds
Short Description: Cures 1 point of damage.
Long Descripton: When laying your hand upon a living creature, you channel positive energy that cures 1 point of damage.[lf][lf]Since undead are powered by negative energy, this spell deals damage to them instead of curing their wounds. An undead creature can apply spell resistance, and can attempt a Will save to take half damage.

Name: Cure Moderate Wounds
Short Description: Cures 2d8 damage +1/level (max +10).
Long Descripton: When laying your hand upon a living creature, you channel positive energy that cures 2d8 points of damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +10).[lf][lf]Since undead are powered by negative energy, this spell deals damage to them instead of curing their wounds. An undead creature can apply spell resistance, and can attempt a Will save to take half damage.

Name: Cure Moderate Wounds, Mass
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Saving Throw: Will half (harmless) or Will half; see text
Short Description: Cures 2d8 damage +1/level for many creatures.
Long Descripton: You channel positive energy to cure 2d8 points of damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +30) in each selected creature.[lf][lf]Like other cure spells, mass cure light wounds deals damage to undead in its area rather than curing them. Each affected undead may attempt a Will save for half damage.

Name: Cure Serious Wounds
Short Description: Cures 3d8 damage +1/level (max +15).
Long Descripton: When laying your hand upon a living creature, you channel positive energy that cures 3d8 points of damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +15).[lf][lf]Since undead are powered by negative energy, this spell deals damage to them instead of curing their wounds. An undead creature can apply spell resistance, and can attempt a Will save to take half damage.

Name: Cure Serious Wounds, Mass
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Saving Throw: Will half (harmless) or Will half; see text
Short Description: Cures 3d8 damage +1/level for many creatures.
Long Descripton: You channel positive energy to cure 3d8 points of damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +35) in each selected creature.[lf][lf]Like other cure spells, mass cure light wounds deals damage to undead in its area rather than curing them. Each affected undead may attempt a Will save for half damage.

Name: Curse of Ill Fortune
Short Description: Subject suffers -3 penalty on attacks, saves, and checks.

Name: Curse of Ill Fortune, Mass
Short Description: Enemies take -3 penalty on attack rolls and saves.

Name: Curse of Impending Blades
Short Description: Subject takes -2 penalty to AC.

Name: Curse of Impending Blades, Mass
Short Description: Enemies take -2 penalty to AC.

Name: Curse of Lycanthropy
Short Description: Causes temporary lycanthropy in subject.

Name: Curse of Lycanthropy 2
Short Description: Kills subject and summons wererats.

Name: Curse of Petty Failing
Short Description: Subject takes -2 penalty on attack rolls and saves.

Name: Curse of Spilt Water
Short Description: Transforms an enemy into water.

Name: Curse of the Brute
Short Description: Up to +1/level to Str, Dex, or Con, both Int and Cha down the same.

Name: Curse of the Putrid Husk
Short Description: Subject is unconscious for 1d10 minutes.

Name: Curse Water
Short Description: Makes unholy water.
Long Descripton: This spell imbues a flask (1 pint) of water with negative energy, turning it into unholy water. Unholy water damages good outsiders the way holy water damages undead and evil outsiders.

Name: Cursed Blade
Short Description: Swift, Creature gains a curse that prevents healing or raising until removed.

Name: Curtain of Light
Effect: Curtain of light whose area is up to one 5ft. square/level
Short Description: Shapable curtain of light does 2d4 damage/round to evil creatures and 2d6 damage +1/level (max +20) to evil creatures passing through (double for undead).
Medium Description: Shapable curtain of light does 2d4 brilliant energy damage/round to evil creatures and 2d6 +1/level (max +20) to evil creatures passing through (double for undead).

Name: Cutting Hand
Short Description: Your hand gains a +2 enhancement bonus and is considered armed.

Name: Cyclonic Blast
Short Description: Horizontal cyclone deals 1d6/level (max 15d6) damage and initiates a bull rush.

Name: Daggerspell Stance
Short Description: Swift. You gain +2 insight bonus on attack and damage if you make a full attack, SR 5 + caster level if you fight defensively, and DR 5/magic if you use the total defense action.

Name: Damning Darkness
Short Description: Darkness deals either 2d6 or 1d6 damage per round.
Medium Description: Darkness deals 2d6 unholy damage to good creatures or 1d6 to nongood and non-evil creatures, per round.

Name: Dampen Magic
Short Description: Decrease enhancement bonus of magic weapons as well as save DC and caster level of magical effects used against subject; subject can invoke a 5-ft.-radius antimagic field.
Medium Description: Decrease enhancement bonus of magic weapons as well as save DC and caster level of magical effects used against subject by 1 or more points; subject can invoke a 5-ft.-radius antimagic field.

Name: Dance of Ruin
Short Description: Nondemons take 2d20 points of damage.

Name: Dance of the Unicorn
Short Description: Purifying mist washes the air clean of smoke, dust, and poisons.

Name: Dancing Blade
Short Description: Sword fights with an ally and prevents flanking.

Name: Dancing Chains
Effect: One chain per level within range
Short Description: Animates one chain per level.

Name: Dancing Lights
Effect: Up to four lights, all within a 10-ft.-radius area
Short Description: Creates torches or other lights.
Medium Description: Up to 4 lanterns within a 10' radius, or 1 glowing humanoid shape. Lights can move 100'/round within spell's range.
Long Descripton: Depending on the version selected, you create up to four lights that resemble lanterns or torches (and cast that amount of light), or up to four glowing spheres of light (which look like will-o'-wisps), or one faintly glowing, vaguely humanoid shape. The dancing lights must stay within a 10-foot-radius area in relation to each other but otherwise move as you desire (no concentration required): forward or back, up or down, straight or turning corners, or the like. The lights can move up to 100 feet per round. A light winks out if the distance between you and it exceeds the spell's range.[lf][lf]Dancing lights can be made permanent with a permanency spell.

Name: Dancing Web
Short Description: 1d6 points/level of nonlethal damage and if save fails, evil creatures are entangled (half speed, -2 att, -4 Dex, Concentration DC 15 + level).

Name: Dark Tide
Short Description: Infuse water over a large area with negative energy, causing weakness and 1d6 damage/hour.

Name: Dark Way
Effect: One bridge of force 5 ft. wide, 1 in. thick, and up to 20 ft./level long
Short Description: Creates temporary unbreakable bridge supporting up to 200 lbs./level.

Name: Darkbolt, Darkness
Short Description: You hurl one/two levels beams of darkness dealing 2d8 damage/round and may daze target for 1 round.
Medium Description: You hurl 1 beam of darkness/2 levels (max 7 bolts), dealing 2d8 damage/round and may daze for 1 round.

Name: Darkbolt, Vile
Short Description: Deals 1d8 damage/2 levels and stuns 1 round.
Medium Description: Deals 1d8 damage/2 levels (max 5d8), half is cold damage, and stuns 1 round.

Name: Darkfire
Short Description: As produce flame, but dark flames visible with darkvision.

Name: Darkflame Arrow
Short Description: Masterwork arrow or bolt deals normal damage plus 1d6 damage each round for 3 rounds.
Medium Description: Masterwork arrow or bolt deals its damage plus 1d6 black fire damage (no resistance) per round.

Name: Darkliqht
Short Description: Creates 5-ft.-radius area where all can see without light.

Name: Darkness
Short Description: 20-ft. radius of supernatural shadow.
Long Descripton: This spell causes an object to radiate shadowy illumination out to a 20-foot radius. All creatures in the area gain concealment (20% miss chance). Even creatures that can normally see in such conditions (such as with darkvision or low-light vision) have the miss chance in an area shrouded in magical darkness.[lf][lf]Normal lights (torches, candles, lanterns, and so forth) are incapable of brightening the area, as are light spells of lower level. Higher level light spells are not affected by darkness.[lf][lf]If darkness is cast on a small object that is then placed inside or under a lightproof covering, the spells effect is blocked until the covering is removed.[lf][lf]Darkness counters or dispels any light spell of equal or lower spell level.

Name: Darkvision
Short Description: See 60 ft. in total darkness.
Long Descripton: The subject gains the ability to see 60 feet even in total darkness. Darkvision is black and white only but otherwise like normal sight. Darkvision does not grant one the ability to see in magical darkness.[lf][lf]Darkvision can be made permanent with a permanency spell.

Name: Darkvision, Mass
Effect: You and all allies in a 10-ft.-radius burst, centered on you.
Short Description: As darkvision, but affects subjects within 10 feet of you.

Name: Darkvision, Superior
Short Description: Subject can see in the dark to any range.

Name: Darts Of Life
Effect: One or more creatures per round
Short Description: Create ten projectiles that you can launch at allies to cure ld8 points of damage each.
Medium Description: Create ten projectiles that you can launch at allies to cure ld8 points of damage each.

Name: Dawn
Effect: All creatures in a 15-ft.-radius burst centered on you
Short Description: Swift, Awaken sleeping and unconscious creatures.

Name: Dawn Shroud
Short Description: In addition to acting as a daylight spell, the light is harmful to oozes and undead.

Name: Daylight
Short Description: 60-ft. radius of bright light.
Long Descripton: The object touched sheds light as bright as full daylight in a 60-foot radius, and dim light for an additional 60 feet beyond that. Creatures that take penalties in bright light also take them while within the radius of this magical light. Despite its name, this spell is not the equivalent of daylight for the purposes of creatures that are damaged or destroyed by bright light.[lf][lf]If daylight is cast on a small object that is then placed inside or under a light- proof covering, the spells effects are blocked until the covering is removed.[lf][lf]Daylight brought into an area of magical darkness (or vice versa) is temporarily negated, so that the otherwise prevailing light conditions exist in the overlapping areas of effect.[lf][lf]Daylight counters or dispels any darkness spell of equal or lower level, such as darkness.

Name: Daze
Effect: One humanoid creature of 4 HD or less
Short Description: Humanoid creature of 4 HD or less loses next action.
Long Descripton: This enchantment clouds the mind of a humanoid creature with 4 or fewer Hit Dice so that it takes no actions. Humanoids of 5 or more HD are not affected. A dazed subject is not stunned, so attackers get no special advantage against it.

Name: Daze Monster
Effect: One living creature of 6 HD or less
Short Description: Living creature of 6 HD or less loses next action.
Long Descripton: This enchantment clouds the mind of a living creature with 6 or fewer Hit Dice so that it takes no actions. Creatures of 7 or more HD are not affected. A dazed subject is not stunned, so attackers get no special advantage against it.

Name: Dead End
Saving Throw: Will negates (harmless) or Will disbelief (if interacted with); see text
Short Description: Illusions conceal the targets' spoor.

Name: Deadfall
Effect: Mass of dead wood forming in a cylinder (20-ft. radius, 40 ft. high); see text
Short Description: Creates a deadfall, Reflex save dealing 1d6/level bludgeoning damage (save half), prone (save negate), and Fort save or stunned for 1 round.
Medium Description: Creates a deadfall, 1d6/level bludgeoning damage (Reflex half), prone (save negate), and Fort save or stunned 1 round.

Name: Deafening Clang
Short Description: Swift, Weapon deafens with a successful touch attack.

Name: Death Armor
Short Description: Black aura damages creatures attacking you.
Medium Description: Black aura deals 1d4 +1/two levels damage to creatures attacking you.

Name: Death by Thorns
Effect: Up to three creatures, no two of which can be more than 15 ft. apart
Short Description: Up to three creatures die in 1d4 rounds or are incapacitated, taking 4d6 damage.
Medium Description: Up to three creatures die in 1d4 rounds or are incapacitated, taking 4d6 piercing damage.

Name: Death Dragon
Short Description: You gain +4 natural armor, +4 deflection, and natural attacks.

Name: Death Grimace
Short Description: Caster leaves magical "calling card" on a corpse.

Name: Death Hail
Short Description: Summons a storm of death hail dealing 1d2 points of Strength and Constitution damage.
Medium Description: Summons a storm of death hail dealing 1d2 points of Str and Con damage.

Name: Death Knell
Duration: Instantaneous/10 minutes per HD of subject; see text
Short Description: Kills dying creature; you gain 1d8 temporary hp, +2 to Str, and +1 level.
Long Descripton: You draw forth the ebbing life force of a creature and use it to fuel your own power. Upon casting this spell, you touch a living creature that has -1 or fewer hit points. If the subject fails its saving throw, it dies, and you gain 1d8 temporary hit points and a +2 bonus to Strength. Additionally, your effective caster level goes up by +1, improving spell effects dependent on caster level. (This increase in effective caster level does not grant you access to more spells.) These effects last for 10 minutes per HD of the subject creature.

Name: Death Pact
Short Description: -2 to Constitution, in exchange for effects of true resurrection.

Name: Death Throes
Short Description: Your body explodes when you die.

Name: Death Ward
Short Description: Grants immunity to death spells and negative energy effects.
Long Descripton: The subject is immune to all death spells, magical death effects, energy drain, and any negative energy effects.[lf][lf]This spell doesn't remove negative levels that the subject has already gained, nor does it affect the saving throw necessary 24 hours after gaining a negative level.[lf][lf]Death ward does not protect against other sorts of attacks even if those attacks might be lethal.

Name: Death Ward, Mass
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: As death ward, but more targets.

Name: Deathwatch
Short Description: Reveals how near death subjects within 30 ft. are.
Long Descripton: Using the foul sight granted by the powers of unlife, you can determine the condition of creatures near death within the spells range. You instantly know whether each creature within the area is dead, fragile (alive and wounded, with 3 or fewer hit points left), fighting off death (alive with 4 or more hit points), undead, or neither alive nor dead (such as a construct).[lf][lf]Deathwatch sees through any spell or ability that allows creatures to feign death.

Name: Decapitating Scarf
Short Description: Decapitate target or deal 1d4/level (max 20d4) damage.  Some creatures take 6d4 instead.

Name: Decastave
Short Description: Thundering quarterstaff of force deals 1d6 damage with touch attack.
Medium Description: Thundering quarterstaff deals 1d6 force damage with touch attack.

Name: Decomposition
Effect: All enemies within a 50-ft.-radius emanation centered on you
Short Description: Wounds deal 3 extra point of damage each round.

Name: Decoy Image
Effect: Figment that mimics you and all allies within 50 ft. of you
Saving Throw: Will disbelief (if interacted with); see text
Short Description: Figment mimics you and allies.

Name: Deep Breath
Short Description: Your lungs fill with fresh air for the duration of the spell.

Name: Deep Slumber
Effect: One or more living creatures within a 10-ft.-radius burst
Short Description: Puts 10 HD of creatures to sleep.
Medium Description: Puts 10 HD of creatures to sleep, starting with lowest HD creatures.
Long Descripton: A sleep spell causes a magical slumber to come upon 10 Hit Dice of creatures. Creatures with the fewest HD are affected first.[lf][lf]Among creatures with equal HD, those who are closest to the spells point of origin are affected first. Hit Dice that are not sufficient to affect a creature are wasted.[lf][lf]Sleeping creatures are helpless. Slapping or wounding awakens an affected creature, but normal noise does not. Awakening a creature is a standard action (an application of the aid another action).[lf][lf]Sleep does not target unconscious creatures, constructs, or undead creatures.

Name: Deeper Darkness
Short Description: Object sheds supernatural shadow in 60-ft. radius.
Long Descripton: This spell causes an object to radiate shadowy illumination out to a 60-foot radius. All creatures in the area gain concealment (20% miss chance). Even creatures that can normally see in such conditions (such as with darkvision or low-light vision) have the miss chance in an area shrouded in magical darkness.[lf][lf]Normal lights (torches, candles, lanterns, and so forth) are incapable of brightening the area, as are light spells of lower level. [lf][lf]If deeper darkness is cast on a small object that is then placed inside or under a lightproof covering, the spells effect is blocked until the covering is removed.[lf][lf]Daylight brought into an area of deeper darkness (or vice versa) is temporarily negated, so that the otherwise prevailing light conditions exist in the overlapping areas of effect.[lf][lf]Deeper darkness counters and dispels any light spell of equal or lower level, including daylight and light.

Name: Deeper Darkvision
Short Description: Subject can see 90 ft. in magical darkness.

Name: Defenestrating Sphere
Short Description: Cloudy gray sphere knocks enemies prone, hurls them upward for subsequent falling damage.

Name: Defile Snow and Ice
Short Description: Grants undead a +4 profane bonus

Name: Deflect
Short Description: Gain bonus to AC for one attack.
Medium Description: Gain 1/2 CL shield bonus until end of your next turn.

Name: Deflect, Lesser
Short Description: Gain a deflection bonus of +1/3 levels (max +5) against one attack.
Medium Description: Gain deflection AC +1 per 3 CL vs 1 attack. Can cast when not your turn.

Name: Dehydrate
Short Description: Deals Con damage to target.

Name: Deific Bastion
Short Description: Your shield or armor gains a +1 enhancement bonus plus a special ability that varies by deity.
Medium Description: Your shield or armor gains a +1 enhancement bonus plus a special ability that varies by deity.

Name: Deific Vengeance
Short Description: God's punishment deals 1d6 damage/two caster levels (max 5d6). (1d6/level max 10d6 vs undead.)

Name: Delay Death
Short Description: Losing hit points doesn't kill subject.

Name: Delay Disease
Short Description: Postpones effects of a disease.

Name: Delay Poison
Short Description: Stops poison from harming subject for 1 hour/ level.
Long Descripton: The subject becomes temporarily immune to poison. Any poison in its system or any poison to which it is exposed during the spell's duration does not affect the subject until the spell's duration has expired. Delay poison does not cure any damage that poison may have already done.

Name: Delayed Blast Fireball
Short Description: 1d6/level fire damage; you can postpone blast for 5 rounds.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like fireball, except that it is more powerful and can detonate up to 5 rounds after the spell is cast. The burst of flame deals 1d6 points of fire damage per caster level (maximum 20d6).[lf][lf][lf][lf]A fireball spell is an explosion of flame that detonates with a low roar and deals 1d6 points of fire damage per caster level (maximum 20d6) to every creature within the area. Unattended objects also take this damage. The explosion creates almost no pressure.  [lf][lf]You point your finger and determine the range (distance and height) at which the fireball is to burst. A glowing, pea-sized bead streaks from the pointing digit and, unless it impacts upon a material body or solid barrier prior to attaining the prescribed range, blossoms into the fireball at that point. (An early impact results in an early detonation.) If you attempt to send the bead through a narrow passage, such as through an arrow slit, you must hit the opening with a ranged touch attack, or else the bead strikes the barrier and detonates prematurely.[lf][lf]The fireball sets fire to combustibles and damages objects in the area. It can melt metals with low melting points, such as lead, gold, copper, silver, and bronze. If the damage caused to an interposing barrier shatters or breaks through it, the fireball may continue beyond the barrier if the area permits; otherwise it stops at the barrier just as any other spell effect does.[lf][lf]The glowing bead created by delayed blast fireball can detonate immediately if you desire, or you can choose to delay the burst for as many as 5 rounds. You select the amount of delay upon completing the spell, and that time cannot change once it has been set unless someone touches the bead (see below). If you choose a delay, the glowing bead sits at its destination until it detonates. A creature can pick up and hurl the bead as a thrown weapon (range increment 10 feet). If a creature handles and moves the bead within 1 round of its detonation, there is a 25% chance that the bead detonates while being handled.

Name: Delusions of Grandeur
Short Description: Subject becomes overconfident and careless.

Name: Demand
Short Description: As sending, plus you can send suggestion.
Long Descripton: You contact a particular creature with which you are familiar and send a short message of twenty-five words or less to the subject. The subject recognizes you if it knows you. It can answer in like manner immediately. If the creature in question is not on the same plane of existence as you are, there is a 5% chance that the demand does not arrive. (Local conditions on other planes may worsen this chance considerably.)[lf][lf]You influence the actions of the target creature by demanding a course of activity (limited to the length of the short message). The demand must be worded in such a manner as to make the activity sound reasonable. Asking the creature to do some obviously harmful act automatically negates the effect of the spell. [lf][lf]A very reasonable suggestion causes the save to be made with a penalty (such as 1 or 2).[lf][lf]A successful Will save negates the suggestion effect but not the contact itself. The demand, if received, is understood even if the subjects Intelligence score is as low as 1. If the message is impossible or meaningless according to the circumstances that exist for the subject at the time the demand is issued, the message is understood but the suggestion is ineffective.

Name: Demon Dirge
Saving Throw: None or Fortitude partial; see text
Short Description: Demons are stunned and take 2d6 damage/round for 1d6 rounds.

Name: Demon Wings
Short Description: You fly at your land speed.

Name: Demoncall
Short Description: You gain +10 on one Knowledge (the planes), Knowledge (arcana)or Knowledge (religion) check.

Name: Demonflesh
Short Description: Caster gains +1 natural armor/5 caster levels.

Name: Demonhide
Short Description: The subject gains damage reduction 5/cold iron or good.

Name: Demonic Blood Infusion
Short Description: Temporarily grant subject the fiendish template, may cause the subject to become chaotic and evil permanently.

Name: Depression
Short Description: Enemies around you become fatigued and take penalties to Will saves.

Name: Depthsurge
Short Description: Water slam deals 2d6 + 1/level damage to all within 20-ft. radius, pushes targets back, sinks ships.

Name: Desecrate
Short Description: Fills area with negative energy, making undead stronger.
Long Descripton: This spell imbues an area with negative energy. Each Charisma check made to turn undead within this area takes a -3 profane penalty, and every undead creature entering a desecrated area gains a +1 profane bonus on attack rolls, damage rolls, and saving throws. An undead creature created within or summoned into such an area gains +1 hit points per HD.[lf][lf]If the desecrated area contains an altar, shrine, or other permanent fixture dedicated to your deity or aligned higher power, the modifiers given above are doubled (-6 profane penalty on turning checks, +2 profane bonus and +2 hit points per HD for undead in the area).[lf][lf]Furthermore, anyone who casts animate dead within this area may create as many as double the normal amount of undead (that is, 4 HD per caster level rather than 2 HD per caster level).[lf][lf]If the area contains an altar, shrine, or other permanent fixture of a deity, pantheon, or higher power other than your patron, the desecrate spell instead curses the area, cutting off its connection with the associated deity or power. This secondary function, if used, does not also grant the bonuses and penalties relating to undead, as given above.[lf][lf]Desecrate counters and dispels consecrate.

Name: Desecrate Battlefield
Short Description: Fills large area with negative energy, making undead stronger.

Name: Desert Binding
Short Description: Imprisons creature as sand in an hourglass or wind in the waste.

Name: Desert Burial
Short Description: Buries targets up to their necks in sand.

Name: Desert Diversion
Short Description: Those attempting planar travel are diverted to a random wasteland.

Name: Desiccate
Short Description: Deals 1d6/2 levels dessication damage and dehydrates living creature.

Name: Desiccate, Mass
Effect: One living creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Desiccates several creatures.

Name: Desiccating Bubble
Short Description: Directable globe of supernaturally dry air which causes evaporative damage to those it engulfs.

Name: Despoil
Saving Throw: Fortitude partial (plants) or Fortitude negates (other living creatures)
Short Description: Kills plants, damages objects in 100-ft. radius/level.

Name: Destruction
Short Description: Kills subject and destroys remains.
Long Descripton: This spell instantly slays the subject and consumes its remains (but not its equipment and possessions) utterly. If the target's Fortitude saving throw succeeds, it instead takes 10d6 points of damage. The only way to restore life to a character who has failed to save against this spell is to use true resurrection, a carefully worded wish spell followed by resurrection, or miracle.

Name: Detect Aberration
Short Description: Reveals aberrations within 60 ft.

Name: Detect Animals or Plants
Short Description: Detects kinds of animals or plants.
Long Descripton: You can detect a particular kind of animal or plant in a cone emanating out from you in whatever direction you face. You must think of a kind of animal or plant when using the spell, but you can change the animal or plant kind each round. The amount of information revealed depends on how long you search a particular area or focus on a specific kind of animal or plant.[lf][lf]1st Round: Presence or absence of that kind of animal or plant in the area.[lf][lf]2nd Round: Number of individuals of the specified kind in the area, and the condition of the healthiest specimen.[lf][lf]3rd Round: The condition (see below) and location of each individual present. If an animal or plant is outside your line of sight, then you discern its direction but not its exact location.[lf][lf]Conditions: For purposes of this spell, the categories of condition are as follows:[lf][lf]Normal: Has at least 90% of full normal hit points, free of disease.[lf][lf]Fair: 30% to 90% of full normal hit points remaining.[lf][lf]Poor: Less than 30% of full normal hit points remaining, afflicted with a disease, or suffering from a debilitating injury.[lf][lf]Weak: 0 or fewer hit points remaining, afflicted with a disease in the terminal stage, or crippled.[lf][lf]If a creature falls into more than one category, the spell indicates the weaker of the two.[lf][lf]Each round you can turn to detect a kind of animal or plant in a new area. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt blocks it.

Name: Detect Attitude
Short Description: Reveals target's attitude.

Name: Detect Chaos
Short Description: Reveals creatures, spells, or objects of selected alignment.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like detect evil, except that it detects the auras of chaotic creatures, clerics of chaotic deities, chaotic spells, and chaotic magic items, and you are vulnerable to an overwhelming chaotic aura if you are lawful.

Name: Detect Crossroads
Effect: Quarter circle emanating from you to the extreme of the range
Short Description: Detect fey crossroads within 60 ft.

Name: Detect Dragonmark
Short Description: Detect and identify dragonmarks within 60 ft.

Name: Detect Evil
Short Description: Reveals creatures, spells, or objects of selected alignment.
Long Descripton: You can sense the presence of evil. The amount of information revealed depends on how long you study a particular area or subject.  [lf]1st Round: Presence or absence of evil.  [lf]2nd Round: Number of evil auras (creatures, objects, or spells) in the area and the power of the most potent evil aura present.  [lf]If you are of good alignment, and the strongest evil aura's power is overwhelming (see below), and the HD or level of the auras source is at least twice your character level, you are stunned for 1 round and the spell ends.  [lf]3rd Round: The power and location of each aura. If an aura is outside your line of sight, then you discern its direction but not its exact location.  [lf]Aura Power: An evil auras power depends on the type of evil creature or object that youre detecting and its HD, caster level, or (in the case of a cleric) class level; see the accompanying table. If an aura falls into more than one strength category, the spell indicates the stronger of the two.  [lf] Aura Power  [lf]Object/Creature  Faint  Moderate  Strong  Overwhelming  [lf]Evil creature1 (HD)  10 or lower  11-25  26-50  51 or higher  [lf]Undead (HD)  2 or lower  3-8  9-20  21 or higher  [lf]Evil outsider (HD)  1 or lower  2-4  5-10  11 or higher  [lf]Cleric of an evil deity 2 (class levels)  1  2-4  5-10  11 or higher  [lf]Evil magic item or spell (caster level)  2nd or lower  3rd-8th  9th-20th  21st or higher    [lf]1 Except for undead and outsiders, which have their own entries on the table.  [lf]2 Some characters who are not clerics may radiate an aura of equivalent power. The class description will indicate whether this applies.  [lf]Lingering Aura: An evil aura lingers after its original source dissipates (in the case of a spell) or is destroyed (in the case of a creature or magic item). If detect evil is cast and directed at such a location, the spell indicates an aura strength of dim (even weaker than a faint aura). How long the aura lingers at this dim level depends on its original power:  [lf]Original Strength  Duration of Lingering Aura  [lf]Faint  1d6 rounds  [lf]Moderate  1d6 minutes  [lf]Strong  1d6x10 minutes  [lf]Overwhelming  1d6 days    [lf]Animals, traps, poisons, and other potential perils are not evil, and as such this spell does not detect them.  [lf]Each round, you can turn to detect evil in a new area. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt blocks it.

Name: Detect Favored Enemy
Effect: Quarter circle emanating from you to the extreme of the range
Short Description: You know if favored enemies are within 60 ft.

Name: Detect Fire
Short Description: Detect fire within 60 ft.

Name: Detect Good
Short Description: Reveals creatures, spells, or objects of selected alignment.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like detect evil, except that it detects the auras of good creatures, clerics or paladins of good deities, good spells, and good magic items, and you are vulnerable to an overwhelming good aura if you are evil. Healing potions, antidotes, and similar beneficial items are not good.

Name: Detect Guilt
Short Description: Reveals how much guilt target feels.

Name: Detect Heresy
Short Description: Reveals heretical thoughts or actions in target's recent past.

Name: Detect Law
Short Description: Reveals creatures, spells, or objects of selected alignment.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like detect evil, except that it detects the auras of lawful creatures, clerics of lawful deities, lawful spells, and lawful magic items, and you are vulnerable to an overwhelming lawful aura if you are chaotic.

Name: Detect Magic
Short Description: Detects spells and magic items within 60 ft.
Medium Description: Round 1: Detect presence of magic aura. 2: Number of auras and max power. 3: Power and location of each aura. School: Spellcraft DC 15+spell level or 15+1/2 CL for nonspell.
Long Descripton: You detect magical auras. The amount of information revealed depends on how long you study a particular area or subject.  [lf]1st Round: Presence or absence of magical auras.  [lf]2nd Round: Number of different magical auras and the power of the most potent aura.  [lf]3rd Round: The strength and location of each aura. If the items or creatures bearing the auras are in line of sight, you can make Spellcraft skill checks to determine the school of magic involved in each. (Make one check per aura; DC 15 + spell level, or 15 + half caster level for a nonspell effect.)  [lf]Magical areas, multiple types of magic, or strong local magical emanations may distort or conceal weaker auras.  [lf]Aura Strength: An auras power depends on a spells functioning spell level or an items caster level. If an aura falls into more than one category, detect magic indicates the stronger of the two.  [lf] Aura Power  [lf]Spell or Object  Faint  Moderate  Strong  Overwhelming  [lf]Functioning spell (spell level)  3rd or lower  4th - 6th  7th - 9th  10th+ (deity-level)  [lf]Magic item (caster level)  5th or lower  6th - 11th  12th - 20th  21st+ (artifact)    [lf]Lingering Aura: A magical aura lingers after its original source dissipates (in the case of a spell) or is destroyed (in the case of a magic item). If detect magic is cast and directed at such a location, the spell indicates an aura strength of dim (even weaker than a faint aura). How long the aura lingers at this dim level depends on its original power:  [lf]Original Strength  Duration of Lingering Aura  [lf]Faint  1d6 rounds  [lf]Moderate  1d6 minutes  [lf]Strong  1d6x10 minutes  [lf]Overwhelming  1d6 days    [lf]Outsiders and elementals are not magical in themselves, but if they are summoned, the conjuration spell registers.  [lf]Each round, you can turn to detect magic in a new area. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt blocks it.  [lf]Detect magic can be made permanent with a permanency spell.

Name: Detect Metal and Minerals
Effect: Quarter circle emanating from you to the extreme of the range
Short Description: Find metals and minerals within 60 ft.

Name: Detect Poison
Effect: One creature, one object, or a 5-ft. cube
Short Description: Detects poison in one creature or object.
Long Descripton: You determine whether a creature, object, or area has been poisoned or is poisonous. You can determine the exact type of poison with a DC 20 Wisdom check. A character with the Craft (alchemy) skill may try a DC 20 Craft (alchemy) check if the Wisdom check fails, or may try the Craft (alchemy) check prior to the Wisdom check.[lf][lf]The spell can penetrate barriers, but 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt blocks it.

Name: Detect Scrying
Short Description: Alerts you of magical eavesdropping.
Long Descripton: You immediately become aware of any attempt to observe you by means of a divination (scrying) spell or effect. The spells area radiates from you and moves as you move. You know the location of every magical sensor within the spells area.[lf][lf]If the scrying attempt originates within the area, you also know its location; otherwise, you and the scrier immediately make opposed caster level checks (1d20 + caster level). If you at least match the scriers result, you get a visual image of the scrier and an accurate sense of his or her direction and distance from you.

Name: Detect Secret Doors
Short Description: Reveals hidden doors within 60 ft.
Medium Description: Round 1: presence of doors within 60' thru less than 1' stone or 1" metal. 2: number and location of each w/in line of sight, or direction otherwise.
Long Descripton: You can detect secret doors, compartments, caches, and so forth. Only passages, doors, or openings that have been specifically constructed to escape detection are detected by this spell. The amount of information revealed depends on how long you study a particular area or subject.[lf][lf]1st Round: Presence or absence of secret doors.[lf][lf]2nd Round: Number of secret doors and the location of each. If an aura is outside your line of sight, then you discern its direction but not its exact location.[lf][lf]Each Additional Round: The mechanism or trigger for one particular secret portal closely examined by you. Each round, you can turn to detect secret doors in a new area. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt blocks it.

Name: Detect Ship
Short Description: Detect and identify ships.

Name: Detect Snares and Pits
Short Description: Reveals natural or primitive traps.
Long Descripton: You can detect simple pits, deadfalls, and snares as well as mechanical traps constructed of natural materials. The spell does not detect complex traps, including trapdoor traps.[lf][lf]Detect snares and pits does detect certain natural hazardsquicksand (a snare), a sinkhole (a pit), or unsafe walls of natural rock (a deadfall). However, it does not reveal other potentially dangerous conditions. The spell does not detect magic traps (except those that operate by pit, deadfall, or snaring; see the spell snare), nor mechanically complex ones, nor those that have been rendered safe or inactive.[lf][lf]The amount of information revealed depends on how long you study a particular area.[lf][lf]1st Round: Presence or absence of hazards.[lf][lf]2nd Round: Number of hazards and the location of each. If a hazard is outside your line of sight, then you discern its direction but not its exact location.[lf][lf]Each Additional Round: The general type and trigger for one particular hazard closely examined by you.[lf][lf]Each round, you can turn to detect snares and pits in a new area. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt blocks it.

Name: Detect Thoughts
Short Description: Allows listening to surface thoughts.
Medium Description: Round 1: Presence of thoughts from Int 1+. 2: Number of minds and Int scores; Int>=26 and 10 exceeding yours stuns you for 1 round. 3: Surface thoughts of any mind.
Long Descripton: You detect surface thoughts. The amount of information revealed depends on how long you study a particular area or subject.[lf][lf]1st Round: Presence or absence of thoughts (from conscious creatures with Intelligence scores of 1 or higher).[lf][lf]2nd Round: Number of thinking minds and the Intelligence score of each. If the highest Intelligence is 26 or higher (and at least 10 points higher than your own Intelligence score), you are stunned for 1 round and the spell ends. This spell does not let you determine the location of the thinking minds if you cant see the creatures whose thoughts you are detecting.[lf][lf]3rd Round: Surface thoughts of any mind in the area. A targets Will save prevents you from reading its thoughts, and you must cast detect thoughts again to have another chance. Creatures of animal intelligence (Int 1 or 2) have simple, instinctual thoughts that you can pick up.[lf][lf]Each round, you can turn to detect thoughts in a new area. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt blocks it.

Name: Detect Undead
Short Description: Reveals undead within 60 ft.
Long Descripton: You can detect the aura that surrounds undead creatures. The amount of information revealed depends on how long you study a particular area.  [lf]1st Round: Presence or absence of undead auras.  [lf]2nd Round: Number of undead auras in the area and the strength of the strongest undead aura present. If you are of good alignment, and the strongest undead aura's strength is overwhelming (see below), and the creature has HD of at least twice your character level, you are stunned for 1 round and the spell ends.  [lf]3rd Round: The strength and location of each undead aura. If an aura is outside your line of sight, then you discern its direction but not its exact location.  [lf]Aura Strength: The strength of an undead aura is determined by the HD of the undead creature, as given on the following table:  [lf]HD  Strength  [lf]1 or lower  Faint  [lf]2-4  Moderate  [lf]5-10  Strong  [lf]11 or higher  Overwhelming    [lf]Lingering Aura: An undead aura lingers after its original source is destroyed. If detect undead is cast and directed at such a location, the spell indicates an aura strength of dim (even weaker than a faint aura). How long the aura lingers at this dim level depends on its original power:  [lf]Original Strength  Duration of Lingering Aura  [lf]Faint  1d6 rounds  [lf]Moderate  1d6 minutes  [lf]Strong  1d6x10 minutes  [lf]Overwhelming  1d6 days    [lf]Each round, you can turn to detect undead in a new area. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt blocks it.

Name: Detect Violence
Short Description: Reveals violence done in area within recent past.

Name: Detoxify
Short Description: Neutralize poison in 30-ft. radius.

Name: Devil Blight
Saving Throw: None or Fortitude partial; see text
Short Description: Damage and confuse baatezu; damage other lawful and evil creatures.

Name: Devil's Ego
Short Description: You gain 1d4+1 Cha and become an outsider.

Name: Devil's Eye
Short Description: You can see even in magical darkness up to 30 feet.

Name: Devil's Tail
Short Description: You gain a spiked tail that deals 1d4 damage.
Medium Description: You gain a spiked tail that deals 1d4 piercing damage.

Name: Devil's Tongue
Short Description: Tongue grapples with reach 15 ft.

Name: Devlin's Barb
Effect: One arrow, bolt, bullet, or sling stone
Short Description: You temporarily create an arrow, bolt, bullet, or sling stone that ceases to exist at the end of the duration.

Name: Devlin's Venomblade
Short Description: Temporarily create a slashing weapon coated in venom that disappears after the first wounding.

Name: Diamond Spray
Short Description: Dazzle evil creature for 2d6 rounds (no save) and do 1d6 damage/level (max 10d6).
Medium Description: Dazzle evil creature for 2d6 rounds (no save) and do 1d6 good-aligned damage/level (max 10d6).

Name: Diamondsteel
Short Description: Metal armor provides damage reduction.

Name: Dictum
Effect: Nonlawful creatures in a 40-ft.-radius spread centered on you
Saving Throw: None or Will negates; see text
Short Description: Kills, paralyzes, slows, or deafens nonlawful subjects.
Long Descripton: Any nonlawful creature within the area of a dictum spell suffers the following ill effects.     [lf]    HD    Effect      [lf]        [lf]Equal to    caster level            [lf]Deafened          [lf]        [lf]Up to    caster level -1            [lf]Slowed,    deafened          [lf]        [lf]Up to    caster level -5            [lf]Paralyzed,    slowed, deafened          [lf]        [lf]Up to    caster level -10            [lf]Killed,    paralyzed, slowed, deafened           [lf]The effects are cumulative and concurrent. No saving throw is allowed against these effects.  [lf]Deafened: The creature is deafened for 1d4 rounds.  [lf]Slowed: The creature is slowed, as by the slow spell, for 2d4 rounds.  [lf]Paralyzed: The creature is paralyzed and helpless for 1d10 minutes.  [lf]Killed: Living creatures die. Undead creatures are destroyed.  [lf]Furthermore, if you are on your home plane when you cast this spell, nonlawful extraplanar creatures within the area are instantly banished back to their home planes. Creatures so banished cannot return for at least 24 hours. This effect takes place regardless of whether the creatures hear the dictum. The banishment effect allows a Will save (at a 4 penalty) to negate.  [lf]Creatures whose HD exceed your caster level are unaffected by dictum.

Name: Dimension Door
Effect: You and touched objects or other touched willing creatures
Short Description: Teleports you short distance.
Long Descripton: You instantly transfer yourself from your current location to any other spot within range. You always arrive at exactly the spot desired-whether by simply visualizing the area or by stating direction. After using this spell, you can't take any other actions until your next turn. You can bring along objects as long as their weight doesnt exceed your maximum load. You may also bring one additional willing Medium or smaller creature (carrying gear or objects up to its maximum load) or its equivalent per three caster levels. A Large creature counts as two Medium creatures, a Huge creature counts as two Large creatures, and so forth. All creatures to be transported must be in contact with one another, and at least one of those creatures must be in contact with you.[lf][lf]If you arrive in a place that is already occupied by a solid body, you and each creature traveling with you take 1d6 points of damage and are shunted to a random open space on a suitable surface within 100 feet of the intended location.[lf][lf]If there is no free space within 100 feet, you and each creature traveling with you take an additional 2d6 points of damage and are shunted to a free space within 1,000 feet. If there is no free space within 1,000 feet, you and each creature travelling with you take an additional 4d6 points of damage and the spell simply fails.

Name: Dimension Door, Greater
Effect: You and touched objects or other touched willing creatures
Short Description: Creates short-range, multiple-use dimension door.

Name: Dimension Hop
Short Description: Teleport subject short distance.
Medium Description: Teleport subject 5'/2 CL, to empty square within line of sight.

Name: Dimension Leap
Short Description: Teleport 10 ft./level.

Name: Dimensional Anchor
Short Description: Bars extradimensional movement.
Long Descripton: A green ray springs from your outstretched hand. You must make a ranged touch attack to hit the target. Any creature or object struck by the ray is covered with a shimmering emerald field that completely blocks extradimensional travel. Forms of movement barred by a dimensional anchor include astral projection, blink, dimension door, ethereal jaunt, etherealness, gate, maze, plane shift, shadow walk, teleport, and similar spell-like or psionic abilities. The spell also prevents the use of a gate or teleportation circle for the duration of the spell.[lf][lf]A dimensional anchor does not interfere with the movement of creatures already in ethereal or astral form when the spell is cast, nor does it block extradimensional perception or attack forms. Also, dimensional anchor does not prevent summoned creatures from disappearing at the end of a summoning spell.

Name: Dimensional Lock
Effect: 20-ft.-radius emanation centered on a point in space
Short Description: Teleportation and interplanar travel blocked for one day/level.
Long Descripton: You create a shimmering emerald barrier that completely blocks extradimensional travel. Forms of movement barred include astral projection, blink, dimension door, ethereal jaunt, etherealness, gate, maze, plane shift, shadow walk, teleport, and similar spell-like or psionic abilities. Once dimensional lock is in place, extradimensional travel into or out of the area is not possible.[lf][lf]A dimensional lock does not interfere with the movement of creatures already in ethereal or astral form when the spell is cast, nor does it block extradimensional perception or attack forms. Also, the spell does not prevent summoned creatures from disappearing at the end of a summoning spell.

Name: Diminish Plants
Short Description: Reduces size or blights growth of normal plants.
Long Descripton: This spell has two versions.[lf][lf]Prune Growth: This version causes normal vegetation within long range (400 feet + 40 feet per level) to shrink to about one-third of their normal size, becoming untangled and less bushy. The affected vegetation appears to have been carefully pruned and trimmed.[lf][lf]At your option, the area can be a 100- foot-radius circle, a 150-foot-radius semicircle, or a 200-foot-radius quarter-circle.[lf][lf]You may also designate portions of the area that are not affected.[lf][lf]Stunt Growth: This version targets normal plants within a range of 1/2 mile, reducing their potential productivity over the course of the following year to one third below normal.[lf][lf]Diminish plants counters plant growth.[lf][lf]This spell has no effect on plant creatures.

Name: Dinosaur Stampede
Short Description: Spectral dinosaurs deal 1d12 damage +1/level.
Medium Description: Throwing down and shattering a fossil to complete the spell, you call upon potent natural-forces and energies, and manifest them. in the form of a swath of intangible, spectral, stampeding dinosaurs.

Name: Dire Hunger
Short Description: Subject grows fangs and attacks creatures near it.

Name: Dirge
Effect: All enemies within a 50-ft.-radius burst centered on you
Short Description: Enemies suffer 2 points of Str and Dex damage per round.

Name: Dirge of Discord
Short Description: Unnatural dirge that causes -4 to attack and concentration checks, and -4 enhancement penalty to Dexterity.

Name: Disable Construct
Short Description: Deals 10/level damage to target construct.

Name: Disarm
Short Description: Disarm a foe or push an object with an unseen force.

Name: Discern Bloodline
Short Description: Know the race of one creature/level.

Name: Discern Lies
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Reveals deliberate falsehoods.
Long Descripton: Each round, you concentrate on one subject, who must be within range. You know if the subject deliberately and knowingly speaks a lie by discerning disturbances in its aura caused by lying. The spell does not reveal the truth, uncover unintentional inaccuracies, or necessarily reveal evasions.[lf][lf]Each round, you may concentrate on a different subject.

Name: Discern Location
Short Description: Reveals exact location of creature or object.
Long Descripton: A discern location spell is among the most powerful means of locating creatures or objects. Nothing short of a mind blank spell or the direct intervention of a deity keeps you from learning the exact location of a single individual or object. Discern location circumvents normal means of protection from scrying or location. The spell reveals the name of the creature or objects location (place, name, business name, building name, or the like), community, county (or similar political division), country, continent, and the plane of existence where the target lies.[lf][lf]To find a creature with the spell, you must have seen the creature or have some item that once belonged to it. To find an object, you must have touched it at least once.

Name: Discern Shapechanger
Short Description: See creatures as they really are or know they can shapechange.

Name: Discolor Pool
Short Description: Change the color of a color pool on the Astral Plane.

Name: Disguise Self
Short Description: Changes your appearance.
Medium Description: Change your appearance, +10 to Disguise check. Glamer creatures get a Will save.
Long Descripton: You make yourself-including clothing, armor, weapons, and equipmentlook different. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller, thin, fat, or in between. You cannot change your body type. Otherwise, the extent of the apparent change is up to you. You could add or obscure a minor feature or look like an entirely different person.[lf][lf]The spell does not provide the abilities or mannerisms of the chosen form, nor does it alter the perceived tactile (touch) or audible (sound) properties of you or your equipment. [lf][lf]If you use this spell to create a disguise, you get a +10 bonus on the Disguise check.[lf][lf]A creature that interacts with the glamer gets a Will save to recognize it as an illusion.

Name: Disguise Ship
Short Description: Disguises a ship.

Name: Disguise Undead
Short Description: Change appearance of one corporeal undead.

Name: Disintegrate
Short Description: Makes one creature or object vanish.
Long Descripton: A thin, green ray springs from your pointing finger. You must make a successful ranged touch attack to hit. Any creature struck by the ray takes 2d6 points of damage per caster level (to a maximum of 40d6). Any creature reduced to 0 or fewer hit points by this spell is entirely disintegrated, leaving behind only a trace of fine dust. A disintegrated creature's equipment is unaffected.[lf][lf]When used against an object, the ray simply disintegrates as much as one 10-foot cube of nonliving matter. Thus, the spell disintegrates only part of any very large object or structure targeted. The ray affects even objects constructed entirely of force, such as forceful hand or a wall of force, but not magical effects such as a globe of invulnerability or an antimagic field.[lf][lf]A creature or object that makes a successful Fortitude save is partially affected, taking only 5d6 points of damage. If this damage reduces the creature or object to 0 or fewer hit points, it is entirely disintegrated.[lf][lf]Only the first creature or object struck can be affected; that is, the ray affects only one target per casting.

Name: Dismissal
Short Description: Forces a creature to return to native plane.
Long Descripton: This spell forces an extraplanar creature back to its proper plane if it fails a special Will save (DC = spells save DC - creatures HD + your caster level). If the spell is successful, the creature is instantly whisked away, but there is a 20% chance of actually sending the subject to a plane other than its own.

Name: Disobedience
Short Description: Subject is shielded from mind control.
Medium Description: Shield subject from mind control, blocking active compulsion spells.

Name: Dispel Chaos
Effect: You and a touched evil creature from another plane; or you and an enchantment or evil spell on a touched creature or object
Duration: 1 round/level or until discharged, whichever comes first
Short Description: +4 bonus against attacks by chaotic creatures.
Long Descripton: Shimmering, blue, lawful energy surrounds you. This power has three effects.[lf][lf]First, you gain a +4 deflection bonus to AC against attacks by chaotic creatures.[lf][lf]Second, on making a successful melee touch attack against a chaotic creature from another plane, you can choose to drive that creature back to its home plane. The creature can negate the effects with a successful Will save (spell resistance applies). This use discharges and ends the spell.[lf][lf]Third, with a touch you can automatically dispel any one enchantment spell cast by a chaotic creature or any one chaotic spell. Exception: Spells that can't be dispelled by dispel magic also can't be dispelled by dispel chaos. Saving throws and spell resistance do not apply to this effect. This use discharges and ends the spell.

Name: Dispel Cold
Effect: You and a touched evil creature from another plane; or you and an enchantment or evil spell on a touched creature or object
Duration: 1 round/level or until discharged, whichever comes first
Short Description: Cancels cold spells and effects.

Name: Dispel Evil
Effect: You and a touched evil creature from another plane; or you and an enchantment or evil spell on a touched creature or object
Duration: 1 round/level or until discharged, whichever comes first
Short Description: +4 bonus against attacks by evil creatures.
Long Descripton: Shimmering, white, holy energy surrounds you. This power has three effects.[lf][lf]First, you gain a +4 deflection bonus to AC against attacks by evil creatures.[lf][lf]Second, on making a successful melee touch attack against an evil creature from another plane, you can choose to drive that creature back to its home plane. The creature can negate the effects with a successful Will save (spell resistance applies). This use discharges and ends the spell.[lf][lf]Third, with a touch you can automatically dispel any one enchantment spell cast by an evil creature or any one evil spell. Exception: Spells that can't be dispelled by dispel magic also can't be dispelled by dispel evil. Saving throws and spell resistance do not apply to this effect. This use discharges and ends the spell.

Name: Dispel Fire
Effect: You and a touched evil creature from another plane; or you and an enchantment or evil spell on a touched creature or object
Duration: 1 round/level or until discharged, whichever comes first
