Short Description: Cancels fire spells and effects.

Name: Dispel Good
Effect: You and a touched evil creature from another plane; or you and an enchantment or evil spell on a touched creature or object
Duration: 1 round/level or until discharged, whichever comes first
Short Description: +4 bonus against attacks by good creatures.
Long Descripton: Shimmering, dark, unholy energy surrounds you. This power has three effects.[lf][lf]First, you gain a +4 deflection bonus to AC against attacks by good creatures.[lf][lf]Second, on making a successful melee touch attack against a good creature from another plane, you can choose to drive that creature back to its home plane. The creature can negate the effects with a successful Will save (spell resistance applies). This use discharges and ends the spell.[lf][lf]Third, with a touch you can automatically dispel any one enchantment spell cast by a good creature or any one good spell. Exception: Spells that can't be dispelled by dispel magic also can't be dispelled by dispel good. Saving throws and spell resistance do not apply to this effect. This use discharges and ends the spell.

Name: Dispel Law
Effect: You and a touched evil creature from another plane; or you and an enchantment or evil spell on a touched creature or object
Duration: 1 round/level or until discharged, whichever comes first
Short Description: +4 bonus against attacks by lawful creatures.
Long Descripton: Shimmering, yellow, chaotic energy surrounds you. This power has three effects.[lf][lf]First, you gain a +4 deflection bonus to AC against attacks by chaotic creatures.[lf][lf]Second, on making a successful melee touch attack against a chaotic creature from another plane, you can choose to drive that creature back to its home plane. The creature can negate the effects with a successful Will save (spell resistance applies). This use discharges and ends the spell.[lf][lf]Third, with a touch you can automatically dispel any one enchantment spell cast by a chaotic creature or any one good spell. Exception: Spells that can't be dispelled by dispel magic also can't be dispelled by dispel chaotic. Saving throws and spell resistance do not apply to this effect. This use discharges and ends the spell.

Name: Dispel Magic
Effect: One spellcaster, creature, or object; or 20-ft.-radius burst
Short Description: Cancels magical spells and effects.
Long Descripton: You can use dispel magic to end on-going spells that have been cast on a creature or object, to temporarily suppress the magical abilities of a magic item, to end ongoing spells (or at least their effects) within an area, or to counter another spellcasters spell. A dispelled spell ends as if its duration had expired. Some spells, as detailed in their descriptions, can't be defeated by dispel magic. Dispel magic can dispel (but not counter) spell-like effects just as it does spells.[lf][lf]Note: The effect of a spell with an instantaneous duration can't be dispelled, because the magical effect is already over before the dispel magic can take effect. [lf][lf]You choose to use dispel magic in one of three ways: a targeted dispel, an area dispel, or a counterspell:[lf][lf]Targeted Dispel: One object, creature, or spell is the target of the dispel magic spell. You make a dispel check (1d20 + your caster level, maximum +10) against the spell or against each on-going spell currently in effect on the object or creature. The DC for this dispel check is 11 + the spells caster level. If you succeed on a particular check, that spell is dispelled; if you fail, that spell remains in effect.[lf][lf]If you target an object or creature that is the effect of an on-going spell (such as a monster summoned by monster summoning), you make a dispel check to end the spell that conjured the object or creature.[lf][lf]If the object that you target is a magic item, you make a dispel check against the item's caster level. If you succeed, all the item's magical properties are suppressed for 1d4 rounds, after which the item recovers on its own. A suppressed item becomes non-magical for the duration of the effect. An interdimensional interface (such as a bag of holding) is temporarily closed. A magic items physical properties are unchanged: A suppressed magic sword is still a sword (a masterwork sword, in fact). Artifacts and deities are unaffected by mortal magic such as this.[lf][lf]You automatically succeed on your dispel check against any spell that you cast yourself.[lf][lf]Area Dispel: When dispel magic is used in this way, the spell affects everything within a 20-foot radius.[lf][lf]For each creature within the area that is the subject of one or more spells, you make a dispel check against the spell with the highest caster level. If that check fails, you make dispel checks against progressively weaker spells until you dispel one spell (which discharges the dispel magic spell so far as that target is concerned) or until you fail all your checks. The creatures magic items are not affected.[lf][lf]For each object within the area that is the target of one or more spells, you make dispel checks as with creatures. Magic items are not affected by an area dispel.[lf][lf]For each ongoing area or effect spell whose point of origin is within the area of the dispel magic spell, you can make a dispel check to dispel the spell.[lf][lf]For each ongoing spell whose area overlaps that of the dispel magic spell, you can make a dispel check to end the effect, but only within the overlapping area.[lf][lf]If an object or creature that is the effect of an ongoing spell (such as a monster summoned by monster summoning) is in the area, you can make a dispel check to end the spell that conjured that object or creature (returning it whence it came) in addition to attempting to dispel spells targeting the creature or object.[lf][lf]You may choose to automatically succeed on dispel checks against any spell that you have cast.[lf][lf]Counterspell: When dispel magic is used in this way, the spell targets a spellcaster and is cast as a counterspell. Unlike a true counterspell, however, dispel magic may not work; you must make a dispel check to counter the other spellcaster's spell.

Name: Dispel Magic, Greater
Effect: One spellcaster, creature, or object; or 20-ft.-radius burst
Short Description: As dispel magic, but +20 on check.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like dispel magic, except that the maximum caster level on your dispel check is +20 instead of +10.[lf][lf]Additionally, greater dispel magic has a chance to dispel any effect that remove curse can remove, even if dispel magic can't dispel that effect.

Name: Dispel Shield
Short Description: This spell protects you from dispel magic attemps by being dispelled first.
Long Descripton: When an area dispel magic lands on you, this spell automatically registers as the highest level spell, even if it is not, and also automatically fails its caster level check.  Thus protecting your other active spells.  [lf][lf]You may not have more than one dispel shield active at once.  Any additional castings replace the previous ones.

Name: Dispel Ward
Short Description: As dispel magic, but affects only wards.

Name: Dispel Water
Short Description: Cancels water spells and effects or dismisses water creatures.

Name: Dispelling Breath
Short Description: Your breath weapon acts as a targeted dispel magic to all creatures in its area.

Name: Dispelling Screen
Effect: Energy wall whose area is up to one 10-ft. square/level, or a sphere or hemisphere with a radius of up to 1 ft./level
Short Description: Create an opaque screen that targets passing objects with dispel magic.

Name: Dispelling Screen, Greater
Effect: Energy wall whose area is up to one 10-ft. square/level, or a sphere or hemisphere with a radius of up to 1 ft./level
Short Description: As dispelling screen, except that the maximum caster level bonus on the dispel check is +20.

Name: Dispelling Touch
Effect: One touched creature, object, or spell effect
Short Description: Dispel one magical effect on touched subject.

Name: Displacement
Short Description: Attacks miss subject 50%.
Long Descripton: The subject of this spell appears to be about 2 feet away from its true location. The creature benefits from a 50% miss chance as if it had total concealment. However, unlike actual total concealment, displacement does not prevent enemies from targeting the creature normally. True seeing reveals its true location.

Name: Displacer Form
Short Description: You change into displacer beast, gain some abilities.

Name: Disquietude
Short Description: Target avoids physical contact with others.

Name: Disrupt Undead
Short Description: Deals 1d6 damage to one undead.
Medium Description: Deals 1d6 positive energy damage to one undead.
Long Descripton: You direct a ray of positive energy. You must make a ranged touch attack to hit, and if the ray hits an undead creature, it deals 1d6 points of damage to it.

Name: Disrupt Undead, Greater
Short Description: As disrupt undead, but damage increases per caster level.
Medium Description: Deals 1d8/caster level (max 10d8) positive energy damage to any undead.

Name: Disrupting Weapon
Short Description: Melee weapon destroys undead.
Long Descripton: This spell makes a melee weapon deadly to undead. Any undead creature with HD equal to or less than your caster level must succeed on a Will save or be destroyed utterly if struck in combat with this weapon. Spell resistance does not apply against the destruction effect.

Name: Dissonant Chant
Short Description: Distracting chant which makes Concentration checks in the area more difficult.

Name: Dissonant Chord
Short Description: Deal 1d8/2 levels sonic damage in 10-ft. burst.

Name: Distilled Joy
Short Description: Creates ambrosia.

Name: Distort Speech
Short Description: Target's speech becomes unintelligible, hampers spellcasting.

Name: Distort Summons
Short Description: Creates area where only evil creatures can be summoned.

Name: Distort Weapon
Short Description: All threats of a critical hit against good foes are automatically confirmed.

Name: Distract
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart.
Short Description: Distracts targets with the zest for life.

Name: Distract Assailant
Short Description: Swift. One creature is flat-footed for 1 round.

Name: Distracting Ray
Short Description: Distracts target spellcaster as counterspell.

Name: Distracting Shadows
Short Description: -5 penalty on Spot and Search checks in a 10-ft.-radius spread.

Name: Divination
Short Description: Provides useful advice for specific proposed actions.
Long Descripton: Similar to augury but more powerful, a divination spell can provide you with a useful piece of advice in reply to a question concerning a specific goal, event, or activity that is to occur within one week. The advice can be as simple as a short phrase, or it might take the form of a cryptic rhyme or omen. If your party doesn't act on the information, the conditions may change so that the information is no longer useful. The base chance for a correct divination is 70% + 1% per caster level, to a maximum of 90%. If the dice roll fails, you know the spell failed, unless specific magic yielding false information is at work.[lf][lf]As with augury, multiple divinations about the same topic by the same caster use the same dice result as the first divination spell and yield the same answer each time.

Name: Divine Agility
Short Description: Subject gains +10 to Dexterity for 1 round/level.

Name: Divine Favor
Short Description: You gain +1 per three levels on attack and damage rolls.
Long Descripton: Calling upon the strength and wisdom of a deity, you gain a +1 luck bonus on attack and weapon damage rolls for every three caster levels you have (at least +1, maximum +6). The bonus doesn't apply to spell damage.

Name: Divine Flame
Short Description: Wards area against cold creatures.

Name: Divine Insight
Short Description: You gain insight bonus of 5 + caster level on one single skill check.

Name: Divine Inspiration
Short Description: Target gains +3 sacred bonus on attack rolls against evil creatures.

Name: Divine Interdiction
Effect: 10-ft.-radius emanation, centered on a creature, object, or point in space
Saving Throw: Will negates or None (object); see text
Short Description: Prevents other divine characters from turning or rebuking.

Name: Divine Power
Short Description: You gain attack bonus, +6 to Str, and 1 hp/level.
Long Descripton: Calling upon the divine power of your patron, you imbue yourself with strength and skill in combat. Your base attack bonus becomes equal to your character level (which may give you additional attacks), you gain a +6 enhancement bonus to Strength, and you gain 1 temporary hit point per caster level.

Name: Divine Presence
Short Description: Gain a bonus on Intimidate checks against those who don't worship your deity.
Medium Description: Gain a +5, +10, or +15 bonus on Intimidate checks against those who don't worship your deity.

Name: Divine Protection
Short Description: Allies gain a +1 morale bonus to their Armor Class and on saving throws.

Name: Divine Retribution
Short Description: Any creature that harms you takes ld6/caster level points of damage and ld4 points of ability damage based on the deity selected.
Medium Description: Any creature that harms you takes ld6/caster level (max. 15d6) points of damage (half energy and half divine) and ld4 points of ability damage based on the deity selected.

Name: Divine Sacrifice
Short Description: You sacrifice hit points to deal extra damage.

Name: Divine Storm
Effect: Whirling disk of weapons, up to 30-ft. radius
Short Description: Whirling disk of weapons, dealing 1d6 + 2/level (max +20) in a plane.

Name: Divine Zephyr
Short Description: Wards area against fire creatures.

Name: Dolor
Short Description: Cause a creature trapped in a planar binding pain, compelling it to agree to some service.

Name: Dolorous Blow
Short Description: Weapon's threat range is doubled and threats are automatically confirmed.

Name: Dolorous Motes
Short Description: Creates clouds of flickering light (1 10-ft. cube/level) that dazes creatures.

Name: Dominate Animal
Short Description: Subject animal obeys silent mental commands.
Long Descripton: You can enchant an animal and direct it with simple commands such as Attack, Run, and Fetch. Suicidal or self-destructive commands (including an order to attack a creature two or more size categories larger than the dominated animal) are simply ignored.[lf][lf]Dominate animal establishes a mental link between you and the subject creature. The animal can be directed by silent mental command as long as it remains in range. You need not see the creature to control it. You do not receive direct sensory input from the creature, but you know what it is experiencing. Because you are directing the animal with your own intelligence, it may be able to undertake actions normally beyond its own comprehension. You need not concentrate exclusively on controlling the creature unless you are trying to direct it to do something it normally couldn't do. Changing your instructions or giving a dominated creature a new command is the equivalent of redirecting a spell, so it is a move action.

Name: Dominate Living Construct
Short Description: As dominate person, but affecting a living construct.

Name: Dominate Monster
Short Description: As dominate person, but any creature.
Long Descripton: You can control the actions of any creature through a telepathic link that you establish with the subjects mind.[lf][lf]If you and the subject have a common language, you can generally force the subject to perform as you desire, within the limits of its abilities. If no common language exists, you can communicate only basic commands, such as Come here, Go there, Fight, and Stand still. You know what the subject is experiencing, but you do not receive direct sensory input from it, nor can it communicate with you telepathically.[lf][lf]Once you have given a dominated creature a command, it continues to attempt to carry out that command to the exclusion of all other activities except those necessary for day-to-day survival (such as sleeping, eating, and so forth). Because of this limited range of activity, a Sense Motive check against DC 15 (rather than DC 25) can determine that the subject's behavior is being influenced by an enchantment effect (see the Sense Motive skill description).[lf][lf]Changing your instructions or giving a dominated creature a new command is the equivalent of redirecting a spell, so it is a move action.[lf][lf]By concentrating fully on the spell (a standard action), you can receive full sensory input as interpreted by the mind of the subject, though it still can't communicate with you. You can't actually see through the subject's eyes, so it's not as good as being there yourself, but you still get a good idea of what's going on.[lf][lf]Subjects resist this control, and any subject forced to take actions against its nature receives a new saving throw with a +2 bonus. Obviously self-destructive orders are not carried out. Once control is established, the range at which it can be exercised is unlimited, as long as you and the subject are on the same plane. You need not see the subject to control it.[lf][lf]If you don't spend at least 1 round concentrating on the spell each day, the subject receives a new saving throw to throw off the domination.[lf][lf]Protection from evil or a similar spell can prevent you from exercising control or using the telepathic link while the subject is so warded, but such an effect neither prevents the establishment of domination nor dispels it.

Name: Dominate Person
Short Description: Controls humanoid telepathically.
Long Descripton: You can control the actions of any humanoid creature through a telepathic link that you establish with the subjects mind.[lf][lf]If you and the subject have a common language, you can generally force the subject to perform as you desire, within the limits of its abilities. If no common language exists, you can communicate only basic commands, such as Come here, Go there, Fight, and Stand still. You know what the subject is experiencing, but you do not receive direct sensory input from it, nor can it communicate with you telepathically.[lf][lf]Once you have given a dominated creature a command, it continues to attempt to carry out that command to the exclusion of all other activities except those necessary for day-to-day survival (such as sleeping, eating, and so forth). Because of this limited range of activity, a Sense Motive check against DC 15 (rather than DC 25) can determine that the subjects behavior is being influenced by an enchantment effect (see the Sense Motive skill description).[lf][lf]Changing your instructions or giving a dominated creature a new command is the equivalent of redirecting a spell, so it is a move action.[lf][lf]By concentrating fully on the spell (a standard action), you can receive full sensory input as interpreted by the mind of the subject, though it still can't communicate with you. You can't actually see through the subjects eyes, so it's not as good as being there yourself, but you still get a good idea of what's going on.[lf][lf]Subjects resist this control, and any subject forced to take actions against its nature receives a new saving throw with a +2 bonus. Obviously self-destructive orders are not carried out. Once control is established, the range at which it can be exercised is unlimited, as long as you and the subject are on the same plane. You need not see the subject to control it.[lf][lf]If you don't spend at least 1 round concentrating on the spell each day, the subject receives a new saving throw to throw off the domination.[lf][lf]Protection from evil or a similar spell can prevent you from exercising control or using the telepathic link while the subject is so warded, but such an effect neither prevents the establishment of domination nor dispels it.

Name: Doom
Short Description: One subject takes -2 on attack rolls, damage rolls, saves, and checks.
Long Descripton: This spell fills a single subject with a feeling of horrible dread that causes it to become shaken.

Name: Doom of the Seas
Short Description: Summons a fiendish kraken (Doom of the Seas) under your command.

Name: Doom Scarabs
Short Description: Scarab swarm deals 1d6/2 levels, gives you temporary hit points.
Medium Description: Scarab swarm deals 1d6/2 levels (max 10d6), you gain 1d4 temp HP for 1 hour for overcoming SR.

Name: Doomtide
Effect: Eight 10-ft. cubes extending from the caster's location
Short Description: Black mist obscures vision, dazes creatures.

Name: Door Of Decay
Short Description: Move instantly from one willing or  ontrolled[lf][lf]undead to another.
Medium Description: Move instantly from one willing or  ontrolled[lf][lf]undead to another.

Name: Door to Great Evil
Short Description: Send yourself or another paladin to the nearest evil you can deal with.

Name: Doppelganger Transformation
Short Description: You gain physical and mental bonuses.

Name: Doublestrike Arrow
Short Description: One arrow or bolt strikes two targets within 30 feet of each other.

Name: Downdraft
Short Description: Force flying creatures to fall 100 feet or knock landborne people prone.

Name: Draconic Might
Short Description: Gain +5 to Str, Con, Cha; +4 natural armor; immunity to magic sleep and paralysis effects.

Name: Draconic Polymorph
Short Description: As polymorph, except average Str + 8 and average Con + 2 and Max 20 HD.

Name: Dragon Ally
Effect: One called dragon of 18 HD or less
Short Description: As dragon ally, lesser, but up to 18 HD.

Name: Dragon Ally, Greater
Effect: One called dragon of 22 HD or less
Short Description: As dragon ally, lesser, but up to 27 HD.

Name: Dragon Ally, Lesser
Effect: One summoned dragon of up to 9 HD.
Short Description: Exchange services with a 15 HD dragon.

Name: Dragon Breath
Short Description: You choose a dragon type and mimic its breath weapon.

Name: Dragon Cloud
Short Description: Calls forth an elemental spirit that assumes a cloudy, dragonlike form.

Name: Dragonsight
Short Description: Gain low-light vision, darkvision, and blindsense.

Name: Dragonskin
Short Description: You gain +3 to +5 natural armor bonus and Energy Resistance 10 to 20.

Name: Dread Word
Short Description: 1d3 Cha drain on one target.

Name: Dream
Short Description: Sends message to anyone sleeping.
Long Descripton: You, or a messenger touched by you, sends a phantasmal message to others in the form of a dream. At the beginning of the spell, you must name the recipient or identify him or her by some title that leaves no doubt as to identity. The messenger then enters a trance, appears in the intended recipient's dream, and delivers the message. The message can be of any length, and the recipient remembers it perfectly upon waking. The communication is one-way. The recipient cannot ask questions or offer information, nor can the messenger gain any information by observing the dreams of the recipient.[lf][lf]Once the message is delivered, the messenger's mind returns instantly to its body. The duration of the spell is the time required for the messenger to enter the recipient's dream and deliver the message.[lf][lf]If the recipient is awake when the spell begins, the messenger can choose to wake up (ending the spell) or remain in the trance. The messenger can remain in the trance until the recipient goes to sleep, then enter the recipients dream and deliver the message as normal. A messenger that is disturbed during the trance comes awake, ending the spell.[lf][lf]Creatures who don't sleep (such as elves, but not half-elves) or don't dream cannot be contacted by this spell.[lf][lf]The messenger is unaware of its own surroundings or of the activities around it while in the trance. It is defenseless both physically and mentally (always fails any saving throw) while in the trance.

Name: Dream Casting
Short Description: Alter subject's dreams to produce desired effect.

Name: Dream Image
Short Description: Create a shadow copy of yourself to interact with the area.

Name: Dream Sight
Short Description: Your spirit can hear and see at distance for 1 min./level.

Name: Drown
Short Description: Target immediately begins to drown.

Name: Drown, Mass
Effect: One or more creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart.
Short Description: As drown, but affects multiple creatures.

Name: Drown, Vile
Short Description: Subject begins to drown.

Name: Drug Resistance
Short Description: Subject is immune to addiction.

Name: Drums of War
Short Description: Enemies take -2 penalty on attacks and saves.

Name: Duelward
Short Description: You can counterspell as an immediate action with a +4 bonus to Spellcraft.

Name: Dust Storm
Effect: Sand storm cylinder 60-feet across and 30 ft. high
Short Description: Create a blinding storm that deals 1d6 damage per round.
Medium Description: Create a blinding storm that deals 1d6 slashing damage per round.

Name: Dust to Dust
Short Description: Disintegrate undead with your ray attack. Deals 1d8/2 levels (max 10d8) damage.

Name: Dweomer of Transference
Short Description: Convert spellcasting into psionic power points.
Long Descripton: With this spell, you form a radiating corona around the head of a psionic ally, then convert some of your spells into psionic power points. When you finish casting dweomer of transference, a red-orange glow surrounds the psionic creature's head. For the duration of the spell, any spells cast at the subject don't have their usual effect, instead converting themselves harmlessly into psionic energy that the subject can use as energy for psionic powers. You can cast any spell you like at the subject, even area spells, effect spells, and spells for whom the subject would ordinarily not be a legitimate target. The spells don't do anything other than provide the subject with power points, but you must still cast them normally, obeying the component and range requirements listed in the description of each spell.  For each spell you cast into the dweomer of transference, the psionic creature gets temporary power points, according to the following table. The transference isn't perfectly efficient. The temporary power points acquired through a dweomer of transference dissipate after 1 hour if they haven't already been spent.    [lf]Spell LevelPower Points Acquired  [lf]00  [lf]1st1  [lf]2nd2  [lf]3rd4  [lf]4th6  [lf]5th8  [lf]6th10  [lf]7th12  [lf]8th14  [lf]9th16

Name: Eagle's Splendor
Short Description: Subject gains +4 to Cha for 1 min./level.
Long Descripton: The transmuted creature becomes more poised, articulate, and personally forceful. The spell grants a +4 enhancement bonus to Charisma, adding the usual benefits to Charisma-based skill checks and other uses of the Charisma modifier. Sorcerers and bards (and other spellcasters who rely on Charisma) affected by this spell do not gain any additional bonus spells for the increased Charisma, but the save DCs for spells they cast while under this spells effect do increase.

Name: Eagle's Splendor, Mass
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: As eagle's splendor, affects one subject/level.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like eagle's splendor, except that it affects multiple creatures.

Name: Early Twilight
Short Description: Reduce light in 80-ft.-radius cylinder.

Name: Earth Glide
Short Description: Grants the ability to move through earth and stone like an earth elemental

Name: Earth Hammer
Short Description: You transform one melee weapon into a bludgeoning adamantine weapon.

Name: Earth Lock
Effect: One 1-foot length of tunnel with a diameter of up to 10 feet
Short Description: Constricts tunnel, preventing access.

Name: Earth Reaver
Short Description: Eruption deals 4d6 impact damage and 3d6 fire damage to all in area.
Medium Description: Eruption deals 4d6 impact damage and 3d6 fire damage to all in area.

Name: Earthbind
Short Description: Subject creature can't fly.

Name: Earthbolt
Effect: 5-ft. wide path to close range (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)
Short Description: Deal 1d6 damage/level (max 10d6) on an earth bound line.

Name: Earthen Grace
Short Description: Stone and rock damage sources deal nonlethal damage instead of lethal damage.

Name: Earthen Grasp
Short Description: Dense hand grapples creatures and pins them.

Name: Earthfast
Effect: One stone structure or rock formation, up to 25 cu. ft./level
Short Description: Double hardness and hit points of stone structure or rock formation.

Name: Earthquake
Short Description: Intense tremor shakes 5-ft./level radius.
Long Descripton: When you cast earthquake, an intense but highly localized tremor rips the ground. The shock knocks creatures down, collapses structures, opens cracks in the ground, and more. The effect lasts for 1 round, during which time creatures on the ground can't move or attack. A spellcaster on the ground must make a Concentration check (DC 20 + spell level) or lose any spell he or she tries to cast. The earthquake affects all terrain, vegetation, structures, and creatures in the area. The specific effect of an earthquake spell depends on the nature of the terrain where it is cast.[lf][lf]Cave, Cavern, or Tunnel: The spell collapses the roof, dealing 8d6 points of bludgeoning damage to any creature caught under the cave-in (Reflex DC 15 half ) and pinning that creature beneath the rubble (see below). An earthquake cast on the roof of a very large cavern could also endanger those outside the actual area but below the falling debris.[lf][lf]Cliffs: Earthquake causes a cliff to crumble, creating a landslide that travels horizontally as far as it fell vertically. Any creature in the path takes 8d6 points of bludgeoning damage (Reflex DC 15 half ) and is pinned beneath the rubble (see below).[lf][lf]Open Ground: Each creature standing in the area must make a DC 15 Reflex save or fall down. Fissures open in the earth, and every creature on the ground has a 25% chance to fall into one (Reflex DC 20 to avoid a fissure). At the end of the spell, all fissures grind shut, killing any creatures still trapped within.[lf][lf]Structure: Any structure standing on open ground takes 100 points of damage, enough to collapse a typical wooden or masonry building, but not a structure built of stone or reinforced masonry. Hardness does not reduce this damage, nor is it halved as damage dealt to objects normally is. Any creature caught inside a collapsing structure takes 8d6 points of bludgeoning damage (Reflex DC 15 half ) and is pinned beneath the rubble (see below).[lf][lf]River, Lake, or Marsh: Fissures open underneath the water, draining away the water from that area and forming muddy ground. Soggy marsh or swampland becomes quicksand for the duration of the spell, sucking down creatures and structures. Each creature in the area must make a DC 15 Reflex save or sink down in the mud and quicksand. At the end of the spell, the rest of the body of water rushes in to replace the drained water, possibly drowning those caught in the mud.[lf][lf]Pinned beneath Rubble: Any creature pinned beneath rubble takes 1d6 points of nonlethal damage per minute while pinned. If a pinned character falls unconscious, he or she must make a DC 15 Constitution check or take 1d6 points of lethal damage each minute thereafter until freed or dead.

Name: Ease of Breath
Short Description: +20 inherent bonus on Fortitude saves to resist altitude sickness.

Name: Ease Pain
Short Description: Removes lingering effects of pain.

Name: Easy Climb
Effect: Vertical path 10 ft. wide and 20 ft. tall/level
Short Description: Changes vertical surface Climb DC to 10.

Name: Easy Math
Short Description: Allows instant counting and distance calculation.

Name: Easy Trail
Short Description: Makes a trail easier to pass.

Name: Ebon Eyes
Short Description: Subject can see through magical darkness.

Name: Ebon Ray of Doom
Short Description: Black energy prevents magical healing and special healing abilities from functioning.

Name: Echo Skull
Short Description: See, hear, and speak through a prepared animal skull for 1 hour/level.

Name: Ectoplasmic Armor
Short Description: Gain +5 to +9 armor bonus against incorporeal touch attacks.

Name: Ectoplasmic Enhancement
Short Description: Incorporeal undead gain +1 AC, +1d8 hp, +1 on attacks, +2 turn resistance for every 3 levels.

Name: Ectoplasmic Feedback
Short Description: Incorporeal attackers take 1d6 damage.
Medium Description: Incorporeal attackers take 1d6 + 1/caster level (max +10) force damage.

Name: Effulgent Epuration
Effect: One magic-absorbing sphere per caster level.
Short Description: Creates one sphere/level to negate hostile magic.

Name: Eladrin Form
Short Description: You become an incorporeal globe.

Name: Elation
Effect: Allies in an 80-ft.-radius spread of you
Short Description: Allies gain +2 to Strength and Dexterity, +5 ft. of speed.

Name: Electric Jolt
Short Description: Ray deals 1d3 electricity damage.

Name: Electric Loop
Effect: One creature/3 levels, each of which is adjacent to another target
Short Description: Deals 1d6/two levels electricity damage plus stunning to a single creature.
Medium Description: Deals 1d6/two levels (max 5d6) electricity damage + stuns a single creature.

Name: Electric Slap
Short Description: Touch attack deals 1d6 electricity damage.
Long Descripton: Your hand is imbued with a small electric charge that triggers when you touch an creature, requiring a successful melee touch attack. The spell deals 1d6 electricity damage.

Name: Electric Spark
Short Description: Ray deals 1d3 electricity damage.
Long Descripton: You cause a spark of electricity to arc from you to the target, requiring a successful ranged touch attack. The spell deals 1d3 electricity damagee.

Name: Electrical Deluge
Effect: A spread centered on you, 5 ft. high and 200ft. across
Short Description: See Text

Name: Elemental Body
Short Description: You take on the qualities of a type of elemental.

Name: Elemental Burst
Saving Throw: Reflex half or Reflex negates; see text
Short Description: Deal elemental damage in a burst.

Name: Elemental Familiar
Short Description: Transmutes your familiar into an elemental.

Name: Elemental Prod
Short Description: Move an elemental creature a short distance.

Name: Elemental Shroud
Effect: Up to one animate dead creature/level
Short Description: Grant undead creatures armor and turn bonuses and deal elemental damage upon being struck by a foe or striking a foe.

Name: Elemental Swarm
Effect: Two or more summoned creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Summons multiple elementals.
Long Descripton: This spell opens a portal to an Elemental Plane and summons elementals from it. A druid can choose the plane (Air, Earth, Fire, or Water); a cleric opens a portal to the plane matching his domain.[lf][lf]When the spell is complete, 2d4 Large elementals appear. Ten minutes later, 1d4 Huge elementals appear. Ten minutes after that, one greater elemental appears. Each elemental has maximum hit points per HD. Once these creatures appear, they serve you for the duration of the spell.[lf][lf]The elementals obey you explicitly and never attack you, even if someone else manages to gain control over them. You do not need to concentrate to maintain control over the elementals. You can dismiss them singly or in groups at any time.[lf][lf]When you use a summoning spell to summon an air, earth, fire, or water creature, it is a spell of that type.

Name: Elemental Ward
Short Description: Drive Wu Jen type elementals away from you.

Name: Elf Disguise
Short Description: As disguise self, except no body changes and only to an Elf type.

Name: Embrace of Endless Day
Duration: 1 min./level or until expended; see text
Short Description: Target gets 3/level (max 30) "points" of positive energy to heal or harm, and gains +1 on saves against necromantic and death effects.

Name: Embrace the Wild
Short Description: You gain an animal's senses for 10 min./level.

Name: Emerald Burst
Short Description: 20-ft.-radius burst dazes neutral creatures for 1 round, stuns evil creatures for 1d4 rounds.

Name: Emerald Flame Fist
Short Description: You can transfer a burning aura to a subject dealing 3d6 +1/level (max +20) fire damage per round.

Name: Emerald Planes
Short Description: Creates up to five 5-foot squares that hold 100 lb./level.

Name: Empyreal Ecstasy
Short Description: Targets immune to pain and mind-influencing effects, and take half damage from melee and ranged attacks; -4 to skill checks.

Name: Enchanting Flavor
Short Description: A meal tastes wonderful and you gain a one-time Charisma-based check bonus.

Name: End to Strife
Short Description: Any attack made within 80 feet of caster causes attacker to take 1d6 points of lethal or nonlethal damage/caster level (max 20d6).

Name: Endure Elements
Short Description: Exist comfortably in hot or cold environments.
Long Descripton: A creature protected by endure elements suffers no harm from being in a hot or cold environment. It can exist comfortably in conditions between -50 and 140 degrees Fahrenheit without having to make Fortitude saves). The creatures equipment is likewise protected.[lf][lf]Endure elements doesn't provide any protection from fire or cold damage, nor does it protect against other environmental hazards such as smoke, lack of air, and so forth.

Name: Enduring Flight
Short Description: Carry medium loads at full fly speed; flight duration doubles.

Name: Energetic Healing
Short Description: Target is immune to one energy type and gains 10% of the energy damage as healing.

Name: Energize Potion
Short Description: Transforms potion into a grenade that deals energy damage in a 10-ft.-radius burst.
Medium Description: Transforms potion into a grenade that deals 1d6/spell level (max 3d6) acid, cold, fire, electricity, or sonic damage in a 10-ft.-radius burst.

Name: Energized Shield
Short Description: Shield provides user resistance 10, shield bash deals +2d6 damage.

Name: Energized Shield, Lesser
Short Description: Shield provides user resistance 5, shield bash deals +1d6 damage.

Name: Energy Aegis
Short Description: Subject gains resistance 20 against one energy type for one attack.

Name: Energy Alteration
Short Description: Item using one kind of energy uses another instead.

Name: Energy Buffer
Short Description: Absorbs 1d6/level points of damage (maximum 15d6) from one kind of energy.
Medium Description: Absorbs 1d6/level points of damage (maximum 15d6) from one kind of energy (acid, cold, electricity, fire, sonic).

Name: Energy Drain
Short Description: Subject gains 2d4 negative levels.
Long Descripton: You point your finger and utter the incantation, releasing a black ray of crackling negative energy that suppresses the life force of any living creature it strikes. You must make a ranged touch attack to hit. If the attack succeeds, the subject gains 2d4 negative levels.[lf][lf]If the subject has at least as many negative levels as HD, it dies. Each negative level gives a creature a 1 penalty on attack rolls, saving throws, skill checks, ability checks, and effective level (for determining the power, duration, DC, and other details of spells or special abilities).[lf][lf]Additionally, a spellcaster loses one spell or spell slot from his or her highest available level. Negative levels stack.[lf][lf]There is no saving throw to avoid gaining the negative levels, but 24 hours after gaining them, the subject must make a Fortitude saving throw (DC = energy drain spells save DC) for each negative level. If the save succeeds, that negative level is removed. If it fails, the negative level also goes away, but one of the subjects character levels is permanently drained.[lf][lf]An undead creature struck by the ray gains 2d4x5 temporary hit points for 1 hour.

Name: Energy Ebb
Short Description: Give subject one negative level/round for 1 round/level.

Name: Energy Immunity
Short Description: Subject is immune to damage from one kind of energy.
Medium Description: Subject is immune to damage from one kind of energy (acid, cold, electricity, fire, sonic).

Name: Energy Spheres
Duration: 1 round/level or until discharged, whichever comes first
Short Description: Five colored spheres attack with or negate acid, cold, electricity, fire, and sonic damage.

Name: Energy Surge
Short Description: As lesser energy surge, but 2d6 damage.
Medium Description: Weapon deals extra 2d6 acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage (your choice).

Name: Energy Surge, Greater
Short Description: As lesser energy surge, but 3d6 damage.
Medium Description: Weapon deals extra 3d6 acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage (your choice).

Name: Energy Surge, Lesser
Short Description: One attack deals an extra 1d6 energy damage.
Medium Description: Weapon deals extra 1d6 acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage (your choice).

Name: Energy Transformation Field
Short Description: Area absorbs magic energy to power a predetermined spell.

Name: Energy Vortex
Effect: All creatures within a 20-ft.-radius burst centered on you
Short Description: Burst of energy centered on you damages nearby creatures.
Medium Description: Burst centered on you deals 1d8 +1/caster level (max +20) acid, cold, fire, or electricity damage to nearby creatures.

Name: Enervating Breath
Short Description: Your breath weapon also bestows 2d4 negative levels.

Name: Enervation
Short Description: Subject gains 1d4 negative levels.
Long Descripton: You point your finger and utter the incantation, releasing a black ray of crackling negative energy that suppresses the life force of any living creature it strikes. You must make a ranged touch attack to hit. If the attack succeeds, the subject gains 1d4 negative levels.[lf][lf]If the subject has at least as many negative levels as HD, it dies. Each negative level gives a creature a -1 penalty on attack rolls, saving throws, skill checks, ability checks, and effective level (for determining the power, duration, DC, and other details of spells or special abilities).[lf][lf]Additionally, a spellcaster loses one spell or spell slot from his or her highest available level. Negative levels stack.[lf][lf]Assuming the subject survives, it regains lost levels after a number of hours equal to your caster level (maximum 15 hours). Usually, negative levels have a chance of permanently draining the victims levels, but the negative levels from enervation don't last long enough to do so.[lf][lf]An undead creature struck by the ray gains 1d4x5 temporary hit points for 1 hour.

Name: Enhance Familiar
Short Description: Your familiar gains a +2 modifier on saves, combat rolls, and AC for 1 hour/level.

Name: Enhance Magical Flow
Short Description: Gain a +1 enhancement bonus to spell DCs.

Name: Enhance Magical Flow, Greater
Short Description: Gain a +2 enhancement bonus to spell DCs.

Name: Enhance Wild Shape
Short Description: Your wild shape ability gains a bonus.

Name: Enhanced Shifting
Short Description: Gain bonuses depending on shifter characteristics.

Name: Enhancement Alteration
Short Description: Magic shield's enhancement bonus applies to shield bash attacks, or magic weapon's enhancement bonus applies to Two-Weapon Defense.

Name: Enlarge Person
Short Description: Humanoid creature doubles in size.
Long Descripton: This spell causes instant growth of a humanoid creature, doubling its height and multiplying its weight by 8. This increase changes the creatures size category to the next larger one. The target gains a +2 size bonus to Strength, a -2 size penalty to Dexterity (to a minimum of 1), and a -1 penalty on attack rolls and AC due to its increased size.[lf][lf]A humanoid creature whose size increases to Large has a space of 10 feet and a natural reach of 10 feet. This spell does not change the targets speed.[lf][lf]If insufficient room is available for the desired growth, the creature attains the maximum possible size and may make a Strength check (using its increased Strength) to burst any enclosures in the process. If it fails, it is constrained without harm by the materials enclosing it the spell cannot be used to crush a creature by increasing its size.[lf][lf]All equipment worn or carried by a creature is similarly enlarged by the spell. Melee and projectile weapons affected by this spell deal more damage. Other magical properties are not affected by this spell. Any enlarged item that leaves an enlarged creatures possession (including a projectile or thrown weapon) instantly returns to its normal size. This means that thrown weapons deal their normal damage, and projectiles deal damage based on the size of the weapon that fired them. Magical properties of enlarged items are not increased by this spell.[lf][lf]Multiple magical effects that increase size do not stack,.[lf][lf]Enlarge person counters and dispels reduce person.[lf][lf]Enlarge person can be made permanent with a permanency spell.

Name: Enlarge Person, Greater
Short Description: Humanoid creature doubles in size.

Name: Enlarge Person, Mass
Effect: One humanoid creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Enlarges several creatures.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like enlarge person, except that it affects multiple creatures.

Name: Enlarge Weapon
Short Description: Your weapon grows one size category.
Medium Description: Weapon grows 1 size category without penalty to wield.

Name: Enrage Animal
Short Description: Animal rages like barbarian, not fatigued.

Name: Enrage Animals
Effect: Animals within 30 ft. of each other
Short Description: Render normal animals hostile, and vicious.

Name: Ensnarement
Short Description: Augment the effectiveness of a magic circle prior to casting planar binding.

Name: Entangle
Short Description: Plants entangle everyone in 40-ft.-radius.
Long Descripton: Grasses, weeds, bushes, and even trees wrap, twist, and entwine about creatures in the area or those that enter the area, holding them fast and causing them to become entangled. The creature can break free and move half its normal speed by using a full-round action to make a DC 20 Strength check or a DC 20 Escape Artist check. A creature that succeeds on a Reflex save is not entangled but can still move at only half speed through the area. Each round on your turn, the plants once again attempt to entangle all creatures that have avoided or escaped entanglement.[lf][lf]Note: The effects of the spell may be altered somewhat, based on the nature of the entangling plants.

Name: Entangling Scarf
Short Description: A scarf entangles foe.

Name: Entangling Staff
Short Description: Swift. Quarterstaff gains improved grab and can constrict grappled foes.

Name: Enthrall
Short Description: Captivates all within 100 ft. + 10 ft./level.
Long Descripton: If you have the attention of a group of creatures, you can use this spell to hold them spellbound. To cast the spell, you must speak or sing without interruption for 1 full round. Thereafter, those affected give you their undivided attention, ignoring their surroundings. They are considered to have an attitude of friendly while under the effect of the spell. Any potentially affected creature of a race or religion unfriendly to yours gets a +4 bonus on the saving throw.[lf][lf]A creature with 4 or more HD or with a Wisdom score of 16 or higher remains aware of its surroundings and has an attitude of indifferent. It gains a new saving throw if it witnesses actions that it opposes.[lf][lf]The effect lasts as long as you speak or sing, to a maximum of 1 hour. Those enthralled by your words take no action while you speak or sing and for 1d3 rounds thereafter while they discuss the topic or performance. Those entering the area during the performance must also successfully save or become enthralled. The speech ends (but the 1d3-round delay still applies) if you lose concentration or do anything other than speak or sing.[lf][lf]If those not enthralled have unfriendly or hostile attitudes toward you, they can collectively make a Charisma check to try to end the spell by jeering and heckling. For this check, use the Charisma bonus of the creature with the highest Charisma in the group; others may make Charisma checks to assist. The heckling ends the spell if this check result beats your Charisma check result. Only one such challenge is allowed per use of the spell.[lf][lf]If any member of the audience is attacked or subjected to some other overtly hostile act, the spell ends and the previously enthralled members become immediately unfriendly toward you. Each creature with 4 or more HD or with a Wisdom score of 16 or higher becomes hostile.

Name: Entice Gift
Short Description: Subject gives caster what its holding.

Name: Entomb
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Captures subjects in blocks of ice, suffocating them.

Name: Entropic Shield
Short Description: Ranged attacks against you have 20% miss chance.
Long Descripton: A magical field appears around you, glowing with a chaotic blast of multicolored hues. This field deflects incoming arrows, rays, and other ranged attacks. Each ranged attack directed at you for which the attacker must make an attack roll has a 20% miss chance (similar to the effects of concealment). Other attacks that simply work at a distance are not affected.

Name: Enveloping Cocoon
Effect: Cocoon of force around one Large or smaller creature
Short Description: Entraps target creature and denies save for attached spell.

Name: Eradicate Earth
Short Description: Deals 1d8 points of damage/level to earth creatures (max 10d8).

Name: Erase
Short Description: Mundane or magical writing vanishes.
Long Descripton: Erase removes writings of either magical or mundane nature from a scroll or from one or two pages of paper, parchment, or similar surfaces. With this spell, you can remove explosive runes, a glyph of warding, a sepia snake sigil, or an arcane mark, but not illusory script or a symbol spell. Nonmagical writing is automatically erased if you touch it and no one else is holding it. Otherwise, the chance of erasing nonmagical writing is 90%.[lf][lf]Magic writing must be touched to be erased, and you also must succeed on a caster level check (1d20 + caster level) against DC 15. (A natural 1 or 2 is always a failure on this check.) If you fail to erase explosive runes, a glyph of warding, or a sepia snake sigil, you accidentally activate that writing instead.

Name: Erupt
Effect: Burst with a radius of 100 ft./level
Short Description: Molten lava burns everthing in area of effect.
Medium Description: Lava causes 10/level fire damage ignites fires. Fortitude save halves damage and avoids catching fire.

Name: Essence Of The Dragon
Short Description: Confer the dragon type on touched creature.

Name: Essence Of The Raptor
Short Description: Base speed becomes 60 feet, gain skill bonuses and scent.

Name: Estanna's Stew
Effect: Fills pot with healing stew (1 serving/2 levels)
Short Description: Conjures stew that heals 1d6+1 per serving.

Name: Eternity of Torture
Short Description: Target is rendered helpless, ageless, and has all ability scores except for Con drop to 0.

Name: Ether Blast
Effect: 25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels spherical emanation centered on you
Short Description: Blast Ethereal creatures with an ethereal tornado.

Name: Ethereal Breath
Short Description: Your breath weapon manifests on the Ethereal Plane.

Name: Ethereal Chamber
Short Description: Crystalline force chamber is incapable of planar travel away from the Ethereal Plane and normal movement.

Name: Ethereal Jaunt
Short Description: You become ethereal for 1 round/level.
Long Descripton: You become ethereal, along with your equipment. For the duration of the spell, you are in a place called the Ethereal Plane, which overlaps the normal, physical, Material Plane. When the spell expires, you return to material existence.[lf][lf]An ethereal creature is invisible, insubstantial, and capable of moving in any direction, even up or down, albeit at half normal speed. As an insubstantial creature, you can move through solid objects, including living creatures. An ethereal creature can see and hear on the Material Plane, but everything looks gray and ephemeral. Sight and hearing onto the Material Plane are limited to 60 feet.[lf][lf]Force effects and abjurations affect an ephemeral creature normally. Their effects extend onto the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, but not vice versa. An ethereal creature can't attack material creatures, and spells you cast while ethereal affect only other ethereal things. Certain material creatures or objects have attacks or effects that work on the Ethereal Plane.[lf][lf]Treat other ethereal creatures and ethereal objects as if they were material. [lf][lf]If you end the spell and become material while inside a material object (such as a solid wall), you are shunted off to the nearest open space and take 1d6 points of damage per 5 feet that you so travel.

Name: Ethereal Mount
Effect: One quasi-real mount, plus one additional mount/2 levels
Short Description: Creates ethereal mounts.

Name: Etherealness
Effect: You and one other touched creature per three levels
Short Description: Travel to Ethereal Plane with companions.
Long Descripton: You and other willing creatures joined by linked hands become ethereal, along with your equipment. Besides yourself, you can bring one creature per three caster levels to the Ethereal Plane. Once ethereal, the subjects need not stay together.  For the duration of the spell, you are in a place called the Ethereal Plane, which overlaps the normal, physical, Material Plane. When the spell expires, you all return to material existence.[lf][lf]An ethereal creature is invisible, insubstantial, and capable of moving in any direction, even up or down, albeit at half normal speed. As an insubstantial creature, you can move through solid objects, including living creatures. An ethereal creature can see and hear on the Material Plane, but everything looks gray and ephemeral. Sight and hearing onto the Material Plane are limited to 60 feet.[lf][lf]Force effects and abjurations affect an ethereal creature normally. Their effects extend onto the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, but not vice versa. An ethereal creature cant attack material creatures, and spells you cast while ethereal affect only other ethereal things. Certain material creatures or objects have attacks or effects that work on the Ethereal Plane.[lf][lf]Treat other ethereal creatures and ethereal objects as if they were material. [lf][lf]If you end the spell and become material while inside a material object (such as a solid wall), you are shunted off to the nearest open space and take 1d6 points of damage per 5 feet that you so travel.

Name: Etherealness, Swift
Short Description: Subject momentarily becomes ethereal.
Medium Description: Subject becomes ethereal, takes 1d6 damage per 5' shunted movement if rematerialized in occupied space.

Name: Evacuation Rune
Short Description: Create invisible rune that you can teleport to as swift action.

Name: Ever Armed
Short Description: A rapier and dueling cloak appear in your hands.

Name: Evergreen
Short Description: Magical heat warms plant life, healing 1d8 damage +1/level (max. +10) and granting immunity to cold.

Name: Evil Eye
Short Description: Subject takes -4 penalty on attacks, saves, and checks.

Name: Evil Glare
Short Description: Paralyze creature with your glare.

Name: Evil Weather
Short Description: Caster conjures one type of evil weather.

Name: Exacting Shot
Short Description: Enhances ranged weapons critical on threat and negates concealment miss chances.

Name: Exaction
Effect: One elemental or outsider caught in a planar binding
Short Description: Make a sacrifice to gain bonuses when trying to compel service from a creature in a planar binding.

Name: Exalted Fury
Short Description: All creatures within 40 ft. take damage equal to 50 + your current hp, and you die.

Name: Exalted Raiment
Short Description: Wearer gains +1 sacred bonus to AC per five caster levels, damage reduction 10/evil, SR 5 + caster level, and ability damage from spell-casting.

Name: Excavate
Short Description: Creates a permanent passage in earth and walls.

Name: Execration
Short Description: Target takes a -2 penalty on saves and must take the lower of two rolls on one attack.
Medium Description: Target takes a -2 penalty on saves and must take  the lower of two rolls on one attack.

Name: Expeditious Excavation
Saving Throw: None or Reflex negates; see text
Short Description: Clear pathway of loose stone, sand, gravel, or other lightweight rubble into a tunnel.

Name: Expeditious Retreat
Short Description: Your speed increases by 30 ft.
Long Descripton: This spell increases your base land speed by 30 feet. (This adjustment is treated as an enhancement bonus.) There is no effect on other modes of movement, such as burrow, climb, fly, or swim. As with any effect that increases your speed, this spell affects your jumping distance (see the Jump skill).

Name: Expeditious Retreat, Swift
Short Description: Your speed increases by 30 ft. for 1 round (swift).

Name: Explosive Cascade
Effect: One 5-ft.-square/level, all of which must be connected in one continuous path (S)
Short Description: Bouncing flame ball deals 1d6/level fire damage.

Name: Explosive Runes
Effect: One touched object weighing no more than 10 lb.
Short Description: Deals 6d6 damage when read.
Medium Description: Deals 6d6 force damage when read.
Long Descripton: You trace these mystic runes upon a book, map, scroll, or similar object bearing written information. The runes detonate when read, dealing 6d6 points of force damage. Anyone next to the runes (close enough to read them) takes the full damage with no saving throw; any other creature within 10 feet of the runes is entitled to a Reflex save for half damage. The object on which the runes were written also takes full damage (no saving throw).[lf][lf]You and any characters you specifically instruct can read the protected writing without triggering the runes. Likewise, you can remove the runes whenever desired. Another creature can remove them with a successful dispel magic or erase spell, but attempting to dispel or erase the runes and failing to do so triggers the explosion.[lf][lf]Note: Magic traps such as explosive runes are hard to detect and disable. A rogue (only) can use the Search skill to find the runes and Disable Device to thwart them. The DC in each case is 25 + spell level, or 28 for explosive runes.

Name: Expose The Dead
Short Description: Gain insight bonuses to locate undead or when investigating a corpse.

Name: Extend Shifting
Short Description: Extend duration of shifting ability by 4 rounds.

Name: Extend Tentacles
Short Description: +5 ft. to reach of tentacle attack; also lengthens medusa's snakes.

Name: Extract Drug
Short Description: Creates drug from inanimate object.

Name: Extract Water Elemental
Short Description: Pulls water from victim, forms water elemental.

Name: Eye of Power
Short Description: As arcane eye, but you can cast spells of 3rd level or lower through it.

Name: Eye of Stone
Short Description: Invisible floating eye moves 30 ft./round, can pass through stone.

Name: Eye of the Beholder
Short Description: Your eye gains random beholder ray.

Name: Eye of the Hurricane
Effect: 40-ft.-radius emanation centered on you, with 10-ft.-radius quiet area centered on you
Short Description: Cause a hurricane to spring forth around you.  It prevents ranged attacks, knocks people back and others prone.

Name: Eyebite
Short Description: Target becomes panicked, sickened, and comatose.
Long Descripton: Each round, you may target a single living creature, striking it with waves of evil power. Depending on the targets HD, this attack has as many as three effects.    [lf]HDEffect  [lf]10 or moreSickened  [lf]5-9Panicked, sickened  [lf]4 or lessComatose, panicked, sickened    [lf]The effects are cumulative and concurrent.  [lf]Sickened: Sudden pain and fever sweeps over the subjects body. A sickened creature takes a -2 penalty on attack rolls, weapon damage rolls, saving throws, skill checks, and ability checks. A creature affected by this spell remains sickened for 10 minutes per caster level. The effects cannot be negated by a remove disease or heal spell, but a remove curse is effective.  [lf]Panicked: The subject becomes panicked for 1d4 rounds. Even after the panic ends, the creature remains shaken for 10 minutes per caster level, and it automatically becomes panicked again if it comes within sight of you during that time. This is a fear effect.  [lf]Comatose: The subject falls into a catatonic coma for 10 minutes per caster level. During this time, it cannot be awakened by any means short of dispelling the effect. This is not a sleep effect, and thus elves are not immune to it.  [lf]The spell lasts for 1 round per three caster levels. You must spend a move action each round after the first to target a foe.

Name: Eyes of the Avoral
Short Description: Subject gians +8 racial bonus on Spot checks.

Name: Eyes of the King
Short Description: Summon fiendish dire bats.

Name: Eyes of the Zombie
Short Description: You see through a zombie's eyes.

Name: Fabricate
Effect: Up to 10 cu. ft./level; see text
Short Description: Transforms raw materials into finished items.
Long Descripton: You convert material of one sort into a product that is of the same material. Creatures or magic items cannot be created or transmuted by the fabricate spell. The quality of items made by this spell is commensurate with the quality of material used as the basis for the new fabrication. If you work with a mineral, the target is reduced to 1 cubic foot per level instead of 10 cubic feet.[lf][lf]You must make an appropriate Craft check to fabricate articles requiring a high degree of craftsmanship.[lf][lf]Casting requires 1 round per 10 cubic feet (or 1 cubic foot) of material to be affected by the spell.

Name: Faerie Fire
Effect: Creatures and objects within a 5-ft.-radius burst
Short Description: Outlines subjects with light, canceling blur, concealment, and the like.
Long Descripton: A pale glow surrounds and outlines the subjects. Outlined subjects shed light as candles. Outlined creatures do not benefit from the concealment normally provided by darkness (though a 2nd-level or higher magical darkness effect functions normally), blur, displacement, invisibility, or similar effects. The light is too dim to have any special effect on undead or dark-dwelling creatures vulnerable to light. The faerie fire can be blue, green, or violet, according to your choice at the time of casting. The faerie fire does not cause any harm to the objects or creatures thus outlined.

Name: Faerinaal's Hymn
Short Description: Up to one creature/level cannot take attacks of opportunity.

Name: Faith Healing
Short Description: Cures 8 +1/level damage (max +5) to worshiper of your patron.

Name: Faith Healing Wand
Short Description: Transform the wand into a wand of faith healing.

Name: False Gravity
Short Description: Travel on a solid surface as if that surface had its own gravity.

Name: False Life
Duration: 1 hour/level or until discharged; see text
Short Description: Gain 1d10 temporary hp +1/level (max +10).
Long Descripton: You harness the power of unlife to grant yourself a limited ability to avoid death. While this spell is in effect, you gain temporary hit points equal to 1d10 +1 per caster level (maximum +10).

Name: False Sending
Short Description: As sending, except caster imitates someone else.

Name: False Vigor
Short Description: Subject gains 1 temporary hitpoint and +1 morale bonus to attack until he attacks or is damaged.
Long Descripton: The target is imbued with a false sense of vitality and courage. He gains 1 temporary hit point and a +1 morale bonus to attack rolls. The spell ends if the target attacks or if he takes any damage (the attack bonus applies to the target's attack roll that causes the spell to end, the temporary hit point works normally against the damage that ends the spell).

Name: False Vision
Short Description: Fools scrying with an illusion.
Long Descripton: Any divination (scrying) spell used to view anything within the area of this spell instead receives a false image (as the major image spell), as defined by you at the time of casting. As long as the duration lasts, you can concentrate to change the image as desired. While you aren't concentrating, the image remains static.

Name: Familiar Pocket
Effect: One container or garment with a pocket
Short Description: Creates an extradimensional hiding place for your familiar.

Name: Fanfare
Short Description: Stuns and deafens targets; deals 4d6 damage to creatures and 2d6 damage to objects.
Medium Description: Stuns and deafens targets; deals 4d6 sonic damage to creatures and 2d6 damage to objects.

Name: Fang Trap
Effect: Object touched or area up to 5 sq. ft./level
Short Description: Inscription bites those who pass it.

Name: Fangs of the Vampire King
Short Description: Grow vampire fangs.

Name: Fantastic Machine
Short Description: Creates many-armed machine that functions as Large animated object.

Name: Fantastic Machine, Greater
Short Description: As fantastic machine, but creates a more powerful construct.

Name: Fatal Flame
Effect: One living creature with 1 or more HD
Short Description: Target's body bursts into flame upon its death.
Medium Description: Failing a Will save upon death, target's body deals fire damage (lesser of 2X target HD or your CL, max 20 points) to adjacent creatures (Reflex 1/2).

Name: Favor of the Martyr
Short Description: Subject gains Endurance plus immunity to nonlethal damage, charm and compulsion effects, pain attacks, and other adverse conditions, subject can function at -1 to -9 hp.

Name: Favor of Yathaghera
Short Description: Grant subject equine creature a fly speed 100 ft (average).

Name: Favorable Sacrifice
Short Description: Subject gains better protection the more gems you sacrifice.

Name: Favorable Wind
Short Description: Produces a strong wind that lasts 10 min./level.

Name: Fear
Short Description: Subjects within cone flee for 1 round/level.
Long Descripton: An invisible cone of terror causes each living creature in the area to become panicked unless it succeeds on a Will save. If cornered, a panicked creature begins cowering. If the Will save succeeds, the creature is shaken for 1 round.

Name: Fearsome Grapple
Short Description: You gain 2 additional arms that only improve your grapple checks.

Name: Feast of Champions
Short Description: Food for one creature/level heals and grants comprenensive bonuses.

Name: Feather Fall
Effect: One Medium or smaller freefalling object or creature/level, no two of which may be more than 20 ft. apart
Short Description: Objects or creatures fall slowly.
Long Descripton: The affected creatures or objects fall slowly. Feather fall instantly changes the rate at which the targets fall to a mere 60 feet per round (equivalent to the end of a fall from a few feet), and the subjects take no damage upon landing while the spell is in effect. However, when the spell duration expires, a normal rate of falling resumes.[lf][lf]The spell affects one or more Medium or smaller creatures (including gear and carried objects up to each creatures maximum load) or objects, or the equivalent in larger creatures: A Large creature or object counts as two Medium creatures or objects, a Huge creature or object counts as two Large creatures or objects, and so forth.[lf][lf]You can cast this spell with an instant utterance, quickly enough to save yourself if you unexpectedly fall. Casting the spell is a free action, like casting a quickened spell, and it counts toward the normal limit of one quickened spell per round. You may even cast this spell when it isn't your turn.[lf][lf]This spell has no special effect on ranged weapons unless they are falling quite a distance. If the spell is cast on a falling item the object does half normal damage based on its weight, with no bonus for the height of the drop.[lf][lf]Feather fall works only upon free-falling objects. It does not affect a sword blow or a charging or flying creature.

Name: Feeblemind
Short Description: Subjects Int and Cha drop to 1.
Long Descripton: If the target creature fails a Will saving throw, its Intelligence and Charisma scores each drop to 1. The affected creature is unable to use Intelligence- or Charisma-based skills, cast spells, understand language, or communicate coherently. Still, it knows who its friends are and can follow them and even protect them. The subject remains in this state until a heal, limited wish, miracle, or wish spell is used to cancel the effect of the feeblemind. A creature that can cast arcane spells, such as a sorcerer or a wizard, takes a -4 penalty on its saving throw.

Name: Feign Death
Effect: One willing, living creature whose level or Hit Dice do not exceed the caster's
Short Description: Makes one willing, living creature appear dead.

Name: Fell the Greatest Foe
Short Description: Deal extra damage to creatures larger than you.
Medium Description: Deal extra damage to creatures, 1d6 per size category larger than you.

Name: Fengut
Short Description: Subject is nauseated.

Name: Fetid Breath
Short Description: This spell functions like stinking cloud, except as noted above and subjects are nauseated for 1d4+1 rounds.

Name: Fey Ring
Effect: One called Medium or smaller fey
Short Description: Call a Fey creature that may or may not help you.

Name: Field of Ghouls
Short Description: Transform dying creatures into ghouls.

Name: Field Of Icy Razors
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which are more than 60 ft. apart
Short Description: Creatures in area take normal and cold damage, might be slowed.

Name: Fiendform
Short Description: As Alter Self, except you can gain the form and powers of an evil outsider.

Name: Fiendish Clarity
Short Description: You see in even magical darkness, see invisible up to 60 feet, and can detect good.

Name: Fiendish Quickening
Short Description: Your ability to teleport is quickened.

Name: Fierce Pride of the Beastlands
Effect: Two or more summoned creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Summon celestial lions and celestial dire lions to follow you

Name: Fiery Eyes
Short Description: Laser eyes cause fires after focusing for a full round action.

Name: Filter
Short Description: Makes subject resistant to inhaled toxins.

Name: Fimbulwinter
Short Description: Creates winter weather for miles around you that lasts for months.

Name: Find Temple
Effect: Circle centered on you, with a radius of 10 miles + 1 mile/level
Short Description: You know direction of your deity's nearest temple.

Name: Find the Gap
Short Description: Your attacks ignore armor and natural armor.

Name: Find the Path
Short Description: Shows most direct way to a location.
Long Descripton: The recipient of this spell can find the shortest, most direct physical route to a specified destination, be it the way into or out of a locale. The locale can be outdoors, underground, or even inside a maze spell. Find the path works with respect to locations, not objects or creatures at a locale. The location must be on the same plane as you are at the time of casting.[lf][lf]The spell enables the subject to sense the correct direction that will eventually lead it to its destination, indicating at appropriate times the exact path to follow or physical actions to take. For example, the spell enables the subject to sense trip wires or the proper word to bypass a glyph of warding. The spell ends when the destination is reached or the duration expires, whichever comes first. Find the path can be used to remove the subject and its companions from the effect of a maze spell in a single round.[lf][lf]This divination is keyed to the recipient, not its companions, and its effect does not predict or allow for the actions of creatures (including guardians).

Name: Find Traps
Short Description: Notice traps as a rogue does.
Long Descripton: You gain intuitive insight into the workings of traps. You can use the Search skill to detect traps just as a rogue can. In addition, you gain an insight bonus equal to one-half your caster level (maximum +10) on Search checks made to find traps while the spell is in effect.[lf][lf]Note that find traps grants no ability to disable the traps that you may find.

Name: Finding the Center
Short Description: You do not have to concentrate on a previous spell to maintain concentration on it.

Name: Fine-Tuning
Short Description: Makes an instrument masterwork; +2 on Perform checks.

Name: Finger of Death
Short Description: Kills one subject.
Long Descripton: You can slay any one living creature within range. The target is entitled to a Fortitude saving throw to survive the attack. If the save is successful, the creature instead takes 3d6 points of damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +25).[lf][lf]The subject might die from damage even if it succeeds on its saving throw.

Name: Fins to Feet
Short Description: Transforms tails and fins into legs and feet.

Name: Fire Breath
Short Description: You can breath a ray of fire dealing 1d8/2 levels (max 10d8).

Name: Fire Dance
Effect: You and up to one ally per 3 caster levels, all of whom must be within 40 ft. of you
Short Description: Perform (dance) DC 15 + 2/round, gain fire immunity, cast off light.  End dance with ray of heat or personal healing 1d6/level.  Failure results in fatigue and no ray of heat or healing.

Name: Fire Flash
Short Description: Energy missile deals 1d3 fire damage.
Long Descripton: You cause a tiny flame to appear in your hand, which does not harm you or your equipment. It immediately leaps to a target of your choice within range, requiring a successful ranged touch attack. The spell deals 1d3 fire damage, but cannot set a target on fire. It momentarily provides light equal to a candle.

Name: Fire Hand
Short Description: Touch attack deals 1d6 fire damage.
Long Descripton: Your hand is imbued with magical power that causes it to burst into flame when touched to a creature, requiring a successful melee touch attack. The spell deals 1d6 fire damage.

Name: Fire In The Blood
Short Description: Your blood becomes a potent corrosive that burns attackers.
Medium Description: Your blood deals a cumulative 1d6 points of damage per attack upon your attacker (up to 5d6 on 5th attack).

Name: Fire Seeds
Effect: Up to four touched acorns or up to eight touched holly berries
Saving Throw: None or Reflex half; see text
Short Description: Acorns and berries become grenades and bombs.
Long Descripton: Depending on the version of fire seeds you choose, you turn acorns into splash weapons that you or another character can throw, or you turn holly berries into bombs that you can detonate on command.[lf][lf]Acorn Grenades: As many as four acorns turn into special splash weapons that can be hurled as far as 100 feet. A ranged touch attack roll is required to strike the intended target. Together, the acorns are capable of dealing 1d6 points of fire damage per caster level (maximum 20d6), divided up among the acorns as you wish.[lf][lf]Each acorn explodes upon striking any hard surface. In addition to its regular fire damage, it deals 1 point of splash damage per die, and it ignites any combustible materials within 10 feet. A creature within this area that makes a successful Reflex saving throw takes only half damage; a creature struck directly is not allowed a saving throw.[lf][lf]Holly Berry Bombs: You turn as many as eight holly berries into special bombs. The holly berries are usually placed by hand, since they are too light to make effective thrown weapons (they can be tossed only 5 feet). If you are within 200 feet and speak a word of command, each berry instantly bursts into flame, causing 1d8 points of fire damage +1 point per caster level to every creature in a 5-foot radius burst and igniting any combustible materials within 5 feet. A creature in the area that makes a successful Reflex saving throw takes only half damage.

Name: Fire Shield
Short Description: Creatures attacking you take fire damage; you're protected from heat or cold.
Medium Description: Creatures attacking you take 1d6 +1/level (max +15) cold damage if the shield protects from fire, fire damage if it protects from cold.
Long Descripton: This spell wreathes you in flame and causes damage to each creature that attacks you in melee. The flames also protect you from either cold-based or fire-based attacks (your choice).[lf][lf]Any creature striking you with its body or a handheld weapon deals normal damage, but at the same time the attacker takes 1d6 points of damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +15). This damage is either cold damage (if the shield protects against fire-based attacks) or fire damage (if the shield protects against cold-based attacks). If the attacker has spell resistance, it applies to this effect. Creatures wielding weapons with exceptional reach are not subject to this damage if they attack you.[lf][lf]When casting this spell, you appear to immolate yourself, but the flames are thin and wispy, giving off light equal to only half the illumination of a normal torch (10 feet). The color of the flames is determined randomly (50% chance of either color) blue or green if the chill shield is cast, violet or blue if the warm shield is employed. The special powers of each version are as follows.[lf][lf]Warm Shield: The flames are warm to the touch. You take only half damage from cold-based attacks. If such an attack allows a Reflex save for half damage, you take no damage on a successful save.[lf][lf]Chill Shield: The flames are cool to the touch. You take only half damage from fire-based attacks. If such an attack allows a Reflex save for half damage, you take no damage on a successful save.

Name: Fire Shield, Mass
Short Description: Creatures attacking allies take damage; allies are protected from fire or cold.
Medium Description: Creatures attacking allies take 1d6 +1/level (max +15) cold damage if shield protects allies from fire, fire damage if it protects allies from cold.

Name: Fire Shuriken
Short Description: Evoke 1 fire shuriken/3 caster levels (max 6) each deal 3d6 fire damage.
Medium Description: Evoke 1 shuriken/3 caster levels (max 6); each deal 3d6 fire damage.

Name: Fire Spiders
Effect: Fiery spiders that cover a 10-ft.-radius spread
Short Description: Swarm of Fine fire elementals attacks targets.

Name: Fire Storm
Short Description: Deals 1d6/level fire damage.
Long Descripton: When a fire storm spell is cast, the whole area is shot through with sheets of roaring flame. The raging flames do not harm natural vegetation, ground cover, and any plant creatures in the area that you wish to exclude from damage. Any other creature within the area takes 1d6 points of fire damage per caster level (maximum 20d6).

Name: Fire Stride
Short Description: Multiple-use dimension door that works only through large fires.

Name: Fire Trap
Short Description: Opened object deals 1d4 +1/level damage.
Medium Description: Opened object deals 1d4 +1/level (max +20) fire damage.
Long Descripton: Fire trap creates a fiery explosion when an intruder opens the item that the trap protects.
