A fire trap can ward any object that can be opened and closed.[lf][lf]When casting fire trap, you select a point on the object as the spells center. When someone other than you opens the object, a fiery explosion fills the area within a 5-foot radius around the spells center. The flames deal 1d4 points of fire damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +20). The item protected by the trap is not harmed by this explosion.[lf][lf]A fire trapped item cannot have a second closure or warding spell placed on it.[lf][lf]A knock spell does not bypass a fire trap.  An unsuccessful dispel magic spell does not detonate the spell.[lf][lf]Underwater, this ward deals half damage and creates a large cloud of steam.[lf][lf]You can use the fire trapped object without discharging it, as can any individual to whom the object was specifically attuned when cast. Attuning a fire trapped object to an individual usually involves setting a password that you can share with friends.[lf][lf]Note: Magic traps such as fire trap are hard to detect and disable. A rogue (only) can use the Search skill to find a fire trap and Disable Device to thwart it. The DC in each case is 25 + spell level (DC 27 for a druids fire trap or DC 29 for the arcane version).

Name: Fire Wings
Short Description: Your arms become wings that enable flight, deal 2d6 fire damage.

Name: Fireball
Short Description: 1d6 damage per level, 20-ft. radius.
Medium Description: 1d6/level (max 10d6) fire damage in 20-ft. radius.
Long Descripton: A fireball spell is an explosion of flame that detonates with a low roar and deals 1d6 points of fire damage per caster level (maximum 10d6) to every creature within the area. Unattended objects also take this damage. The explosion creates almost no pressure.[lf][lf]You point your finger and determine the range (distance and height) at which the fireball is to burst. A glowing, pea-sized bead streaks from the pointing digit and, unless it impacts upon a material body or solid barrier prior to attaining the prescribed range, blossoms into the fireball at that point. (An early impact results in an early detonation.) If you attempt to send the bead through a narrow passage, such as through an arrow slit, you must hit the opening with a ranged touch attack, or else the bead strikes the barrier and detonates prematurely.[lf][lf]The fireball sets fire to combustibles and damages objects in the area. It can melt metals with low melting points, such as lead, gold, copper, silver, and bronze. If the damage caused to an interposing barrier shatters or breaks through it, the fireball may continue beyond the barrier if the area permits; otherwise it stops at the barrier just as any other spell effect does.

Name: Firebrand
Short Description: One 5-ft. burst/level deals 1d6 fire/level plus burning for 1 round.

Name: Fireburst
Effect: Burst of fire extending 10 ft. from you
Short Description: Adjacent subjects take 1d8/level fire damage.
Medium Description: Adjacent subjects take 1d8/level (max 5d8) fire damage.

Name: Fireburst, Greater
Effect: Burst of fire extending 15 ft. from you
Short Description: Subjects within 15 ft. take 1d10/level fire damage.
Medium Description: Subjects within 15 ft. take 1d10/level (max 15d10) fire damage.

Name: Fires of Purity
Short Description: Target bursts into magical flame, becoming a dangerous weapon.

Name: Fireward
Short Description: As quench, but also suppresses magical fire effects in affected area.

Name: Fist of Stone
Short Description: Your fist gains +6 enhancement bonus to strength for attacks, grapples, breaking, or crushing things.  You gain a slam attack.

Name: Flame Arrow
Effect: Fifty projectiles, all of which must be in contact with each other at the time of casting
Short Description: Arrows deal +1d6 fire damage.
Long Descripton: You turn ammunition (such as arrows, bolts, shuriken, and stones) into fiery projectiles. Each piece of ammunition deals an extra 1d6 points of fire damage to any target it hits. A flaming projectile can easily ignite a flammable object or structure, but it wont ignite a creature it strikes.

Name: Flame Blade
Short Description: Touch attack deals 1d8 +1/two levels damage.
Medium Description: Touch attack deals 1d8 +1/two levels (max +10) fire damage.
Long Descripton: A 3-foot-long, blazing beam of red-hot fire springs forth from your hand. You wield this bladelike beam as if it were a scimitar. Attacks with the flame blade are melee touch attacks. The blade deals 1d8 points of fire damage +1 point per two caster levels (maximum +10). Since the blade is immaterial, your Strength modifier does not apply to the damage. A flame blade can ignite combustible materials such as parchment, straw, dry sticks, and cloth.[lf][lf]The spell does not function underwater.

Name: Flame Dagger
Short Description: As flame blade, but 1d4 +1/level.

Name: Flame of Faith
Short Description: Gives weapon the flaming burst quality.

Name: Flame Strike
Short Description: Smite foes with divine fire (1d6/level damage).
Medium Description: Smite foes with 1d6/level (max 15d6) damage, half fire damage and half divine damage.
Long Descripton: A flame strike produces a vertical column of divine fire roaring downward. The spell deals 1d6 points of damage per caster level (maximum 15d6). Half the damage is fire damage, but the other half results directly from divine power and is therefore not subject to being reduced by resistance to fire-based attacks.

Name: Flame Whips
Short Description: Your forelimbs deal 6d6 fire damage.
Medium Description: Your forelimbs deal 6d6 fire damage.

Name: Flaming Corrosion
Short Description: See Text
Medium Description: Deal 1d6/level (max 10d6) acid and fire (half each) damage in a cone.

Name: Flaming Sphere
Short Description: Creates rolling ball of fire, 2d6 damage, lasts 1 round/level.
Medium Description: Creates rolling ball of 2d6 fire damage, lasts 1 round/level.
Long Descripton: A burning globe of fire rolls in whichever direction you point and burns those it strikes. It moves 30 feet per round. As part of this movement, it can ascend or jump up to 30 feet to strike a target. If it enters a space with a creature, it stops moving for the round and deals 2d6 points of fire damage to that creature, though a successful Reflex save negates that damage. A flaming sphere rolls over barriers less than 4 feet tall. It ignites flammable substances it touches and illuminates the same area as a torch would.[lf][lf]The sphere moves as long as you actively direct it (a move action for you); otherwise, it merely stays at rest and burns. It can be extinguished by any means that would put out a normal fire of its size. The surface of the sphere has a spongy, yielding consistency and so does not cause damage except by its flame. It cannot push aside unwilling creatures or batter down large obstacles. A flaming sphere winks out if it exceeds the spells range.

Name: Flare
Short Description: Dazzles one creature (-1 on attack rolls).
Long Descripton: This cantrip creates a burst of light. If you cause the light to burst directly in front of a single creature, that creature is dazzled for 1 minute unless it makes a successful Fortitude save. Sightless creatures, as well as creatures already dazzled, are not affected by flare.

Name: Flash-Freeze
Short Description: Earth, stone, and water become frozen.

Name: Flashburst
Short Description: Blind or dazzle creatures within area.

Name: Flashflood
Short Description: Wave of water smashes everything in its path and floods area.

Name: Flaywind Burst
Short Description: Cone blows away and knocks down smaller creatures and deals 1d6 damage/level.
Medium Description: Cone blows away and knocks down smaller creatures and deals 1d6 damage/level (max 10d6).

Name: Fleeting Fame
Short Description: Gives you a +2 bonus on Bluff, Diplomacy, and Intimidate checks.

Name: Flensing
Short Description: Trauma deals 2d6 damage plus 1d6 Cha and Con damage.

Name: Flesh Armor
Short Description: Caster gains DR 5/magic.

Name: Flesh Ripper
Short Description: Black claw deals 1d8 damage/level and critical hits deal bleeding wounds.
Medium Description: Black claw deals 1d8/level (max 10d8) damage; critical hits deal 1 pt/round until healed.

Name: Flesh to Ice
Short Description: Turns subject into statue of ice.

Name: Flesh to Salt
Short Description: Turns creature into a statue of salt.

Name: Flesh to Salt, Mass
Effect: One or more creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft.apart
Short Description: Turns several creatures into statues of salt.

Name: Flesh to Stone
Short Description: Turns subject creature into statue.
Long Descripton: The subject, along with all its carried gear, turns into a mindless, inert statue. If the statue resulting from this spell is broken or damaged, the subject (if ever returned to its original state) has similar damage or deformities. The creature is not dead, but it does not seem to be alive either when viewed with spells such as deathwatch.[lf][lf]Only creatures made of flesh are affected by this spell.

Name: Fleshshiver
Short Description: Target is stunned for 1 round, takes 1d6/level damage, and is nauseated for 1d4+2 rounds.
Medium Description: Target is stunned for 1 round, takes 1d6/level (max 15d6) damage; nauseated for 1d4+2 rounds.

Name: Flight of the Dragon
Short Description: You grow dragon wings.

Name: Float
Effect: One Large or smaller creature or object
Short Description: Subject becomes buoyant.

Name: Float of Livre d'Aquatha
Short Description: Makes a willing creature or object buoyant.

Name: Floating Disk
Short Description: Creates 3-ft.-diameter horizontal disk that holds 100 lb./level.
Long Descripton: You create a slightly concave, circular plane of force that follows you about and carries loads for you. The disk is 3 feet in diameter and 1 inch deep at its center. It can hold 100 pounds of weight per caster level. (If used to transport a liquid, its capacity is 2 gallons.) The disk floats approximately 3 feet above the ground at all times and remains level. It floats along horizontally within spell range and will accompany you at a rate of no more than your normal speed each round. If not otherwise directed, it maintains a constant interval of 5 feet between itself and you. The disk winks out of existence when the spell duration expires. The disk also winks out if you move beyond range or try to take the disk more than 3 feet away from the surface beneath it. When the disk winks out, whatever it was supporting falls to the surface beneath it.

Name: Floating Disk, Greater
Short Description: As floating disk, but can move independently of the caster.

Name: Flowsight
Short Description: You can scry creatures in contact with a body of water.

Name: Fly
Short Description: Subject gains a fly speed of 60 ft.
Long Descripton: The subject can fly at a speed of 60 feet (or 40 feet if it wears medium or heavy armor, or if it carries a medium or heavy load). It can ascend at half speed and descend at double speed, and its maneuverability is good. Using a fly spell requires only as much concentration as walking, so the subject can attack or cast spells normally. The subject of a fly spell can charge but not run, and it cannot carry aloft more weight than its maximum load, plus any armor it wears.[lf][lf]Should the spell duration expire while the subject is still aloft, the magic fails slowly. The subject floats downward 60 feet per round for 1d6 rounds. If it reaches the ground in that amount of time, it lands safely. If not, it falls the rest of the distance, taking 1d6 points of damage per 10 feet of fall. Since dispelling a spell effectively ends it, the subject also descends in this way if the fly spell is dispelled, but not if it is negated by an antimagic field.

Name: Fly, Mass
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: As fly, except this spell confers the power of flight upon all targeted creatures.

Name: Fly, Swift
Short Description: This spell functions like fly except for 1 round (swift).

Name: Focus Touchstone Energy
Short Description: Convert unused touchstone abilities into temporary hit points.

Name: Focusing Chant
Short Description: Improves concentration; +1 on attack rolls or selected checks.

Name: Foebane
Short Description: Enhances a weapon against a favored enemy, giving it +5 magic enhancement and +2d6 bonus damage.

Name: Fog Cloud
Effect: Fog spreads in 20-ft. radius, 20 ft. high
Short Description: Fog obscures vision.
Medium Description: Obscure sight and darkvision beyond 5'. 20% miss chance within 5', 50% miss chance further. 11+ mph wind disperses fog in 4 rounds, 21+ mph in 1 round.
Long Descripton: A bank of fog billows out from the point you designate. The fog obscures all sight, including darkvision, beyond 5 feet. A creature within 5 feet has concealment (attacks have a 20% miss chance). Creatures farther away have total concealment (50% miss chance, and the attacker can't use sight to locate the target).[lf][lf]A moderate wind (11+ mph) disperses the fog in 4 rounds; a strong wind (21+ mph) disperses the fog in 1 round.[lf][lf]The spell does not function underwater.

Name: Foil Tracer
Short Description: Subject cannot be tracked while teleporting.

Name: Follow the Leader
Effect: Living creatures with fewer than 5 HD
Short Description: Causes 1 HD/level of creatures to follow.

Name: Footsteps Of The Divine
Short Description: Gain a new movement type and speed based on the deity chosen.
Medium Description: Gain a new movement type and speed based on the deity chosen.

Name: Forbiddance
Short Description: Blocks planar travel, damages creatures of different alignment.
Long Descripton: Forbiddance seals an area against all planar travel into or within it. This includes all teleportation spells (such as dimension door and teleport), plane shifting, astral travel, ethereal travel, and all summoning spells. Such effects simply fail automatically.[lf][lf]In addition, it damages entering creatures whose alignments are different from yours. The effect on those attempting to enter the warded area is based on their alignment relative to yours (see below). A creature inside the area when the spell is cast takes no damage unless it exits the area and attempts to re-enter, at which time it is affected as normal.[lf][lf]Alignments identical: No effect. The creature may enter the area freely (although not by planar travel).[lf][lf]Alignments different with respect to either law/chaos or good/evil: The creature takes 6d6 points of damage. A successful Will save halves the damage, and spell resistance applies.[lf][lf]Alignments different with respect to both law/chaos and good/evil: The creature takes 12d6 points of damage. A successful Will save halves the damage, and spell resistance applies.[lf][lf]At your option, the abjuration can include a password, in which case creatures of alignments different from yours can avoid the damage by speaking the password as they enter the area. You must select this option (and the password) at the time of casting.[lf][lf]Dispel magic does not dispel a forbiddance effect unless the dispeller's level is at least as high as your caster level.[lf][lf]You can't have multiple overlapping forbiddance effects. In such a case, the more recent effect stops at the boundary of the older effect.

Name: Forbidden Speech
Short Description: Subject cannot speak about a certain topic.

Name: Force Blow
Short Description: This spell description has been self-censored.
Long Descripton: This spell description has been self-censored.[lf][lf]For each 50 gp the ring is worth, the will save has a -1 penalty added to it.

Name: Force Chest
Effect: Box of force 2 ft. on a side
Short Description: Creates 2-foot-cube box of force.

Name: Force Claw
Short Description: Claw of force guards an area, making attacks of opportunity.

Name: Force Hammer
Short Description: Ray of force deals 1d4/level points of nonlethal damage
Medium Description: Ray of force deals 1d4/level (max 10d4) points of nonlethal damage; Fortitude save or dazed for one round.

Name: Force Ladder
Effect: One ladder of force up to 60 ft. long
Short Description: Creates a movable ladder of force.

Name: Force Missiles
Effect: Up to four creatures, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Missiles of force strike foes for 2d6 each (max 4 missiles)

Name: Force Shapechange
Short Description: Forces shapechangers into natural form.

Name: Forcecage
Effect: Barred cage (20-ft. cube) or windowless cell (10-ft. cube)
Short Description: Cube or cage of force imprisons all inside.
Long Descripton: This powerful spell brings into being an immobile, invisible cubical prison composed of either bars of force or solid walls of force (your choice).[lf][lf]Creatures within the area are caught and contained unless they are too big to fit inside, in which case the spell automatically fails. Teleportation and other forms of astral travel provide a means of escape, but the force walls or bars extend into the Ethereal Plane, blocking ethereal travel.[lf][lf]Like a wall of force spell, a forcecage resists dispel magic, but it is vulnerable to a disintegrate spell, and it can be destroyed by a sphere of annihilation or a rod of cancellation.[lf][lf]Barred Cage: This version of the spell produces a 20-foot cube made of bands of force (similar to a wall of force spell) for bars. The bands are a half-inch wide, with half-inch gaps between them. Any creature capable of passing through such a small space can escape; others are confined. You can't attack a creature in a barred cage with a weapon unless the weapon can fit between the gaps. Even against such weapons (including arrows and similar ranged attacks), a creature in the barred cage has cover. All spells and breath weapons can pass through the gaps in the bars.[lf][lf]Windowless Cell: This version of the spell produces a 10-foot cube with no way in and no way out. Solid walls of force form its six sides.

Name: Forceful Hand
Short Description: Hand pushes creatures away.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like interposing hand, except that the forceful hand pursues and pushes away the opponent that you designate. Treat this attack as a bull rush with a +14 bonus on the Strength check (+8 for Strength 27, +4 for being Large, and a +2 bonus for charging, which it always gets). The hand always moves with the opponent to push that target back the full distance allowed, and it has no speed limit. Directing the spell to a new target is a move action.[lf][lf]A very strong creature could not push the hand out of its way because the latter would instantly reposition itself between the creature and you, but an opponent could push the hand up against you by successfully bull rushing it.

Name: Forceward
Effect: You and any allies within a 10-ft.-radius emanation centered on you.
Short Description: Creates a sphere of force that prevents entry by all but you and your allies, grants +2 sacred bonus on saving throws against effects created by evil creatures to those inside.

Name: Forceward, Force Effects
Short Description: Creates a sphere of force that protects against force effects and keeps out incorporeal creatures.

Name: Forcewave
Effect: 10-ft. burst of force centered on you
Short Description: Bull rushes all creatures within 10 ft.
Medium Description: Bull rushes all creatures within 10 ft.

Name: Foresight
Short Description: Sixth sense warns of impending danger.
Long Descripton: This spell grants you a powerful sixth sense in relation to yourself or another. Once foresight is cast, you receive instantaneous warnings of impending danger or harm to the subject of the spell. You are never surprised or flat-footed. In addition, the spell gives you a general idea of what action you might take to best protect yourself and gives you a +2 insight bonus to AC and Reflex saves. This insight bonus is lost whenever you would lose a Dexterity bonus to AC.[lf][lf]When another creature is the subject of the spell, you receive warnings about that creature. You must communicate what you learn to the other creature for the warning to be useful, and the creature can be caught unprepared in the absence of such a warning. Shouting a warning, yanking a person back, and even telepathically communicating (via an appropriate spell) can all be accomplished before some danger befalls the subject, provided you act on the warning without delay. The subject, however, does not gain the insight bonus to AC and Reflex saves.

Name: Forestfold
Short Description: You gain +20 on Hide and Move Silently in a designated terrain type.

Name: Fortify Cold Creatures
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Cold subtype creatures gain +1 sacred bonus on attacks and saves against fire effects.

Name: Fortify Familiar
Short Description: Your familiar gains +2 natural armor and a 25% chance to avoid critical hits for 1 hour/level.

Name: Fortissimo
Short Description: Doubles volume of sound; +2 on save DCs and +1d6 damage for sonic attacks.
Medium Description: Doubles volume of sound; +2 on save DCs and extra +1d6 sonic damage.

Name: Fortunate Fate
Short Description: Target immediately receives a heal if killed by damage.

Name: Foundation of Stone
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: +4 bonus to resist being bull rushed or tripped

Name: Fox's Cunning
Short Description: Subject gains +4 to Int for 1 min./level.
Long Descripton: The transmuted creature becomes smarter. The spell grants a +4 enhancement bonus to Intelligence, adding the usual benefits to Intelligence-based skill checks and other uses of the Intelligence modifier. Wizards (and other spellcasters who rely on Intelligence) affected by this spell do not gain any additional bonus spells for the increased Intelligence, but the save DCs for spells they cast while under this spells effect do increase. This spell doesn't grant extra skill points.

Name: Fox's Cunning, Mass
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: As fox's cunning, affects one subject/level.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like fox's cunning, except that it affects multiple creatures.

Name: Freedom
Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels) or see text
Short Description: Releases creature from imprisonment.
Long Descripton: The subject is freed from spells and effects that restrict its movement, including binding, entangle, grappling, imprisonment, maze, paralysis, petrification, pinning, sleep, slow, stunning, temporal stasis, and web. To free a creature from imprisonment or maze, you must know its name and background, and you must cast this spell at the spot where it was entombed or banished into the maze.

Name: Freedom of Breath
Short Description: Protects against suffocation and dangerous vapors.

Name: Freedom of Movement
Short Description: Subject moves normally despite impediments.
Medium Description: Move normally despite impediments. Automatic success on grapples and Escape Artist checks vs grapple or pin. Normal movement underwater.
Long Descripton: This spell enables you or a creature you touch to move and attack normally for the duration of the spell, even under the influence of magic that usually impedes movement, such as paralysis, solid fog, slow, and web. The subject automatically succeeds on any grapple check made to resist a grapple attempt, as well as on grapple checks or Escape Artist checks made to escape a grapple or a pin.[lf][lf]The spell also allows the subject to move and attack normally while underwater, even with slashing weapons such as axes and swords or with bludgeoning weapons such as flails, hammers, and maces, provided that the weapon is wielded in the hand rather than hurled. The freedom of movement spell does not, however, allow water breathing.

Name: Freeze
Short Description: Ray encases target in ice, dealing 2d6 cold each round.

Name: Freeze Armor
Short Description: Locks up suits of metal armor and equipment, dealing damage and impeding movement.
Medium Description: Locks up suits of metal armor and equipment, dealing cold damage and impeding movement.

Name: Freezing Claw
Short Description: Flying hand deals cold damage and freezes targets.
Medium Description: Flying hand deals 3d6 cold damage and freezes victim solid; freed by 20 pts fire damage.

Name: Freezing Fog
Effect: Fog spreads in 20-ft. radius, 20 ft. high
Short Description: Freezing fog deals 1d6 cold damage each round, and creatures must make a Reflex save or fall.  Ballance  DC 10 to move.  Max speed 5.

Name: Freezing Glance
Short Description: Gaze freezes subjects in place.

Name: Freezing Sphere
Short Description: Freezes water or deals cold damage.
Medium Description: Freezes water or deals 1d6/level (max 15d6) cold damage (use d8 for water creatures).
Long Descripton: Freezing sphere creates a frigid globe of cold energy that streaks from your fingertips to the location you select, where it explodes in a 10-foot-radius burst, dealing 1d6 points of cold damage per caster level (maximum 15d6) to each creature in the area. An elemental (water) creature instead takes 1d8 points of cold damage per caster level (maximum 15d8).[lf][lf]If the freezing sphere strikes a body of water or a liquid that is principally water (not including water-based creatures), it freezes the liquid to a depth of 6 inches over an area equal to 100 square feet (a 10- foot square) per caster level (maximum 1,500 square feet). This ice lasts for 1 round per caster level. Creatures that were swimming on the surface of frozen water become trapped in the ice. Attempting to break free is a full-round action. A trapped creature must make a DC 25 Strength check or a DC 25 Escape Artist check to do so.[lf][lf]You can refrain from firing the globe after completing the spell, if you wish. Treat this as a touch spell for which you are holding the charge. You can hold the charge for as long as 1 round per level, at the end of which time the freezing sphere bursts centered on you (and you receive no saving throw to resist its effect). Firing the globe in a later round is a standard action.

Name: Friend to Foe
Effect: 1 living creature/level, each less than 30' apart
Short Description: Make subject creature believe its allies are its enemies.
Medium Description: Enemies failing save turn on each other. Spell ends for an attacker that deals damage to its ally.

Name: Friendly Face
Short Description: Gain +5 bonus on Diplomacy and Gather Information checks.

Name: Frost Breath
Short Description: Icy breath deals 1d4 damage/2 levels.
Medium Description: Icy breath deals 1d4 cold damage/2 levels (max 5d4).

Name: Frost Fingers
Short Description: Area attack deals 1d4/level (max 5d4) cold damage.  Liquids in containers freeze.

Name: Frost Touch
Short Description: Touch attack deals 1d6 cold damage.
Long Descripton: Your touch attacks a target with supernatural cold, requiring a successful melee touch attack. The spell deals 1d6 cold damage.

Name: Frost Weapon
Short Description: Weapon gains frost special ability, +1d6 cold damage.

Name: Frostbite
Short Description: Fort save or take 1d6 nonlethal cold damage and be fatigued.

Name: Frostbite 2
Effect: One creature/2 levels, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Chilled air causes 6d6 cold damage and 2d6 Dex damage.

Name: Frostburn
Short Description: Touch deals 3d12 frostburn damage +1/level (max +20).

Name: Frostburn, Lesser
Short Description: Touch deals 1d12 frostburn damage +1/level (max +5).

Name: Frostburn, Mass
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Deals 3d12 +1/level (max +20) frostburn damage to many creatures.

Name: Frostfell
Short Description: Intense cold turns all subjects in area into ice.

Name: Frostfell Slide
Duration: 1 hour/level or until expended; see text
Short Description: Move instantly from one area of frostfell to another.

Name: Fugue
Short Description: The target is hindered or harmed in a manner dictated by your Perform skill.

Name: Furnace Within
Short Description: Flame bursts from your body, deals 1d8/2 level (max 5d8) fire damage in 10-ft. radius.

Name: Fuse Arms
Effect: Creature with at least 4 arms or tentacles touched
Short Description: Multiple arms/tentacles become one pair of stronger limbs.

Name: Fuse Sand
Effect: Up to two 10-ft. cubes per level(S)
Short Description: Hardens sand and may trap creatures.

Name: G'elsewhere Chant
Short Description: You teleport a target to a random, safe location up to 100 feet distant and visible to you

Name: Gaseous Form
Short Description: Subject becomes insubstantial and can fly slowly.
Long Descripton: The subject and all its gear become insubstantial, misty, and translucent. Its material armor (including natural armor) becomes worthless, though its size, Dexterity, deflection bonuses, and armor bonuses from force effects still apply. The subject gains damage reduction 10/magic and becomes immune to poison and critical hits. It can't attack or cast spells with verbal, somatic, material, or focus components while in gaseous form. (This does not rule out the use of certain spells that the subject may have prepared using the feats Silent Spell, Still Spell, and Eschew Materials.) The subject also loses supernatural abilities while in gaseous form. If it has a touch spell ready to use, that spell is discharged harmlessly when the gaseous form spell takes effect.[lf][lf]A gaseous creature can't run, but it can fly at a speed of 10 feet (maneuverability perfect). It can pass through small holes or narrow openings, even mere cracks, with all it was wearing or holding in its hands, as long as the spell persists. The creature is subject to the effects of wind, and it can't enter water or other liquid. It also can't manipulate objects or activate items, even those carried along with its gaseous form. Continuously active items remain active, though in some cases their effects may be moot.

Name: Gate
Duration: Instantaneous or concentration (up to 1 round/level); see text
Short Description: Connects two planes for travel or summoning.
Long Descripton: Casting a gate spell has two effects. First, it creates an interdimensional connection between your plane of existence and a plane you specify, allowing travel between those two planes in either direction.[lf][lf]Second, you may then call a particular individual or kind of being through the gate.[lf][lf]The gate itself is a circular hoop or disk from 5 to 20 feet in diameter (casters choice), oriented in the direction you desire when it comes into existence (typically vertical and facing you). It is a two-dimensional window looking into the plane you specified when casting the spell, and anyone or anything that moves through is shunted instantly to the other side.[lf][lf]A gate has a front and a back. Creatures moving through the gate from the front are transported to the other plane; creatures moving through it from the back are not.[lf][lf]Planar Travel: As a mode of planar travel, a gate spell functions much like a plane shift spell, except that the gate opens precisely at the point you desire (a creation effect). Deities and other beings who rule a planar realm can prevent a gate from opening in their presence or personal demesnes if they so desire. Travelers need not join hands with you-anyone who chooses to step through the portal is transported. A gate cannot be opened to another point on the same plane; the spell works only for interplanar travel.[lf][lf]You may hold the gate open only for a brief time (no more than 1 round per caster level), and you must concentrate on doing so, or else the interplanar connection is severed.[lf][lf]Calling Creatures: The second effect of the gate spell is to call an extraplanar creature to your aid (a calling effect). By naming a particular being or kind of being as you cast the spell, you cause the gate to open in the immediate vicinity of the desired creature and pull the subject through, willing or unwilling. Deities and unique beings are under no compulsion to come through the gate, although they may choose to do so of their own accord. This use of the spell creates a gate that remains open just long enough to transport the called creatures. This use of the spell has an XP cost (see below).[lf][lf]If you choose to call a kind of creature instead of a known individual you may call either a single creature (of any HD) or several creatures. You can call and control several creatures as long as their HD total does not exceed your caster level. In the case of a single creature, you can control it if its HD do not exceed twice your caster level. A single creature with more HD than twice your caster level can't be controlled. Deities and unique beings cannot be controlled in any event. An uncontrolled being acts as it pleases, making the calling of such creatures rather dangerous. An uncontrolled being may return to its home plane at any time.[lf][lf]A controlled creature can be commanded to perform a service for you. Such services fall into two categories: immediate tasks and contractual service. Fighting for you in a single battle or taking any other actions that can be accomplished within 1 round per caster level counts as an immediate task; you need not make any agreement or pay any reward for the creatures help. The creature departs at the end of the spell.[lf][lf]If you choose to exact a longer or more involved form of service from a called creature, you must offer some fair trade in return for that service. The service exacted must be reasonable with respect to the promised favor or reward; see the  planar ally, lesser spell for appropriate rewards. (Some creatures may want their payment in livestock rather than in coin, which could involve complications.) Immediately upon completion of the service, the being is transported to your vicinity, and you must then and there turn over the promised reward. After this is done, the creature is instantly freed to return to its own plane.[lf][lf]Failure to fulfill the promise to the letter results in your being subjected to service by the creature or by its liege and master, at the very least. At worst, the creature or its kin may attack you.[lf][lf]Note: When you use a calling spell such as gate to call an air, chaotic, earth, evil, fire, good, lawful, or water creature, it becomes a spell of that type.

Name: Gatorswarm
Short Description: This spell summons 1d3 exceptionally irate and hungry monstrous alligators from the surrounding waters.

Name: Gaze Screen
Short Description: Subject has a 50% chance to avoid gaze attacks.

Name: Geas, Lesser
Effect: One living creature with 7 HD or less
Short Description: Commands subject of 7 HD or less.
Long Descripton: A lesser geas places a magical command on a creature to carry out some service or to refrain from some action or course of activity, as desired by you. The creature must have 7 or fewer Hit Dice and be able to understand you. While a geas cannot compel a creature to kill itself or perform acts that would result in certain death, it can cause almost any other course of activity.[lf][lf]The geased creature must follow the given instructions until the geas is completed, no matter how long it takes.[lf][lf]If the instructions involve some open-ended task that the recipient cannot complete through his own actions the spell remains in effect for a maximum of one day per caster level. A clever recipient can subvert some instructions:[lf][lf]If the subject is prevented from obeying the lesser geas for 24 hours, it takes a 2 penalty to each of its ability scores. Each day, another 2 penalty accumulates, up to a total of 8. No ability score can be reduced to less than 1 by this effect. The ability score penalties are removed 24 hours after the subject resumes obeying the lesser geas.[lf][lf]A lesser geas (and all ability score penalties) can be ended by break enchantment, limited wish, remove curse, miracle, or wish. Dispel magic does not affect a lesser geas.

Name: Geas/Quest
Short Description: As geas, lesser, plus it affects any creature.
Long Descripton: A geas/quest places a magical command on a creature to carry out some service or to refrain from some action or course of activity, as desired by you. The creature must be able to understand you. While a geas cannot compel a creature to kill itself or perform acts that would result in certain death, it can cause almost any other course of activity.[lf][lf]The geased creature must follow the given instructions until the geas is completed, no matter how long it takes.[lf][lf]If the instructions involve some open-ended task that the recipient cannot complete through his own actions the spell remains in effect for a maximum of one day per caster level. A clever recipient can subvert some instructions:[lf][lf]If the subject is prevented from obeying the geas/quest for 24 hours, it takes 3d6 points of damage each day it does not attempt to follow the geas/quest. Additionally, each day it must make a Fortitude saving throw or become sickened. These effects end 24 hours after the creature attempts to resume the geas/quest.[lf][lf]A remove curse spell ends a geas/quest spell only if its caster level is at least two higher than your caster level. Break enchantment does not end a geas/quest, but limited wish, miracle, and wish do.[lf][lf]Bards, sorcerers, and wizards usually refer to this spell as geas, while clerics call the same spell quest.

Name: Gelid Blood
Short Description: Subject takes –4 penalty on attacks, AC, and Str- and Dex-related checks, 50% failure of spells with somatic components.

Name: Gembomb
Short Description: Converts five gems into bombs that deal 1d8 force damage/two levels.
Medium Description: Converts a gem into a bomb that deal 1d8/two levels (max 5d8) force damage.

Name: Gemjump
Effect: You and willing creatures totaling up to one/3 levels; see text
Short Description: Teleport to the location of a specially prepared gem.

Name: General of Undeath
Short Description: Increases your maximum HD of controlled undead by your caster level.

Name: Genesis
Effect: A demiplane on the Ethereal Plane centered on your location
Short Description: Create a demi-plane.
Long Descripton: This spell creates an immobile, finite plane with limited access—a demi-plane.[lf][lf]Demiplanes created by this power are very small, minor planes. A character can cast this spell only on the Ethereal Plane. When he or she casts it, a local density fluctuation precipitates the creation of a demiplane. At first, the demiplane grows at a rate of a 1-foot-radius per day to an initial maximum radius of 180 feet as the fledgling plane draws substance from surrounding ethereal vapors and protomatter or astral ectoplasm.[lf][lf]The character determines the environment in the demiplane when he or she first casts genesis, reflecting most any desire he or she can visualize. The caster determines factors such as atmosphere, water, temperature, and the shape of the general terrain. However, the spell cannot create life, nor can it create construction. If desired, these must be brought in by some other fashion.[lf][lf]Once the basic demiplane reaches its maximum size, the character can continue to cast this spell to enlarge the demiplane if he or she is inside the boundaries of the demiplane. In such a case, the radiusof the demiplane increases by 60 feet for each subsequent casting.[lf][lf]If the spell is cast again while outside an existing demi-plane, the casting creates a separate bubble that does not touch or overlap any previously created demiplane.

Name: Gentle Repose
Short Description: Preserves one corpse.
Long Descripton: You preserve the remains of a dead creature so that they do not decay. Doing so effectively extends the time limit on raising that creature from the dead (see raise dead). Days spent under the influence of this spell don't count against the time limit. Additionally, this spell makes transporting a fallen comrade more pleasant.[lf][lf]The spell also works on severed body parts and the like.

Name: Getaway
Short Description: Causes pursuers to go astray 50% of the time.

Name: Geyser
Short Description: Creates a line of water that deals 1d6 nonlethal damage +1d6/2 additional levels.
Medium Description: Creates a line of water that deals 1d6 nonlethal damage +1d6/two levels (max +8d6).

Name: Ghorus Toth's Magnetism
Short Description: Metallic creature or object becomes strongly magnetic.

Name: Ghost Knight
Short Description: A visible force that does not harm, but distracts.

Name: Ghost Light
Effect: One Medium or smaller ghostly light
Short Description: An eerie green torch light causes creatures to become shaken.

Name: Ghost Pipes
Short Description: Causes an instrument to float above the ground and play itself.
Medium Description: Causes an instrument to float above the ground and play itself. If used with your bardic music ability, grants a +2 competence bonus on your Perform check.

Name: Ghost Sound
Short Description: Figment sounds.
Long Descripton: Ghost sound allows you to create a volume of sound that rises, recedes, approaches, or remains at a fixed place. You choose what type of sound ghost sound creates when casting it and cannot thereafter change the sounds basic character.[lf][lf]The volume of sound created depends on your level. You can produce as much noise as four normal humans per caster level (maximum twenty humans). Thus, talking, singing, shouting, walking, marching, or running sounds can be created. The noise a ghost sound spell produces can be virtually any type of sound within the volume limit. A horde of rats running and squeaking is about the same volume as eight humans running and shouting. A roaring lion is equal to the noise from sixteen humans, while a roaring dire tiger is equal to the noise from twenty humans.[lf][lf]Ghost sound can enhance the effectiveness of a silent image spell.[lf][lf]Ghost sound can be made permanent with a permanency spell.

Name: Ghost Storm
Short Description: Save and become Frightened or fail and gain a temporary negative level, per round.  Levels return at the rate of 1 per minute.  More nastiness.

Name: Ghost Touch Armor
Short Description: Armor works normally against incorporeal attacks.

Name: Ghost Touch Weapon
Effect: One weapon or fifty projectiles (all of which must be in contact with each other at the time of casting)
Short Description: Weapon works normally against incorporeal creatures.

Name: Ghost Trap
Short Description: Incorporeal creatures turn corporeal.

Name: Ghostform
Short Description: You become incorporeal.

Name: Ghostharp
Short Description: Object records, plays a song at your command.

Name: Ghostly Reload
Duration: 1 hour or until expended; see text
Short Description: Automatically pulls crossbow string into catch.
Medium Description: Automatically pulls string of a hand crossbow or light crossbow into place 1/level (max 10 times) or a heavy crossbow 1/2 levels (max 5 times).

Name: Ghostly Tail
Short Description: Your tail of force can be used to take advantage of an attack of opportunity.
Medium Description: Use your tail of force to make attacks of opportunity; melee touch attack, dealing 2d6 points of damage.

Name: Ghoul Gauntlet
Short Description: Convert victim to a ghoul under your control.

Name: Ghoul Gesture
Short Description: Ray paralyzes target.

Name: Ghoul Glyph
Effect: One ghoul glyph that must fit within a 1-ft. square
Short Description: Glyph wards area, paralyzes victims.

Name: Ghoul Light
Short Description: Light provides turn resistance.

Name: Ghoul Touch
Short Description: Paralyzes one subject, which exudes stench.
Medium Description: Paralyze one subject, which exudes stench that sickens (Fort neg) all except you witin 10'.
Long Descripton: Imbuing you with negative energy, this spell allows you to paralyze a single living humanoid for the duration of the spell with a successful melee touch attack.[lf][lf]Additionally, the paralyzed subject exudes a carrion stench that causes all living creatures (except you) in a 10-foot-radius spread to become sickened (Fortitude negates). A neutralize poison spell removes the effect from a sickened creature, and creatures immune to poison are unaffected by the stench.

Name: Giant Size
Short Description: You may grow up to Huge, Gargantuan, or Colossal size.

Name: Giant Vermin
Effect: Up to three vermin, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Turns centipedes, scorpions, or spiders into giant vermin.
Long Descripton: You turn three normal-sized centipedes, two normal-sized spiders, or a single normal-sized scorpion into larger forms. Only one type of vermin can be transmuted (so a single casting cannot affect both a centipede and a spider), and all must be grown to the same size. The size to which the vermin can be grown depends on your level; see the table below.[lf][lf]Any giant vermin created by this spell do not attempt to harm you, but your control of such creatures is limited to simple commands (Attack, Defend, Stop, and so forth). Orders to attack a certain creature when it appears or guard against a particular occurrence are too complex for the vermin to understand. Unless commanded to do otherwise, the giant vermin attack whoever or whatever is near them.[lf][lf]Caster Level, Vermin Size[lf][lf]9th or lower, Medium[lf][lf]10th-13th, Large[lf][lf]14th-17th, Huge[lf][lf]18th-19th, Gargantuan[lf][lf]20th or higher, Colossal

Name: Giant's Wrath
Short Description: Thrown pebble turns into boulder dealing 2d6 + 1/2 caster levels bludgeoning damage.  Base damage increases to 2d8 at 9th level, 2d8 + 2d6 fire at 13th, and critical becomes x3 at 17th.
Medium Description: Thrown pebble becomes boulder dealing 2d6 +1/two levels bludgeoning damage. Base damage increases to 2d8 at 9th level, 2d8 +2d6 fire at 13th, critical is x3 at 17th.

Name: Girallon's Blessing
Short Description: Subject gains one additional pair of arms.
Medium Description: Subject gains an additional pair of arms and claws on all hands, allowing four claw attacks, each dealing 1d4 damage. If two claws hit, rend for additional 2d4 + 1-1/2 Str modifier.

Name: Glacial Globe of Invulnerability
Short Description: Stops 1st- through 3rd-level fire spell effects and provides concealment.

Name: Glacial Ward
Short Description: Subject gains SR 18 against fire spells and effects.

Name: Glacial Ward, Greater
Short Description: Area around you provides SR 25 against fi re spells and effects.

Name: Glacier
Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels); see text
Short Description: Conjures glaciers that attack your enemies.

Name: Glass Strike
Effect: One creature or 4 cubic ft. of material
Short Description: Turns subject into glass.

Name: Glaze Lock
Short Description: Jams locks with snow and ice, raising Open Lock DC by 10 and lock's hardness by 5.

Name: Glibness
Short Description: You gain +30 bonus on Bluff checks, and your lies can escape magical discernment.
Medium Description: Gain +30 to Bluff for lying, not feinting or diversion. Detect lies spell must succeed on d20+detector's CL vs DC 15+your CL.
Long Descripton: Your speech becomes fluent and more believable. You gain a +30 bonus on Bluff checks made to convince another of the truth of your words. (This bonus doesn't apply to other uses of the Bluff skill, such as feinting in combat, creating a diversion to hide, or communicating a hidden message via innuendo.)[lf][lf]If a magical effect is used against you that would detect your lies or force you to speak the truth the user of the effect must succeed on a caster level check (1d20 + caster level) against a DC of 15 + your caster level to succeed. Failure means the effect does not detect your lies or force you to speak only the truth.

Name: Glimpse of Eternity
Short Description: Target takes 1d6 nonlethal damage/level and is confused.
Medium Description: Target takes 1d6 nonlethal damage/level (max 15d6) and is confused.

Name: Glimpse of Fear
Short Description: A flash of horror causes the target to become shaken.

Name: Glimpse Of The Prophecy
Short Description: Gain +1 insight bonus to AC and on saves; gain insight bonus equal to 1/2 caster level on one save, or enter prophetic favor as immediate action.

Name: Glimpse of Truth
Short Description: You get an answer to a yes-or-no question.

Name: Glitterdust
Short Description: Blinds creatures, outlines invisible creatures.
Medium Description: Blinds creatures, outlines invisible creatures, imposes -40 penalty to Hide checks.
Long Descripton: A cloud of golden particles covers everyone and everything in the area, causing creatures to become blinded and visibly outlining invisible things for the duration of the spell. All within the area are covered by the dust, which cannot be removed and continues to sparkle until it fades.[lf][lf]Any creature covered by the dust takes a -40 penalty on Hide checks.

Name: Globe of Invulnerability
Short Description: As globe of invulnerability, lesser, plus 4th-level spell effects.
Long Descripton: An immobile, faintly shimmering magical sphere surrounds you and excludes all spell effects of 4th level or lower. The area or effect of any such spells does not include the area of the globe of invulnerability. Such spells fail to affect any target located within the globe. Excluded effects include spell-like abilities and spells or spell-like effects from items. However, any type of spell can be cast through or out of the magical globe. Spells of 5th level and higher are not affected by the globe, nor are spells already in effect when the globe is cast. The globe can be brought down by a targeted dispel magic spell, but not by an area dispel magic. You can leave and return to the globe without penalty.[lf][lf]Note that spell effects are not disrupted unless their effects enter the globe, and even then they are merely suppressed, not dispelled. [lf][lf]If a given spell has more than one level depending on which character class is casting it, use the level appropriate to the caster to determine whether globe of invulnerability stops it.

Name: Globe of Invulnerability, Lesser
Short Description: Stops 1st- through 3rd-level spell effects.
Long Descripton: An immobile, faintly shimmering magical sphere surrounds you and excludes all spell effects of 3rd level or lower. The area or effect of any such spells does not include the area of the lesser globe of invulnerability. Such spells fail to affect any target located within the globe. Excluded effects include spell-like abilities and spells or spell-like effects from items. However, any type of spell can be cast through or out of the magical globe. Spells of 4th level and higher are not affected by the globe, nor are spells already in effect when the globe is cast. The globe can be brought down by a targeted dispel magic spell, but not by an area dispel magic. You can leave and return to the globe without penalty.[lf][lf]Note that spell effects are not disrupted unless their effects enter the globe, and even then they are merely suppressed, not dispelled. [lf][lf]If a given spell has more than one level depending on which character class is casting it, use the level appropriate to the caster to determine whether lesser globe of invulnerability stops it.

Name: Glorious Raiment
Short Description: Wearer gains +1 sacred bonus to AC per five caster levels and damage reduction 5/evil.

Name: Glory of the Martyr
Short Description: As shield other, but affecting multiple creatures, and healing them if you die.

Name: Glossolalia
Short Description: Cone-shaped shriek distracts smart foes, makes concentrating difficult.
Long Descripton: You utter shrieks of nonsense and gibberish that thinking creatures find distracting and confusing. The spell affects only creatures with Intelligence scores of 3 or higher. Any such creatures within the spell's area must succeed on Fortitude saves or be stunned for 1 round (if they have Intelligence scores of 20 or higher), dazed for 1 round (if they have Intelligence scores between 10 and 19), or shaken for 1 round (if they have Intelligence scores between 3 and 9). In addition, a creature within the spell's area loses any psionic focus it might have had and takes a –4 penalty on Concentration checks for 1 round. These effects happen whether or not the creature succeeded on its save.

Name: Glowing Orb
Short Description: Creates permanent magical light; you control brightness.

Name: Glyph of Warding
Effect: Object touched or up to 5 sq. ft./level
Short Description: Inscription harms those who pass it.
Long Descripton: This powerful inscription harms those who enter, pass, or open the warded area or object. A glyph of warding can guard a bridge or passage, ward a portal, trap a chest or box, and so on.[lf][lf]You set the conditions of the ward. Typically, any creature entering the warded area or opening the warded object without speaking a password (which you set when casting the spell) is subject to the magic it stores. Alternatively or in addition to a password trigger, glyphs can be set according to physical characteristics (such as height or weight) or creature type, subtype, or kind. Glyphs can also be set with respect to good, evil, law, or chaos, or to pass those of your religion. They cannot be set according to class, Hit Dice, or level. Glyphs respond to invisible creatures normally but are not triggered by those who travel past them ethereally. Multiple glyphs cannot be cast on the same area. However, if a cabinet has three drawers, each can be separately warded.[lf][lf]When casting the spell, you weave a tracery of faintly glowing lines around the warding sigil. A glyph can be placed to conform to any shape up to the limitations of your total square footage. When the spell is completed, the glyph and tracery become nearly invisible.[lf][lf]Glyphs cannot be affected or by-passed by such means as physical or magical probing, though they can be dispelled. Mislead, polymorph, and nondetection (and similar magical effects) can fool a glyph, though non-magical disguises and the like can't. Read magic allows you to identify a glyph of warding with a DC 13 Spellcraft check. Identifying the glyph does not discharge it and allows you to know the basic nature of the glyph (version, type of damage caused, what spell is stored).[lf][lf]Note: Magic traps such as glyph of warding are hard to detect and disable. A rogue (only) can use the Search skill to find the glyph and Disable Device to thwart it. The DC in each case is 25 + spell level, or 28 for glyph of warding.[lf][lf]Depending on the version selected, a glyph either blasts the intruder or activates a spell.[lf][lf]Blast Glyph: A blast glyph deals 1d8 points of damage per two caster levels (maximum 5d8) to the intruder and to all within 5 feet of him or her. This damage is acid, cold, fire, electricity, or sonic (casters choice, made at time of casting). Each creature affected can attempt a Reflex save to take half damage. Spell resistance applies against this effect.[lf][lf]Spell Glyph: You can store any harmful spell of 3rd level or lower that you know. All level-dependent features of the spell are based on your caster level at the time of casting the glyph. If the spell has a target, it targets the intruder. If the spell has an area or an amorphous effect the area or effect is centered on the intruder. If the spell summons creatures, they appear as close as possible to the intruder and attack. Saving throws and spell resistance operate as normal, except that the DC is based on the level of the spell stored in the glyph.

Name: Glyph of Warding, Greater
Effect: Object touched or up to 5 sq. ft./level
Short Description: As glyph of warding, but up to 10d8 damage or 6th-level spell.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like glyph of warding, except that a greater blast glyph deals up to 10d8 points of damage, and a greater spell glyph can store a spell of 6th level or lower.

Name: Gnome Blight
Effect: Cloud spreads in 20-ft. radius, 20 ft. high
Short Description: Cloud of itchy debilitating pollen sickens living creatures.

Name: Golden Barding
Short Description: Your mount gets force armor.

Name: Golden Dragonmail
Short Description: You create a suit of shining golden +1 mithral full plate around your body.

Name: Golem Immunity
Short Description: Grants a construct the magic immunity special quality of a particular golem.

Name: Golem Strike
Short Description: Swift. You can sneak attack constructs for 1 round.

Name: Good Hope
Effect: One living creature/level, no two of which may be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Subjects gain +2 on attack rolls, damage rolls, saves, and checks.
Long Descripton: This spell instills powerful hope in the subjects. Each affected creature gains a +2 morale bonus on saving throws, attack rolls, ability checks, skill checks, and weapon damage rolls.[lf][lf]Good hope counters and dispels crushing despair.

Name: Goodberry
Short Description: 2d4 berries each cure 1 hp (max 8 hp/24 hours).
Long Descripton: Casting goodberry upon a handful of freshly picked berries makes 2d4 of them magical. You (as well as any other druid of 3rd or higher level) can immediately discern which berries are affected. Each transmuted berry provides nourishment as if it were a normal meal for a Medium creature. The berry also cures 1 point of damage when eaten, subject to a maximum of 8 points of such curing in any 24-hour period.

Name: Grace
Short Description: Silvery light grants +2 Dexterity, +10 feet to land speed, melee attacks treated as good; take -20 to Hide checks.

Name: Grasping Hand
Short Description: Large hand provides cover, pushes, or grapples.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like interposing hand, except the hand can also grapple one opponent that you select. The grasping hand gets one grapple attack per round.[lf][lf]Its attack bonus to make contact equals your caster level + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (for wizards, clerics, and sorcerers, respectively), +10 for the hands Strength score (31), -1 for being Large. Its grapple bonus is this same figure, except with a +4 modifier for being Large instead of -1. The hand holds but does not harm creatures it grapples.[lf][lf]Directing the spell to a new target is a move action.[lf][lf]The grasping hand can also bull rush an opponent as forceful hand does, but at a +16 bonus on the Strength check (+10 for Strength 35, +4 for being Large, and a +2 bonus for charging, which it always gets), or interpose itself as interposing hand does.[lf][lf]Clerics who cast this spell name it for their deities.

Name: Grasping Wall
Effect: Hands sprout from a wall in an area of up to four 5-ft. squares (S)
Short Description: Wall sprouts hands that entangle enemies, help allies climb.
Medium Description: Wall sprouts hands that entangle enemies, allies gain +10 to Climb check on wall.

Name: Grave Strike
Short Description: Swift. You can sneak attack undead for 1 round.

Name: Graymantle
Short Description: Target is prevented from regaining hit points by any means.

Name: Graz'zt's Long Grasp
Short Description: Your hand flies from you to make grapple artacks.

Name: Grease
Short Description: Makes 10-ft. square or one object slippery.
Long Descripton: A grease spell covers a solid surface with a layer of slippery grease. Any creature in the area when the spell is cast must make a successful Reflex save or fall. This save is repeated on your turn each round that the creature remains within the area. A creature can walk within or through the area of grease at half normal speed with a DC 10 Balance check. Failure means it can't move that round (and must then make a Reflex save or fall), while failure by 5 or more means it falls (see the Balance skill for details).[lf][lf]The spell can also be used to create a greasy coating on an item. Material objects not in use are always affected by this spell, while an object wielded or employed by a creature receives a Reflex saving throw to avoid the effect. If the initial saving throw fails, the creature immediately drops the item. A saving throw must be made in each round that the creature attempts to pick up or use the greased item. A creature wearing greased armor or clothing gains a +10 circumstance bonus on Escape Artist checks and on grapple checks made to resist or escape a grapple or to escape a pin.

Name: Great Thunderclap
Short Description: Loud noise causes stunning, deafness, and knocks prone in a 20-ft.-radius spread.

Name: Greenfire
Short Description: Each creature in area takes 2d6 acid damage +1/level.
Medium Description: Each creature in area takes 2d6 acid damage +1/level (max +10).

Name: Grim Revenge
Short Description: Tears hand from target, dealing 6d6 damage, then hand attacks target.

Name: Groundsmoke
Effect: One fire no larger than 5 square feet.
Short Description: Prevents smoke from rising from a small fire.

Name: Guards and Wards
Range: Anywhere within the area to be warded
Short Description: Array of magic effects protect area.
Long Descripton: This powerful spell is primarily used to defend your stronghold. The ward protects 200 square feet per caster level. The warded area can be as much as 20 feet high, and shaped as you desire. You can ward several stories of a stronghold by dividing the area among them; you must be somewhere within the area to be warded to cast the spell. The spell creates the following magical effects within the warded area.[lf][lf]Fog: Fog fills all corridors, obscuring all sight, including darkvision, beyond 5 feet. A creature within 5 feet has concealment (attacks have a 20% miss chance). Creatures farther away have total concealment (50% miss chance, and the attacker cannot use sight to locate the target). Saving Throw: None. Spell Resistance: No.[lf][lf]Arcane Locks: All doors in the warded area are arcane locked. Saving Throw: None. Spell Resistance: No.[lf][lf]Webs: Webs fill all stairs from top to bottom. These strands are identical with those created by the web spell, except that they regrow in 10 minutes if they are burned or torn away while the guards and wards spell lasts. Saving Throw: Reflex negates; see text for web. Spell Resistance: No.[lf][lf]Confusion: Where there are choices in direction-such as a corridor intersection or side passage-a minor confusion-type effect functions so as to make it 50% probable that intruders believe they are going in the opposite direction from the one they actually chose. This is an enchantment, mind-affecting effect. Saving Throw: None. Spell Resistance: Yes.[lf][lf]Lost Doors: One door per caster level is covered by a silent image to appear as if it were a plain wall. Saving Throw: Will disbelief (if interacted with). Spell Resistance: No.[lf][lf]In addition, you can place your choice of one of the following five magical effects.[lf][lf]1. Dancing lights in four corridors. You can designate a simple program that causes the lights to repeat as long as the guards and wards spell lasts. Saving Throw: None. Spell Resistance: No.[lf][lf]2. A magic mouth in two places. Saving Throw: None. Spell Resistance: No.[lf][lf]3. A stinking cloud in two places. The vapors appear in the places you designate; they return within 10 minutes if dispersed by wind while the guards and wards spell lasts. Saving Throw: Fortitude negates; see text for stinking cloud. Spell Resistance: No.[lf][lf]4. A gust of wind in one corridor or room. Saving Throw: Fortitude negates. Spell Resistance: Yes.[lf][lf]5. A suggestion in one place. You select an area of up to 5 feet square, and any creature who enters or passes through the area receives the suggestion mentally. Saving Throw: Will negates. Spell Resistance: Yes.[lf][lf]The whole warded area radiates strong magic of the abjuration school. A dispel magic cast on a specific effect, if successful, removes only that effect. A successful Mage's disjunction destroys the entire guards and wards effect.

Name: Guidance
Short Description: +1 on one attack roll, saving throw, or skill check.
Long Descripton: This spell imbues the subject with a touch of divine guidance. The creature gets a +1 competence bonus on a single attack roll, saving throw, or skill check. It must choose to use the bonus before making the roll to which it applies.

Name: Guidance of the Avatar
Short Description: Provides +20 bonus to a skill check.

Name: Guided Shot
Short Description: Swift. You ignore distance penalties with your ranged attacks for 1 round.

Name: Guiding Light
Short Description: +2 on ranged attacks against creatures in illuminated area.

Name: Guilt
Effect: One living creature of non-good alignment
Short Description: A non-good creature is forced to think about some evil deed it performed, denying it any actions except to defend itself.

Name: Gust of Wind
Effect: Line-shaped gust of severe wind emanating out from you to the extreme of the range
Short Description: Blows away or knocks down smaller creatures.
Long Descripton: This spell creates a severe blast of air (approximately 50 mph) that originates from you, affecting all creatures in its path.[lf][lf]A Tiny or smaller creature on the ground is knocked down and rolled 1d4x10 feet, taking 1d4 points of nonlethal damage per 10 feet. If flying, a Tiny or smaller creature is blown back 2d6x10 feet and takes 2d6 points of nonlethal damage due to battering and buffeting.[lf][lf]Small creatures are knocked prone by the force of the wind, or if flying are blown back 1d6x10 feet.[lf][lf]Medium creatures are unable to move forward against the force of the wind, or if flying are blown back 1d6x5 feet.[lf][lf]Large or larger creatures may move normally within a gust of wind effect.[lf][lf]A gust of wind can't move a creature beyond the limit of its range.[lf][lf]Any creature, regardless of size, takes a -4 penalty on ranged attacks and Listen checks in the area of a gust of wind.[lf][lf]The force of the gust automatically extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames. It causes protected flames, such as those of lanterns, to dance wildly and has a 50% chance to extinguish those lights.[lf][lf]In addition to the effects noted, a gust of wind can do anything that a sudden blast of wind would be expected to do. It can create a stinging spray of sand or dust, fan a large fire, overturn delicate awnings or hangings, heel over a small boat, and blow gases or vapors to the edge of its range.[lf][lf]Gust of wind can be made permanent with a permanency spell.

Name: Gutsnake
Short Description: 15-ft tentacle grows from your stomach and attacks your enemies.

Name: Gutwrench
Short Description: Kills subject and gives you 4d6 temporary hit points and +4 Strength.

Name: Haboob
Effect: Abrasive dust spreads in 20-ft. radius, 20 ft. high
Saving Throw: None or Reflex half; see text
Short Description: Cloud of dust obscures sight and abrades those passing through it.

Name: Hail of Stone
Short Description: Stones deal 1d4 points of damage/level to creatures in the area (max 5d4).

Name: Hailstones
Short Description: Frigid globes deal 5d6 cold damage.

Name: Hallow
Effect: 40-ft. radius emanating from the touched point
Short Description: Designates location as holy.
Long Descripton: Hallow makes a particular site, building, or structure a holy site. This has four major effects.[lf][lf]First, the site or structure is guarded by a magic circle against evil effect.[lf][lf]Second, all Charisma checks made to turn undead gain a +4 sacred bonus, and Charisma checks to command undead take a -4 penalty. Spell resistance does not apply to this effect. (This provision does not apply to the druid version of the spell.)[lf][lf]Third, any dead body interred in a hallowed site cannot be turned into an undead creature.[lf][lf]Finally, you may choose to fix a single spell effect to the hallowed site. The spell effect lasts for one year and functions throughout the entire site, regardless of the normal duration and area or effect. You may designate whether the effect applies to all creatures, creatures who share your faith or alignment, or creatures who adhere to another faith or alignment. At the end of the year, the chosen effect lapses, but it can be renewed or replaced simply by casting hallow again.[lf][lf]Spell effects that may be tied to a hallowed site include aid, bane, bless, cause fear, darkness, daylight, death ward, deeper darkness, detect evil, detect magic, dimensional anchor, discern lies, dispel magic, endure elements, freedom of movement, invisibility purge, protection from energy, remove fear, resist energy, silence, tongues, and zone of truth. Saving throws and spell resistance might apply to these spells effects. (See the individual spell descriptions for details.)[lf][lf]An area can receive only one hallow spell (and its associated spell effect) at a time. Hallow counters but does not dispel unhallow.

Name: Hallucinatory Terrain
Short Description: Makes one type of terrain appear like another (field into forest, or the like).
Long Descripton: You make natural terrain look, sound, and smell like some other sort of natural terrain. Structures, equipment, and creatures within the area are not hidden or changed in appearance.

Name: Halo of Sand
Short Description: Swirling sand grants +1 deflection bonus/3 levels.

Name: Halt
Short Description: Subject's feet become stuck to the ground.
Medium Description: Non-flying subject cannot move. Can be cast out of turn before subject finishes moving.

Name: Halt Deathless
Effect: Up to three deathless, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Immobilizes deathless for 1 round/level.

Name: Halt Undead
Effect: Up to three undead creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Immobilizes undead for 1 round/level.
Long Descripton: This spell renders as many as three undead creatures immobile. A nonintelligent undead creature gets no saving throw; an intelligent undead creature does. If the spell is successful, it renders the undead creature immobile for the duration of the spell (similar to the effect of hold person on a living creature). The effect is broken if the halted creatures are attacked or take damage.

Name: Hamatula Barbs
Short Description: Subjects grow barbs, which damage foes that attack subject in melee.
Medium Description: Subjects grow barbs that deal 1d8 slashing and piercing damage to foes attacking subject.

Name: Hammer of Righteousness
Short Description: Deals 1d6 points of damage per caster level, or 1d8 points of damage per caster level if the target is evil.
Medium Description: Deals 1d6/level damage (choice of lethal or nonlethal), or 1d8/level damage if the target is evil.

Name: Hand of Divinity
Short Description: Gives +2 sacred or profane bonus on saving throws to worshiper of your patron.

Name: Hand of the Faithful
Short Description: Immobile zone of warding stuns those of different patrons.

Name: Handfang
Short Description: Mouth in your hand deals 1d8 damage and allows a free grapple attempt on critical hit.

Name: Handfire
Short Description: Your hand glows and can make a touch attack dealing 1d4 +1/level, 1d6 +1/level vs undead.

Name: Hardening
Effect: One item of a volume no greater than 10 cu. ft./level (see text)
Short Description: Permanently make an object's hardness improve.
Long Descripton: This spell increases the hardness of materials. Paper becomes harder to tear, glass becomes harder to break, wood becomes more resilient, and so on. For every two caster levels, add 1 point of hardness to the material targeted by the spell. This hardness increase improves only the material's resistance to damage. Nothing else is modified by the improvement. For example, a longsword (treat steel as iron, base hardness 10) affected by a hardening spell cast by a 12th-level caster would have hardness 16 for the purpose of ignoring damage caused by someone making a sunder attack. The sword's hit points, attack and damage modifiers, and other factors are not affected. A hardening spell does not in any way affect a substance's resistance to other forms of transformation. Ice still melts, paper and wood still burn, rock still becomes transmutable to mud with the proper spell, and so on. [lf][lf]This spell affects up to 10 cubic feet of material per level of the caster. If cast upon a metal or mineral, the spell affects only 1 cubic foot per level.

Name: Harm
Short Description: Deals 10 points/level damage to target.
Medium Description: Deals 10 points/level (max 150) damage to target; cannot reduce target's HP below 1.
Long Descripton: Harm charges a subject with negative energy that deals 10 points of damage per caster level (to a maximum of 150 points at 15th level). If the creature successfully saves, harm deals half this amount, but it cannot reduce the targets hit points to less than 1.[lf][lf]If used on an undead creature, harm acts like heal.

Name: Harmonic Chorus
Short Description: Give another caster +2 caster levels and +2 on save DCs as long as you concentrate.

Name: Harmonic Void
Short Description: Nearby casters must succeed on Concentration check to use verbal-component spells.
Medium Description: Nearby casters must succeed on Concentration check to use verbal-component spells (DC 20 + spell level). Spell is used up on failure.

Name: Harmonize
Short Description: Using your bardic music requires less effort.

Name: Harmonize, Greater
Short Description: Same as Harmonize, but more powerful.

Name: Harrier
Short Description: Summons an incorporeal bird of prey to fight for you.

Name: Haste
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: One creature/level moves faster, +1 on attack rolls, AC, and Reflex saves.
Long Descripton: The transmuted creatures move and act more quickly than normal. This extra speed has several effects.[lf][lf]When making a full attack action, a hasted creature may make one extra attack with any weapon he is holding. The attack is made using the creatures full base attack bonus, plus any modifiers appropriate to the situation. (This effect is not cumulative with similar effects, such as that provided by a weapon of speed, nor does it actually grant an extra action, so you cant use it to cast a second spell or otherwise take an extra action in the round.)[lf][lf]A hasted creature gains a +1 bonus on attack rolls and a +1 dodge bonus to AC and Reflex saves. Any condition that makes you lose your Dexterity bonus to Armor Class (if any) also makes you lose dodge bonuses.[lf][lf]All of the hasted creatures modes of movement (including land movement, burrow, climb, fly, and swim) increase by 30 feet, to a maximum of twice the subjects normal speed using that form of movement. This increase counts as an enhancement bonus, and it affects the creatures jumping distance as normal for increased speed.[lf][lf]Multiple haste effects don't stack. Haste dispels and counters slow.

Name: Haste, Swift
Short Description: You are hasted for 1d4 rounds (swift).

Name: Haunt Shift
Short Description: Turn corporeal and incorporeal undead into haunting presences.

Name: Haunting Tune
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: 1 target/level becomes shaken.

Name: Hawkeye
Short Description: You gain +5 on spot checks and fire ranged weapons better.

Name: Heal
Short Description: Cures 10 points/level of damage, all diseases and mental conditions.
Medium Description: Cures 10 points/level (max 150) damage, all diseases and mental conditions.
Long Descripton: Heal enables you to channel positive energy into a creature to wipe away injury and afflictions. It immediately ends any and all of the following adverse conditions affecting the Target: ability damage, blinded, confused, dazed, dazzled, deafened, diseased, exhausted, fatigued, feebleminded, insanity, nauseated, sickened, stunned, and poisoned. It also cures 10 hit points of damage per level of the caster, to a maximum of 150 points at 15th level.[lf][lf]Heal does not remove negative levels, restore permanently drained levels, or restore permanently drained ability score points.[lf][lf]If used against an undead creature, heal instead acts like harm.

Name: Heal Animal Companion
Short Description: Restores health and damage to an animal companion.

Name: Heal Mount
Short Description: As heal on warhorse or other special mount.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like heal, but it affects only the paladin's special mount (typically a warhorse).

Name: Heal, Mass
Effect: One or more creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: As heal, but with several subjects.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like heal, except as noted above. The maximum number of hit points restored to each creature is 250.

Name: Healer's Vision
Short Description: Gain +5 bonus on Heal checks, and +2 attack and damage on sneak attacks.

Name: Healing Lorecall
Short Description: If you have 5 or more ranks in Heal, you can remove harmful conditions with conjuration (healing) spells.

Name: Healing Sting
Short Description: Touch deals 1d12 +1 point/level; caster gains damage as hp.
Medium Description: Touch deals 1d12 +1 point/level (max 1d12 + 10) damage which caster gains as HP.

Name: Healing Surf
Effect: Caster, plus one additional creature per 3 caster levels
Short Description: Heals 5 points/level (max 50) and removes all trace of disease, ability damage, exhaustion, fatigue, nausea, and sickened.  Targets gain +4 sacred bonus against these effects that cause those conditions.

Name: Healing Touch
Short Description: You heal the target 1d6/2 levels and take half as damage.

Name: Healthful Rest
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 feet apart
Short Description: Subjects heal at twice the normal rate.

Name: Healthful Slumber
Short Description: Doubles natural healing rate.

Name: Heart of Stone
Short Description: You gain DR 5/- and resist energy 5 vs cold, fire, and electricity.  Healing slows and requires caster level checks (DC 10 + your caster level)

Name: Heart Ripper
Short Description: Slay a creature with HD totaling up to your caster level or less.  Stun him if more.

Name: Heart's Ease
Short Description: Removes fear, despair, confusion, insanity, and some mind-influencing effects; restores 2d4 points of temporary Wisdom damage.

Name: Heartache
Short Description: Subject helpless for 1 round.

Name: Heartclutch
Short Description: Subject dies in 1d3 rounds or takes 3d6 damage +1/level.

Name: Heartfire
Short Description: Passions of targets ignite as real fire upon the target.

Name: Heartfreeze
Short Description: Subject exhausted, dies in 1d3+2 rounds.

Name: Heat Drain
Short Description: Subjects take 1d6 cold damage/level, you gain equal amount hp.

Name: Heat Leech
Short Description: Subject takes 1d8 points of cold damage/round.

Name: Heat Metal
Effect: Metal equipment of one creature per two levels, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart; or 25 lb. of metal/level, all of which must be within a 30-ft. circle
Short Description: Make metal so hot it damages those who touch it.
Medium Description: Make metal so hot it deals fire damage to those who touch it.
Long Descripton: Heat metal makes metal extremely warm. Unattended, nonmagical metal gets no saving throw. Magical metal is allowed a saving throw against the spell. An item in a creatures possession uses the creatures saving throw bonus unless its own is higher.[lf][lf]A creature takes fire damage if its equipment is heated.
