It takes full damage if its armor is affected or if it is holding, touching, wearing, or carrying metal weighing one-fifth of its weight. The creature takes minimum damage (1 point or 2 points; see the table) if its not wearing metal armor and the metal that its carrying weighs less than one-fifth of its weight.[lf][lf]On the first round of the spell, the metal becomes warm and uncomfortable to touch but deals no damage. The same effect also occurs on the last round of the spells duration. During the second (and also the next-to-last) round, intense heat causes pain and damage. In the third, fourth, and fifth rounds, the metal is searing hot, causing more damage, as shown on the table below.[lf][lf]RoundMetal TemperatureDamage[lf][lf]1WarmNone[lf][lf]2Hot1d4 points[lf][lf]3-5Searing2d4 points[lf][lf]6Hot1d4 points[lf][lf]7WarmNone[lf][lf][lf][lf]Any cold intense enough to damage the creature negates fire damage from the spell (and vice versa) on a point-for-point basis. If cast underwater, heat metal deals half damage and boils the surrounding water.[lf][lf]Heat metal counters and dispels chill metal.

Name: Heatstroke
Short Description: Subject creature takes nonlethal damage and becomes fatigued.
Medium Description: Target takes 2d6 points of nonlethal damage. If it fails a Fortitude save, it becomes fatigued (if already fatigued, it becomes exhausted).

Name: Heaven's Trumpet
Effect: Foes in a 120-ft.-radius burst centered on you
Short Description: Blast of music paralyzes foes.

Name: Heavenly Host
Effect: Two or more summoned creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Summons archons to fight for you.

Name: Heavenly Lightning
Effect: Up to one creature per 2 caster levels
Short Description: Arcs of radiant lightning deal 3d6 damage to one target per two caster levels.
Medium Description: Arcs of radiant lightning deal 3d6 electricity damage to 1 target per 2 caster levels.

Name: Heavenly Lightning Storm
Effect: Up to one creature per caster level
Short Description: Arcs of radiant lightning deal 5d6 damage to one target per level.
Medium Description: Arcs of radiant lightning deal 5d6 electricity damage to one target per level.

Name: Hell's Power
Short Description: You gain +2 AC and good to existing DR.

Name: Hellfire
Short Description: Deal 3d6 diabolic fire damage.

Name: Hellfire Storm
Short Description: Explosion of brimstone deals 5d6 damage in 20-ft. radius.
Medium Description: Explosion of brimstone deals 5d6 diabolic fire damage in 20-ft. radius.

Name: Hellish Horde
Effect: Two or more summoned creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Summons devils to fight for you.

Name: Helping Hand
Short Description: Ghostly hand leads subject to you.
Long Descripton: You create the ghostly image of a hand, which you can send to find a creature within 5 miles. The hand then beckons to that creature and leads it to you if the creature is willing to follow.[lf][lf]When the spell is cast, the hand appears in front of you. You then specify a person (or any creature) by physical description, which can include race, gender, and appearance but not ambiguous factors such as level, alignment, or class. When the description is complete, the hand streaks off in search of a subject that fits the description. The amount of time it takes to find the subject depends on how far away she is.[lf][lf]Distance, Time to Locate[lf][lf]100 ft. or less, 1 round[lf][lf]1,000 ft., 1 minute[lf][lf]1 mile, 10 minutes[lf][lf]2 miles, 1 hour[lf][lf]3 miles, 2 hours[lf][lf]4 miles, 3 hours[lf][lf]5 miles, 4 hours[lf][lf]Once the hand locates the subject, it beckons the creature to follow it. If the subject does so, the hand points in your direction, indicating the most direct feasible route. The hand hovers 10 feet in front of the subject, moving before it at a speed of as much as 240 feet per round. Once the hand leads the subject back to you, it disappears.[lf][lf]The subject is not compelled to follow the hand or act in any particular way toward you. If the subject chooses not to follow, the hand continues to beckon for the duration of the spell, then disappears. If the spell expires while the subject is en route to you, the hand disappears; the subject must then rely on her own devices to locate you.[lf][lf]If more than one subject in a 5-mile radius meets the description, the hand locates the closest creature. If that creature refuses to follow the hand, the hand does not seek out a second subject.[lf][lf]If, at the end of 4 hours of searching, the hand has found no subject that matches the description within 5 miles, it returns to you, displays an outstretched palm (indicating that no such creature was found), and disappears.[lf][lf]The ghostly hand has no physical form. It is invisible to anyone except you and a potential subject. It cannot engage in combat or execute any other task aside from locating a subject and leading it back to you. The hand can't pass through solid objects but can ooze through small cracks and slits. The hand cannot travel more than 5 miles from the spot it appeared when you cast the spell.

Name: Hemorrhage
Short Description: Inflict wound that bleeds 1d3 damage per round.

Name: Herald's Call
Short Description: Shout slows those within 20 ft.

Name: Hero's Blade
Short Description: Channel the spirit of a great hero into a melee weapon.

Name: Heroes' Feast
Short Description: Food for one creature/level cures and grants combat bonuses.
Long Descripton: You bring forth a great feast, including a magnificent table, chairs, service, and food and drink. The feast takes 1 hour to consume, and the beneficial effects do not set in until this hour is over. Every creature partaking of the feast is cured of all diseases, sickness, and nausea; becomes immune to poison for 12 hours; and gains 1d8 temporary hit points +1 point per two caster levels (maximum +10) after imbibing the nectar-like beverage that is part of the feast. The ambrosial food that is consumed grants each creature that partakes a +1 morale bonus on attack rolls and Will saves and immunity to fear effects for 12 hours.[lf][lf]If the feast is interrupted for any reason, the spell is ruined and all effects of the spell are negated.

Name: Heroics
Short Description: Fighter gains one fighter bonus feat.

Name: Heroism
Short Description: Gives +2 on attack rolls, saves, skill checks.
Long Descripton: This spell imbues a single creature with great bravery and morale in battle. The target gains a +2 morale bonus on attack rolls, saves, and skill checks.

Name: Heroism, Greater
Short Description: Gives +4 bonus on attack rolls, saves, skill checks; immunity to fear; temporary hp.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like heroism, except the creature gains a +4 morale bonus on attack rolls, saves, and skill checks, immunity to fear effects, and temporary hit points equal to your caster level (maximum 20).

Name: Hesitate
Short Description: Force subject to lose actions.
Medium Description: Subject can take no action other than move and defend. Attacking subject ends spell. Subject can attempt save each turn.

Name: Hibernal Healing
Short Description: You absorb ice, slush, and snow, curing 10 points/level of damage (max 150).

Name: Hibernate
Short Description: Sends subject into state of hibernation for one week/level.

Name: Hidden Lodge
Short Description: Creates a camouflaged Secure Shelter.

Name: Hidden Object
Short Description: Object is subject to invisibility and can be seen through a piece of glass.  Otherwise, cannot be seen.

Name: Hidden Ward
Short Description: Hide magical effects on an object.

Name: Hide from Animals
Short Description: Animals cant perceive one subject/level.
Long Descripton: Animals cannot see, hear, or smell the warded creatures. Even extraordinary or supernatural sensory capabilities, such as blindsense, blindsight, scent, and tremorsense, cannot detect or locate warded creatures. Animals simply act as though the warded creatures are not there. If a warded character touches an animal or attacks any creature, even with a spell, the spell ends for all recipients.

Name: Hide from Dragons
Short Description: Dragons can't perceive one subject/two levels.

Name: Hide from Undead
Short Description: Undead can't perceive one subject/level.
Long Descripton: Undead cannot see, hear, or smell the warded creatures. Even extraordinary or supernatural sensory capabilities, such as blindsense, blindsight, scent, and tremorsense, cannot detect or locate warded creatures. Nonintelligent undead creatures are automatically affected and act as though the warded creatures are not there. An intelligent undead creature gets a single Will saving throw. If it fails, the subject can't see any of the warded creatures. However, if it has reason to believe unseen opponents are present, it can attempt to find or strike them. If a warded creature attempts to turn or command undead, touches an undead creature, or attacks any creature (even with a spell), the spell ends for all recipients.

Name: Hide Life
Short Description: You lock away your life force into a small receptacle and cannot be killed while the receptacle remains intact.

Name: Hide the Path
Range: Anywhere within the area to be warded
Short Description: Disrupts find the path and other 6th level or lower divination spells.

Name: Hideous Laughter
Short Description: Subject loses actions for 1 round/level.
Long Descripton: This spell afflicts the subject with uncontrollable laughter. It collapses into gales of manic laughter, falling prone. The subject can take no actions while laughing, but is not considered helpless. After the spell ends, it can act normally.[lf][lf]A creature with an Intelligence score of 2 or lower is not affected. A creature whose type is different from the caster's receives a +4 bonus on its saving throw, because humor doesn't translate well.

Name: Hindsight
Short Description: Divination that allows you to see the history of a location.

Name: Hiss of Sleep
Short Description: You induce comatose slumber in targets.

Name: Hoard Life
Short Description: Store some of your life force for later healing.

Name: Hold Animal
Short Description: Paralyzes one animal for 1 round/level.
Long Descripton: The subject becomes paralyzed and freezes in place. It is aware and breathes normally but cannot take any actions, even speech. Each round on its turn, the subject may attempt a new saving throw to end the effect. (This is a full-round action that does not provoke attacks of opportunity.)[lf][lf]A winged creature who is paralyzed cannot flap its wings and falls. A swimmer cant swim and may drown.

Name: Hold Monster
Short Description: As hold person, but any creature.
Long Descripton: The subject becomes paralyzed and freezes in place. It is aware and breathes normally but cannot take any actions, even speech. Each round on its turn, the subject may attempt a new saving throw to end the effect. (This is a full-round action that does not provoke attacks of opportunity.)[lf][lf]A winged creature who is paralyzed cannot flap its wings and falls. A swimmer can't swim and may drown.

Name: Hold Monster, Mass
Effect: One or more creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: As hold monster, but all within 30 ft.
Long Descripton: The subjects become paralyzed and freezes in place. They're aware and breathe normally but cannot take any action, even speech. Each round on their turn, each subject may attempt a new saving throw to end the effect. (This is a full-round action that does not provoke attacks of opportunity.)[lf][lf]A winged creature who is paralyzed cannot flap its wings and falls. A swimmer can't swim and may drown.

Name: Hold Person
Short Description: Paralyzes one humanoid for 1 round/level.
Long Descripton: The subject becomes paralyzed and freezes in place. It is aware and breathes normally but cannot take any actions, even speech. Each round on its turn, the subject may attempt a new saving throw to end the effect. (This is a full-round action that does not provoke attacks of opportunity.)[lf][lf]A winged creature who is paralyzed cannot flap its wings and falls. A swimmer can't swim and may drown.

Name: Hold Person, Mass
Effect: One or more humanoid creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: As hold person, but all within 30 ft.
Long Descripton: The subjects become paralyzed and freeze in place. They are aware and breathe normally but cannot take any actions, even speech. Each round on its turn, the subject may attempt a new saving throw to end the effect. (This is a full-round action that does not provoke attacks of opportunity.)[lf][lf]A winged creature who is paralyzed cannot flap its wings and falls. A swimmer can't swim and may drown.

Name: Hold Portal
Effect: One portal, up to 20 sq. ft./level
Short Description: Holds door shut.
Long Descripton: This spell magically holds shut a door, gate, window, or shutter of wood, metal, or stone. The magic affects the portal just as if it were securely closed and normally locked. A knock spell or a successful dispel magic spell can negate a hold portal spell.[lf][lf]For a portal affected by this spell, add 5 to the normal DC for forcing open the portal.

Name: Holy Aura
Effect: One creature/level in a 20-ft.-radius burst centered on you
Short Description: +4 to AC, +4 resistance, and SR 25 against evil spells.
Long Descripton: A brilliant divine radiance surrounds the subjects, protecting them from attacks, granting them resistance to spells cast by evil creatures, and causing evil creatures to become blinded when they strike the subjects. This abjuration has four effects.[lf][lf]First, each warded creature gains a +4 deflection bonus to AC and a +4 resistance bonus on saves. Unlike protection from evil, this benefit applies against all attacks, not just against attacks by evil creatures.[lf][lf]Second, each warded creature gains spell resistance 25 against evil spells and spells cast by evil creatures.[lf][lf]Third, the abjuration blocks possession and mental influence, just as protection from evil does.[lf][lf]Finally, if an evil creature succeeds on a melee attack against a warded creature, the offending attacker is blinded (Fortitude save negates, as blindness/deafness, but against holy aura's save DC).

Name: Holy Mount
Short Description: Special mount gains celestial template.

Name: Holy Smite
Short Description: Damages and blinds evil creatures.
Medium Description: Deals 1d8/two caster levels (max 5d8) holy damage and blinds evil creatures (1d6/CL, max 10d6 to evil outsiders).
Long Descripton: You draw down holy power to smite your enemies. Only evil and neutral creatures are harmed by the spell; good creatures are unaffected.[lf][lf]The spell deals 1d8 points of damage per two caster levels (maximum 5d8) to each evil creature in the area (or 1d6 points of damage per caster level, maximum 10d6, to an evil outsider) and causes it to become blinded for 1 round. A successful Will saving throw reduces damage to half and negates the blinded effect.[lf][lf]The spell deals only half damage to creatures who are neither good nor evil, and they are not blinded. Such a creature can reduce that damage by half (down to one-quarter of the roll) with a successful Will save.

Name: Holy Spurs
Short Description: Special mount's speed increases by 40 ft. for 1 round (swift).

Name: Holy Star
Short Description: Glowing light turns spell, gives a cover bonus to AC, or shoots beams of fire.

Name: Holy Storm
Short Description: Good-aligned rain falls in 20-ft. radius.
Medium Description: Good-aligned rain falls in 20-ft. radius, dealing 2d6 damage/round to evil creatures (evil outsiders take double damage). Reduces hearing and visibility.

Name: Holy Sword
Short Description: Weapon becomes +5, deals +2d6 damage against evil.
Medium Description: Weapon becomes +5, deals +2d6 holy damage against evil.
Long Descripton: This spell allows you to channel holy power into your sword, or any other melee weapon you choose. The weapon acts as a +5 holy weapon (+5 enhancement bonus on attack and damage rolls, extra 2d6 damage against evil opponents). It also emits a magic circle against evil effect (as the spell). If the magic circle ends, the sword creates a new one on your turn as a free action. The spell is automatically canceled 1 round after the weapon leaves your hand. You cannot have more than one holy sword at a time.[lf][lf]If this spell is cast on a magic weapon, the powers of the spell supersede any that the weapon normally has, rendering the normal enhancement bonus and powers of the weapon inoperative for the duration of the spell. This spell is not cumulative with bless weapon or any other spell that might modify the weapon in any way.[lf][lf]This spell does not work on artifacts.[lf][lf]Note: A masterwork weapons bonus to attack does not stack with an enhancement bonus to attack.

Name: Holy Transformation
Short Description: You change into hound archon, gain abilities.

Name: Holy Transformation, Lesser
Short Description: You change into protectar, gain abilities.

Name: Holy Word
Effect: Nongood creatures in a 40-ft.-radius spread centered on you
Saving Throw: None or Will negates; see text
Short Description: Kills, paralyzes, blinds, or deafens nongood subjects.
Long Descripton: Any nongood creature within the area that hears the holy word suffers the following ill effects.    [lf]HDEffect  [lf]Equal to caster level  Deafened  [lf]Up to caster level - 1  Blinded, deafened  [lf]Up to caster level - 5   Paralyzed, blinded, deafened  [lf]Up to caster level - 10  Killed, paralyzed, blinded, deafened    [lf]The effects are cumulative and concurrent. No saving throw is allowed against these effects.  [lf]Deafened: The creature is deafened for 1d4 rounds.  [lf]Blinded: The creature is blinded for 2d4 rounds.  [lf]Paralyzed: The creature is paralyzed and helpless for 1d10 minutes.  [lf]Killed: Living creatures die. Undead creatures are destroyed.  [lf]Furthermore, if you are on your home plane when you cast this spell, nongood extraplanar creatures within the area are instantly banished back to their home planes. Creatures so banished cannot return for at least 24 hours. This effect takes place regardless of whether the creatures hear the holy word. The banishment effect allows a Will save (at a -4 penalty) to negate.  Creatures whose HD exceed your caster level are unaffected by holy word.

Name: Horizikaul's Boom
Short Description: Target takes 1d4/two levels sonic damage plus deafness.

Name: Horrible Taste
Short Description: Attackers that bite you must make a Fort save or be Nauseated for 1 full round.

Name: Horrid Wilting
Effect: Living creatures, no two of which can be more than 60 ft. apart
Short Description: Deals 1d6/level damage within 30 ft.
Long Descripton: This spell evaporates moisture from the body of each subject living creature, dealing 1d6 points of damage per caster level (maximum 20d6). This spell is especially devastating to water elementals and plant creatures, which instead take 1d8 points of damage per caster level (maximum 20d8).

Name: Hound of Doom
Short Description: Create a shadow dire wolf that serves you.

Name: Howling Chain
Short Description: Chain of force entangles and attacks opponent.

Name: Humanoid Essence
Short Description: Imposes upon a construct some of the weakness of the humanoid type.

Name: Humanoid Essence, Greater
Short Description: Gives a construct the humanoid type.

Name: Humanoid Essence, Lesser
Short Description: Grants a construct the ability to accept healing magic.

Name: Hungry Gizzard
Short Description: Gizzard engulfs victim, grapples and deals damage.
Medium Description: Gizzard engulfs victim, grapples and deals 2d8+8 crushing damage and 1d8 acid damage per round. Victim must deal 25 point of damage to cut itself free.

Name: Hunter's Mercy
Short Description: Your next attack with a bow automatically is a critical hit if you hit.

Name: Hunters of Hades
Effect: Two summoned pack fiends, which can be no more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Summons a pair of pack fiends or a Retriever to follow your commands.

Name: Hurl
Short Description: Thrown weapon returns to thrower.

Name: Hurtling Stone
Short Description: Stone deals 6d6 damage, knocks targets prone.

Name: Hydrate
Short Description: Heals dessication damage.  Heals 2d8 + 1/level (max +10) damage.

Name: Hymn of Praise
Short Description: Grants +2 caster level to good-aligned divine spellcasters.

Name: Hypnotic Pattern
Short Description: Fascinates (2d4 + level) HD of creatures.
Long Descripton: A twisting pattern of subtle, shifting colors weaves through the air, fascinating creatures within it. Roll 2d4 and add your caster level (maximum 10) to determine the total number of Hit Dice of creatures affected. Creatures with the fewest HD are affected first; and, among creatures with equal HD, those who are closest to the spells point of origin are affected first. Hit Dice that are not sufficient to affect a creature are wasted. Affected creatures become fascinated by the pattern of colors. Sightless creatures are not affected.[lf][lf]A wizard or sorcerer need not utter a sound to cast this spell, but a bard must sing, play music, or recite a rhyme as a verbal component.

Name: Hypnotism
Effect: Several living creatures, no two of which may be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Fascinates 2d4 HD of creatures.
Medium Description: 2d4 HD of creatures become 2 steps friendlier, obey reasonable orders, need not understand you. Creatures on combat get +2 to save, otherwise -2.
Long Descripton: Your gestures and droning incantation fascinate nearby creatures, causing them to stop and stare blankly at you. In addition, you can use their rapt attention to make your suggestions and requests seem more plausible. Roll 2d4 to see how many total Hit Dice of creatures you affect. Creatures with fewer HD are affected before creatures with more HD. Only creatures that can see or hear you are affected, but they do not need to understand you to be fascinated.[lf][lf]If you use this spell in combat, each target gains a +2 bonus on its saving throw. If the spell affects only a single creature not in combat at the time, the saving throw has a penalty of -2.[lf][lf]While the subject is fascinated by this spell, it reacts as though it were two steps more friendly in attitude. This allows you to make a single request of the affected creature (provided you can communicate with it). The request must be brief and reasonable. Even after the spell ends, the creature retains its new attitude toward you, but only with respect to that particular request.[lf][lf]A creature that fails its saving throw does not remember that you enspelled it.

Name: Hypothermia
Short Description: Causes 1d6 cold damage/level, fatigue.
Medium Description: Causes 1d6 cold damage/level (Max 10d6), fatigue.

Name: Ice Assassin
Short Description: Creates duplicate of creature with sole purpose to slay original.

Name: Ice Axe
Short Description: You create a battleaxe made of ice.
Medium Description: You create a battleaxe made of ice. It requires a melee touch attacks to hit and deals 2d12 +1/2 levels (max +10) points of cold damage.

Name: Ice Blast
Short Description: Deal 1d6/2 levels (max 10d6) cold damage in a cone.

Name: Ice Burst
Short Description: Chunks of ice deal 1d4 points of cold damage and 1 point of blunt damage/level (max 10d4 + 10).

Name: Ice Castle
Short Description: Creates castle of snow and ice with an array of magical effects.

Name: Ice Claw
Short Description: Claw of ice grapples and deals cold damage.
Medium Description: Claw of ice grapples with a grapple modifier of your caster level + your Int or Cha modifier + 7 for the claw's Strength (24). When grappling it deals 1d8 cold damage per round.

Name: Ice Claw Prison
Short Description: Ice claw grapples and deals normal and cold damage.

Name: Ice Dagger
Short Description: Splash weapon deals target 1d4 cold damage per level, plus area damage.
Medium Description: Splash deals target 1d4/level (max 5d4) cold damage, and 1 pt damage to any within 5 ft.

Name: Ice Darts
Short Description: Icicle missiles deal 2d4 damage, half of which is cold.
Medium Description: Icicle missiles deal 2d4 damage, half of which is cold damage.

Name: Ice Flowers
Short Description: Ice and earth deal 1d6 damage/level.
Medium Description: Ice and earth deal 1d6 damage/level and turn the ground into dense rubble (DMG 90).

Name: Ice Gauntlet
Short Description: A spiked gauntlet of ice forms around your fist.
Medium Description: A +1 spiked gauntlet of ice forms around your fist. It deals normal damage + 1d4 cold damage.

Name: Ice Knife
Short Description: Ranged attack, 1d8 points of cold damage and 2 cold Dexterity damage.
Medium Description: Ranged attack, 1d8 points of cold damage + 2 points Dex damage.

Name: Ice Rift
Short Description: Intense quake shakes 40-ft. radius spread of ice.

Name: Ice Shape
Effect: Ice touched, up to 10 cu. ft. + 1 cu. ft./level
Short Description: Sculpts ice into any shape.

Name: Ice Shield
Short Description: Subject gains damage reduction 15/—.

Name: Ice Ship
Short Description: Creates ice runner or ice galleon.

Name: Ice Skate
Short Description: While on ice, your speed increases by 60 feet.

Name: Ice Slick
Short Description: Creates a 20-ft. square of slippery ice.

Name: Ice Storm
Short Description: Hail deals 5d6 damage in cylinder 40 ft. across.
Medium Description: Hail deals 3d6 bludgeoning damage and 2d6 cold damage in cylinder 40 ft. across.
Long Descripton: Great magical hailstones pound down for 1 full round, dealing 3d6 points of bludgeoning damage and 2d6 points of cold damage to every creature in the area. A -4 penalty applies to each Listen check made within the ice storms effect, and all land movement within its area is at half speed. At the end of the duration, the hail disappears, leaving no after-effects (other than the damage dealt).

Name: Ice to Flesh
Effect: One frozen creature or a cylinder of ice from 1 ft. to 3 ft. in diameter and up to 10 ft. long
Short Description: Restores frozen creature.

Name: Ice Web
Effect: Webs of coldfire in a 20-ft.-radius spread
Short Description: Creates webs of coldfire that entangle and deal 1d6 frostburn damage/round.

Name: Iceberg
Saving Throw: None or Reflex half; see text
Short Description: Block of ice falls from sky, dealing 20d6 damage and burying subjects.

Name: Icebolt
Short Description: Ranged attack against a target with a piercing ice sicle for 2d6 piercing damage +1d6 + 1/level (max +10) cold damage.  If a touch attack would hit, deal only the cold damage.
Medium Description: Ranged attack with icicle for 2d6 piercing damage +1d6 +1/level (max +10) cold damage. Deals only cold damage if a touch attack would hit.

Name: Icelance
Short Description: Changes ice into lance, which attacks target for 6d6 damage and stuns for 1d4 rounds.
Medium Description: Changes ice into lance, which attacks target for 6d6 (half piercing, half cold) damage and stuns for 1d4 rounds.

Name: Icicle
Effect: One 10-ft. square section of ceiling or doorframe
Short Description: Magical trap hangs from ceiling, dealing 4d6 damage when triggered.
Medium Description: Magical trap hangs from ceiling, dealing 4d6 piercing damage when triggered.

Name: Identify
Short Description: Determines properties of magic item.
Long Descripton: The spell determines all magic properties of a single magic item, including how to activate those functions (if appropriate), and how many charges are left (if any).[lf][lf]Identify does not function when used on an artifact.

Name: Identify Transgressor
Short Description: You learn the identity of one person.

Name: Illusion Purge
Short Description: Dispels illusions within 5 ft./level.

Name: Illusory Feast
Short Description: Subjects become dazed by illusory food.

Name: Illusory Pit
Short Description: Illusiory pit causes creature to believe it is falling helplessly and stuns for 1 round when done.

Name: Illusory Script
Effect: One touched object weighing no more than 10 lb.
Short Description: Only intended reader can decipher.
Long Descripton: You write instructions or other information on parchment, paper, or any suitable writing material. The illusory script appears to be some form of foreign or magical writing. Only the person (or people) designated by you at the time of the casting are able to read the writing; it's unintelligible to any other character, although an illusionist recognizes it as illusory script.[lf][lf]Any unauthorized creature attempting to read the script triggers a potent illusory effect and must make a saving throw. A successful saving throw means the creature can look away with only a mild sense of disorientation. Failure means the creature is subject to a suggestion implanted in the script by you at the time the illusory script spell was cast. The suggestion lasts only 30 minutes. Typical suggestions include Close the book and leave, Forget the existence of the book, and so forth. If successfully dispelled by dispel magic, the illusory script and its secret message disappear. The hidden message can be read by a combination of the true seeing spell with the read magic or comprehend languages spell.[lf][lf]The casting time depends on how long a message you wish to write, but it is always at least 1 minute.

Name: Illusory Wall
Effect: Image 1 ft. by 10 ft. by 10 ft.
Short Description: Wall, floor, or ceiling looks real, but anything can pass through.
Long Descripton: This spell creates the illusion of a wall, floor, ceiling, or similar surface. It appears absolutely real when viewed, but physical objects can pass through it without difficulty. When the spell is used to hide pits, traps, or normal doors, any detection abilities that do not require sight work normally. Touch or a probing search reveals the true nature of the surface, though such measures do not cause the illusion to disappear.

Name: Ilyykur's Mantle
Short Description: Aura grants +1/three levels against spells and spell-like abilities and resistance to electricity 10.

Name: Imbrue
Short Description: Bind a creature from a planar binding into a living host.

Name: Imbue Familiar with Spell Ability
Short Description: You transfer spells to your familiar.

Name: Imbue Guardian
Short Description: A guardian gains bonuses to a 100-foot radius area.

Name: Imbue with Spell Ability
Short Description: Transfer spells to subject.
Long Descripton: You transfer some of your currently prepared spells, and the ability to cast them, to another creature. Only a creature with an Intelligence score of at least 5 and a Wisdom score of at least 9 can receive this bestowal. Only cleric spells from the schools of abjuration, divination, and conjuration (healing) can be transferred. The number and level of spells that the subject can be granted depends on its Hit Dice; even multiple castings of imbue with spell ability can't exceed this limit.[lf][lf]HD of Recipient, Spells Imbued[lf][lf]2 or lower, One 1st-level spell[lf][lf]3-4, One or two 1st-level spells[lf][lf]5 or higher, One or two 1st-level spells and one 2nd-level spell[lf][lf]The transferred spells variable characteristics (range, duration, area, and the like) function according to your level, not the level of the recipient.[lf][lf]Once you cast imbue with spell ability, you cannot prepare a new 4th-level spell to replace it until the recipient uses the imbued spells or is slain, or until you dismiss the imbue with spell ability spell. In the meantime, you remain responsible to your deity or your principles for the use to which the spell is put. If the number of 4th-level spells you can cast decreases, and that number drops below your current number of active imbue with spell ability spells, the more recently cast imbued spells are dispelled.[lf][lf]To cast a spell with a verbal component, the subject must be able to speak. To cast a spell with a somatic component, it must have humanlike hands. To cast a spell with a material component or focus, it must have the materials or focus.

Name: Impede Sun's Brilliance
Short Description: Diminishes the heat and light of the sun in an area.

Name: Imperious Glare
Effect: One living creature/level, no two of which may be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: You cause targets to cower in fear.

Name: Implacable Pursuer
Short Description: You know where prey is, as long as it's moving.

Name: Implore
Effect: One elemental or outsider with 22 HD or less
Short Description: Call and trap an elemental or outsider of 24 HD using its true name.

Name: Implosion
Short Description: Kills one creature/round.
Long Descripton: You create a destructive resonance in a corporeal creatures body. For each round you concentrate, you cause one creature to collapse in on itself, killing it. (This effect, being instantaneous, cannot be dispelled.)[lf][lf]You can target a particular creature only once with each casting of the spell.[lf][lf]Implosion has no effect on creatures in gaseous form or on incorporeal creatures.

Name: Impotent Possessor
Short Description: Subject that can possess creatures is rendered powerless.

Name: Imprison Possessor
Effect: One possessing creature and its host
Short Description: Subject that can possess creatures is trapped in current body.

Name: Imprison Soul
Short Description: Traps soul in a small object, and victim takes 1d4 Con damage per day.

Name: Imprisonment
Short Description: Entombs subject beneath the earth.
Long Descripton: When you cast imprisonment and touch a creature, it is entombed in a state of suspended animation (see the temporal stasis spell) in a small sphere far beneath the surface of the earth. The subject remains there unless a freedom spell is cast at the locale where the imprisonment took place. Magical search by a crystal ball, a locate object spell, or some other similar divination does not reveal the fact that a creature is imprisoned, but discern location does. A wish or miracle spell will not free the recipient, but will reveal where it is entombed. If you know the targets name and some facts about its life, the target takes a -4 penalty on its save.

Name: Improvisation
Short Description: Applies +2 points/level of luck bonuses to selected checks or attacks.

Name: Incarnate Construct
Short Description: Turns construct into living creature.

Name: Incarnation of Evil
Short Description: As polymorph except only into crocodile, jackal, medium scorpion, or Medium viper.

Name: Incendiary Cloud
Effect: Cloud spreads in 20-ft. radius, 20 ft. high
Short Description: Cloud deals 4d6 fire damage/round.
Long Descripton: An incendiary cloud spell creates a cloud of roiling smoke shot through with white-hot embers. The smoke obscures all sight as a fog cloud does. In addition, the white-hot embers within the cloud deal 4d6 points of fire damage to everything within the cloud on your turn each round. All targets can make Reflex saves each round to take half damage.[lf][lf]As with a cloudkill spell, the smoke moves away from you at 10 feet per round. Figure out the smokes new spread each round based on its new point of origin, which is 10 feet farther away from where you were when you cast the spell. By concentrating, you can make the cloud (actually its point of origin) move as much as 60 feet each round. Any portion of the cloud that would extend beyond your maximum range dissipates harmlessly, reducing the remainders spread thereafter.[lf][lf]As with fog cloud, wind disperses the smoke, and the spell can't be cast underwater.

Name: Incite
Short Description: Subject can't ready actions or delay.

Name: Incite Riot
Effect: 1 creature/level, each less than 30' from another
Short Description: Subjects attack nearest creature.
Medium Description: Subjects attack adjacent friendor foe, or charge/move to nearest creature to attack.

Name: Incorporeal Enhancement
Short Description: Grant bonuses to incorporeal undead.

Name: Incorporeal Nova
Effect: Incorporeal or gaseous creatures within a 50-ft.-radius burst
Short Description: Destroy incorporeal undead.

Name: Indifference
Short Description: Makes subject resistant to fear, compulsion, and morale effects.

Name: Indisputable Possession
Short Description: Call an item back to your hand if it leaves your possession.

Name: Indomitability
Short Description: Subject can't be reduced below 1 hp.

Name: Inescapable Swarm
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 feet apart.
Saving Throw: Will disbelief (if interacted with), then Fortitude partial; see text
Short Description: Targets feel as though they are covered by an invisible swarm of insects.

Name: Inevitable Defeat
Short Description: Subject takes 3d6 nonlethal damage/round.
Medium Description: Target takes 3d6 nonlethal damage (no save), then 3d6/round thereafter (with save). Spell ends if subject saves.

Name: Infernal Threnody
Effect: A sphere-shaped emanation with a radius equal to the range, centered on you
Short Description: Grants +2 caster level to evil-aligned divine spellcasters.

Name: Infernal Transformation
Short Description: You change into bone devil, gain abilities.

Name: Infernal Transformation, Lesser
Short Description: You change into bearded devil, gain abilities.

Name: Infernal Wound
Short Description: Weapon inflicts persistent, bleeding wounds.

Name: Inferno
Saving Throw: Fortitude negates and Reflex partial; see text
Short Description: Creature bursts into flames and suffers 6d6 fire damage or less per round.

Name: Infestation of Maggots
Short Description: Maggotlike creatures deal 1d4 temporary Con damage every round

Name: Inflict Critical Damage
Short Description: Deals 4d8 + 1/level damage (maximum +20) to a construct.

Name: Inflict Critical Wounds
Short Description: Touch attack, 4d8 damage +1/level (max +20).
Long Descripton: When laying your hand upon a creature, you channel negative energy that deals 4d8 points of damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +20).[lf][lf]Since undead are powered by negative energy, this spell cures such a creature of a like amount of damage, rather than harming it.

Name: Inflict Critical Wounds, Mass
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Deals 4d8 damage +1/level to many creatures.
Long Descripton: Negative energy spreads out in all directions from the point of origin, dealing 4d8 points of damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +40) to nearby living enemies.[lf][lf]Like other inflict spells, mass inflict light wounds cures undead in its area rather than damaging them. A cleric capable of spontaneously casting inflict spells can also spontaneously cast mass inflict spells.

Name: Inflict Light Damage
Short Description: Deals 1d8 + 1/level damage (maximum +5) to a construct.

Name: Inflict Light Damage, Mass
Effect: One construct/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Deals 1d8 damage +1/level to many constructs.
Medium Description: Deals 1d8 damage +1/level (max +25) to many constructs.

Name: Inflict Light Wounds
Short Description: Touch deals 1d8 damage +1/level (max +5).
Long Descripton: When laying your hand upon a creature, you channel negative energy that deals 1d8 points of damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +5).[lf][lf]Since undead are powered by negative energy, this spell cures such a creature of a like amount of damage, rather than harming it.

Name: Inflict Light Wounds, Mass
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Deals 1d8 damage +1/level to many creatures.
Long Descripton: Negative energy spreads out in all directions from the point of origin, dealing 1d8 points of damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +25) to nearby living enemies.[lf][lf]Like other inflict spells, mass inflict light wounds cures undead in its area rather than damaging them. A cleric capable of spontaneously casting inflict spells can also spontaneously cast mass inflict spells.

Name: Inflict Minor Wounds
Short Description: Touch attack, 1 point of damage.
Long Descripton: When laying your hand upon a creature, you channel negative energy that deals 1 point of damage.[lf][lf]Since undead are powered by negative energy, this spell cures such a creature of a like amount of damage, rather than harming it.

Name: Inflict Moderate Damage
Short Description: Deals 2d8 + 1/level damage (maximum +10) to a construct.

Name: Inflict Moderate Damage, Mass
Effect: One construct/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Deals 2d8 damage +1/level to many constructs.
Medium Description: Deals 2d8 damage +1/level (max +30) to many constructs.

Name: Inflict Moderate Wounds
Short Description: Touch attack, 2d8 damage +1/level (max +10).
Long Descripton: When laying your hand upon a creature, you channel negative energy that deals 2d8 points of damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +10).[lf][lf]Since undead are powered by negative energy, this spell cures such a creature of a like amount of damage, rather than harming it.

Name: Inflict Moderate Wounds, Mass
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Deals 2d8 damage +1/level to many creatures.
Medium Description: Deals 2d8 damage +1/level (max +30) to many creatures.
Long Descripton: Negative energy spreads out in all directions from the point of origin, dealing 2d8 points of damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +30) to nearby living enemies.[lf][lf]Like other inflict spells, mass inflict light wounds cures undead in its area rather than damaging them. A cleric capable of spontaneously casting inflict spells can also spontaneously cast mass inflict spells.

Name: Inflict Serious Damage
Short Description: Deals 3d8 + 1/level damage (maximum +15) to a construct.

Name: Inflict Serious Wounds
Short Description: Touch attack, 3d8 damage +1/level (max +15).
Long Descripton: When laying your hand upon a creature, you channel negative energy that deals 3d8 points of damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +15).[lf][lf]Since undead are powered by negative energy, this spell cures such a creature of a like amount of damage, rather than harming it.

Name: Inflict Serious Wounds, Mass
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Deals 3d8 damage +1/level to many creatures.
Medium Description: Deals 3d8 damage +1/level (max +35) to many creatures.
Long Descripton: Negative energy spreads out in all directions from the point of origin, dealing 3d8 points of damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +35) to nearby living enemies.[lf][lf]Like other inflict spells, mass inflict light wounds cures undead in its area rather than damaging them. A cleric capable of spontaneously casting inflict spells can also spontaneously cast mass inflict spells.

Name: Inhibit
Short Description: Subject delays until next round.

Name: Inky Cloud
Effect: Cloud that spreads underwater in a 30-ft. radius, centered on you
Short Description: Obscures sight underwater beyond 5 ft.

Name: Inquisition
Effect: One creature with an Intelligence of 6 or more
Short Description: Compels target to divuldge information truthfully.

Name: Insanity
Short Description: Subject suffers continuous confusion.
Long Descripton: The affected creature suffers from a continuous confusion effect, as the spell.[lf][lf]Remove curse does not remove insanity. restoration, Greater, heal, limited wish, miracle, or wish can restore the creature.

Name: Insect Plague
Effect: One swarm of locusts per three levels, each of which must be adjacent to at least one other swarm
Short Description: Locust swarms attack creatures.
Long Descripton: You summon a number of swarms of locusts (one per three levels, to a maximum of six swarms at 18th level). The swarms must be summoned so that each one is adjacent to at least one other swarm (that is, the swarms must fill one contiguous area). You may summon the locust swarms so that they share the area of other creatures. Each swarm attacks any creatures occupying its area. The swarms are stationary after being summoned, and won't pursue creatures that flee.

Name: Insidious Insight
Short Description: Gain insight bonus on Bluff, Diplomacy, Intimidate, and Sense Motive against affected creature.
Medium Description: Gain +10 insight bonus on Bluff, Diplomacy, Intimidate, and Sense Motive against affected creature.

Name: Insidious Rhythm
Short Description: Implants melody in subject's mind; -4 penalty on Concentration checks, requires Concentration check for spellcasting.

Name: Insidious Suggestion
Short Description: Suggestion repeats over and over in creature's mind.

Name: Insightful Feint
Short Description: Swift. Gain +10 on your next Bluff check to feint in combat.

Name: Insignia of Alarm
Effect: All wearers of special insignia within range
Short Description: Alert bearers of special insignia.

Name: Insignia of Blessing
Effect: All wearers of special insignia within range
Short Description: Bearers of special insignia gain +1 bonus on attack rolls and saves against fear.

Name: Insignia of Healing
Effect: All wearers of special insignia within range
Short Description: Bearers of special insignia healed of 1d8 damage +1 point/level (max. +10).

Name: Insignia of Warding
Effect: All wearers of special insignia within range
Short Description: Bearers of special insignia gain +1 to AC, Fortitude saves.

Name: Inspirational Boost
Short Description: Swift. The bonuses granted by your inspire courage ability increase by 1

Name: Inspired Aim
Effect: Allies with 40-ft.-radius emanation centered on you
Short Description: Allies within 40 ft. gain +2 insight bonus on ranged attack rolls.

Name: Instant Diversion
Short Description: Creates illusory doubles of you.
Medium Description: Creates 1 illusory double + 1 illusory double/4 levels (max 5).

Name: Instant Locksmith
Short Description: Swift. Make Disable Device or Open Lock check at +2 as free action.

Name: Instant Refuge
Short Description: Enhanced contingency spell teleports you under six possible conditions.

Name: Instant Search
Short Description: Swift. Make Search check at +2 as free action.

Name: Instant Summons
Effect: One object weighing 10 lb. or less whose longest dimension is 6 ft. or less
Short Description: Prepared object appears in your hand.
Long Descripton: You call some nonliving item from virtually any location directly to your hand.[lf][lf]First, you must place your arcane mark on the item. Then you cast this spell, which magically and invisibly inscribes the name of the item on a sapphire worth at least 1,000 gp. Thereafter, you can summon the item by speaking a special word (set by you when the spell is cast) and crushing the gem. The item appears instantly in your hand. Only you can use the gem in this way.[lf][lf]If the item is in the possession of another creature, the spell does not work, but you know who the possessor is and roughly where that creature is located when the summons occurs.[lf][lf]The inscription on the gem is invisible. It is also unreadable, except by means of a read magic spell, to anyone but you.[lf][lf]The item can be summoned from another plane, but only if no other creature has claimed ownership of it.

Name: Internal Fire
Effect: Up to 1 HD/level of creatures, no two of which can be more than 20 ft. apart
Short Description: Subject dies or takes 6d6 +1 (max +20) fire damage.

Name: Interplanar Message
Short Description: Send a limited message of 25 words or less to the targeted creature, who may be on another plane.

Name: Interposing Hand
Short Description: Hand provides cover against one opponent.
Long Descripton: Interposing hand creates a Large magic hand that appears between you and one opponent. This floating, disembodied hand then moves to remain between the two of you, regardless of where you move or how the opponent tries to get around it, providing cover (+4 AC) for you against that opponent. Nothing can fool the hand, it sticks with the selected opponent in spite of darkness, invisibility, polymorphing, or any other attempt at hiding or disguise. The hand does not pursue an opponent, however.[lf][lf]An interposing hand is 10 feet long and about that wide with its fingers outstretched. It has as many hit points as you do when you're undamaged, and its AC is 20 (1 size, +11 natural). It takes damage as a normal creature, but most magical effects that don't cause damage do not affect it.[lf][lf]The hand never provokes attacks of opportunity from opponents. It cannot push through a wall of force or enter an antimagic field, but it suffers the full effect of a prismatic wall or prismatic sphere. The hand makes saving throws as its caster.[lf][lf]Disintegrate or a successful dispel magic destroys it.[lf][lf]Any creature weighing 2,000 pounds or less that tries to push past the hand is slowed to half its normal speed. The hand cannot reduce the speed of a creature weighing more than 2,000 pounds, but it still affects the creatures attacks.[lf][lf]Directing the spell to a new target is a move action

Name: Invisibility
Effect: You or a creature or object weighing no more than 100 lb./level
Saving Throw: Will negates (harmless) or Will negates (harmless, object)
Short Description: Subject is invisible for 1 min./level or until it attacks.
Long Descripton: The creature or object touched becomes invisible, vanishing from sight, even from darkvision. If the recipient is a creature carrying gear, that vanishes, too. If you cast the spell on someone else, neither you nor your allies can see the subject, unless you can normally see invisible things or you employ magic to do so.[lf][lf]Items dropped or put down by an invisible creature become visible; items picked up disappear if tucked into the clothing or pouches worn by the creature. Light, however, never becomes invisible, although a source of light can become so (thus, the effect is that of a light with no visible source). Any part of an item that the subject carries but that extends more than 10 feet from it becomes visible.[lf][lf]Of course, the subject is not magically silenced, and certain other conditions can render the recipient detectable (such as stepping in a puddle). The spell ends if the subject attacks any creature. For purposes of this spell, an attack includes any spell targeting a foe or whose area or effect includes a foe. (Exactly who is a foe depends on the invisible characters perceptions.) Actions directed at unattended objects do not break the spell. Causing harm indirectly is not an attack. Thus, an invisible being can open doors, talk, eat, climb stairs, summon monsters and have them attack, cut the ropes holding a rope bridge while enemies are on the bridge, remotely trigger traps, open a portcullis to release attack dogs, and so forth. If the subject attacks directly, however, it immediately becomes visible along with all its gear. Spells such as bless that specifically affect allies but not foes are not attacks for this purpose, even when they include foes in their area.[lf][lf]Invisibility can be made permanent (on objects only) with a permanency spell.

Name: Invisibility Purge
Short Description: Dispels invisibility within 5 ft./level.
Long Descripton: You surround yourself with a sphere of power with a radius of 5 feet per caster level that negates all forms of invisibility.[lf][lf]Anything invisible becomes visible while in the area.

Name: Invisibility Sphere
Effect: 10-ft.-radius emanation around the creature or object touched
Saving Throw: Will negates (harmless) or Will negates (harmless, object)
Short Description: Makes everyone within 10 ft. invisible.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like invisibility, except that this spell confers invisibility upon all creatures within 10 feet of the recipient. The center of the effect is mobile with the recipient.[lf][lf]Those affected by this spell can see each other and themselves as if unaffected by the spell. Any affected creature moving out of the area becomes visible, but creatures moving into the area after the spell is cast do not become invisible. Affected creatures (other than the recipient) who attack negate the invisibility only for themselves. If the spell recipient attacks, the invisibility sphere ends.

Name: Invisibility, Greater
Short Description: As invisibility, but subject can attack and stay invisible.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like invisibility, except that it doesnt end if the subject attacks.

Name: Invisibility, Mass
Effect: Any number of creatures, no two of which can be more than 180 ft. apart
Saving Throw: Will negates (harmless) or Will negates (harmless, object)
Short Description: As invisibility, but affects all in range.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like invisibility, except that the effect is mobile with the group and is broken when anyone in the group attacks. Individuals in the group cannot see each other. The spell is broken for any individual who moves more than 180 feet from the nearest member of the group. (If only two individuals are affected, the one moving away from the other one loses its invisibility. If both are moving away from each other, they both become visible when the distance between them exceeds 180 feet.)

Name: Invisibility, Minor
Effect: You or a creature or object weighing no more than 100 lb./level
Saving Throw: Will negates (harmless) or Will negates (harmless, object)
Short Description: As invisibility, except as noted above and that the spell ends at the end of your turn on the round it was cast.
Long Descripton: As invisibility, except as noted above and that the spell ends at the end of your turn on the round it was cast.

Name: Invisibility, Superior
Effect: You or a creature or object weighing no more than 100lb./level
Short Description: As invisibility, greater, except you make no scent, sound, or image.

Name: Invisibility, Swift
Short Description: Invisibility lasts 1 round (swift).

Name: Invoke Elemental
Effect: Vehicle with a bound elemental touched
Short Description: You temporarily release a bound elemental and compel it to obey you.

Name: Invoke Magic
Short Description: Momentarily negate antimagic effects.

Name: Invoke the Cerulean Sign
Effect: Multiple aberrations whose combined total Hit Dice do not exceed twice caster level in a spread emanating from the character to the extreme of the range
Short Description: Aberrations become sickened, nauseated, dazed, or stunned.

Name: Involuntary Shapeshifting
Short Description: If able to do so, target creature must change shape.
Medium Description: If able to do so, target creature must change shape each round. Each time it changes shape, it takes 1/level (max 15) points of damage.

Name: Irian's Light
Short Description: Ranged touch attack heals 2d8 damage, +1 ray/four levels (max 3).
Medium Description: Ranged touch attack heals 2d8 damage, +1 ray/four levels beyond 3rd (max 3 rays).

Name: Iron Body
Short Description: Your body becomes living iron.
Long Descripton: This spell transforms your body into living iron, which grants you several powerful resistances and abilities.[lf][lf]You gain damage reduction 15/adamantine. You are immune to blindness, critical hits, ability score damage, deafness, disease, drowning, electricity, poison, stunning, and all spells or attacks that affect your physiology or respiration, because you have no physiology or respiration while this spell is in effect. You take only half damage from acid and fire of all kinds. However, you also become vulnerable to all special attacks that affect iron golems.[lf][lf]You gain a +6 enhancement bonus to your Strength score, but you take a -6 penalty to Dexterity as well (to a minimum Dexterity score of 1), and your speed is reduced to half normal. You have an arcane spell failure chance of 50% and a -8 armor check penalty, just as if you were clad in full plate armor. You cannot drink (and thus can't use potions) or play wind instruments.[lf][lf]Your unarmed attacks deal damage equal to a club sized for you (1d4 for Small characters or 1d6 for Medium characters), and you are considered armed when making unarmed attacks.[lf][lf]Your weight increases by a factor of ten, causing you to sink in water like a stone. However, you could survive the crushing pressure and lack of air at the bottom of the oceanat least until the spell duration expires.

Name: Iron Bones
Short Description: Corporeal undead gains +6 natural armor bonus.

Name: Iron Construct
Short Description: Construct gains DR 15/adamantine and takes half damage from acid and fire.

Name: Iron Scarf
Short Description: Scarf deals 1d8 +1 (max +5) damage to target.

Name: Iron Silence
Effect: One suit of armor touched per three levels
Short Description: Armor touched has no armor check penalty on Hide and Move Silently checks for 1 hour/level.

Name: Ironguard
Short Description: Subject becomes immune to both magical and mundane metal.

Name: Ironguard, Lesser
Short Description: Subject becomes immune to nonmagical metal.

Name: Ironguts
Short Description: Target gains +5 bonus on saving throws against poison.

Name: Ironthunder Horn
Short Description: Intense vibrations trip those in area.

Name: Ironwood
Effect: An ironwood object weighing up to 5 lb./level
Short Description: Magic wood is strong as steel.
Long Descripton: Ironwood is a magical substance created by druids from normal wood. While remaining natural wood in almost every way, ironwood is as strong, heavy, and resistant to fire as steel. Spells that affect metal or iron do not function on ironwood. Spells that affect wood do affect ironwood, although ironwood does not burn. Using this spell with wood shape or a wood-related Craft check, you can fashion wooden items that function as steel items. Thus, wooden plate armor and wooden swords can be created that are as durable as their normal steel counterparts. These items are freely usable by druids.[lf][lf]Further, if you make only half as much ironwood as the spell would normally allow, any weapon, shield, or suit of armor so created is treated as a magic item with a +1 enhancement bonus.

Name: Irresistible Dance
Short Description: Forces subject to dance.
Long Descripton: The subject feels an undeniable urge to dance and begins doing so, complete with foot shuffling and tapping. The spell effect makes it impossible for the subject to do anything other than caper and prance in place. The effect imposes a -4 penalty to Armor Class and a -10 penalty on Reflex saves, and it negates any AC bonus granted by a shield the target holds. The dancing subject provokes attacks of opportunity each round on its turn.

Name: Item Alteration
Short Description: Item that provides a certain type of bonus provides a different type of bonus to the same value or roll.

Name: Ivory Flesh
Short Description: Flesh turns white, granting +5 circumstance bonus on Hide checks in snow and ice.

Name: Jagged Tooth
Effect: One natural slashing or piercing weapon of target creature
Short Description: Doubles the critical threat range of natural weapons.

Name: Jaws of the Moray
Short Description: Subject gains a bite attack.

Name: Jaws of the Wolf
Short Description: One carving/2 levels turns into a worg.

Name: Jig of the Waves
Effect: One or more creatures in a 10-ft.-radius burst
Short Description: Force creatures to dance a jig which causes penalties and forces random movement.

Name: Joyful Noise
Short Description: You negate silence in a 10-ft.-radius emanation for as long as you concentrate.

Name: Jump
Short Description: Subject gets bonus on Jump checks.
Long Descripton: The subject gets a +10 enhancement bonus on Jump checks. The enhancement bonus increases to +20 at caster level 5th, and to +30 (the maximum) at caster level 9th.

Name: Jungle's Rapture
Short Description: Curse causes 1d6 Dexterity drain.
Medium Description: Curse causes 1d6 Dexterity drain per day.

Name: Junglerazer
Short Description: Fey, vermin, plants, and animals take 1d10 damage/level.
Medium Description: Fey, vermin, plants, and animals take 1d10 damage/level (max 10d10).

Name: Kaupaer's Quickblast
Short Description: Quickened spell deals 1 fire, cold or electricity damage/level to target.

Name: Kaupaer's Reflexive Strike
Short Description: Subject gains one extra attack of opportunity to use during the duration of the spell, usable even while flat-footed.

Name: Keen Edge
Effect: One weapon or fifty projectiles, all of which must be in contact with each other at the time of casting
Short Description: Doubles normal weapons threat range.
Long Descripton: This spell makes a weapon magically keen, improving its ability to deal telling blows. This transmutation doubles the threat range of the weapon. A threat range of 20 becomes 19-20, a threat range of 19-20 becomes 17-20, and a threat range of 18-20 becomes 15-20. The spell can be cast only on piercing or slashing weapons. If cast on arrows or crossbow bolts, the keen edge on a particular projectile ends after one use, whether or not the missile strikes its intended target. (Treat shuriken as arrows, rather than as thrown weapons, for the purpose of this spell.)[lf][lf]Multiple effects that increase a weapons threat range (such as the keen edge spell and the Improved Critical feat) dont stack. You can't cast this spell on a natural weapon, such as a claw.

Name: Kelgore's Fire Bolt
Short Description: 1d6 fire damage/level (max 5d6), partially ignore SR.
Medium Description: 1d6 fire damage/CL (max 5d6), but only 1d6 if you fail to overcome SR.

Name: Kelpstrand
Effect: One strand of animated kelp/3 levels
Short Description: Ranged touch attack to special grapple with kelp.

Name: Khyber Trap
Short Description: Trap extraplanar creature within a Khyber dragonshard.

Name: Kiss of the Toad
Short Description: Your touch becomes poisonous dealing 1d6 Con damage secondary 1d6 Con.

Name: Kiss of the Vampire
Short Description: You gain vampire-like supernatural abilities, but are vulnerable to attacks that harm undead.

Name: Knife Spray
Short Description: Cone of droplets, 1d6 and +1/level damage (max +5).

Name: Knight's Move
Short Description: You instantly move to flank a subject.
Medium Description: You instantly move up to 5 feet/2 levels, but must end up flanking an enemy.

Name: Knock
Effect: One door, box, or chest with an area of up to 10 sq. ft./level
Short Description: Opens locked or magically sealed door.
Long Descripton: The knock spell opens stuck, barred, locked, held, or arcane locked doors. It opens secret doors, as well as locked or trick-opening boxes or chests. It also loosens welds, shackles, or chains (provided they serve to hold closures shut). If used to open a arcane locked door, the spell does not remove the arcane lock but simply suspends its functioning for 10 minutes. In all other cases, the door does not relock itself or become stuck again on its own. Knock does not raise barred gates or similar impediments (such as a portcullis), nor does it affect ropes, vines, and the like. The effect is limited by the area. Each spell can undo as many as two means of preventing egress.

Name: Know Bloodline
Short Description: Reveals target's type, race, subrace, and all subtypes possessed.

Name: Know Direction
Short Description: You discern north.
Long Descripton: You instantly know the direction of north from your current position. The spell is effective in any environment in which north exists, but it may not work in extraplanar settings. Your knowledge of north is correct at the moment of casting, but you can get lost again within moments if you don't find some external reference point to help you keep track of direction.

Name: Know Greatest Enemy
Short Description: Determines relative power level of creatures within the area.

Name: Know Opponent
Short Description: Learn strengths and weaknesses of foe.
Medium Description: Learn one strength or weakness of a foe per 2 levels.

Name: Know Protections
Short Description: Determines target's defenses.

Name: Know Vulnerabilities
Short Description: Determine target's vulnerabilities and resistances.

Name: Kuo-Toa Skin
Short Description: Subject gains +8 on Escape Artist checks and cannot be snared by webs.

Name: Lahm's Finger Darts
Effect: Up to five creatures, no two of which can be more than 15 ft. apart
Short Description: Your fingers become projectiles that deal 1d4 Dex damage.

Name: Land Womb
Short Description: You and one creature/level hide within the earth.

Name: Languor
Short Description: Ray slows target and diminishes its Strength.

Name: Lantern Light
Short Description: Ranged touch attack deals 1d6 points of damage.

Name: Laogzed's Breath
Short Description: Nauseating vapors within cone persist for 10 rounds.

Name: Lash of the Kraken
Short Description: Transforms the target's arm into a constricting tentacle.

Name: Last Breath
Short Description: Returns to life a creature that has been dead no longer than 1 round.  As raise dead, except to 0 hp.  You take 1d4 damage/HD of creature.

Name: Last Judgment
Effect: One evil humanoid, monstrous humanoid, or giant/2 levels
Short Description: Evil creatures are struck dead and sent to Lower Planes.

Name: Lastai's Caress
Short Description: Intense feelings of good leave evil subject cowering, frightened, nauseated, or shaken.

Name: Launch Bolt
Effect: One crossbow bolt in your possession.
Short Description: Launches a crossbow bolt up to 800 feet.

Name: Launch Item
Effect: One Fine item in your possession, weighing up to 10 lb.
Short Description: Hurls fine item up to long range.

Name: Lava Missile
Effect: Up to five creatures, no two of which can be more than 15 ft. apart.
Short Description: 1d4 fire damage; 1 missile per two levels (max 5).
Medium Description: 1d4 fire damage; 1 missile/2 levels (max 5). Reflex save or catch fire.

Name: Lava Splash
Short Description: Wave of lava deals 1d4/level (max 15d4) fire damage.

Name: Lawful Sword
Short Description: Weapon becomes +5 axiomatic weapon and emits Magic Circle against Chaos.

Name: Lay of the Land
Short Description: You gain an overview of the geography around you.

Name: Leap Into Animal
Effect: You and one willing animal; see text
Short Description: Merge with animal and control its actions.

Name: Leech Ghost Skill
Short Description: Another creature can use a ghost's skill ranks instead of their own and the ghost is supressed.

Name: Leech Undeath
Short Description: Harm undead to gain temporary hit points.

Name: Legend Lore
Short Description: Lets you learn tales about a person, place, or thing.
Long Descripton: Legend lore brings to your mind legends about an important person, place, or thing. If the person or thing is at hand, or if you are in the place in question, the casting time is only 1d4x10 minutes. If you have only detailed information on the person, place, or thing, the casting time is 1d10 days, and the resulting lore is less complete and specific (though it often provides enough information to help you find the person, place, or thing, thus allowing a better legend lore result next time). If you know only rumors, the casting time is 2d6 weeks, and the resulting lore is vague and incomplete (though it often directs you to more detailed information, thus allowing a better legend lore result next time).[lf][lf]During the casting, you cannot engage in other than routine activities: eating, sleeping, and so forth. When completed, the divination brings legends (if any) about the person, place, or things to your mind. These may be legends that are still current, legends that have been forgotten, or even information that has never been generally known. If the person, place, or thing is not of legendary importance, you gain no information. As a rule of thumb, characters who are 11th level and higher are legendary, as are the sorts of creatures they contend with, the major magic items they wield, and the places where they perform their key deeds.

Name: Legion of Sentinels
Effect: 10-ft radius emanation centered on a point in space
Short Description: Ghostly swordsmen threaten a 10-foot radius, deal 1d8 damage +1/3 levels (max +5).
Medium Description: 1 incorporeal swordsman/square in 10' radius circle, BaB=CL, crit=19-20, AC=25, HP=2xCL, save bonus=CL, deal 1d8 slash damage +1/3 levels (max +5).

Name: Leomund's Billet
Short Description: Creates sturdy barracks.

Name: Leomund's Tiny Igloo
Effect: 5-ft.-radius sphere, with 1-in.-thick wall/level centered on your location
Short Description: Creates igloo that lasts for 2 hours/level.

Name: Leonal's Roar
Effect: Nongood creatures in a 40-ft.-radius spread centered on you
Short Description: Kills, paralyzes, weakens, or dazes nongood subjects, and deals 2d6 points of sonic damage.

Name: Levitate
Range: Personal or close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)
Effect: You or one willing creature or one object (total weight up to 100 lb./level)
Short Description: Subject moves up and down at your direction.
Long Descripton: Levitate allows you to move yourself, another creature, or an object up and down as you wish. A creature must be willing to be levitated, and an object must be unattended or possessed by a willing creature. You can mentally direct the recipient to move up or down as much as 20 feet each round; doing so is a move action. You cannot move the recipient horizontally, but the recipient could clamber along the face of a cliff, for example, or push against a ceiling to move laterally (generally at half its base land speed).[lf][lf]A levitating creature that attacks with a melee or ranged weapon finds itself increasingly unstable; the first attack has a 1 penalty on attack rolls, the second 2, and so on, to a maximum penalty of 5. A full round spent stabilizing allows the creature to begin again at 1.

Name: Life Bolt
Short Description: 1 ray/2 levels draws 1 hp from you to deal 2d4 damage to undead.
Medium Description: 1 ray/2 levels (max 5) draws 1 hp from you to deal 2d4 positive energy damage to undead.

Name: Life Ward
Short Description: Grants immunity to healing spells and positive energy effects.

Name: Life's Grace
Short Description: Grants immunity to death effects, energy drain, and negative energy effects.  Also grants ghost touch to armor.

Name: Light
Short Description: Object shines like a torch.
Long Descripton: This spell causes an object to glow like a torch, shedding bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light for an additional 20 feet) from the point you touch. The effect is immobile, but it can be cast on a movable object. Light taken into an area of magical darkness does not function.[lf][lf]A light spell (one with the light descriptor) counters and dispels a darkness spell (one with the darkness descriptor) of an equal or lower level.

Name: Light of Lunia
Effect: You and up to two rays; see text
Short Description: You radiate silvery light, which you can expend as 2 bolts that deal 1d8 damage.

Name: Light of Mercuria
Effect: You and up to two rays; see text
Short Description: You radiate golden light, which you can expend as 2 bolts that deal 2d6 damage, 4d6 against undead and evil outsiders.

Name: Light of Venya
Effect: You and up to two rays; see text
Short Description: You radiate silvery light, which you can expend as 2 bolts that either deal 6d6 against evil outsiders and undead or heal 1d6 points of damage.

Name: Lightfoot
Short Description: Your move does not provoke attacks of opportunity for 1 round (swift)

Name: Lightning Blade
Short Description: Electrical long sword deals 1d6/level (max 10d6) in touch attacks or range touch attacks (30 ft.) each attack using up dice from the limit.
Medium Description: Electrical long sword deals 1d6/level (max 10d6) electricity damage in touch attacks or range touch attacks (30 ft.) each attack using up dice from the limit.

Name: Lightning Bolt
Short Description: Electricity deals 1d6/level damage.
Medium Description: Deal 1d6/level (max 10d6) electricity damage.
Long Descripton: You release a powerful stroke of electrical energy that deals 1d6 points of electricity damage per caster level (maximum 10d6) to each creature within its area. The bolt begins at your fingertips.[lf][lf]The lightning bolt sets fire to combustibles and damages objects in its path. It can melt metals with a low melting point, such as lead, gold, copper, silver, or bronze. If the damage caused to an interposing barrier shatters or breaks through it, the bolt may continue beyond the barrier if the spells range permits; otherwise, it stops at the barrier just as any other spell effect does.

Name: Lightning Ring
Short Description: Ring of lightning gives you resistance to electricity 20, damages adjacent creatures, and emits two lightning bolts per round.
Medium Description: Ring of lightning gives you resistance to electricity 20, deals 10d6 electricity damage to adjacent creatures, and emits two lightning bolts per round.

Name: Lightwall
Effect: Wall whose area is up to one 10 ft. square/level or a sphere or hemisphere with a radius of up to 1 ft./level
Short Description: Creates a wall of light that dazzles creatures passing through it.

Name: Limited Wish
Short Description: Alters reality within spell limits.
Long Descripton: A limited wish lets you create nearly any type of effect. For example, a limited wish can do any of the following things.[lf][lf] Duplicate any sorcerer/wizard spell of 6th level or lower, provided the spell is not of a school prohibited to you.[lf][lf] Duplicate any other spell of 5th level or lower, provided the spell is not of a school prohibited to you.[lf][lf] Duplicate any sorcerer/wizard spell of 5th level or lower, even if its of a prohibited school.[lf][lf] Duplicate any other spell of 4th level or lower, even if its of a prohibited school.[lf][lf] Undo the harmful effects of many spells, such as geas/quest or insanity.[lf][lf] Produce any other effect whose power level is in line with the above effects, such as a single creature automatically hitting on its next attack or taking a -7 penalty on its next saving throw.[lf][lf]A duplicated spell allows saving throws and spell resistance as normal (but the save DC is for a 7th-level spell). When a limited wish duplicates a spell that has an XP cost, you must pay that cost or 300 XP, whichever is more. When a limited wish spell duplicates a spell with a material component that costs more than 1,000 gp, you must provide that component.

Name: Lion's Charge
Short Description: You gain the pounce special ability.

Name: Lion's Roar
Saving Throw: Will negates (harmless) or Fortitude partial; see text
Short Description: Deal 1d8 sonic damage to foes and grant a +1 morale bonus and 1d8 + 1/level (max +20) temporary hit points to allies.

Name: Lionheart
Short Description: The subject gains immunity to fear effects.

Name: Liquid Pain
Short Description: Extracts one dose of liquid pain from tortured victim.

Name: Listening Coin
Short Description: Allows remote eavesdropping.

Name: Listening Lorecall
Short Description: Gain +4 on Listen checks, plus blindsense or blindsight if you have 5 or more ranks in Listen.

Name: Lively Step
Short Description: You and allies gain +10 increase to speed and can hustle for an extra hour per day per level.

Name: Liveoak
Short Description: Oak becomes treant guardian.
Long Descripton: This spell turns an oak tree into a protector or guardian. The spell can be cast on only a single tree at a time; while liveoak is in effect, you can't cast it again on another tree. The tree on which the spell is cast must be within 10 feet of your dwelling place, within a place sacred to you, or within 300 feet of something that you wish to guard or protect.[lf][lf]Liveoak must be cast on a healthy, Huge oak. A triggering phrase of up to one word per caster level is placed on the targeted oak. The liveoak spell triggers the tree into animating as a treant. [lf][lf]If liveoak is dispelled, the tree takes root immediately, wherever it happens to be. If released by you, the tree tries to return to its original location before taking root.

Name: Living Prints
Short Description: You perceive tracks as if they had just been made.

Name: Living Undeath
Short Description: Subject becomes immune to critical hits and sneak attacks.

Name: Llenol's Hasty Spell Scriber
Effect: Scroll or spellbook source, and target spellbook.
Short Description: Inscribes spell into target spellbook from source scroll or spellbook.
Long Descripton: While casting this spell, you are enhanced to quickly understand and scribe a spell.  The first half hour of this spell casting time is spent studying the source spell from a spellbook or scroll.  A scroll used this way is destroyed at this point, even upon failure of the following check.  After this time, you must make a DC 30 + spell level Spellcraft check to see if you understand the spell.  If you succeed, you procceed to the second half of this spell.  If you fail, you take 1d6 temporary Intelligence damage, Fortitude save for half damage, and you cannot try to learn that spell until you gain at least one more rank in Spellcraft.  [lf][lf]Once you understand the spell.  The spell enhances your ability to scribe the spell into a spellbook.  At the end of the casting time, you take 2d6 points of nonleathal damage per spell level (minimum 1d6 for cantrips), Fortitude save for half damage.[lf][lf]The scribing process still uses up the normal amount of materials as usual for the spellbook.[lf][lf]If the spell source is one you scribed yourself, casting time and damages are halved.  You also automatically succeed on the spellcraft check.[lf][lf]Llenol started researching this spell once he realized he would not have the continous safety and time needed to maintain his spellbooks.

Name: Lobotomize
Short Description: You cause a target to forget how to use specific feats, skills, or spells.

Name: Local Tremor
Duration: 1 min./level or until expended; see text
Short Description: Light tremor shakes in a 30-ft. line.

Name: Locate City
Effect: 10 miles/level radius circle, centered on you
Short Description: Find nearest city.

Name: Locate Creature
Effect: Circle, centered on you, with a radius of 400 ft. + 40 ft./level
Short Description: Indicates direction to familiar creature.
Long Descripton: You sense the direction of a known or familiar creature. You slowly turn and sense when you are facing in the direction of the creature to be located, provided it is within range. You also know in which direction the creature is moving, if any.[lf][lf]The spell can locate a creature of a specific kind or a specific creature known to you. It cannot find a creature of a certain type. To find a kind of creature, you must have seen such a creature up close (within 30 feet) at least once.[lf][lf]Running water blocks the spell. It cannot detect objects. It can be fooled by mislead, nondetection, and polymorph spells.

Name: Locate Node
Effect: Circle, centered on you, with a radius of 1 mile/level (see text)
Short Description: Finds closest earth node in 1 mile/level radius.

Name: Locate Object
Effect: Circle, centered on you, with a radius of 400 ft. + 40 ft./level
Short Description: Senses direction toward object (specific or type).
Long Descripton: You sense the direction of a well-known or clearly visualized object. You can search for general items, in which case you locate the nearest one of its kind if more than one is within range. Attempting to find a certain item requires a specific and accurate mental image; if the image is not close enough to the actual object, the spell fails.
