You cannot specify a unique item unless you have observed that particular item firsthand (not through divination).[lf][lf]The spell is blocked by even a thin sheet of lead. Creatures cannot be found by this spell. Polymorph any object fools it.

Name: Locate Touchstone
Effect: Learn location of nearest planar touchstone.
Short Description: Find nearest planar touchstone on the plane you currently inhabit.

Name: Locate Water
Short Description: Reveals location, size, and quality of water sources.

Name: Longstrider
Short Description: Increases your speed.
Long Descripton: This spell increases your base land speed by 10 feet. (This adjustment counts as an enhancement bonus.) It has no effect on other modes of movement, such as burrow, climb, fly, or swim.

Name: Loresong
Short Description: You gain a bonus with one skill and can use it untrained.

Name: Love's Lament
Short Description: Creatures in 60-ft. cone take 1d6 Wisdom damage and are nauseated for 1d4 rounds.
Medium Description: Creatures in 60-ft. cone take 1d6 Wis damage and are nauseated for 1d4 rounds.

Name: Love's Pain
Short Description: Deals 1d6 damage/2 levels to subject's dearest loved one.

Name: Low-Light Vision
Short Description: Subject sees twice as far under current light.

Name: Lower Spell Resistance
Short Description: Subject's spell resistance reduced.

Name: Loyal Vassal
Short Description: Ally gains +3 against mind-affecting effects and cannot be compelled to harm you.

Name: Lucent Lance
Short Description: Ray uses ambient light to deal varied amounts of damage and dazzle target.

Name: Lucky Blade
Short Description: Weapon grants a single reroll of an attack.

Name: Lucky Cape
Short Description: Cape grants a single reroll of a saving throw.

Name: Lucky Streak
Short Description: Target gains +2 luck bonus on rerolls made with luck feats.

Name: Lullaby
Short Description: Makes subject drowsy; 5 on Spot and Listen checks, 2 on Will saves against sleep.
Long Descripton: Any creature within the area that fails a Will save becomes drowsy and inattentive, taking a -5 penalty on Listen and Spot checks and a -2 penalty on Will saves against sleep effects while the lullaby is in effect. Lullaby lasts for as long as the caster concentrates, plus up to 1 round per caster level thereafter.

Name: Luminous Armor
Short Description: Shimmering light around target grants +5 armor bonus, dispels magical darkness, and imposes a -4 penalty on opponents' melee attacks.

Name: Luminous Armor, Greater
Short Description: Shimmering light around target grants +8 armor bonus, dispels magical darkness, and imposes a -4 penalty on opponents' melee attacks.

Name: Luminous Gaze
Short Description: You cast a dazzling light.

Name: Mace of Odo
Short Description: Force effect damages target or absorbs spell.
Medium Description: 1d6/caster level (max 10d6) +1/level to undead (max +10) force damage or absorbs spell.

Name: Maddening Scream
Short Description: Subject has -4 AC, no shield, Reflex save on 20 only.
Long Descripton: This spell makes it impossible for the victim to do anything other than race about caterwauling. The creature must move its speed each turn, unless somehow prevented, and can take no other action. The spell gives the subject a –4 penalty to Armor Class, its Reflex saving throws fail except on a roll of 20, and the subject cannot use a shield.

Name: Maddening Whispers
Short Description: You induce confusion and madness in targets.

Name: Maelstrom
Effect: A whirlpool 120 ft. wide and 60 ft. deep
Short Description: Waterspout sucks in and damages creatures.
Medium Description: Waterspout sucks creatures in and inflicts 3d8 bludgeoning damage for 2d4 rounds.

Name: Mage Armor
Short Description: Gives subject +4 armor bonus.
Long Descripton: An invisible but tangible field of force surrounds the subject of a mage armor spell, providing a +4 armor bonus to AC.[lf][lf]Unlike mundane armor, mage armor entails no armor check penalty, arcane spell failure chance, or speed reduction. Since mage armor is made of force, incorporeal creatures can't bypass it the way they do normal armor.

Name: Mage Armor, Greater
Short Description: Field of force provides a +6 armor bonus.

Name: Mage Armor, Mass
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: As mage armor, but affects one creature/level.

Name: Mage Burr
Effect: One creature wearing armor or using a shield
Short Description: Double arcane spell failure chance for target's armor.
Medium Description: Target's armor suffers 2X arcane failure chance, target takes -5 penalty to Concentration checks.

Name: Mage Hand
Effect: One nonmagical, unattended object weighing up to 5 lb.
Short Description: 5-pound telekinesis.
Long Descripton: You point your finger at an object and can lift it and move it at will from a distance. As a move action, you can propel the object as far as 15 feet in any direction, though the spell ends if the distance between you and the object ever exceeds the spells range.

Name: Mage Hand, Greater
Effect: One object or creature weighing up to 40 lb.
Short Description: As mage hand, but medium range and 40 lb.

Name: Mage's Disjunction
Effect: All magical effects and magic items within a 40-ft.-radius burst
Short Description: Dispels magic, disenchants magic items.
Long Descripton: All magical effects and magic items within the radius of the spell, except for those that you carry or touch, are disjoined. That is, spells and spell-like effects are separated into their individual components (ending the effect as a dispel magic spell does), and each permanent magic item must make a successful Will save or be turned into a normal item. An item in a creatures possession uses its own Will save bonus or its possessors Will save bonus, whichever is higher.[lf][lf]You also have a 1% chance per caster level of destroying an antimagic field. If the antimagic field survives the disjunction, no items within it are disjoined.[lf][lf]Even artifacts are subject to disjunction, though there is only a 1% chance per caster level of actually affecting such powerful items. Additionally, if an artifact is destroyed, you must make a DC 25 Will save or permanently lose all spellcasting abilities. (These abilities cannot be recovered by mortal magic, not even miracle or wish.)[lf][lf]Note: Destroying artifacts is a dangerous business, and it is 95% likely to attract the attention of some powerful being who has an interest in or connection with the device.

Name: Mage's Faithful Hound
Short Description: Phantom dog can guard, attack.
Long Descripton: You conjure up a phantom watchdog that is invisible to everyone but yourself. It then guards the area where it was conjured (it does not move). The hound immediately starts barking loudly if any Small or larger creature approaches within 30 feet of it. (Those within 30 feet of the hound when it is conjured may move about in the area, but if they leave and return, they activate the barking.) The hound sees invisible and ethereal creatures. It does not react to figments, but it does react to shadow illusions.[lf][lf]If an intruder approaches to within 5 feet of the hound, the dog stops barking and delivers a vicious bite (+10 attack bonus, 2d6+3 points of piercing damage) once per round. The dog also gets the bonuses appropriate to an invisible creature.[lf][lf]The dog is considered ready to bite intruders, so it delivers its first bite on the intruders turn. Its bite is the equivalent of a magic weapon for the purpose of damage reduction. The hound cannot be attacked, but it can be dispelled.[lf][lf]The spell lasts for 1 hour per caster level, but once the hound begins barking, it lasts only 1 round per caster level. If you are ever more than 100 feet distant from the hound, the spell ends.

Name: Mage's Lucubration
Short Description: Wizard only. Recalls spell of 5th level or lower.
Long Descripton: You instantly recall any one spell of 5th level or lower that you have used during the past 24 hours. The spell must have been actually cast during that period. The recalled spell is stored in your mind as through prepared in the normal fashion.[lf][lf]If the recalled spell requires material components, you must provide them. The recovered spell is not usable until the material components are available.

Name: Mage's Magnificent Mansion
Effect: Extradimensional mansion, up to three 10-ft. cubes/level (S)
Short Description: Door leads to extradimensional mansion.
Long Descripton: You conjure up an extradimensional dwelling that has a single entrance on the plane from which the spell was cast. The entry point looks like a faint shimmering in the air that is 4 feet wide and 8 feet high. Only those you designate may enter the mansion, and the portal is shut and made invisible behind you when you enter. You may open it again from your own side at will. Once observers have passed beyond the entrance, they are in a magnificent foyer with numerous chambers beyond. The atmosphere is clean, fresh, and warm.[lf][lf]You can create any floor plan you desire to the limit of the spells effect. The place is furnished and contains sufficient foodstuffs to serve a nine-course banquet to a dozen people per caster level. A staff of near-transparent servants (as many as two per caster level), liveried and obedient, wait upon all who enter. The servants function as unseen servant spells except that they are visible and can go anywhere in the mansion.[lf][lf]Since the place can be entered only through its special portal, outside conditions do not affect the mansion, nor do conditions inside it pass to the plane beyond.

Name: Mage's Private Sanctum
Short Description: Prevents anyone from viewing or scrying an area for 24 hours.
Long Descripton: This spell ensures privacy. Anyone looking into the area from outside sees only a dark, foggy mass. Darkvision cannot penetrate it. No sounds, no matter how loud, can escape the area, so nobody can eavesdrop from outside. Those inside can see out normally.[lf][lf]Divination (scrying) spells cannot perceive anything within the area, and those within are immune to detect thoughts. The ward prevents speech between those inside and those outside (because it blocks sound), but it does not prevent other communication, such as a sending or message spell, or telepathic communication, such as that between a wizard and her familiar.[lf][lf]The spell does not prevent creatures or objects from moving into and out of the area.[lf][lf]Mage's private sanctum can be made permanent with a permanency spell.

Name: Mage's Sword
Short Description: Floating magic blade strikes opponents.
Long Descripton: This spell brings into being a shimmering, swordlike plane of force. The sword strikes at any opponent within its range, as you desire, starting in the round that you cast the spell. The sword attacks its designated target once each round on your turn. Its attack bonus is equal to your caster level + your Int bonus or your Cha bonus (for wizards or sorcerers, respectively) with an additional +3 enhancement bonus. As a force effect, it can strike ethereal and incorporeal creatures. It deals 4d6+3 points of force damage, with a threat range of 19-20 and a critical multiplier of x2.[lf][lf]The sword always strikes from your direction. It does not get a bonus for flanking or help a combatant get one. If the sword goes beyond the spell range from you, if it goes out of your sight, or if you are not directing it, the sword returns to you and hovers.[lf][lf]Each round after the first, you can use a standard action to switch the sword to a new target. If you do not, the sword continues to attack the previous round's target.[lf][lf]The sword cannot be attacked or harmed by physical attacks, but dispel magic, disintegrate, a  sphere of annihilation , or a rod of cancellation affects it. The swords AC is 13 (10, +0 size bonus for Medium object, +3 deflection bonus).[lf][lf]If an attacked creature has spell resistance, the resistance is checked the first time Mage's sword strikes it. If the sword is successfully resisted, the spell is dispelled. If not, the sword has its normal full effect on that creature for the duration of the spell.

Name: Magecraft
Short Description: +5 competence bonus on one Craft check.

Name: Magic Aura
Effect: One touched object weighing up to 5 lb./level
Short Description: Alters objects magic aura.
Long Descripton: You alter an items aura so that it registers to detect spells (and spells with similar capabilities) as though it were nonmagical, or a magic item of a kind you specify, or the subject of a spell you specify. [lf][lf]If the object bearing magic aura has identify cast on it or is similarly examined, the examiner recognizes that the aura is false and detects the objects actual qualities if he succeeds on a Will save. Otherwise, he believes the aura and no amount of testing reveals what the true magic is.[lf][lf]If the targeted items own aura is exceptionally powerful (if it is an artifact, for instance), magic aura doesn't work.[lf][lf]Note: A magic weapon, shield, or suit of armor must be a masterwork item, so a sword of average make, for example, looks suspicious if it has a magical aura.

Name: Magic Circle against Chaos
Short Description: As protection spells, but 10-ft. radius and 10 min./level.
Long Descripton: All creatures within the area gain the effects of a protection from chaos spell, and no nonlawful summoned creatures can enter the area either. You must overcome a creatures spell resistance in order to keep it at bay (as in the third function of protection from chaos), but the deflection and resistance bonuses and the protection from mental control apply regardless of enemies spell resistance.[lf][lf]This spell has an alternative version that you may choose when casting it. A magic circle against chaos can be focused inward rather than outward. When focused inward, the spell binds a nonlawful called creature (such as those called by the lesser planar binding, planar binding, and greater planar binding spells) for a maximum of 24 hours per caster level, provided that you cast the spell that calls the creature within 1 round of casting the magic circle. The creature cannot cross the circles boundaries. If a creature too large to fit into the spells area is the subject of the spell, the spell acts as a normal protection from chaos spell for that creature only.[lf][lf]A magic circle leaves much to be desired as a trap. If the circle of powdered silver laid down in the process of spellcasting is broken, the effect immediately ends. The trapped creature can do nothing that disturbs the circle, directly or indirectly, but other creatures can. If the called creature has spell resistance, it can test the trap once a day. If you fail to overcome its spell resistance, the creature breaks free, destroying the circle. A creature capable of any form of dimensional travel (astral projection, blink, dimension door, etherealness, gate, plane shift, shadow walk, teleport, and similar abilities) can simply leave the circle through that means. You can prevent the creatures extradimensional escape by casting a dimensional anchor spell on it, but you must cast the spell before the creature acts. If you are successful, the anchor effect lasts as long as the magic circle does. The creature cannot reach across the magic circle, but its ranged attacks (ranged weapons, spells, magical abilities, and the like) can. The creature can attack any target it can reach with its ranged attacks except for the circle itself.[lf][lf]You can add a special diagram (a two-dimensional bounded figure with no gaps along its circumference, augmented with various magical sigils) to make the magic circle more secure. Drawing the diagram by hand takes 10 minutes and requires a DC 20 Spellcraft check. You do not know the result of this check. If the check fails, the diagram is ineffective. You can take 10 when drawing the diagram if you are under no particular time pressure to complete the task. This task also takes 10 full minutes. If time is no factor at all, and you devote 3 hours and 20 minutes to the task, you can take 20.[lf][lf]A successful diagram allows you to cast a dimensional anchor spell on the magic circle during the round before casting any summoning spell. The anchor holds any called creatures in the magic circle for 24 hours per caster level. A creature cannot use its spell resistance against a magic circle prepared with a diagram, and none of its abilities or attacks can cross the diagram. If the creature tries a Charisma check to break free of the trap (see the lesser planar binding spell), the DC increases by 5. The creature is immediately released if anything disturbs the diagrameven a straw laid across it. However, the creature itself cannot disturb the diagram either directly or indirectly, as noted above.[lf][lf]This spell is not cumulative with protection from chaos and vice versa.

Name: Magic Circle against Evil
Short Description: As protection spells, but 10-ft. radius and 10 min./level.
Long Descripton: All creatures within the area gain the effects of a protection from evil spell, and no nongood summoned creatures can enter the area either. You must overcome a creatures spell resistance in order to keep it at bay (as in the third function of protection from evil), but the deflection and resistance bonuses and the protection from mental control apply regardless of enemies spell resistance.[lf][lf]This spell has an alternative version that you may choose when casting it. A magic circle against evil can be focused inward rather than outward. When focused inward, the spell binds a nongood called creature (such as those called by the lesser planar binding, planar binding, and greater planar binding spells) for a maximum of 24 hours per caster level, provided that you cast the spell that calls the creature within 1 round of casting the magic circle. The creature cannot cross the circles boundaries. The trapped creature can do nothing that disturbs the circle, directly or indirectly, but other creatures can. If the called creature has spell resistance, it can test the trap once a day. If you fail to overcome its spell resistance, the creature breaks free, destroying the circle. A creature capable of any form of dimensional travel (astral projection, blink, dimension door, etherealness, gate, plane shift, shadow walk, teleport, and similar abilities) can simply leave the circle through that means. You can prevent the creatures extradimensional escape by casting a dimensional anchor spell on it, but you must cast the spell before the creature acts. If you are successful, the anchor effect lasts as long as the magic circle does. The creature cannot reach across the magic circle, but its ranged attacks (ranged weapons, spells, magical abilities, and the like) can. The creature can attack any target it can reach with its ranged attacks except for the circle itself.[lf][lf]You can add a special diagram (a two-dimensional bounded figure with no gaps along its circumference, augmented with various magical sigils) to make the magic circle more secure. Drawing the diagram by hand takes 10 minutes and requires a DC 20 Spellcraft check. You do not know the result of this check. If the check fails, the diagram is ineffective. You can take 10 when drawing the diagram if you are under no particular time pressure to complete the task. This task also takes 10 full minutes. If time is no factor at all, and you devote 3 hours and 20 minutes to the task, you can take 20.[lf][lf]A successful diagram allows you to cast a dimensional anchor spell on the magic circle during the round before casting any summoning spell. The anchor holds any called creatures in the magic circle for 24 hours per caster level. A creature cannot use its spell resistance against a magic circle prepared with a diagram, and none of its abilities or attacks can cross the diagram. If the creature tries a Charisma check to break free of the trap (see the lesser planar binding spell), the DC increases by 5. The creature is immediately released if anything disturbs the diagrameven a straw laid across it. However, the creature itself cannot disturb the diagram either directly or indirectly, as noted above.[lf][lf]This spell is not cumulative with protection from evil and vice versa.

Name: Magic Circle against Good
Short Description: As protection spells, but 10-ft. radius and 10 min./level.
Long Descripton: All creatures within the area gain the effects of a protection from good spell, and no nonevil summoned creatures can enter the area either. You must overcome a creatures spell resistance in order to keep it at bay (as in the third function of protection from good), but the deflection and resistance bonuses and the protection from mental control apply regardless of enemies spell resistance.[lf][lf]This spell has an alternative version that you may choose when casting it. A magic circle against chaos can be focused inward rather than outward. When focused inward, the spell binds a nongood called creature (such as those called by the lesser planar binding, planar binding, and greater planar binding spells) for a maximum of 24 hours per caster level, provided that you cast the spell that calls the creature within 1 round of casting the magic circle. The creature cannot cross the circles boundaries. If a creature too large to fit into the spells area is the subject of the spell, the spell acts as a normal protection from chaos spell for that creature only.[lf][lf]A magic circle leaves much to be desired as a trap. If the circle of powdered silver laid down in the process of spellcasting is broken, the effect immediately ends. The trapped creature can do nothing that disturbs the circle, directly or indirectly, but other creatures can. If the called creature has spell resistance, it can test the trap once a day. If you fail to overcome its spell resistance, the creature breaks free, destroying the circle. A creature capable of any form of dimensional travel (astral projection, blink, dimension door, etherealness, gate, plane shift, shadow walk, teleport, and similar abilities) can simply leave the circle through that means. You can prevent the creatures extradimensional escape by casting a dimensional anchor spell on it, but you must cast the spell before the creature acts. If you are successful, the anchor effect lasts as long as the magic circle does. The creature cannot reach across the magic circle, but its ranged attacks (ranged weapons, spells, magical abilities, and the like) can. The creature can attack any target it can reach with its ranged attacks except for the circle itself.[lf][lf]You can add a special diagram (a two-dimensional bounded figure with no gaps along its circumference, augmented with various magical sigils) to make the magic circle more secure. Drawing the diagram by hand takes 10 minutes and requires a DC 20 Spellcraft check. You do not know the result of this check. If the check fails, the diagram is ineffective. You can take 10 when drawing the diagram if you are under no particular time pressure to complete the task. This task also takes 10 full minutes. If time is no factor at all, and you devote 3 hours and 20 minutes to the task, you can take 20.[lf][lf]A successful diagram allows you to cast a dimensional anchor spell on the magic circle during the round before casting any summoning spell. The anchor holds any called creatures in the magic circle for 24 hours per caster level. A creature cannot use its spell resistance against a magic circle prepared with a diagram, and none of its abilities or attacks can cross the diagram. If the creature tries a Charisma check to break free of the trap (see the lesser planar binding spell), the DC increases by 5. The creature is immediately released if anything disturbs the diagrameven a straw laid across it. However, the creature itself cannot disturb the diagram either directly or indirectly, as noted above.[lf][lf]This spell is not cumulative with protection from good and vice versa.

Name: Magic Circle against Law
Short Description: As protection spells, but 10-ft. radius and 10 min./level.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like magic circle against evil, except that it is similar to protection from law instead of protection from evil, and it can imprison a nonchaotic called creature.[lf][lf]All creatures within the area gain the effects of a protection from law spell, and no nonchaotic summoned creatures can enter the area either. You must overcome a creatures spell resistance in order to keep it at bay (as in the third function of protection from chaos), but the deflection and resistance bonuses and the protection from mental control apply regardless of enemies spell resistance.[lf][lf]This spell has an alternative version that you may choose when casting it. A magic circle against chaos can be focused inward rather than outward. When focused inward, the spell binds a nonchaotic called creature (such as those called by the lesser planar binding, planar binding, and greater planar binding spells) for a maximum of 24 hours per caster level, provided that you cast the spell that calls the creature within 1 round of casting the magic circle. The creature cannot cross the circles boundaries. If a creature too large to fit into the spells area is the subject of the spell, the spell acts as a normal protection from chaos spell for that creature only.[lf][lf]A magic circle leaves much to be desired as a trap. If the circle of powdered silver laid down in the process of spellcasting is broken, the effect immediately ends. The trapped creature can do nothing that disturbs the circle, directly or indirectly, but other creatures can. If the called creature has spell resistance, it can test the trap once a day. If you fail to overcome its spell resistance, the creature breaks free, destroying the circle. A creature capable of any form of dimensional travel (astral projection, blink, dimension door, etherealness, gate, plane shift, shadow walk, teleport, and similar abilities) can simply leave the circle through that means. You can prevent the creatures extradimensional escape by casting a dimensional anchor spell on it, but you must cast the spell before the creature acts. If you are successful, the anchor effect lasts as long as the magic circle does. The creature cannot reach across the magic circle, but its ranged attacks (ranged weapons, spells, magical abilities, and the like) can. The creature can attack any target it can reach with its ranged attacks except for the circle itself.[lf][lf]You can add a special diagram (a two-dimensional bounded figure with no gaps along its circumference, augmented with various magical sigils) to make the magic circle more secure. Drawing the diagram by hand takes 10 minutes and requires a DC 20 Spellcraft check. You do not know the result of this check. If the check fails, the diagram is ineffective. You can take 10 when drawing the diagram if you are under no particular time pressure to complete the task. This task also takes 10 full minutes. If time is no factor at all, and you devote 3 hours and 20 minutes to the task, you can take 20.[lf][lf]A successful diagram allows you to cast a dimensional anchor spell on the magic circle during the round before casting any summoning spell. The anchor holds any called creatures in the magic circle for 24 hours per caster level. A creature cannot use its spell resistance against a magic circle prepared with a diagram, and none of its abilities or attacks can cross the diagram. If the creature tries a Charisma check to break free of the trap (see the lesser planar binding spell), the DC increases by 5. The creature is immediately released if anything disturbs the diagrameven a straw laid across it. However, the creature itself cannot disturb the diagram either directly or indirectly, as noted above.[lf][lf]This spell is not cumulative with protection from law and vice versa.

Name: Magic Fang
Short Description: One natural weapon of subject creature gets +1 on attack and damage rolls.
Long Descripton: Magic fang gives one natural weapon of the subject a +1 enhancement bonus on attack and damage rolls. The spell can affect a slam attack, fist, bite, or other natural weapon. (The spell does not change an unarmed strike's damage from nonlethal damage to lethal damage.)[lf][lf]Magic fang can be made permanent with a permanency spell.

Name: Magic Fang, Greater
Short Description: One natural weapon of subject creature gets +1/three levels on attack and damage rolls (max +5).
Long Descripton: This spell functions like magic fang, except that the enhancement bonus on attack and damage rolls is +1 per four caster levels (maximum +5).[lf][lf]Alternatively, you may imbue all of the creatures natural weapons with a +1 enhancement bonus (regardless of your caster level).[lf][lf]Greater magic fang can be made permanent with a permanency spell.

Name: Magic Fang, Superior
Short Description: Your natural weapons gain +1 enhancement bonus per four levels.

Name: Magic Jar
Duration: 1 hour/level or until you return to your body
Short Description: Enables possession of another creature.
Long Descripton: By casting magic jar, you place your soul in a gem or large crystal (known as the magic jar), leaving your body lifeless. Then you can attempt to take control of a nearby body, forcing its soul into the magic jar. You may move back to the jar (thereby returning the trapped soul to its body) and attempt to possess another body. The spell ends when you send your soul back to your own body, leaving the receptacle empty.[lf][lf]To cast the spell, the magic jar must be within spell range and you must know where it is, though you do not need line of sight or line of effect to it. When you transfer your soul upon casting, your body is, as near as anyone can tell, dead. [lf][lf]While in the magic jar, you can sense and attack any life force within 10 feet per caster level (and on the same plane of existence). You do need line of effect from the jar to the creatures. You cannot determine the exact creature types or positions of these creatures. In a group of life forces, you can sense a difference of 4 or more Hit Dice between one creature and another and can determine whether a life force is powered by positive or negative energy. (Undead creatures are powered by negative energy. Only sentient undead creatures have, or are, souls.)[lf][lf]You could choose to take over either a stronger or a weaker creature, but which particular stronger or weaker creature you attempt to possess is determined randomly.[lf][lf]Attempting to possess a body is a full-round action. It is blocked by protection from evil or a similar ward. You possess the body and force the creature's soul into the magic jar unless the subject succeeds on a Will save. Failure to take over the host leaves your life force in the magic jar, and the target automatically succeeds on further saving throws if you attempt to possess its body again.[lf][lf]If you are successful, your life force occupies the host body, and the host's life force is imprisoned in the magic jar. You keep your Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, level, class, base attack bonus, base save bonuses, alignment, and mental abilities. The body retains its Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, hit points, natural abilities, and automatic abilities. A body with extra limbs does not allow you to make more attacks (or more advantageous two-weapon attacks) than normal. You can't choose to activate the body's extraordinary or supernatural abilities. The creature's spells and spell-like abilities do not stay with the body.[lf][lf]As a standard action, you can shift freely from a host to the magic jar if within range, sending the trapped soul back to its body. The spell ends when you shift from the jar to your own body.[lf][lf]If the host body is slain, you return to the magic jar, if within range, and the life force of the host departs (it is dead). If the host body is slain beyond the range of the spell, both you and the host die. Any life force with nowhere to go is treated as slain.[lf][lf]If the spell ends while you are in the magic jar, you return to your body (or die if your body is out of range or destroyed). If the spell ends while you are in a host, you return to your body (or die, if it is out of range of your current position), and the soul in the magic jar returns to its body (or dies if it is out of range). Destroying the receptacle ends the spell, and the spell can be dispelled at either the magic jar or at the host's location.

Name: Magic Miasma
Short Description: Solid fog reduces caster level by -4 and spell DCs by -2.

Name: Magic Missile
Effect: Up to five creatures, no two of which can be more than 15 ft. apart
Short Description: 1d4+1 damage; +1 missile per two levels above 1st (max 5).
Medium Description: 1d4+1 force damage; +1 missile per two levels above 1st (max 5).
Long Descripton: A missile of magical energy darts forth from your fingertip and strikes its target, dealing 1d4+1 points of force damage.[lf][lf]The missile strikes unerringly, even if the target is in melee combat or has less than total cover or total concealment. Specific parts of a creature can't be singled out. Inanimate objects are not damaged by the spell.[lf][lf]For every two caster levels beyond 1st, you gain an additional missile-two at 3rd level, three at 5th, four at 7th, and the maximum of five missiles at 9th level or higher. If you shoot multiple missiles, you can have them strike a single creature or several creatures. A single missile can strike only one creature. You must designate targets before you check for spell resistance or roll damage.

Name: Magic Mouth
Short Description: Speaks once when triggered.
Long Descripton: This spell imbues the chosen object or creature with an enchanted mouth that suddenly appears and speaks its message the next time a specified event occurs. The message, which must be twenty-five or fewer words long, can be in any language known by you and can be delivered over a period of 10 minutes. The mouth cannot utter verbal components, use command words, or activate magical effects. It does, however, move according to the words articulated; if it were placed upon a statue, the mouth of the statue would move and appear to speak. Of course, magic mouth can be placed upon a tree, rock, or any other object or creature.[lf][lf]The spell functions when specific conditions are fulfilled according to your command as set in the spell. Commands can be as general or as detailed as desired, although only visual and audible triggers can be used. Triggers react to what appears to be the case. Disguises and illusions can fool them. Normal darkness does not defeat a visual trigger, but magical darkness or invisibility does. Silent movement or magical silence defeats audible triggers. Audible triggers can be keyed to general types of noises or to a specific noise or spoken word. Actions can serve as triggers if they are visible or audible. A magic mouth cannot distinguish alignment, level, Hit Dice, or class except by external garb.[lf][lf]The range limit of a trigger is 15 feet per caster level, so a 6th-level caster can command a magic mouth to respond to triggers as far as 90 feet away. Regardless of range, the mouth can respond only to visible or audible triggers and actions in line of sight or within hearing distance.[lf][lf]Magic mouth can be made permanent with a permanency spell.

Name: Magic Stone
Short Description: Three stones gain +1 on attack, deal 1d6 +1 damage.
Long Descripton: You transmute as many as three pebbles, which can be no larger than sling bullets, so that they strike with great force when thrown or slung. If hurled, they have a range increment of 20 feet. If slung, treat them as sling bullets (range increment 50 feet). The spell gives them a +1 enhancement bonus on attack and damage rolls. The user of the stones makes a normal ranged attack. Each stone that hits deals 1d6+1 points of damage (including the spells enhancement bonus), or 2d6+2 points against undead.

Name: Magic Vestment
Short Description: Armor or shield gains +1 enhancement per four levels.
Long Descripton: You imbue a suit of armor or a shield with an enhancement bonus of +1 per four caster levels (maximum +5 at 20th level).[lf][lf]An outfit of regular clothing counts as armor that grants no AC bonus for the purpose of this spell.

Name: Magic Weapon
Short Description: Weapon gains +1 bonus.
Long Descripton: Magic weapon gives a weapon a +1 enhancement bonus on attack and damage rolls. (An enhancement bonus does not stack with a masterwork weapons +1 bonus on attack rolls.)[lf][lf]You cant cas't this spell on a natural weapon, such as an unarmed strike (instead, see magic fang). A monk's unarmed strike is considered a weapon, and thus it can be enhanced by this spell.

Name: Magic Weapon, Greater
Effect: One weapon or fifty projectiles (all of which must be in contact with each other at the time of casting)
Short Description: +1 bonus/four levels (max +5).
Long Descripton: This spell functions like magic weapon, except that it gives a weapon an enhancement bonus on attack and damage rolls of +1 per four caster levels (maximum +5).[lf][lf]Alternatively, you can affect as many as fifty arrows, bolts, or bullets. The projectiles must be of the same kind, and they have to be together (in the same quiver or other container). Projectiles, but not thrown weapons, lose their transmutation when used. (Treat shuriken as projectiles, rather than as thrown weapons, for the purpose of this spell.)

Name: Magic Weapon, Greater Legion's
Effect: Melee or ranged weapons held by allied creatures in a 20-ft.-radius burst
Short Description: Allies' weapons gain +2 or greater enhancement bonus.

Name: Magic Weapon, Legion's
Effect: Melee or ranged weapons held by allied creatures in a 20-ft.-radius burst
Short Description: Allies' weapons gain +1 enhancement bonus.

Name: Magma Burst
Short Description: Creates an area of lava, dealing 20d6 fire damage/round.

Name: Magnetic Pulse
Short Description: Magnetic forces cause 5d6 or 3d6 damage and trip attacks.

Name: Magnetism
Short Description: Pull a steel item to you each round.

Name: Mailed Might of The Magelords
Short Description: Field of force around subject grants +8 armor bonus, immunity to 2nd level or lower force spells, and DR 5/magic.

Name: Major Creation
Effect: Unattended, nonmagical object of matter, up to 1 cu. ft./level
Short Description: As minor creation, plus stone and metal.
Long Descripton: You create a non-magical, unattended object of nonliving, vegetable, stone, crystal, metal, or the like matter. The volume of the item created cannot exceed 1 cubic foot per caster level. You must succeed on an appropriate skill check to make a complex item.  [lf]Attempting to use any created object as a material component causes the spell to fail.  [lf]Hardness and Rarity ExamplesDuration  [lf]Vegetable matter2 hr./level  [lf]Stone, crystal, base metals1 hr./level  [lf]Precious metals20 min./level  [lf]Gems10 min./level  [lf]Rare metal1 round/level    [lf]Rare metals include adamantine, alchemical silver, and mithral. You can't use major creation to create a cold iron item.

Name: Major Image
Effect: Visual figment that cannot extend beyond four 10-ft. cubes + one 10-ft. cube/level (S)
Short Description: As silent image, plus sound, smell and thermal effects.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like silent image, except that sound, smell, and thermal illusions are included in the spell effect. While concentrating, you can move the image within the range. [lf][lf]The image disappears when struck by an opponent unless you cause the illusion to react appropriately.

Name: Make Manifest
Short Description: Force a creature in coterminous/coexistent plane to appear on your plane.

Name: Make Manifest, Mass
Effect: 25-ft.-radius emanation centered on a point in space
Short Description: As the Make Manifest spell except multiple targets.

Name: Make Whole
Effect: One object of up to 10 cu. ft./ level
Short Description: Repairs an object.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like mending, except that make whole completely repairs an object made of any substance, even one with multiple breaks, to be as strong as new. The spell does not restore the magical abilities of a broken magic item made whole, and it cannot mend broken magic rods, staffs, or wands. The spell does not repair items that have been warped, burned, disintegrated, ground to powder, melted, or vaporized, nor does it affect creatures (including constructs).

Name: Malevolent Miasma
Short Description: Cloud of fog deals 1d4 nonlethal damage/level.
Medium Description: Cloud of fog deals 1d4 nonlethal damage/level (max 5d4).

Name: Manifest Dragon Heritage
Short Description: Conjures a wyvern.

Name: Manifest Dragon Heritage, Greater
Short Description: Conjures a dragon turtle.

Name: Manifestation Of The Deity
Effect: An image of the deity you worship
Short Description: Create illusion of your deity, rendering enemies shaken for 1 round.

Name: Mantle of Chaos
Short Description: You gain spell resistance 12 + caster level against spells with opposite alignment descriptor.

Name: Mantle of Egregious Might
Short Description: Grant +4 luck bonus to AC, Attacks, saves, and ability scores.

Name: Mantle of Evil
Short Description: You gain spell resistance 12 + caster level against spells with opposite alignment descriptor.

Name: Mantle of Good
Short Description: You gain spell resistance 12 + caster level against spells with opposite alignment descriptor.

Name: Mantle of Law
Short Description: You gain spell resistance 12 + caster level against spells with opposite alignment descriptor.

Name: Mantle of the Fiery Spirit
Short Description: Permanently grants one creature the fire subtype.

Name: Mantle of the Icy Soul
Short Description: Gives subject the cold subtype.

Name: Mantle of the Slime Lord
Short Description: Nonintelligent oozes do not attack you, and you gain some ooze immunities.

Name: Manyjaws
Effect: One pair of disembodied, flying jaws per caster level (maximum ten pairs)
Short Description: One set of jaws/level attacks enemies for 1d6 damage.

Name: Mark of Air
Short Description: Subject gains +2 to Dex.  The mark can be discharged to create sheild of air that provides +5 deflection bonus for 10 rounds.

Name: Mark of Air, Greater
Short Description: See Text

Name: Mark of Death
Short Description: See Text

Name: Mark of Doom
Short Description: Subject takes 1d6 damage for each hostile action.

Name: Mark of Earth
Short Description: Subject gains +2 to Str.  They can perform a ranged touch attack that deals 5d6 damage that ends the spell.

Name: Mark of Earth, Greater
Short Description: See Text

Name: Mark of Fire
Short Description: Subject gains +2 to Dex.  Can also use a Ray attack for 3d3 fire damage, dismissing the spell.

Name: Mark of Fire, Greater
Short Description: See Text

Name: Mark of Frost
Short Description: Subject gains +1 natural armor bonus to AC.  Can also create a spear that deals 1d8 piercing + 2d6 cold damage, dismissing the spell.

Name: Mark of Frost, Greater
Short Description: See Text

Name: Mark of Justice
Short Description: Designates action that will trigger curse on subject.
Long Descripton: You draw an indelible mark on the subject and state some behavior on the part of the subject that will activate the mark. When activated, the mark curses the subject. Typically, you designate some sort of criminal behavior that activates the mark, but you can pick any act you please. The effect of the mark is identical with the effect of bestow curse.[lf][lf]Since this spell takes 10 minutes to cast and involves writing on the target, you can cast it only on a creature that is willing or restrained.[lf][lf]Like the effect of bestow curse, a mark of justice cannot be dispelled, but it can be removed with a break enchantment, limited wish, miracle, remove curse, or wish spell. Remove curse works only if its caster level is equal to or higher than your mark of justice caster level. These restrictions apply regardless of whether the mark has activated.

Name: Mark of the Hunter
Effect: One creature, which must be a favored enemy of the caster
Short Description: Rune on creature makes it easier to track and attack.

Name: Mark of the Outcast
Short Description: Subject takes -5 penalty on bluff and Diplomacy checks and a -2 penalty to AC.

Name: Mark of the Unfaithful
Short Description: Mark someone as an enemy of your faith.

Name: Mark of Water
Short Description: Subject gains +2 to Con.  Can also create a stream of water that deals 5d6 damage to a target, dismissing the spell.

Name: Mark of Water, Greater
Short Description: See Text

Name: Marked Man
Short Description: Helps track a subject.

Name: Marked Object
Short Description: You gain bonus to track a specific being.

Name: Masochism
Short Description: For every 10 hp damage you take, you gain +1 on attacks, saves, and checks.

Name: Master Air
Short Description: You sprout insubstantial wings and can fly.

Name: Master Earth
Short Description: Travel through the earth to any location.

Name: Master's Touch
Short Description: You gain proficiency in any one weapon or shield.

Name: Mastery of the Sky
Short Description: Gain +2 on attack rolls and damage rolls while airborne; maneuverability becomes perfect; foes incur penalties against you.

Name: Maw of Chaos
Effect: 15-ft.-radius emanation centered on a point in space
Short Description: Area of energy damages creatures and disrupts concentration.
Medium Description: Area of energy deals 1d6/caster level force damage and disrupts concentration.

Name: Maw of Stone
Effect: One cave mouth or natural tunnel up to 20 ft. in diameter
Short Description: Animates natural chamber to attack enemies.

Name: Maze
Short Description: Traps subject in extradimensional maze.
Long Descripton: You banish the subject into an extradimensional labyrinth of force planes. Each round on its turn, it may attempt a DC 20 Intelligence check to escape the labyrinth as a full-round action. If the subject doesnt escape, the maze disappears after 10 minutes, forcing the subject to leave.[lf][lf]On escaping or leaving the maze, the subject reappears where it had been when the maze spell was cast. If this location is filled with a solid object, the subject appears in the nearest open space. Spells and abilities that move a creature within a plane, such as teleport and dimension door, do not help a creature escape a maze spell, although a plane shift spell allows it to exit to whatever plane is designated in that spell. Minotaurs are not affected by this spell.

Name: Mechanus Mind
Short Description: Reformat subject's mind to be coldly calculating.

Name: Megalodon Empowerment
Short Description: Gain scent, water breathing, swim speed for 1 hour/level.

Name: Meld into Ice
Short Description: You and your gear merge with ice.

Name: Meld into Stone
Short Description: You and your gear merge with stone.
Long Descripton: Meld into stone enables you to meld your body and possessions into a single block of stone. The stone must be large enough to accommodate your body in all three dimensions. When the casting is complete, you and not more than 100 pounds of non-living gear merge with the stone. If either condition is violated, the spell fails and is wasted.[lf][lf]While in the stone, you remain in contact, however tenuous, with the face of the stone through which you melded. You remain aware of the passage of time and can cast spells on yourself while hiding in the stone. Nothing that goes on outside the stone can be seen, but you can still hear what happens around you. Minor physical damage to the stone does not harm you, but its partial destruction (to the extent that you no longer fit within it) expels you and deals you 5d6 points of damage. The stones complete destruction expels you and slays you instantly unless you make a DC 18 Fortitude save.[lf][lf]Any time before the duration expires, you can step out of the stone through the surface that you entered. If the spells duration expires or the effect is dispelled before you voluntarily exit the stone, you are violently expelled and take 5d6 points of damage.[lf][lf]The following spells harm you if cast upon the stone that you are occupying: Stone to flesh expels you and deals you 5d6 points of damage. Stone shape deals you 3d6 points of damage but does not expel you. Transmute rock to mud expels you and then slays you instantly unless you make a DC 18 Fortitude save, in which case you are merely expelled. Finally, passwall expels you without damage.

Name: Melt
Effect: One 5-ft. cube of ice or 10-ft. cube of snow/level, or one cold creature/level
Saving Throw: None or Fortitude half; see text
Short Description: Deal 2/level (max 10) damage to cold subtype creature.

Name: Memory Rot
Short Description: Spores deal 1d6 Int drain to target, plus 1 Int/round.

Name: Mending
Effect: One object of up to 1 lb.
Short Description: Makes minor repairs on an object.
Long Descripton: Mending repairs small breaks or tears in objects (but not warps, such as might be caused by a warp wood spell). It will weld broken metallic objects such as a ring, a chain link, a medallion, or a slender dagger, providing but one break exists.[lf][lf]Ceramic or wooden objects with multiple breaks can be invisibly rejoined to be as strong as new. A hole in a leather sack or a wineskin is completely healed over by mending. The spell can repair a magic item, but the items magical abilities are not restored. The spell cannot mend broken magic rods, staffs, or wands, nor does it affect creatures (including constructs).

Name: Mental Alarm
Short Description: Mental alarm that goes off at a specific time within the duration to all subjects simultaneiously.

Name: Mental Pinnacle
Short Description: You gain the mental powers of a psion.
Long Descripton: For a brief time, you achieve the mental dominance of a powerful psion, able to lash out at enemies using only the power of your mind. Your revel in your new mental powers to the point that you disdain using spells, even in the form of effects from magic items. You gain a +4 enhancement bonus to Intelligence and Wisdom, 3 power points per caster level, and access to the following powers.    [lf]Mind Thrust: Deal 1d10 damage.  [lf]Ego Whip: Deal 1d4 Cha damage and daze for 1 round.  [lf]Psionic Blast: Stun creatures in 30-ft. cone for 1 round.  [lf]Id Insinuation: Swift tendrils of thought disrupt and confuse your target.  [lf]Psychic Crush: Brutally crush subject’s mental essence, reducing subject to –1 hit points.    [lf]You manifest the powers as a psion of your caster level does, creating displays as described in each power's description. You lose your spellcasting ability, including your ability to use spell activation or spell completion magic items, just as if those spells were no longer on your class list. For the duration of this spell, you use magic items and psionic items as if you were a psion with only the five powers given above on your class list.  [lf]Any unspent power points dissipate when the spell ends.

Name: Mephit Mob
Effect: Two or more summoned creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Summons 2d6 mephits of a kind you designate.

Name: Mesmerizing Glare
Effect: One living creature/level, no two of which may be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Your gaze fascinates creatures.

Name: Message
Short Description: Whispered conversation at distance.
Long Descripton: You can whisper messages and receive whispered replies with little chance of being overheard. You point your finger at each creature you want to receive the message. When you whisper, the whispered message is audible to all targeted creatures within range. Magical silence, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal (or a thin sheet of lead), or 3 feet of wood or dirt blocks the spell. The message does not have to travel in a straight line. It can circumvent a barrier if there is an open path between you and the subject, and the paths entire length lies within the spells range. The creatures that receive the message can whisper a reply that you hear. The spell transmits sound, not meaning. It doesn't transcend language barriers.[lf][lf]Note: To speak a message, you must mouth the words and whisper, possibly allowing observers the opportunity to read your lips.

Name: Metal Melt
Effect: Nonmagical metal object weighing up to 5 lb./level
Short Description: Melts metal object without heat.

Name: Metal Skin
Short Description: Subject gains +8 natural armor bonus and a -2 Dex penalty.

Name: Metamagic Item
Short Description: Imbue spell trigger item with metamagic feat.

Name: Metamagic Scroll
Duration: 1 round/level or until discharged, whichever comes first
Short Description: Imbue spell completion item with metamagic feat.

Name: Meteor Swarm
Saving Throw: None or Reflex half; see text
Short Description: Four exploding spheres each deal 6d6 fire damage.
Long Descripton: Meteor swarm is a very powerful and spectacular spell that is similar to fireball in many aspects. When you cast it, four 2- foot-diameter spheres spring from your outstretched hand and streak in straight lines to the spots you select. The meteor spheres leave a fiery trail of sparks.[lf][lf]If you aim a sphere at a specific creature, you may make a ranged touch attack to strike the target with the meteor. Any creature struck by one of these spheres takes 2d6 points of bludgeoning damage (no save) and receives no saving throw against the sphere's fire damage (see below). If a targeted sphere misses its target, it simply explodes at the nearest corner of the target's space. You may aim more than one meteor at the same target.[lf][lf]Once a sphere reaches its destination, it explodes in a 40-foot-radius spread, dealing 6d6 points of fire damage to each creature in the area. If a creature is within the area of more than one sphere, it must save separately against each. (Fire resistance applies to each spheres damage individually.)

Name: Miasma
Short Description: Gas fills creature's mouth, suffocating it.

Name: Miasma of Entropy
Effect: Cone-shaped burst or one solid object; see text
Saving Throw: Will negates (object) or Fortitude half; see text
Short Description: Rot all natural materials in 30-ft. cone-shaped burst.

Name: Mighty Wallop
Short Description: +1 size category of bludgeoning weapon.
Medium Description: The head of the weapon you touch is suddenly encased in a filmy halo that only you can see, extending out from the weapon to a distance of several inches.

Name: Mighty Wallop, Greater
Short Description: +1 size category of bludgeoning weapon/four levels (maximum 5).

Name: Mimicry
Short Description: Perfectly mimic familiar sounds, voices, or accents.

Name: Mind Blank
Short Description: Subject is immune to mental/emotional magic and scrying.
Long Descripton: The subject is protected from all devices and spells that detect, influence, or read emotions or thoughts. This spell protects against all mind-affecting spells and effects as well as information gathering by divination spells or effects. Mind blank even foils limited wish, miracle, and wish spells when they are used in such a way as to affect the subjects mind or to gain information about it. In the case of scrying that scans an area the creature is in, such as arcane eye, the spell works but the creature simply isn't detected. Scrying attempts that are targeted specifically at the subject do not work at all.

Name: Mind Bond
Short Description: You and your mount gain a +4 flanking bonus when flanking the same opponent; mount gains bonus on attack rolls.

Name: Mind Fog
Effect: Fog spreads in 20-ft. radius, 20 ft. high
Short Description: Subjects in fog get -10 to Wis and Will checks.
Long Descripton: Mind fog produces a bank of thin mist that weakens the mental resistance of those caught in it. Creatures in the mind fog take a -10 competence penalty on Wisdom checks and Will saves. (A creature that successfully saves against the fog is not affected and need not make further saves even if it remains in the fog.) Affected creatures take the penalty as long as they remain in the fog and for 2d6 rounds thereafter. The fog is stationary and lasts for 30 minutes (or until dispersed by wind).[lf][lf]A moderate wind (11+ mph) disperses the fog in four rounds; a strong wind (21+ mph) disperses the fog in 1 round.[lf][lf]The fog is thin and does not significantly hamper vision.

Name: Mind Poison
Short Description: Touch attack poison that deals 1d6 temporary Wisdom damage and again one minute later.

Name: Mindburn
Short Description: Target loses a spell or infusion each round.

Name: Mindfrost
Short Description: Deals 5d6 cold damage, 1d4 Int damage.

Name: Mindless Rage
Short Description: Incite a rage in an opponent that drives them to attacking you by melee only.

Name: Mindrape
Short Description: You learn everything subject knows and can alter its memory or knowledge.

Name: Mineralize Warrior
Short Description: Grants willing subject the mineral warrior template

Name: Minimus Containment
Effect: One willing elemental or outsider caught in a planar binding
Short Description: Bind a creature from a planar binding into a gem.

Name: Minor Creation
Effect: Unattended, nonmagical object of nonliving plant matter, up to 1 cu. ft./level
Short Description: Creates one cloth or wood object.
Long Descripton: You create a non-magical, unattended object of nonliving, vegetable matter. The volume of the item created cannot exceed 1 cubic foot per caster level. You must succeed on an appropriate skill check to make a complex item.[lf][lf]Attempting to use any created object as a material component causes the spell to fail.

Name: Minor Disguise
Short Description: Makes slight changes to your appearance.

Name: Minor Energy Ward
Short Description: Grant 5 points of energy resistance.
Long Descripton: You grant a creature limited protection against one type of energy (acid, cold, electricity, fire, sonic). When the spell absorbs 5 points of energy damage of that type, it is discharged.[lf][lf]This spell overlaps (does not stack) with endure elements, resist energy, and protection from energy. It combines with the other spells in the same manner as protection from energy and is superceded by protection from energy (if a character is protected by this spell and protection from energy, the protection spell absorbs damage but the ward does not).

Name: Minor Image
Effect: Visual figment that cannot extend beyond four 10-ft. cubes + one 10-ft. cube/level (S)
Short Description: As silent image, plus some sound.
Long Descripton: This spell creates the visual illusion of an object, creature, or force, as visualized by you. The illusion does not create smell, texture, or temperature. [lf][lf]The illusion includes some minor sounds but not understandable speech. You can move the image within the limits of the size of the effect.

Name: Minor Servitor
Effect: One object up to 1 cu. ft./level
Short Description: Animated object does your bidding.

Name: Minute Form
Short Description: Reduce your size to Tiny, Diminutive, or Fine depending on your caster level.

Name: Miracle
Short Description: Requests a deity's intercession.
Long Descripton: You don't so much cast a miracle as request one. You state what you would like to have happen and request that your deity (or the power you pray to for spells) intercede.[lf][lf]A miracle can do any of the following things.[lf][lf] Duplicate any cleric spell of 8th level or lower (including spells to which you have access because of your domains). [lf][lf] Duplicate any other spell of 7th level or lower.[lf][lf] Undo the harmful effects of certain spells, such as feeblemind or insanity.[lf][lf] Have any effect whose power level is in line with the above effects.[lf][lf]If the miracle has any of the above effects, casting it has no experience point cost.[lf][lf]Alternatively, a cleric can make a very powerful request. Casting such a miracle costs the cleric 5,000 XP because of the powerful divine energies involved. Examples of especially powerful miracles of this sort could include the following.[lf][lf] Swinging the tide of a battle in your favor by raising fallen allies to continue fighting.[lf][lf] Moving you and your allies, with all your and their gear, from one plane to another through planar barriers to a specific locale with no chance of error.[lf][lf] Protecting a city from an earthquake, volcanic eruption, flood, or other major natural disaster.[lf][lf]In any event, a request that is out of line with the deity's (or alignments) nature is refused.[lf][lf]A duplicated spell allows saving throws and spell resistance as normal, but the save DCs are as for a 9th-level spell. When a miracle duplicates a spell that has an XP cost, you must pay that cost. When a miracle spell duplicates a spell with a material component that costs more than 100 gp, you must provide that component.

Name: Mirage Arcana
Short Description: As hallucinatory terrain, plus structures.
Long Descripton: You make natural terrain look, sound, and smell like some other sort of natural terrain. The spell can alter the appearance of structures (or add them where none are present). Still, it can't disguise, conceal, or add creatures (though creatures within the area might hide themselves within the illusion just as they can hide themselves within a real location).

Name: Mirror Image
Short Description: Creates decoy duplicates of you (1d4 +1 per three levels, max 8).
Long Descripton: Several illusory duplicates of you pop into being, making it difficult for enemies to know which target to attack. The figments stay near you and disappear when struck.[lf][lf]Mirror image creates 1d4 images plus one image per three caster levels (maximum eight images total). These figments separate from you and remain in a cluster, each within 5 feet of at least one other figment or you. You can move into and through a mirror image. When you and the mirror image separate, observers can't use vision or hearing to tell which one is you and which the image. The figments may also move through each other. The figments mimic your actions, pretending to cast spells when you cast a spell, drink potions when you drink a potion, levitate when you levitate, and so on.[lf][lf]Enemies attempting to attack you or cast spells at you must select from among indistinguishable targets. Generally, roll randomly to see whether the selected target is real or a figment. Any successful attack against an image destroys it. An images AC is 10 + your size modifier + your Dex modifier. Figments seem to react normally to area spells (such as looking like they're burned or dead after being hit by a fireball).[lf][lf]While moving, you can merge with and split off from figments so that enemies who have learned which image is real are again confounded.[lf][lf]An attacker must be able to see the images to be fooled. If you are invisible or an attacker shuts his or her eyes, the spell has no effect. (Being unable to see carries the same penalties as being blinded.)

Name: Mirror Image, Greater
Short Description: As mirror image, but gain an additional image each round.
Medium Description: As mirror image, but gain an additional image each round (max 8). Can be cast out of turn.

Name: Mirror Move
Short Description: Use general feat that you have seen used recently.

Name: Mirror Sending
Short Description: You send your image to a mirror and can see and speak through it.

Name: Misdirection
Effect: One creature or object, up to a 10-ft. cube in size
Saving Throw: None or Will negates; see text
Short Description: Misleads divinations for one creature or object.
Long Descripton: By means of this spell, you misdirect the information from divination spells that reveal auras (detect evil, detect magic, discern lies, and the like). On casting the spell, you choose another object within range. For the duration of the spell, the subject of misdirection is detected as if it were the other object. (Neither the subject nor the other object gets a saving throw against this effect.) Detection spells provide information based on the second object rather than on the actual target of the detection unless the caster of the detection succeeds on a Will save. For instance, you could make yourself detect as a tree if one were within range at casting: not evil, not lying, not magical, neutral in alignment, and so forth. This spell does not affect other types of divination magic (augury, detect thoughts, clairaudience/clairvoyance, and the like).

Name: Miser's Envy
Effect: One living creature and one object (see text)
Short Description: Subject jealously covets nearby object.

Name: Mislead
Saving Throw: 1 round/level (D) and concentration + 3 rounds; see text
Resistance: None or Will disbelief (if interacted with); see text
Short Description: No
Medium Description: Turns you invisible and creates illusory double.

Name: Misrepresent Alignment
Short Description: Projects a false alignment for an object or creature.

Name: Mnemonic Enhancer
Short Description: Wizard only. Prepares extra spells or retains one just cast.
Long Descripton: Casting this spell allows you to prepare additional spells or retain spells recently cast. Pick one of these two versions when the spell is cast.[lf][lf]Prepare: You prepare up to three additional levels of spells. A cantrip counts as 1/2 level for this purpose. You prepare and cast these spells normally.[lf][lf]Retain: You retain any spell of 3rd level or lower that you had cast up to 1 round before you started casting the mnemonic enhancer. This restores the previously cast spell to your mind.[lf][lf]In either event, the spell or spells prepared or retained fade after 24 hours (if not cast).

Name: Modify Memory
Short Description: Changes 5 minutes of subjects memories.
Long Descripton: You reach into the subjects mind and modify as many as 5 minutes of its memories in one of the following ways.[lf][lf] Eliminate all memory of an event the subject actually experienced. This spell cannot negate charm, geas/quest, suggestion, or similar spells.[lf][lf] Allow the subject to recall with perfect clarity an event it actually experienced.[lf][lf] Change the details of an event the subject actually experienced.[lf][lf] Implant a memory of an event the subject never experienced.[lf][lf]Casting the spell takes 1 round. If the subject fails to save, you proceed with the spell by spending as much as 5 minutes (a period of time equal to the amount of memory time you want to modify) visualizing the memory you wish to modify in the subject. If your concentration is disturbed before the visualization is complete, or if the subject is ever beyond the spells range during this time, the spell is lost.[lf][lf]A modified memory does not necessarily affect the subjects actions, particularly if it contradicts the creatures natural inclinations. An illogical modified memory is dismissed by the creature as a bad dream or a memory muddied by too much wine.

Name: Molten Strike
Short Description: 5-ft.-radius burst deals 2d6 fire damage, ignites nearby targets.

Name: Moment of Clarity
Short Description: Target immediately makes a new saving throw to resist a mind-affecting spell or effect.

Name: Moment of Prescience
Short Description: You gain insight bonus on single attack roll, check, or save.
Long Descripton: This spell grants you a powerful sixth sense in relation to yourself. Once during the spells duration, you may choose to use its effect. This spell grants you an insight bonus equal to your caster level (maximum +25) on any single attack roll, opposed ability or skill check, or saving throw. Alternatively, you can apply the insight bonus to your AC against a single attack (even if flatfooted). Activating the effect doesn't take an action; you can even activate it on another characters turn if needed. You must choose to use the moment of prescience before you make the roll it is to modify. Once used, the spell ends.[lf][lf]You can't have more than one moment of prescience active on you at the same time.

Name: Monstrous Regeneration
Short Description: Grants the regeneration ability for 1 round/2 levels.

Name: Monstrous Thrall
Short Description: As true domination, but nearly permanent and affects any creature.

Name: Moon Blade
Short Description: Touch attack deals 1d8 damage +1/two levels (max +15), more to undead, plus scrambles spellcasting.

Name: Moon Bolt
Effect: One living or undead creature, or two living or undead creatures that are no more than 15 ft. apart; see text
Saving Throw: Fortitude half (living target) or Will negates (undead target)
Short Description: 1d4 Strength damage/3 levels; undead made helpless.
Medium Description: 1d4 Strength damage/3 levels (max 5d4); undead made helpless for 1d4 rounds and -2 attack and Will saves for 1 minute.

Name: Moon Lust
Short Description: Subject obsesses about moon, is fascinated or dazzled.
Medium Description: Subject obsesses about moon, is fascinated or dazzled on successful Will save.

Name: Moon Path
Effect: A variable-width, glowing white stair or bridge of translucent force up to 15 ft/level long (see text)
Short Description: Grants sanctuary to 1 creature/level and bridges gaps.

Name: Moonbeam
Short Description: Creates a cone of moonlight that causes lycanthropes to assume animal form, penetrates darkness spells of equal or lower level.

Name: Moonbow
Duration: Instantaneous or up to 4 rounds; see text
Short Description: Creates 1d4 motes of light that attack enemies.

Name: Moonfire
Effect: Cone-shaped burst and cone-shaped emanation; see text
Saving Throw: Reflex half and Will negates; see text
Short Description: Cone of moonlight deals 1d8 damage/two levels (max 10d8, magical auras glow blue for 1 round/level, illuminates as full mune, negates electricity for 1 round/level.
Medium Description: Cone of moonlight deals 1d8 damage/two levels (max 10d8), magical auras glow for 1 round/level, illuminates as full moon, negates electricity for 1 round/level.

Name: Morality Undone
Short Description: Subject becomes evil.

Name: Mordenkainen's Capable Caravel
Effect: Ship plus extradimensional space, up to three 10-ft. cubes/level (S)
Short Description: Creates magical ship with extradimensional staterooms.

Name: Mount
Short Description: Summons riding horse for 2 hours/level.
Long Descripton: You summon a light horse or a pony (your choice) to serve you as a mount. The steed serves willingly and well. The mount comes with a bit and bridle and a riding saddle.

Name: Mountain Stance
Short Description: Subject can root itself against involuntary movement.

Name: Move Earth
Effect: Dirt in an area up to 750 ft. square and up to 10 ft. deep (S)
Short Description: Digs trenches and builds hills.
Long Descripton: Move earth moves dirt (clay, loam, sand), possibly collapsing embankments, moving hillocks, shifting dunes, and so forth.[lf][lf]However, in no event can rock formations be collapsed or moved. The area to be affected determines the casting time. For every 150-foot square (up to 10 feet deep), casting takes 10 minutes. The maximum area, 750 feet by 750 feet, takes 4 hours and 10 minutes to move.[lf][lf]This spell does not violently break the surface of the ground. Instead, it creates wavelike crests and troughs, with the earth reacting with glacierlike fluidity until the desired result is achieved. Trees, structures, rock formations, and such are mostly unaffected except for changes in elevation and relative topography.[lf][lf]The spell cannot be used for tunneling and is generally too slow to trap or bury creatures. Its primary use is for digging or filling moats or for adjusting terrain contours before a battle.[lf][lf]This spell has no effect on earth creatures.

Name: Move Snow and Ice
Effect: Snow or ice in an area up to 750 ft. square and up to 10 ft. deep (S)
Short Description: Digs trenches and builds hills in ice and snow.

Name: Mudslide
Short Description: Landslide buries, mires creatures within a 40-ft. radius.

Name: Mummify
Short Description: Touched living creature dies and is mummified.

Name: Murderous Mist
Effect: Cloud that spreads in 30-ft. radius, 20 ft. high
Short Description: Cloud of steam deals 2d6 damage and causes blindness and inflicts 1d6/round thereafter.

Name: Mystic Lash
Short Description: Ranged touch attack deals 1d8 +1/2 levels electricity, plus stunning.

Name: Nar Fiendbond
Effect: One humanoid with Int 4 or higher
Short Description: Subject gains half-fiend template.

Name: Natural Weapon Augmentation
Short Description: Natural weapon gains special ability with up to +3 bonus market price modifier.

Name: Natural Weapon Augmentation, Greater
Short Description: Natural weapon gains special ability with up to +5 bonus market price modifier.

Name: Natural Weapon Augmentation, Lesser
Short Description: Natural weapon gains special ability with +1 bonus market price modifier.

Name: Natural Weapon Augmentation, Personal
Short Description: One of your natural weapons gains special ability with +1 bonus market price modifier.

Name: Nature's Avatar
Short Description: Animal gains +10 on attack and damage, extra attack, and 1d8 hp/caster level.

Name: Nature's Balance
Short Description: You transfer 4 ability score points to the target for 10 min./level.

Name: Nature's Favor
Short Description: Target animal gains +1/3 caster levels (max +5) luck bonus on attack and damage rolls.

Name: Nature's Purity
Short Description: Ray deals 2d6 force damage to undead and 5d6 to aberrations.

Name: Nature's Rampart
Short Description: Alter a natural setting into a fortified position.

Name: Nature's Wrath
Saving Throw: Will partial or Will half; see text
Short Description: Damages and dazes aberrations; damages other creatures.
Medium Description: Deals 1d6/level (max 10d6) damage and dazes aberrations; 1d8/two levels (max 5d8) to other creatures.

Name: Naturewatch
Effect: Quarter circle emanating from you to the extreme of the range
Short Description: As deathwatch, but only for animals and plants.

Name: Nauseating Breath
Short Description: Exhale a cone of nauseating gas.
Medium Description: Creatures in the cone are nauseated for 1d6 rounds

Name: Necrosurgery
Short Description: Grants +2 bonus to resist disease.

Name: Necrotic Awareness
Short Description: Sense encysted subjects.

Name: Necrotic Bloat
Short Description: Encysted subject takes 1d6 damage/level.
Medium Description: Encysted subject takes 1d6/level (max 10d6) internal damage, half of it vile.

Name: Necrotic Burst
Short Description: Encysted subject killed, cyst begins to roam.

Name: Necrotic Cyst
Short Description: Encyst undead sac of tissue in subject.
Medium Description: Encyst undead sac of tissue in subject, causing extra 1d6 damage when subject is harmed by undead natural weapons.

Name: Necrotic Domination
Short Description: Completely control encysted subject.

Name: Necrotic Empowerment
Short Description: Draw personal vigor from mother cyst.

Name: Necrotic Eruption
Effect: Living creature with necrotic cyst and all creatures in 20 ft. radius spread
Short Description: Encysted subject killed, those nearby damaged and possibly encysted.
Medium Description: Encysted subject killed, those nearby take 1d6 damage/level (max 15d6) and possibly encysted.

Name: Necrotic Scrying
Short Description: Hear or see encysted subject at a distance.

Name: Necrotic Skull Bomb
Short Description: Exploding skull releases negative energy; targets each gain 1d4 negative levels.

Name: Necrotic Termination
Short Description: Permanently eliminates encysted subject.

Name: Necrotic Tumor
Short Description: Permanently control encysted subject.

Name: Negative Energy Aura
Short Description: 10-ft. radius surrounding you deals 2 points of damage/round.
Medium Description: 10-ft. radius surrounding you deals 2 points negative energy damage/round.

Name: Negative Energy Burst
Short Description: 1d8+1/level (max +10) negative energy damage, 20-foot radius.

Name: Negative Energy Ray
Short Description: Ranged touch, 1d6 negative energy damage; 1d6/two levels above 1st (max 5d6).

Name: Negative Energy Wave
Short Description: Surge of negative energy rebukes or bolsters 1d6 HD/level (max 15d6) worth of undead.

Name: Nerveskitter
Short Description: Target gains +5 bonus on initiative checks.

Name: Net of Shadows
Effect: Up to one creature/level, no two of which can be more than 25 ft. apart.
Short Description: Creates ordinary shadows that provide concealment to all in the area.

Name: Nether Trail
Short Description: Creates a trail compelling evil outsiders to follow.

Name: Neutralize Poison
Effect: Creature or object of up to 1 cu. ft./level touched
Short Description: Immunizes subject against poison, detoxifies venom in or on subject.
Long Descripton: You detoxify any sort of venom in the creature or object touched. A poisoned creature suffers no additional effects from the poison, and any temporary effects are ended, but the spell does not reverse instantaneous effects, such as hit point damage, temporary ability damage, or effects that don't go away on their own.[lf][lf]The creature is immune to any poison it is exposed to during the duration of the spell. Unlike with delay poison, such effects aren't postponed until after the duration the creature need not make any saves against poison effects applied to it during the length of the spell.[lf][lf]This spell can instead neutralize the poison in a poisonous creature or object for the duration of the spell, at the caster's option.

Name: Nezram's Amethyst Aura
Short Description: Prevents poisons and diseases from affecting the subject.

Name: Nezram's Emerald Energy Shield
Short Description: Grants immunity to deafness effects and language-dependent, mind-affecting effects, plus sonic resistance 10 and a +4 bonus on saves against spells and effects with the sonic descriptor to which the subject isn't already immune.

Name: Nezram's Sapphire Screen of Shielding
Short Description: Moving shield of force grants +4 bonus to AC against ranged attacks and DR 10/magic against all other attacks.

Name: Night's Caress
Short Description: Touched foe take 1d8 points of damage per level plus 1d8+2 Con damage.
Medium Description: Touched foe take 1d6/level (max 15d6) damage plus 1d6+2 Con damage. Undead flee in panic 1d4 rounds.

Name: Nightmare
Short Description: Sends vision dealing 1d10 damage, fatigue.
Long Descripton: You send a hideous and unsettling phantasmal vision to a specific creature that you name or otherwise specifically designate.  [lf]The nightmare prevents restful sleep and causes 1d10 points of damage. The nightmare leaves the subject fatigued and unable to regain arcane spells for the next 24 hours.  [lf]The difficulty of the save depends on how well you know the subject and what sort of physical connection (if any) you have to that creature.  [lf]  KnowledgeWill Save Modifier  [lf]None(1)+10  [lf]Secondhand (you have heard of the subject)+5  [lf]Firsthand (you have met the subject)+0  [lf]Familiar (you know the subject well)-5  [lf]1 You must have some sort of connection to a creature you have no knowledge of.    [lf]ConnectionWill Save Modifier  [lf]Likeness or picture-2  [lf]Possession or garment-4  [lf]Body part, lock of hair, bit of nail, etc.-10    [lf]Dispel evil cast on the subject while you are casting the spell dispels the nightmare and causes you to be stunned for 10 minutes per caster level of the dispel evil.
