[lf]If the recipient is awake when the spell begins, you can choose to cease casting (ending the spell) or to enter a trance until the recipient goes to sleep, whereupon you become alert again and complete the casting. If you are disturbed during the trance, you must succeed on a Concentration check as if you were in the midst of casting a spell or the spell ends.  [lf]If you choose to enter a trance, you are not aware of your surroundings or the activities around you while in the trance.  [lf]You are defenseless, both physically and mentally, while in the trance. (You always fail any saving throw, for example.)  [lf]Creatures who don't sleep (such as elves, but not half-elves) or dream are immune to this spell.

Name: Nightmare Lullaby
Short Description: Target is confused as long as you concentrate +2 rounds.

Name: Nightshield
Short Description: You gain +1/3 caster levels resistance bonus (max +3) and a magic missile shield for 5 points/level.  Spell ends when all damage is absorbed.

Name: Nightstalker's Transformation
Short Description: Gain +4 Dex, +3 luck bonus to AC, +5 luck bonus on Ref saves, +3d6 sneak attack, and evasion.

Name: Nimbus of Light
Short Description: Sunlight illuminates you until released as an attack for 1d8+1/level damage.

Name: Nixie's Grace
Short Description: You gain a swim speed, water breathing, low-light vision, damage reduction 5/cold iron, and enhancements to Dexterity and Wisdom.
Medium Description: You gain swim speed 30 feet, water breathing, low-light vision, DR 5/cold iron, +6 Dexterity, +2 Wisdom, and +8 Charisma.

Name: No Light
Short Description: Prevents normal light from illuminating.

Name: Node Door
Effect: You and touched objects or other touched willing creatures.
Short Description: Allows teleportation between any known nodes.

Name: Node Genesis
Effect: One Class 1 node with a 10-ft. radius
Short Description: Creates a Class 1 earth node.

Name: Node Lock
Short Description: Deters others from using an earth node's powers.

Name: Nondetection
Short Description: Hides subject from divination, scrying.
Long Descripton: The warded creature or object becomes difficult to detect by divination spells such as clairaudience/clairvoyance, locate object, and detect spells. Nondetection also prevents location by such magic items as crystal balls. If a divination is attempted against the warded creature or item, the caster of the divination must succeed on a caster level check (1d20 + caster level) against a DC of 11 + the caster level of the spellcaster who cast nondetection. If you cast nondetection on yourself or on an item currently in your possession, the DC is 15 + your caster level.[lf][lf]If cast on a creature, nondetection wards the creature's gear as well as the creature itself.

Name: Nosy Neighbor
Short Description: Provides you with a +1 bonus on Listen checks.

Name: Numbing Sphere
Short Description: Creates rolling ball of intense cold that deals 1d6 cold damage plus 1d4 Dex damage, lasts 1[lf][lf]round/level.

Name: Nybor's Joyful Voyage
Short Description: This spell functions like teleport, except that it teleports another creature (willing or unwilling) rather than yourself, and the target location is random.

Name: Nybor's Psychic Imprint
Short Description: Imprint a mind into a gem that can be used as the personality of an intelligent item.

Name: Obedient Avalanche
Effect: 20-ft.-radius avalanche of snow, centered anywhere within range; see text
Short Description: Snowy avalanche crushes and buries your foes.

Name: Obscure Object
Effect: One object touched of up to 100 lb./level
Short Description: Masks object against scrying.
Long Descripton: This spell hides an object from location by divination (scrying) effects, such as the scrying spell or a crystal ball. Such an attempt automatically fails (if the divination is targeted on the object) or fails to perceive the object (if the divination is targeted on a nearby location, object, or person).

Name: Obscuring Mist
Effect: Cloud spreads in 20-ft. radius from you, 20 ft. high
Short Description: Fog surrounds you.
Medium Description: Fog obscures all sight incl darkvision, 20% miss chance on adjacent, 50% on farther creatures.
Long Descripton: A misty vapor arises around you. It is stationary once created. The vapor obscures all sight, including darkvision, beyond 5 feet. A creature 5 feet away has concealment (attacks have a 20% miss chance). Creatures farther away have total concealment (50% miss chance, and the attacker cannot use sight to locate the target).[lf][lf]A moderate wind (11+ mph), such as from a gust of wind spell, disperses the fog in 4 rounds. A strong wind (21+ mph) disperses the fog in 1 round. A fireball, flame strike, or similar spell burns away the fog in the explosive or fiery spell's area. A wall of fire burns away the fog in the area into which it deals damage.[lf][lf]This spell does not function underwater.

Name: Obscuring Snow
Effect: Cloud spreads in 30-ft.-radius from you, 30 ft. high
Short Description: Obscures sight in a 30-ft. radius around the caster.

Name: Omen of Peril
Short Description: You know how dangerous the future will be.

Name: One Mind
Short Description: As lesser one mind, but also gain +2 to attack while mounted.

Name: One Mind, Greater
Short Description: As one mind, but also gain +2 to damage while mounted.

Name: One Mind, Lesser
Short Description: You gain +4 on Spot and Listen checks while mounted
Medium Description: While mounted, you gain +4 on Spot and Listen checks and the scent ability.

Name: One with the Land
Short Description: Link with nature gives a +2 bonus on nature-related skill checks.

Name: Ooze Puppet
Short Description: You telekinetically control an ooze.

Name: Opalescent Glare
Short Description: Kill evil creatures with a look, or make them very afraid.

Name: Open/Close
Effect: Object weighing up to 30 lb. or portal that can be opened or closed
Short Description: Opens or closes small or light things.
Long Descripton: You can open or close (your choice) a door, chest, box, window, bag, pouch, bottle, barrel, or other container. If anything resists this activity (such as a bar on a door or a lock on a chest), the spell fails. In addition, the spell can only open and close things weighing 30 pounds or less. Thus, doors, chests, and similar objects sized for enormous creatures may be beyond this spells ability to affect.

Name: Opportune Dodge
Short Description: Subject can avoid a single attack of opportunity.

Name: Orb of Acid
Short Description: Ranged touch, 1d6/level (max 15d6) points of acid damage.

Name: Orb of Acid, Greater
Short Description: Orb deals 1d6/level (max 25d6) acid damage, may sicken subject for 1d6 + 1 rounds.
Long Descripton: An orb of acid, greater about 3 inches across shoots from your palm at its target, dealing 1d6 points of acid damage per caster level (maximum 25d6). You must succeed on a ranged touch attack to hit your target.[lf][lf]A creature struck by the orb takes damage and becomes sickened by the acid's noxious fumes for 1d6 + 1 round. A successful Fortitude save negates the sickened effect but does not reduce the damage.

Name: Orb of Acid, Lesser
Short Description: Ranged touch, 1d8 or more acid damage.

Name: Orb of Cold
Short Description: Ranged touch, 1d6/level (max 15d6) points of cold damage.

Name: Orb of Cold, Lesser
Short Description: Ranged touch, 1d8 or more cold damage.

Name: Orb of Dancing Death
Short Description: Orb you control bestows 1 negative level each round.
Medium Description: Orb you control bestows 1 negative level to targets. Each round, it requires a move action to direct the attack and a ranged touch attack to hit.

Name: Orb of Electricity
Short Description: Ranged touch, 1d6/level (max 15d6) points of electricity damage.

Name: Orb of Electricity, Lesser
Short Description: Ranged touch, 1d8 or more electricity damage.

Name: Orb of Fire
Short Description: Ranged touch, 1d6/level (max 15d6) points of fire damage.

Name: Orb of Fire, Lesser
Short Description: Ranged touch, 1d8 or more fire damage.

Name: Orb of Force
Short Description: Globes of force deal 1d6/level (max 10d6) damage.

Name: Orb of Negative Energy
Short Description: Globes of negative energy deal 1d6/level damage (max 10d6).
Long Descripton: You create a globe of negative energy 3 inches across, which streaks from your palm toward your target. You must succeed on a ranged touch attack to hit the target. The orb deals a total of 1d6 points of damage per caster level (maximum 10d6).

Name: Orb of Sound
Short Description: Ranged touch, 1d4/level (max 15d4) points of sonic damage.

Name: Orb of Sound, Lesser
Short Description: Ranged touch, 1d6 or more sonic damage.

Name: Orbs of Various Energy
Descriptor: Acid, Cold, Electricity, Fire, Force, Sonic, Negative
Short Description: 7 orbs deal 1d6/level (max 20d6) of damage dice divided evenly amoung the five elemental energies, force, and negative energy.
Long Descripton: You create 7 orbs of energy, one for each of the primary energies, a force orb, and a negative energy orb. You may deal 1d6 damage per caster level (max 20d6) divided any way you want amoung the seven orbs, with no orb having more than 1 die of damage more than any other die.[lf][lf]Thus an 11th level wizard could do 2d6 damage with each Acid, Cold, Fire, and Electricity and 1d6 with each negative energy, sonic, and force. None of his orbs could have 3d6 until 15th level.[lf][lf]If the negative energy orb is directed at an undead or other creature powered by negative energy, it is healed instead of damaged.

Name: Order's Wrath
Effect: Nonlawful creatures within a burst that fills a 30-ft. cube
Short Description: Damages and dazes chaotic creatures.
Long Descripton: You channel lawful power to smite enemies. The power takes the form of a three-dimensional grid of energy. Only chaotic and neutral (not lawful) creatures are harmed by the spell.[lf][lf]The spell deals 1d8 points of damage per two caster levels (maximum 5d8) to chaotic creatures (or 1d6 points of damage per caster level, maximum 10d6, to chaotic outsiders) and causes them to be dazed for 1 round. A successful Will save reduces the damage to half and negates the daze effect.[lf][lf]The spell deals only half damage to creatures who are neither chaotic nor lawful, and they are not dazed. They can reduce the damage in half again (down to one-quarter of the roll) with a successful Will save.

Name: Otyugh Swarm
Effect: Three or more otyughs, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Creates 4d4 otyughs or 1d3+1 Huge otyughs.

Name: Overland Flight
Short Description: You fly at a speed of 40 ft. and can hustle over long distances.
Long Descripton: The subject can fly at a speed of 40 feet (or 30 feet if it wears medium or heavy armor, or if it carries a medium or heavy load). It can ascend at half speed and descend at double speed, and its maneuverability is average. Using a fly spell requires only as much concentration as walking, so the subject can attack or cast spells normally. The subject of a fly spell can charge but not run, and it cannot carry aloft more weight than its maximum load, plus any armor it wears.[lf][lf]Should the spell duration expire while the subject is still aloft, the magic fails slowly. The subject floats downward 60 feet per round for 1d6 rounds. If it reaches the ground in that amount of time, it lands safely. If not, it falls the rest of the distance, taking 1d6 points of damage per 10 feet of fall. Since dispelling a spell effectively ends it, the subject also descends in this way if the fly spell is dispelled, but not if it is negated by an antimagic field.[lf][lf]When using this spell for long-distance movement, you can hustle without taking nonlethal damage (a forced march still requires Constitution checks). This means you can cover 64 miles in an eight-hour period of flight (or 48 miles at a speed of 30 feet).

Name: Overwhelming Revelations
Short Description: Creatures take a -2d6 penalty to Wisdom, are confused for 1 round.
Medium Description: Creatures take a -2d6 penalty to Wisdom, are confused for 1 round. A successful Will save reduces the penalty by half and negates the confusion.

Name: Owl's Insight
Short Description: Subject gains +1/2 levels enhancement bonus to Wis for 1 hour.

Name: Owl's Wisdom
Short Description: Subject gains +4 to Wis for 1 min./level.
Long Descripton: The transmuted creature becomes wiser. The spell grants a +4 enhancement bonus to Wisdom, adding the usual benefit to Wisdom-related skills. Clerics, druids, paladins, and rangers (and other Wisdom-based spellcasters) who receive owls wisdom do not gain any additional bonus spells for the increased Wisdom, but the save DCs for their spells increase.

Name: Owl's Wisdom, Mass
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: As owl's wisdom, affects one subject/level.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like owl's wisdom, except that it affects multiple creatures.

Name: Pack of Ghouls
Effect: 3d4 ghouls, no two of which can be more than 5 ft. apart
Short Description: You summon a pack of ghouls.
Medium Description: You summon a pack of ghouls.

Name: Pain
Effect: Up to 1 HD/level of creatures, no two of which can be more than 20 ft. apart
Short Description: The target creatures are struck by wracking pains and agony, giving them a -4 penalty on attack rolls, skill checks, and ability checks. A successful Fortitude save lessens this penalty to -2.

Name: Panacea
Short Description: Removes most afflictions.

Name: Parboil
Short Description: Flash-heats air dealing 6d6 fire and 2d4 Intelligence damage to one or more creatures.

Name: Parching Touch
Effect: Living creature or creatures touched (up to one/level)
Short Description: One touch/level deals 1d6 desication damage and possibly 1 Con damage.

Name: Pass through Ice
Short Description: Subject can pass through ice or snow like water.

Name: Pass without Trace
Short Description: One subject/level leaves no tracks.
Long Descripton: The subject or subjects can move through any type of terrain and leave neither footprints nor scent. Tracking the subjects is impossible by nonmagical means.

Name: Passwall
Effect: 5 ft. by 8 ft. opening, 10 ft. deep plus 5 ft. deep per three additional levels
Short Description: Creates passage through wood or stone wall.
Long Descripton: You create a passage through wooden, plaster, or stone walls, but not through metal or other harder materials. The passage is 10 feet deep plus an additional 5 feet deep per three caster levels above 9th (15 feet at 12th, 20 feet at 15th, and a maximum of 25 feet deep at 18th level). If the walls thickness is more than the depth of the passage created, then a single passwall simply makes a niche or short tunnel. Several passwall spells can then form a continuing passage to breach very thick walls. When passwall ends, creatures within the passage are ejected out the nearest exit. If someone dispels the passwall or you dismiss it, creatures in the passage are ejected out the far exit, if there is one, or out the sole exit if there is only one.

Name: Path of the Exalted
Short Description: Caster receives divine guidance from a higher power.

Name: Pavilion of Grandeur
Effect: Extradimensional pavilion, up to five 10-ft. cubes/ level (S), plus feast for 12 creatures/level
Short Description: A feast and a great pavilion are created.

Name: Peaceful Serenity of Io
Effect: One creature plus one additional creature/four levels, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Grant subject +4 bonus on Concentration checks and against compulsions and fear effects.

Name: Pending Potion
Effect: Vial of potion or oil touched
Short Description: Target potion or oil takes effect at a later time.

Name: Percussion
Short Description: Creates illusory drum accompaniment.

Name: Perfect Summons
Short Description: Creates an area where only good creatures can be summoned.

Name: Perinarch
Saving Throw: None (object) and Reflex negates; see text
Short Description: Gain greater control over Limbo's morphic essence.

Name: Perinarch, Planar
Effect: Plane's morphic essence within close range.
Saving Throw: None (object) and Reflex negates; see text
Short Description: Gain control over a small area of any divinely morphic plane.

Name: Permanency
Short Description: Makes certain spells permanent.
Long Descripton: This spell makes certain other spells permanent.  Depending on the spell, you must be of a minimum caster level and must expend a number of XP.  [lf]You can make the following spells permanent in regard to yourself.  [lf]SpellMinimum Caster LevelXP Cost  [lf]Arcane sight11th1,500 XP  [lf]Comprehend languages9th500 XP  [lf]Darkvision10th1,000 XP  [lf]Detect magic9th500 XP  [lf]Read magic9th500 XP  [lf]See invisibility10th1,000 XP  [lf]Tongues11th1,500 XP    [lf]You cast the desired spell and then follow it with the permanency spell. You cannot cast these spells on other creatures. This application of permanency can be dispelled only by a caster of higher level than you were when you cast the spell.  [lf]In addition to personal use, permanency can be used to make the following spells permanent on yourself, another creature, or an object (as appropriate).    [lf]SpellMinimum Caster LevelXP Cost  [lf]Enlarge person9th500 XP  [lf]Magic fang9th500 XP  [lf]Magic fang, greater11th1,500 XP  [lf]Reduce person9th500 XP  [lf]Resistance9th500 XP  [lf]Telepathic bond 113th2,500 XP  [lf]Silvered Claws  9th500 XP  [lf]Silvered Weapon, Alternate  9th500 XP  [lf]Touch of Adamantine  12th2,000 XP    [lf]Enhance Familiar  11th1,500 XP  [lf]Fortify Familiar  12th2,000 XP      [lf]1 Only bonds two creatures per casting of permanency.  [lf]Additionally, the following spells can be cast upon objects or areas only and rendered permanent.    [lf]SpellMinimum Caster LevelXP Cost  [lf]Alarm9th500 XP  [lf]Animate objects14th3,000 XP  [lf]Dancing lights9th500 XP  [lf]Ghost sound9th500 XP  [lf]Gust of wind11th1,500 XP  [lf]Invisibility10th1,000 XP  [lf]Mage's private sanctum13th2,500 XP  [lf]Magic mouth10th1,000 XP  [lf]Phase door15th3,500 XP  [lf]Prismatic sphere17th4,500 XP  [lf]Prismatic wall16th4,000 XP  [lf]Shrink item11th1,500 XP  [lf]Solid fog12th2,000 XP  [lf]Stinking cloud11th1,500 XP  [lf]Symbol of death16th4,000 XP  [lf]Symbol of fear14th3,000 XP  [lf]Symbol of insanity16th4,000 XP  [lf]Symbol of pain13th2,500 XP  [lf]Symbol of persuasion14th3,000 XP  [lf]Symbol of sleep16th4,000 XP  [lf]Symbol of stunning15th3,500 XP  [lf]Symbol of weakness15th3,500 XP  [lf]Teleportation circle17th4,500 XP  [lf]Wall of fire12th2,000 XP  [lf]Wall of force13th2,500 XP  [lf]Web10th1,000 XP  [lf]Curtain of Light13th2,500 XP  [lf]Emerald Planes10th1,000 XP  [lf]Expeditious Excavation  15th3,500 XP    [lf]Familiar Pocket  10th1,000 XP  [lf]Otiluke's Dispelling Screen  12th2,000 XP  [lf]Spiritwall  13th2,500 XP  [lf]Otiluke's Greater Dispelling Screen  15th3,500 XP    [lf]Ice Web12th2,000 XP  [lf]Wall of coldfire12th2,000 XP    [lf]Black Sand11th1,500 XP  [lf]Wall of Magma13th2,500 XP  [lf]Wall of Sand 212th2,000 XP  [lf]Wall of Water12th2,000 XP      [lf]Spell8th level + 1 per spell level (min 9th)500 XP * spell level (min 500 XP)          [lf]Spells cast on other creatures, objects, or locations (not on you) are vulnerable to dispel magic as normal.

Name: Permanent Image
Effect: Figment that cannot extend beyond a 20-ft. cube + one 10-ft. cube/level (S)
Short Description: Includes sight, sound, and smell.
Long Descripton: This spell creates the visual illusion of an object, creature, or force, as visualized by you.[lf][lf]The figment includes visual, auditory, olfactory, and thermal elements, and the spell is permanent. By concentrating, you can move the image within the limits of the range, but it is static while you are not concentrating.

Name: Permanent Soul Binding
Short Description: Permanently soul bind an item to a person.
Long Descripton: The item gains a Permanent mark of Soulbinding (This is different from the Temporary binding marks.) and the item will disintigrate and appear near or in the possesion of the creature touched when the target creature is reborn in the Fount of Lost Souls. Soulbound Items can be identified as such with a Knowledge(San Suras) check (DC 10) or a Search check (DC 20).

Name: Permeable Form
Short Description: Immediate: You become incorporeal for 1 round.

Name: Persistent Blade
Short Description: Blade of force attacks target, automatically flanks.

Name: Persistent Image
Effect: Visual figment that cannot extend beyond four 10-ft. cubes + one 10-ft. cube/level (S)
Short Description: As major image, but no concentration required.
Long Descripton: This spell creates the visual illusion of an object, creature, or force, as visualized by you.[lf][lf]The figment includes visual, auditory, olfactory, and thermal elements, and the figment follows a script determined by you. The figment follows that script without your having to concentrate on it. The illusion can include intelligible speech if you wish.

Name: Pestilence
Short Description: Subject gains a disease, as do all who touch him.

Name: Phade's Fearsome Aspect
Short Description: The target gains a +5 bonus on Intimidate checks and can demoralize as a swift action.

Name: Phantasmal Assailants
Saving Throw: Will disbelief (if interacted with), then Fortitude half; see text
Short Description: Phantasm deals 4 Wis damage and 4 Dex damage.

Name: Phantasmal Decoy
Short Description: Creates illusory enemy for foe to chase.

Name: Phantasmal Disorientation
Short Description: Fools creature's sense of direction, making movement difficult.

Name: Phantasmal Killer
Saving Throw: Will disbelief (if interacted with), then Fortitude partial; see text
Short Description: Fearsome illusion kills subject or deals 3d6 damage.
Long Descripton: You create a phantasmal image of the most fearsome creature imaginable to the subject simply by forming the fears of the subject's subconscious mind into something that its conscious mind can visualize: this most horrible beast. Only the spell's subject can see the phantasmal killer. You see only a vague shape. The target first gets a Will save to recognize the image as unreal. If that save fails, the phantasm touches the subject, and the subject must succeed on a Fortitude save or die from fear. Even if the Fortitude save is successful, the subject takes 3d6 points of damage.[lf][lf]If the subject of a phantasmal killer attack succeeds in disbelieving and is wearing a helm of telepathy, the beast can be turned upon you. You must then disbelieve it or become subject to its deadly fear attack.

Name: Phantasmal Thief
Short Description: Creates an unseen force that steals from others.

Name: Phantom Battle
Short Description: Illusion of battle flanks creatures and denies attacks of opportunity.
Medium Description: Creatures failing save in area are flanked and denied attacks of opportunity. A CL number of designated allies are unaffected.

Name: Phantom Bear
Short Description: As phantom wolf, except you instead conjure an incorporeal bear with a fearsome roar.

Name: Phantom Foe
Short Description: Phantasm flanks subject.

Name: Phantom Guardians
Short Description: Create illusion of group of guards.

Name: Phantom Stag
Short Description: Magic stag appears for 1 hour/level.

Name: Phantom Steed
Short Description: Magic horse appears for 1 hour/level.
Long Descripton: You conjure a Large, quasi-real, horselike creature. The steed can be ridden only by you or by the one person for whom you specifically created the mount. A phantom steed has a black head and body, gray mane and tail, and smoke-colored, insubstantial hooves that make no sound. It has what seems to be a saddle, bit, and bridle. It does not fight, but animals shun it and refuse to attack it.[lf][lf]The mount has an AC of 18 (-1 size, +4 natural armor, +5 Dex) and 7 hit points +1 hit point per caster level. If it loses all its hit points, the phantom steed disappears. A phantom steed has a speed of 20 feet per caster level, to a maximum of 240 feet. It can bear its riders weight plus up to 10 pounds per caster level.[lf][lf]These mounts gain certain powers according to caster level. A mount's abilities include those of mounts of lower caster levels. [lf][lf]8th Level: The mount can ride over sandy, muddy, or even swampy ground without difficulty or decrease in speed.[lf][lf]10th Level: The mount can use water walk at will (as the spell, no action required to activate this ability).[lf][lf]12th Level: The mount can use air walk at will (as the spell, no action required to activate this ability) for up to 1 round at a time, after which it falls to the ground.[lf][lf]14th Level: The mount can fly at its speed (average maneuverability).

Name: Phantom Steed, Mass
Short Description: Magic horses appear for 1 hour/level.
Long Descripton: You conjure one Large, quasi-real, horselike creature per 2 caster levels (maximum 15 horses). Each steed can be ridden only by you or by the one person for whom you specifically created the mount. A phantom steed has a black head and body, gray mane and tail, and smoke-colored, insubstantial hooves that make no sound. It has what seems to be a saddle, bit, and bridle. It does not fight, but animals shun it and refuse to attack it.[lf][lf][lf][lf]The mount has an AC of 22 (-1 size, +6 natural armor, +7 Dex) and 14 hit points +2 hit points per caster level. If it loses all its hit points, the phantom steed disappears. A phantom steed has a speed of 20 feet per caster level, to a maximum of 240 feet. It can bear its riders weight plus up to 10 pounds per caster level.[lf][lf][lf][lf]These mounts gain certain powers according to caster level. A mount's abilities include those of mounts of lower caster levels.[lf][lf][lf][lf]8th Level: The mount can ride over sandy, muddy, or even swampy ground without difficulty or decrease in speed.[lf][lf][lf][lf]10th Level: The mount can use water walk at will (as the spell, no action required to activate this ability).[lf][lf][lf][lf]12th Level: The mount can use air walk at will (as the spell, no action required to activate this ability) for up to 1 round at a time, after which it falls to the ground.[lf][lf][lf][lf]14th Level: The mount can fly at its speed (good maneuverability).

Name: Phantom Threat
Short Description: Subject is flanked despite nothing being there.

Name: Phantom Trap
Short Description: Makes item seem trapped.
Long Descripton: This spell makes a lock or other small mechanism seem to be trapped to anyone who can detect traps. You place the spell upon any small mechanism or device, such as a lock, hinge, hasp, cork, cap, or ratchet. Any character able to detect traps, or who uses any spell or device enabling trap detection, is 100% certain a real trap exists. Of course, the effect is illusory and nothing happens if the trap is sprung; its primary purpose is to frighten away thieves or make them waste precious time.[lf][lf]If another phantom trap is active within 50 feet when the spell is cast, the casting fails.

Name: Phantom Wolf
Short Description: Incorporeal wolf fights for you.

Name: Phase Door
Effect: Ethereal 5 ft. by 8 ft. opening, 10 ft. deep + 5 ft. deep per three levels
Short Description: Creates an invisible passage through wood or stone.
Long Descripton: This spell creates an ethereal passage through wooden, plaster, or stone walls, but not other materials. The phase door is invisible and inaccessible to all creatures except you, and only you can use the passage. You disappear when you enter the phase door and appear when you exit. If you desire, you can take one other creature (Medium or smaller) through the door. This counts as two uses of the door. The door does not allow light, sound, or spell effects through it, nor can you see through it without using it. Thus, the spell can provide an escape route, though certain creatures, such as phase spiders, can follow with ease. A gem of true seeing or similar magic reveals the presence of a phase door but does not allow its use.[lf][lf]A phase door is subject to dispel magic. If anyone is within the passage when it is dispelled, he is harmlessly ejected just as if he were inside a passwall effect.[lf][lf]You can allow other creatures to use the phase door by setting some triggering condition for the door. Such conditions can be as simple or elaborate as you desire. They can be based on a creatures name, identity, or alignment, but otherwise must be based on observable actions or qualities. Intangibles such as level, class, Hit Dice, and hit points dont qualify.[lf][lf]Phase door can be made permanent with a permanency spell.

Name: Phieran's Resolve
Effect: One good creature/level in a 20-ft.-radius burst centered on you
Short Description: +4 sacred bonus on saves against spells with the evil descriptor.

Name: Phoenix Fire
Short Description: Evil creatures take 2d6 damage/caster level as you immolate yourself.

Name: Plague Carrier
Short Description: As contagion, except target can transmit the disease for a short time.

Name: Plague of Nightmares
Short Description: Subject takes ld4 Con damage and does not heal.

Name: Plague of Rats
Effect: One swarm of rats/two levels, each of which must be adjacent to at least one other swarm
Short Description: Summon horde of diseased rats.

Name: Plague of Undead
Effect: One or more corpses within range
Short Description: Animates horde of undead.

Name: Planar Ally
Effect: One or two called elementals or outsiders, totaling no more than 12 HD, which cannot be more than 30 ft. apart when they appear
Short Description: As lesser planar ally, but up to 12 HD.
Long Descripton: By casting this spell, you request your deity to send you an elemental or outsider (of 12 HD or less) of the deitys choice or two creatures of the same kind whose Hit Dice total no more than 12. If you serve no particular deity, the spell is a general plea answered by a creature sharing your philosophical alignment. If you know an individual creatures name, you may request that individual by speaking the name during the spell (though you might get a different creature anyway).[lf][lf]You may ask the creatures to perform one task in exchange for a payment from you. Tasks might range from the simple to the complex. You must be able to communicate with the creatures called in order to bargain for their services.[lf][lf]The creatures called require a payment for their services. This payment can take a variety of forms, from donating gold or magic items to an allied temple, to a gift given directly to the creature, to some other action on your part that matches the creatures' alignment and goals. Regardless, this payment must be made before the creatures agrees to perform any services. The bargaining takes at least 1 round, so any actions by the creature begin in the round after it arrives.[lf][lf]A task taking up to 1 minute per caster level requires a payment of 100 gp per HD of the creature called. For a task taking up to 1 hour per caster level, the creature requires a payment of 500 gp per HD. A long-term task, one requiring up to one day per caster level, requires a payment of 1,000 gp per HD.[lf][lf]A nonhazardous task requires only half the indicated payment, while an especially hazardous task might require a greater gift. Few if any creatures will accept a task that seems suicidal (remember, a called creature actually dies when it is killed, unlike a summoned creature). However, if the task is strongly aligned with the creatures' ethos, it may halve or even waive the payment. [lf][lf]At the end of its task, or when the duration bargained for expires, the creature returns to its home plane (after reporting back to you, if appropriate and possible).[lf][lf]Note: When you use a calling spell that calls an air, chaotic, earth, evil, fire, good, lawful, or water creature, it is a spell of that type.

Name: Planar Ally, Greater
Effect: Up to three called elementals or outsiders, totaling no more than 18 HD, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart when they appear.
Short Description: As lesser planar ally, but up to 18 HD.
Long Descripton: By casting this spell, you request your deity to send you an elemental or outsider (of 18 HD or less) of the deitys choice or up to three creatures of the same kind whose Hit Dice total no more than 18. If you serve no particular deity, the spell is a general plea answered by a creature sharing your philosophical alignment. If you know an individual creatures name, you may request that individual by speaking the name during the spell (though you might get a different creature anyway).[lf][lf]You may ask the creatures to perform one task in exchange for a payment from you. Tasks might range from the simple to the complex. You must be able to communicate with the creatures called in order to bargain for their services.[lf][lf]The creatures called require a payment for their services. This payment can take a variety of forms, from donating gold or magic items to an allied temple, to a gift given directly to the creature, to some other action on your part that matches the creatures' alignment and goals. Regardless, this payment must be made before the creatures agrees to perform any services. The bargaining takes at least 1 round, so any actions by the creature begin in the round after it arrives.[lf][lf]A task taking up to 1 minute per caster level requires a payment of 100 gp per HD of the creature called. For a task taking up to 1 hour per caster level, the creature requires a payment of 500 gp per HD. A long-term task, one requiring up to one day per caster level, requires a payment of 1,000 gp per HD.[lf][lf]A nonhazardous task requires only half the indicated payment, while an especially hazardous task might require a greater gift. Few if any creatures will accept a task that seems suicidal (remember, a called creature actually dies when it is killed, unlike a summoned creature). However, if the task is strongly aligned with the creatures' ethos, it may halve or even waive the payment. [lf][lf]At the end of its task, or when the duration bargained for expires, the creature returns to its home plane (after reporting back to you, if appropriate and possible).[lf][lf]Note: When you use a calling spell that calls an air, chaotic, earth, evil, fire, good, lawful, or water creature, it is a spell of that type.

Name: Planar Ally, Lesser
Effect: One called elemental or outsider of 6 HD or less
Short Description: Exchange services with a 6 HD extraplanar creature.
Long Descripton: By casting this spell, you request your deity to send you an elemental or outsider (of 6 HD or less) of the deitys choice. If you serve no particular deity, the spell is a general plea answered by a creature sharing your philosophical alignment. If you know an individual creature's name, you may request that individual by speaking the name during the spell (though you might get a different creature anyway).[lf][lf]You may ask the creature to perform one task in exchange for a payment from you. Tasks might range from the simple to the complex. You must be able to communicate with the creature called in order to bargain for its services.[lf][lf]The creature called requires a payment for its services. This payment can take a variety of forms, from donating gold or magic items to an allied temple, to a gift given directly to the creature, to some other action on your part that matches the creature's alignment and goals. Regardless, this payment must be made before the creature agrees to perform any services. The bargaining takes at least 1 round, so any actions by the creature begin in the round after it arrives.[lf][lf]A task taking up to 1 minute per caster level requires a payment of 100 gp per HD of the creature called. For a task taking up to 1 hour per caster level, the creature requires a payment of 500 gp per HD. A long-term task, one requiring up to one day per caster level, requires a payment of 1,000 gp per HD.[lf][lf]A nonhazardous task requires only half the indicated payment, while an especially hazardous task might require a greater gift. Few if any creatures will accept a task that seems suicidal (remember, a called creature actually dies when it is killed, unlike a summoned creature). However, if the task is strongly aligned with the creature's ethos, it may halve or even waive the payment. [lf][lf]At the end of its task, or when the duration bargained for expires, the creature returns to its home plane (after reporting back to you, if appropriate and possible).[lf][lf]Note: When you use a calling spell that calls an air, chaotic, earth, evil, fire, good, lawful, or water creature, it is a spell of that type.

Name: Planar Binding
Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels); see text
Effect: Up to three elementals or outsiders, totaling no more than 12 HD, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart when they appear
Short Description: As lesser planar binding, but up to 12 HD.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like lesser planar binding, except that you may call a single creature of 12 HD or less, or up to three creatures of the same kind whose Hit Dice total no more than 12. Each creature gets a save, makes an independent attempt to escape, and must be individually persuaded to aid you.[lf][lf]Casting this spell attempts a dangerous act to lure a creature from another plane to a specifically prepared trap, which must lie within the spells range. The called creature is held in the trap until it agrees to perform one service in return for its freedom.[lf][lf]To create the trap, you must use a magic circle spell, focused inward. The kind of creature to be bound must be known and stated. If you wish to call a specific individual, you must use that individuals proper name in casting the spell.[lf][lf]The target creature is allowed a Will saving throw. If the saving throw succeeds, the creature resists the spell. If the saving throw fails, the creature is immediately drawn to the trap (spell resistance does not keep it from being called). The creature can escape from the trap with by successfully pitting its spell resistance against your caster level check, by dimensional travel, or with a successful Charisma check (DC 15 + 1/2 your caster level + your Cha modifier). It can try each method once per day. If it breaks loose, it can flee or attack you. A dimensional anchor cast on the creature prevents its escape via dimensional travel. You can also employ a calling diagram (see magic circle against evil) to make the trap more secure.[lf][lf]If the creature does not break free of the trap, you can keep it bound for as long as you dare. You can attempt to compel the creature to perform a service by describing the service and perhaps offering some sort of reward. You make a Charisma check opposed by the creatures Charisma check. The check is assigned a bonus of +0 to +6 based on the nature of the service and the reward. If the creature wins the opposed check, it refuses service. New offers, bribes, and the like can be made or the old ones reoffered every 24 hours. This process can be repeated until the creature promises to serve, until it breaks free, or until you decide to get rid of it by means of some other spell. Impossible demands or unreasonable commands are never agreed to. If you roll a 1 on the Charisma check, the creature breaks free of the binding and can escape or attack you.[lf][lf]Once the requested service is completed, the creature need only so inform you to be instantly sent back whence it came. The creature might later seek revenge. If you assign some open-ended task that the creature cannot complete though its own actions the spell remains in effect for a maximum of one day per caster level, and the creature gains an immediate chance to break free. Note that a clever recipient can subvert some instructions.[lf][lf]When you use a calling spell to call an air, chaotic, earth, evil, fire, good, lawful, or water creature, it is a spell of that type.

Name: Planar Binding, Greater
Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels); see text
Effect: Up to three elementals or outsiders, totaling no more than 18 HD, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart when they appear.

New offers, bribes, and the like can be made or the old ones reoffered every 24 hours. Impossible demands or unreasonable commands are never agreed to. If you roll a 1 on the Charisma check, the creature breaks free of the binding and can escape or attack you.[lf][lf]Once the requested service is completed, the creature need only so inform you to be instantly sent back whence it came. The creature might later seek revenge. If you assign some open-ended task that the creature cannot complete though its own actions the spell remains in effect for a maximum of one day per caster level, and the creature gains an immediate chance to break free. Note that a clever recipient can subvert some instructions.[lf][lf]When you use a calling spell to call an air, chaotic, earth, evil, fire, good, lawful, or water creature, it is a spell of that type.

Name: Planar Binding, Lesser
Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels); see text
Effect: one elemental or outsider with 6HD or less
Short Description: Traps extraplanar creature of 6 HD or less until it performs a task.
Long Descripton: Casting this spell attempts a dangerous act to lure a creature from another plane to a specifically prepared trap, which must lie within the spells range. The called creature is held in the trap until it agrees to perform one service in return for its freedom.[lf][lf]To create the trap, you must use a magic circle spell, focused inward. The kind of creature to be bound must be known and stated. If you wish to call a specific individual, you must use that individuals proper name in casting the spell.[lf][lf]The target creature is allowed a Will saving throw. You can attempt to compel the creature to perform a service by describing the service and perhaps offering some sort of reward. You make a Charisma check opposed by the creatures Charisma check. The check is assigned a bonus of +0 to +6 based on the nature of the service and the reward. If the creature wins the opposed check, it refuses service. New offers, bribes, and the like can be made or the old ones reoffered every 24 hours. This process can be repeated until the creature promises to serve, until it breaks free, or until you decide to get rid of it by means of some other spell. Impossible demands or unreasonable commands are never agreed to. If you roll a 1 on the Charisma check, the creature breaks free of the binding and can escape or attack you.[lf][lf]Once the requested service is completed, the creature need only so inform you to be instantly sent back whence it came. The creature might later seek revenge. If you assign some open-ended task that the creature cannot complete though its own actions the spell remains in effect for a maximum of one day per caster level, and the creature gains an immediate chance to break free. Note that a clever recipient can subvert some instructions.[lf][lf]When you use a calling spell to call an air, chaotic, earth, evil, fire, good, lawful, or water creature, it is a spell of that type.

Name: Planar Bubble
Short Description: Create bubble around target creature that emulates target's native planar environment.

Name: Planar Exchange
Short Description: Trade places with one of three planar creatures (your choice).

Name: Planar Exchange, Greater
Short Description: Trade places with one of three greater planar creatures (your choice).

Name: Planar Exchange, Lesser
Short Description: Trade places with one of four lesser planar creatures (your choice).

Name: Planar Familiar
Short Description: Transmute your familiar or similar creature into a celestial, fiendish, axiomatic, or anarchic creature.

Name: Planar Navigation
Short Description: Send a whole ship to another plane.

Name: Planar Tolerance
Effect: One creature/level in a 20-ft.-radius burst centered on you
Short Description: Provides long-term protection against overtly damaging planar traits.

Name: Plane Shift
Effect: Creature touched, or up to eight willing creatures joining hands
Short Description: As many as eight subjects travel to another plane.
Long Descripton: You move yourself or some other creature to another plane of existence or alternate dimension. If several willing persons link hands in a circle, as many as eight can be affected by the plane shift at the same time. Precise accuracy as to a particular arrival location on the intended plane is nigh impossible. From the Material Plane, you can reach any other plane, though you appear 5 to 500 miles (5d%) from your intended destination.[lf][lf]Note: Plane shift transports creatures instantaneously and then ends. The creatures need to find other means if they are to travel back.

Name: Plane Shift, Greater
Effect: Creature touched, or up to eight willing creatures joining hands
Short Description: Plane shift accurately to your desired destination.

Name: Plant Body
Short Description: Your type changes to plant.

Name: Plant Growth
Short Description: Grows vegetation, improves crops.
Long Descripton: Plant growth has different effects depending on the version chosen.[lf][lf]Overgrowth: This effect causes normal vegetation (grasses, briars, bushes, creepers, thistles, trees, vines) within long range (400 feet + 40 feet per caster level) to become thick and overgrown. The plants entwine to form a thicket or jungle that creatures must hack or force a way through. Speed drops to 5 feet, or 10 feet for Large or larger creatures. The area must have brush and trees in it for this spell to take effect.[lf][lf]At your option, the area can be a 100-foot-radius circle, a 150-foot-radius semicircle, or a 200-foot-radius quarter circle.[lf][lf]You may designate places within the area that are not affected.[lf][lf]Enrichment: This effect targets plants within a range of one-half mile, raising their potential productivity over the course of the next year to one-third above normal.[lf][lf]Plant growth counters diminish plants.[lf][lf]This spell has no effect on plant creatures.

Name: Pocket Cave
Effect: Extradimensional cave, up to two 10-ft. cubes/level (S)
Short Description: Creates an extradimensional space where you and your allies can hide.

Name: Poison
Short Description: Touch deals 1d10 Con damage, repeats in 1 min.
Long Descripton: Calling upon the venomous powers of natural predators, you infect the subject with a horrible poison by making a successful melee touch attack. The poison deals 1d10 points of temporary Constitution damage immediately and another 1d10 points of temporary Constitution damage 1 minute later. Each instance of damage can be negated by a Fortitude save (DC 10 + 1/2 your caster level + your Wis modifier).

Name: Poison Needles
Saving Throw: None and Fortitude negates; see text
Short Description: Deal 1d4/level max (5d4) with normal ranged attack and deal con damage, or paralyze, or dex damage.

Name: Poison Thorns
Short Description: You grow thorns that poison your attackers.

Name: Poison Vines
Short Description: Vines that entangle and are poisonous.

Name: Polar Ray
Short Description: Ranged touch attack deals 1d6/level cold damage.
Long Descripton: A blue-white ray of freezing air and ice springs from your hand. You must succeed on a ranged touch attack with the ray to deal damage to a target. The ray deals 1d6 points of cold damage per caster level (maximum 25d6).

Name: Polymorph
Short Description: Gives one willing subject a new form.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like alter self, except that you change the willing subject into another form of living creature. The new form may be of the same type as the subject or any of the following types: aberration, animal, dragon, fey, giant, humanoid, magical beast, monstrous humanoid, ooze, plant, or vermin. The assumed form can't have more Hit Dice than your caster level (or the subject's HD, whichever is lower), to a maximum of 15 HD at 15th level. You can't cause a subject to assume a form smaller than Fine, nor can you cause a subject to assume an incorporeal or gaseous form. The subject's creature type and subtype (if any) change to match the new form.[lf][lf]Upon changing, the subject regains lost hit points as if it had rested for a night (though this healing does not restore temporary ability damage and provide other benefits of resting; and changing back does not heal the subject further). If slain, the subject reverts to its original form, though it remains dead.[lf][lf]The subject gains the Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution scores of the new form but retains its own Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. It also gains all extraordinary special attacks possessed by the form but does not gain the extraordinary special qualities possessed by the new form or any supernatural or spell-like abilities.[lf][lf]Incorporeal or gaseous creatures are immune to being polymorphed, and a creature with the shapechanger subtype can revert to its natural form as a standard action.

Name: Polymorph Any Object
Effect: One creature, or one nonmagical object of up to 100 cu. ft./level
Short Description: Changes any subject into anything else.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like polymorph, except that it changes one object or creature into another. The duration of the spell depends on how radical a change is made from the original state to its enchanted state. The duration is determined by using the following guidelines.    [lf]Changed Subject Is:Increase to Duration Factor (1)  [lf]Same kingdom (animal, vegetable, mineral)+5  [lf]Same class (mammals, fungi, metals, etc.)+2  [lf]Same size+2  [lf]Related (twig is to tree, wolf fur is to wolf, etc.)+2  [lf]Same or lower Intelligence+2    [lf]1 Add all that apply. Look up the total on the next table.    [lf]Duration FactorDurationExample  [lf]0  20 minutes  Pebble to human  [lf]2  1 hour  Marionette to human  [lf]4  3 hours  Human to marionette  [lf]5  12 hours  Lizard to manticore  [lf]6  2 days  Sheep to wool coat  [lf]7  1 week  Shrew to manticore  [lf]9+  Permanent  Manticore to shrew    [lf]Unlike polymorph, polymorph any object does grant the creature the Intelligence score of its new form. If the original form didn't have a Wisdom or Charisma score, it gains those scores as appropriate for the new form.  [lf]Damage taken by the new form can result in the injury or death of the polymorphed creature. In general, damage occurs when the new form is changed through physical force.  [lf]A nonmagical object cannot be made into a magic item with this spell. Magic items aren't affected by this spell.  [lf]This spell cannot create material of great intrinsic value, such as copper, silver, gems, silk, gold, platinum, mithral, or adamantine. It also cannot reproduce the special properties of cold iron in order to overcome the damage reduction of certain creatures.  [lf]This spell can also be used to duplicate the effects of baleful polymorph, flesh to stone, stone to flesh, transmute mud to rock, transmute metal to wood, or transmute rock to mud.

Name: Portal Alarm
Short Description: Attach an alarm to a portal that my be audible or mental.

Name: Portal Alarm, Improved
Short Description: As the portal alarm spell, and may be mental, audible, or both.

Name: Portal Barricade
Short Description: Closes portal and prevents it from functioning for 1 hour/level.

Name: Portal Beacon
Short Description: Six creatures know distance and direction to a magic portal.

Name: Portal Reformat
Short Description: Removes or adds one or more keys to portal.

Name: Portal Stabilization
Short Description: Stabilize malfunctioning portal for 1 min./level.

Name: Portal View
Short Description: Turns target portal transparent.

Name: Portal Well
Short Description: When you step into a portal affected by this spell, you can wait for a short time within an extradimensional space between the portal's entrance and exit.

Name: Portal-to-Portal Redirect
Short Description: Changes destination of portal for 1 hour/level.

Name: Positive Energy Aura
Short Description: 10-ft. radius surrounding you heals 2 points of damage/round.

Name: Positive Energy Protection
Short Description: Provides protection from Positive Energy effects for 1 round/level.

Name: Power Leech
Short Description: You drain subject's ability score 1 point/round and gains +1 bonus per point.

Name: Power Surge
Short Description: Charged spell trigger item gains ternporary charges.

Name: Power Word Blind
Effect: One creature with 200 hp or less
Short Description: Blinds creature with 200 hp or less.
Long Descripton: You utter a single word of power that causes one creature of your choice to become blinded, whether the creature can hear the word or not. The duration of the spell depends on the targets current hit point total. Any creature that currently has 201 or more hit points is unaffected by power word blind.[lf][lf]Hit Points, Duration[lf][lf]50 or less, Permanent[lf][lf]51-100, 1d4+1 minutes[lf][lf]101-200, 1d4+1 rounds

Name: Power Word Deafen
Effect: One living creature with 100 hp or less
Short Description: Deafens one creature with 100 hp or less.

Name: Power Word Disable
Effect: One living creature with 50 hp or less
Short Description: Reduces living creature with 50 hp or less to 0 hp.

Name: Power Word Distract
Effect: One living creature with 150 hp or less
Short Description: Makes one creature with 150 hp or less flat-footed.

Name: Power Word Fatigue
Effect: One living creature with 100 hp or less
Short Description: Makes one creature with 100 hp or less fatigued.

Name: Power Word Kill
Effect: One living creature with 100 hp or less
Short Description: Kills one creature with 100 hp or less.
Long Descripton: You utter a single word of power that instantly kills one creature of your choice, whether the creature can hear the word or not. Any creature that currently has 101 or more hit points is unaffected by power word kill.

Name: Power Word Maladroit
Effect: One living creature with 75 hp or less
Short Description: Deals 2 points Dex damage to one creature with 75 hp or less.

Name: Power Word Nauseate
Effect: One living creature with 150 hp or less
Short Description: Makes one creature with 150 hp or less nauseated.

Name: Power Word Pain
Effect: One living creature with 100 hp or less
Short Description: Deal 1d6 points of damage per round to one creature with 100 hp or less.

Name: Power Word Petrify
Effect: One living creature with 100 hp or less
Short Description: Petrifies one creature with 100 hp or less.

Name: Power Word Sicken
Effect: One living creature with 100 hp or less.
Short Description: Sickens one creature with 100 hp or less.

Name: Power Word Stun
Effect: One creature with 150 hp or less
Short Description: Stuns creature with 150 hp or less.
Long Descripton: You utter a single word of power that instantly causes one creature of your choice to become stunned, whether the creature can hear the word or not. The duration of the spell depends on the targets current hit point total. Any creature that currently has 151 or more hit points is unaffected by power word stun.[lf][lf]Hit Points, Duration[lf][lf]50 or less, 4d4 rounds[lf][lf]51-100, 2d4 rounds[lf][lf]101-150, 1d4 rounds

Name: Power Word Weaken
Effect: One living creature with 75 hp or less
Short Description: Deals 2 points Str damage to one creature with 75 hp or less.

Name: Pox
Effect: Up to one living creature/level, no two of which can be more than 10 ft. apart
Short Description: One creature/level takes 1d4 Con drain.

Name: Prayer
Effect: All allies and foes within a 40-ft.-radius burst centered on you
Short Description: Allies +1 bonus on most rolls, enemies -1 penalty.
Long Descripton: You bring special favor upon yourself and your allies while bringing disfavor to your enemies. You and your each of your allies gain a +1 luck bonus on attack rolls, weapon damage rolls, saves, and skill checks, while each of your foes takes a -1 penalty on such rolls.

Name: Precipitate Breach
Short Description: You can force planar boundaries to rip, creating a planar breach.

Name: Precipitate Complete Breach
Short Description: You rip wide the boundary between two planes.

Name: Precise Vision
Short Description: See Text
Medium Description: You gain a +5 compentence bonus to Spot and Search checks.

Name: Preserve Organ
Short Description: Protects one detached organ from decay for 24 hours.

Name: Pressure Sphere
Short Description: Water pressure deals 4d6 damage to submerged targets.

Name: Prestidigitation
Short Description: Performs minor tricks.
Long Descripton: Prestidigitations are minor tricks that novice spellcasters use for practice. Once cast, a prestidigitation spell enables you to perform simple magical effects for 1 hour. The effects are minor and have severe limitations. A prestidigitation can slowly lift 1 pound of material. It can color, clean, or soil items in a 1-foot cube each round. It can chill, warm, or flavor 1 pound of nonliving material. It cannot deal damage or affect the concentration of spellcasters. Prestidigitation can create small objects, but they look crude and artificial. The materials created by a prestidigitation spell are extremely fragile, and they cannot be used as tools, weapons, or spell components. Finally, a prestidigitation lacks the power to duplicate any other spell effects. Any actual change to an object (beyond just moving, cleaning, or soiling it) persists only 1 hour.

Name: Price of Loyalty
Short Description: Identical to charm person except subject does not know a spell was cast.

Name: Primal Form
Short Description: You change into elemental, gain some abilities.

Name: Primal Release
Short Description: Subject gains physical bonuses (+10, +2, +10, -6, -2, -6) and Base Attack bonus becomes +1/HD of subject and gains feats.

Name: Prismatic Eye
Short Description: Orb produces individual prismatic rays as touch attacks.

Name: Prismatic Ray
Short Description: Blind target with 6 HD or less and deal random effect.

Name: Prismatic Sphere
Short Description: As prismatic wall, but surrounds on all sides.
Long Descripton: Prismatic sphere creates a vertical, opaque globe of a shimmering, multicolored light that protects you from all forms of attack. The sphere flashes with seven colors, each of which has a distinct power and purpose. The sphere is immobile, and you can pass through and remain near the sphere without harm. However, any other creature with less than 8 HD that is within 20 feet of the sphere is blinded for 2d4x10 minutes by the colors if it looks at the sphere.  [lf]A Prismatic sphere spell cast to materialize in a space occupied by a creature is disrupted, and the spell is wasted.  [lf]Each color in the sphere has a special effect. The accompanying table shows the seven colors of the sphere, the order in which they appear, their effects on creatures trying to attack you or pass through the sphere, and the magic needed to negate each color.  [lf]The sphere can be destroyed, color by color, in consecutive order, by various magical effects; however, the first color must be brought down before the second can be affected, and so on. A rod of cancellation or a mage's disjunction spell destroys a Prismatic sphere, but an antimagic field fails to penetrate it. Dispel magic and dispel magic, greater cannot dispel the sphere or anything beyond it. Spell resistance is effective against a Prismatic sphere, but the caster level check must be repeated for each color present.  [lf]Prismatic sphere can be made permanent with a permanency spell.    [lf]  ColorOrderEffect of ColorNegated By    [lf]Red1stStops nonmagical ranged weapons.  Deals 20 points of fire damage (Reflex half).Cone of cold  [lf]Orange2ndStops magical ranged weapons.  Deals 40 points of acid damage (Reflex half).Gust of wind  [lf]Yellow3rdStops poisons, gases, and petrification.  Deals 80 points of electricity damage (Reflex half).Disintegrate  [lf]Green4thStops breath weapons.  Poison (Kills; Fortitude partial for 1d6 points of Con damage instead).Passwall  [lf]Blue5thStops divination and mental attacks.  Turned to stone (Fortitude negates).Magic missile  [lf]Indigo6thStops all spells.  Will save or become insane (as insanity spell).Daylight  [lf]Violet7thEnergy field destroys all objects and effects.1  Creatures sent to another plane (Will negates).Dispel magic    [lf]1) The violet effect makes the special effects of the other six colors redundant, but these six effects are included here because certain magic items can create prismatic effects one color at a time, and spell resistance might render some colors ineffective (see above).

Name: Prismatic Spray
Short Description: Rays hit subjects with variety of effects.
Long Descripton: This spell causes seven shimmering, intertwined, multicolored beams of light to spray from your hand. Each beam has a different power. Creatures in the area of the spell with 8 HD or less are automatically blinded for 2d4 rounds. Every creature in the area is randomly struck by one or more beams, which have additional effects.    [lf]1d8  Color of Beam  Effect  [lf]1  Red  20 points fire damage (Reflex half)  [lf]2  Orange  40 points acid damage (Reflex half)  [lf]3  Yellow  80 points electricity damage (Reflex half)  [lf]4  Green  Poison (Kills; Fortitude partial, take 1d6 points of Con damage instead)  [lf]5  Blue  Turned to stone (Fortitude negates)  [lf]6  Indigo  Insane, as insanity spell (Will negates)  [lf]7  Violet  Sent to another plane (Will negates)  [lf]8  Struck by two rays; roll twice more, ignoring any 8 results.

Name: Prismatic Wall
Short Description: Wall’s colors have array of effects.
Long Descripton: Prismatic wall creates a vertical, opaque wall -- a shimmering, multicolored plane of light that protects you from all forms of attack. The wall flashes with seven colors, each of which has a distinct power and purpose. The wall is immobile, and you can pass through and remain near the wall without harm. However, any other creature with less than 8 HD that is within 20 feet of the wall is blinded for 2d4 rounds by the colors if it looks at the wall.  [lf]The wall’s maximum proportions are 4 feet wide per caster level and 2 feet high per caster level. A prismatic wall spell cast to materialize in a space occupied by a creature is disrupted, and the spell is wasted.  [lf]Each color in the wall has a special effect. The accompanying table shows the seven colors of the wall, the order in which they appear, their effects on creatures trying to attack you or pass through the wall, and the magic needed to negate each color.  [lf]The wall can be destroyed, color by color, in consecutive order, by various magical effects; however, the first color must be brought down before the second can be affected, and so on. A rod of cancellation or a mage's disjunction spell destroys a prismatic wall, but an antimagic field fails to penetrate it. Dispel magic and dispel magic, greater cannot dispel the wall or anything beyond it. Spell resistance is effective against a prismatic wall, but the caster level check must be repeated for each color present.  [lf]Prismatic wall can be made permanent with a permanency spell.    [lf]  ColorOrderEffect of ColorNegated By    [lf]Red1stStops nonmagical ranged weapons.  Deals 20 points of fire damage (Reflex half).Cone of cold  [lf]Orange2ndStops magical ranged weapons.  Deals 40 points of acid damage (Reflex half).Gust of wind  [lf]Yellow3rdStops poisons, gases, and petrification.  Deals 80 points of electricity damage (Reflex half).Disintegrate  [lf]Green4thStops breath weapons.  Poison (Kills; Fortitude partial for 1d6 points of Con damage instead).Passwall  [lf]Blue5thStops divination and mental attacks.  Turned to stone (Fortitude negates).Magic missile  [lf]Indigo6thStops all spells.  Will save or become insane (as insanity spell).Daylight  [lf]Violet7thEnergy field destroys all objects and effects.1  Creatures sent to another plane (Will negates).Dispel magic    [lf]1) The violet effect makes the special effects of the other six colors redundant, but these six effects are included here because certain magic items can create prismatic effects one color at a time, and spell resistance might render some colors ineffective (see above).

Name: Probe Thoughts
Short Description: Read subject's memories, one question/round.

Name: Produce Flame
Short Description: 1d6 damage +1/level, touch or thrown.
Long Descripton: Flames as bright as a torch appear in your open hand. The flames harm neither you nor your equipment.[lf][lf]In addition to providing illumination, the flames can be hurled or used to touch enemies. You can strike an opponent with a melee touch attack, dealing fire damage equal to 1d6 +1 point per caster level (maximum +5). Alternatively, you can hurl the flames up to 120 feet as a thrown weapon. When doing so, you attack with a ranged touch attack (with no range penalty) and deal the same damage as with the melee attack. No sooner do you hurl the flames than a new set appears in your hand. Each attack you make reduces the remaining duration by 1 minute. If an attack reduces the remaining duration to 0 minutes or less, the spell ends after the attack resolves.[lf][lf]This spell does not function underwater.

Name: Programmed Amnesia
Short Description: You can selectively destroy, alter, or implant memories in the target creature as you see fit.

Name: Programmed Image
Effect: Visual figment that cannot extend beyond a 20-ft. cube + one 10-ft. cube/level (S)
Short Description: As major image, plus triggered by event.
Long Descripton: This spell creates the visual illusion of an object, creature, or force, as visualized by you. This spell's figment activates when a specific condition occurs. The figment includes visual, auditory, olfactory, and thermal elements, including intelligible speech. You set the triggering condition (which may be a special word) when casting the spell. The event that triggers the illusion can be as general or as specific and detailed as desired but must be based on an audible, tactile, olfactory, or visual trigger. The trigger cannot be based on some quality not normally obvious to the senses, such as alignment. (See magic mouth for more details about such triggers.)

Name: Project Image
Short Description: Illusory double can talk and cast spells.
Long Descripton: You tap energy from the Plane of Shadow to create a quasi-real, illusory version of yourself. The projected image looks, sounds, and smells like you but is intangible. The projected image mimics your actions (including speech) unless you direct it to act differently (which is a move action).[lf][lf]You can see through its eyes and hear through its ears as if you were standing where it is, and during your turn you can switch from using its senses to using your own, or back again, as a free action. While you are using its senses, your body is considered blinded and deafened.[lf][lf]If you desire, any spell you cast whose range is touch or greater can originate from the projected image instead of from you. The projected image can't cast any spells on itself except for illusion spells. The spells affect other targets normally, despite originating from the projected image.[lf][lf]Objects are affected by the projected image as if they had succeeded on their Will save.[lf][lf]You must maintain line of effect to the projected image at all times. If your line of effect is obstructed, the spell ends. If you use dimension door, teleport, plane shift, or a similar spell that breaks your line of effect, even momentarily, the spell ends.

Name: Pronouncement Of Fate
Saving Throw: Will negates or Will partial; see text
Short Description: Imposes a -4 penalty on an offender's attacks, damage, saves, and checks; target loses actions.

Name: Protection from Arrows
Short Description: Subject immune to most ranged attacks.
Long Descripton: The warded creature gains resistance to ranged weapons. The subject gains damage reduction 10/magic against ranged weapons. (This spell doesn't grant you the ability to damage creatures with similar damage reduction.) Once the spell has prevented a total of 10 points of damage per caster level (maximum 100 points), it is discharged.

Name: Protection from Chaos
Short Description: +2 to AC and saves, counter mind control, hedge out elementals and outsiders.
Long Descripton: This spell wards a creature from attacks by chaotic creatures, from mental control, and from summoned creatures. It creates a magical barrier around the subject at a distance of 1 foot. The barrier moves with the subject and has three major effects.[lf][lf]First, the subject gains a +2 deflection bonus to AC and a +2 resistance bonus on saves. Both these bonuses apply against attacks made or effects created by chaotic creatures.[lf][lf]Second, the barrier blocks any attempt to possess the warded creature (by a magic jar attack, for example) or to exercise mental control over the creature (including enchantment (charm) effects and enchantment (compulsion) effects that grant the caster ongoing control over the subject, such as dominate person). The protection does not prevent such effects from targeting the protected creature, but it suppresses the effect for the duration of the protection from chaotic effect. If the protection from chaos effect ends before the effect granting mental control does, the would-be controller would then be able to mentally command the controlled creature. Likewise, the barrier keeps out a possessing life force but does not expel one if it is in place before the spell is cast. This second effect works regardless of alignment.[lf][lf]Third, the spell prevents bodily contact by summoned creatures. This causes the natural weapon attacks of such creatures to fail and the creatures to recoil if such attacks require touching the warded creature. Lawful summoned creatures are immune to this effect. The protection against contact by summoned creatures ends if the warded creature makes an attack against or tries to force the barrier against the blocked creature. Spell resistance can allow a creature to overcome this protection and touch the warded creature.

Name: Protection from Charm
Short Description: The recipient of this spell gains a resistance bonus of +1 per three caster levels (maximum +5) on any Will save against charm or compulsion spells or effects.

Name: Protection from Dessication
Short Description: Absorb 10 points/level of dessication damage.

Name: Protection from Energy
Short Description: Absorb 12 points/level of damage from one kind of energy.
Long Descripton: Protection from energy grants temporary immunity to the type of energy you specify when you cast it (acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic). When the spell absorbs 12 points per caster level of energy damage (to a maximum of 120 points at 10th level), it is discharged.[lf][lf]Note: Protection from energy overlaps (and does not stack with) resist energy. If a character is warded by protection from energy and resist energy, the protection spell absorbs damage until its power is exhausted.

Name: Protection from Evil
Short Description: +2 to AC and saves, counter mind control, hedge out elementals and outsiders.
Long Descripton: This spell wards a creature from attacks by evil creatures, from mental control, and from summoned creatures. It creates a magical barrier around the subject at a distance of 1 foot. The barrier moves with the subject and has three major effects.[lf][lf]First, the subject gains a +2 deflection bonus to AC and a +2 resistance bonus on saves. Both these bonuses apply against attacks made or effects created by evil creatures.[lf][lf]Second, the barrier blocks any attempt to possess the warded creature (by a magic jar attack, for example) or to exercise mental control over the creature (including enchantment (charm) effects and enchantment (compulsion) effects that grant the caster ongoing control over the subject, such as dominate person). The protection does not prevent such effects from targeting the protected creature, but it suppresses the effect for the duration of the protection from evil effect. If the protection from evil effect ends before the effect granting mental control does, the would-be controller would then be able to mentally command the controlled creature. Likewise, the barrier keeps out a possessing life force but does not expel one if it is in place before the spell is cast. This second effect works regardless of alignment.[lf][lf]Third, the spell prevents bodily contact by summoned creatures. This causes the natural weapon attacks of such creatures to fail and the creatures to recoil if such attacks require touching the warded creature. Good summoned creatures are immune to this effect. The protection against contact by summoned creatures ends if the warded creature makes an attack against or tries to force the barrier against the blocked creature. Spell resistance can allow a creature to overcome this protection and touch the warded creature.

Name: Protection from Good
Short Description: +2 to AC and saves, counter mind control, hedge out elementals and outsiders.
Long Descripton: This spell wards a creature from attacks by good creatures, from mental control, and from summoned creatures. It creates a magical barrier around the subject at a distance of 1 foot. The barrier moves with the subject and has three major effects.[lf][lf]First, the subject gains a +2 deflection bonus to AC and a +2 resistance bonus on saves. Both these bonuses apply against attacks made or effects created by good creatures.[lf][lf]Second, the barrier blocks any attempt to possess the warded creature (by a magic jar attack, for example) or to exercise mental control over the creature (including enchantment (charm) effects and enchantment (compulsion) effects that grant the caster ongoing control over the subject, such as dominate person). The protection does not prevent such effects from targeting the protected creature, but it suppresses the effect for the duration of the protection from chaotic effect. If the protection from good effect ends before the effect granting mental control does, the would-be controller would then be able to mentally command the controlled creature. Likewise, the barrier keeps out a possessing life force but does not expel one if it is in place before the spell is cast. This second effect works regardless of alignment.[lf][lf]Third, the spell prevents bodily contact by summoned creatures. This causes the natural weapon attacks of such creatures to fail and the creatures to recoil if such attacks require touching the warded creature. Evil summoned creatures are immune to this effect. The protection against contact by summoned creatures ends if the warded creature makes an attack against or tries to force the barrier against the blocked creature. Spell resistance can allow a creature to overcome this protection and touch the warded creature.

Name: Protection from Law
Short Description: +2 to AC and saves, counter mind control, hedge out elementals and outsiders.
Long Descripton: This spell wards a creature from attacks by lawful creatures, from mental control, and from summoned creatures. It creates a magical barrier around the subject at a distance of 1 foot. The barrier moves with the subject and has three major effects.[lf][lf]First, the subject gains a +2 deflection bonus to AC and a +2 resistance bonus on saves. Both these bonuses apply against attacks made or effects created by lawfulcreatures.[lf][lf]Second, the barrier blocks any attempt to possess the warded creature (by a magic jar attack, for example) or to exercise mental control over the creature (including enchantment (charm) effects and enchantment (compulsion) effects that grant the caster ongoing control over the subject, such as dominate person). The protection does not prevent such effects from targeting the protected creature, but it suppresses the effect for the duration of the protection from chaotic effect. If the protection from law effect ends before the effect granting mental control does, the would-be controller would then be able to mentally command the controlled creature. Likewise, the barrier keeps out a possessing life force but does not expel one if it is in place before the spell is cast. This second effect works regardless of alignment.[lf][lf]Third, the spell prevents bodily contact by summoned creatures. This causes the natural weapon attacks of such creatures to fail and the creatures to recoil if such attacks require touching the warded creature. Chaotic summoned creatures are immune to this effect. The protection against contact by summoned creatures ends if the warded creature makes an attack against or tries to force the barrier against the blocked creature. Spell resistance can allow a creature to overcome this protection and touch the warded creature.

Name: Protection from Negative Energy
Short Description: Ignore 10 points of negative energy damage per attack.

Name: Protection from Positive Energy
Short Description: Ignore 10 points of positive energy damage per attack.

Name: Protection from Spells
Effect: Up to one creature touched per four levels
Short Description: Confers +8 resistance bonus.
Long Descripton: The subject gains a +8 resistance bonus on saving throws against spells and spell-like abilities (but not against supernatural and extraordinary abilities).

Name: Protégé
Short Description: Grants another creature bardic abilities.

Name: Proud Arrogance
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Targets gain +4 bonus on saves against charm, compulsion, and fear.

Name: Prying Eyes
Short Description: 1d4 +1/level floating eyes scout for you.
Long Descripton: You create a number of semi-tangible, visible magical orbs (called eyes) equal to 1d4 + your caster level. These eyes move out, scout around, and return as you direct them when casting the spell. Each eye can see 120 feet (normal vision only) in all directions.[lf][lf]While the individual eyes are quite fragile, they're small and difficult to spot. Each eye is a Fine construct, about the size of a small apple, that has 1 hit point, AC 18 (+8 bonus for its size), flies at a speed of 30 feet with perfect maneuverability, and has a +16 Hide modifier. It has a Spot modifier equal to your caster level (maximum +15) and is subject to illusions, darkness, fog, and any other factors that would affect your ability to receive visual information about your surroundings. An eye traveling through darkness must find its way by touch.[lf][lf]When you create the eyes, you specify instructions you want them to follow in a command of no more than twenty-five words. Any knowledge you possess is known by the eyes as well.[lf][lf]In order to report their findings, the eyes must return to your hand. Each replays in your mind all it has seen during its existence. It takes an eye 1 round to replay 1 hour of recorded images. After relaying its findings, an eye disappears. [lf][lf]If an eye ever gets more than 1 mile away from you, it instantly ceases to exist. However, your link with the eye is such that you wont know if the eye was destroyed because it wandered out of range or because of some other event.[lf][lf]The eyes exist for up to 1 hour per caster level or until they return to you. Dispel magic can destroy eyes. Roll separately for each eye caught in an area dispel. Of course, if an eye is sent into darkness, it could hit a wall or similar obstacle and destroy itself.
