Against a creature that recognizes it as a shadow creature, however, the shadow creatures damage is four-fifths (80%) normal, and all special abilities that do not deal lethal damage are only 80% likely to work. (Roll for each use and each affected character separately.) Furthermore, the shadow creatures AC bonuses are four-fifths as large.[lf][lf]A creature that succeeds on its save sees the shadow conjurations as transparent images superimposed on vague, shadowy forms.[lf][lf]Objects automatically succeed on their Will saves against this spell.

Name: Shadow Arrow
Short Description: Masterwork arrow or bolt deals 1d6 points of Strength damage.

Name: Shadow Binding
Short Description: Entangle and daze creatures.

Name: Shadow Cache
Short Description: Store small items for a few minutes on the Plane of Shadow, or let them loose there.

Name: Shadow Canopy
Effect: Cyclinder 25 ft. high with diameter 100 ft. + 50 ft./level
Short Description: You create a large umbrella of darkness.

Name: Shadow Conjuration
Saving Throw: Will disbelief (if interacted with); varies; see text
Short Description: Mimics conjuring below 4th level, but only 20% real.
Long Descripton: You use material from the Plane of Shadow to shape quasi-real illusions of one or more creatures, objects, or forces. Shadow conjuration can mimic any sorcerer or wizard conjuration (summoning) or conjuration (creation) spell of 3rd level or lower.[lf][lf]Shadow conjurations are actually one-fifth (20%) as strong as the real things, though creatures who believe the shadow conjurations to be real are affected by them at full strength.[lf][lf]Any creature that interacts with the conjured object, force, or creature can make a Will save to recognize its true nature.[lf][lf]Spells that deal damage have normal effects unless the affected creature succeeds on a Will save. Each disbelieving creature takes only one-fifth (20%) damage from the attack. If the disbelieved attack has a special effect other than damage, that effect is only 20% likely to occur. Regardless of the result of the save to disbelieve, an affected creature is also allowed any save that the spell being simulated allows, but the save DC is set according to shadow conjurations level (4th) rather than the spells normal level. In addition, any effect created by shadow conjuration allows spell resistance, even if the spell it is simulating does not. Shadow objects or substances have normal effects except against those who disbelieve them.[lf][lf]Against disbelievers, they are 20% likely to work.[lf][lf]A shadow creature has one-fifth the hit points of a normal creature of its kind (regardless of whether its recognized as shadowy). It deals normal damage and has all normal abilities and weaknesses. Against a creature that recognizes it as a shadow creature, however, the shadow creature's damage is one-fifth (20%) normal, and all special abilities that do not deal lethal damage are only 20% likely to work. (Roll for each use and each affected character separately.) Furthermore, the shadow creatures AC bonuses are one-fifth as large.[lf][lf]A creature that succeeds on its save sees the shadow conjurations as transparent images superimposed on vague, shadowy forms.[lf][lf]Objects automatically succeed on their Will saves against this spell.

Name: Shadow Conjuration, Greater
Saving Throw: Will disbelief (if interacted with); varies; see text
Short Description: As shadow conjuration, but up to 6th level and 60% real.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like shadow conjuration, except that it can duplicate any sorcerer or wizard conjuration (summoning) or conjuration (creation) spell of 6th level or lower. The illusory conjurations created deal three-fifths (60%) damage to nonbelievers, and nondamaging effects are 60% likely to work against nonbelievers.

Name: Shadow Curse
Short Description: Subject becomes unable to heal except in well illuminated areas until curse is removed.

Name: Shadow Evocation
Short Description: Mimics evocation of lower than 5th level, but only 20% real.
Long Descripton: You tap energy from the Plane of Shadow to cast a quasi-real, illusory version of a sorcerer or wizard evocation spell of 4th level or lower. (For a spell with more than one level, use the best one applicable to you.)[lf][lf]Spells that deal damage have normal effects unless an affected creature succeeds on a Will save. Each disbelieving creature takes only one-fifth damage from the attack. If the disbelieved attack has a special effect other than damage, that effect is one-fifth as strong (if applicable) or only 20% likely to occur. If recognized as a shadow evocation, a damaging spell deals only one-fifth (20%) damage. Regardless of the result of the save to disbelieve, an affected creature is also allowed any save (or spell resistance) that the spell being simulated allows, but the save DC is set according to shadow evocations level (5th) rather than the spells normal level.[lf][lf]Nondamaging effects have normal effects except against those who disbelieve them. Against disbelievers, they have no effect.[lf][lf]Objects automatically succeed on their Will saves against this spell.

Name: Shadow Evocation, Greater
Short Description: As shadow evocation, but up to 7th level and 60% real.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like shadow evocation, except that it enables you to create partially real, illusory versions of sorcerer or wizard evocation spells of 7th level or lower. If recognized as a greater shadow evocation, a damaging spell deals only three-fifths (60%) damage.

Name: Shadow Form
Short Description: Gain +4 on Hide, Move Silently, and Escape Artist checks, and concealment; you can move through obstacles if you have ranks in Escape Artist.

Name: Shadow Guardians
Short Description: Create group of shadowy warriors.

Name: Shadow Hand
Short Description: Medium-sized hand attacks, blocks opponents, or carries items.

Name: Shadow Landscape
Effect: One-mile radius spread, centered on a point in space
Short Description: Makes natural terrain more dangerous, creates guardians that you command.

Name: Shadow Mask
Short Description: Shadows hide your face and protect against darkness, light, and gazes.

Name: Shadow Phase
Short Description: Subject becomes semi-incorporeal.

Name: Shadow Radiance
Effect: 20-ft.-radius burst centered on a point in space
Short Description: Area filled with intense light that grows brighter.

Name: Shadow Shield
Short Description: A smoky shroud causes attackers to be blinded for 1 round/level.

Name: Shadow Spray
Short Description: Shadows daze targets and deal 2 points of Str damage.

Name: Shadow Trap
Short Description: Bind a greater shadow to an object as its guardian.

Name: Shadow Walk
Effect: Up to one touched creature/ level
Short Description: Step into shadow to travel rapidly.
Long Descripton: To use the shadow walk spell, you must be in an area of shadowy illumination. You and any creature you touch are then transported along a coiling path of shadowstuff to the edge of the Material Plane where it borders the Plane of Shadow. The effect is largely illusory, but the path is quasi-real. You can take more than one creature along with you (subject to your level limit), but all must be touching each other.[lf][lf]In the region of shadow, you move at a rate of 50 miles per hour, moving normally on the borders of the Plane of Shadow but much more rapidly relative to the Material Plane. Thus, you can use this spell to travel rapidly by stepping onto the Plane of Shadow, moving the desired distance, and then stepping back onto the Material Plane.[lf][lf]Because of the blurring of reality between the Plane of Shadow and the Material Plane, you can't make out details of the terrain or areas you pass over during transit, nor can you predict perfectly where your travel will end. Its impossible to judge distances accurately, making the spell virtually useless for scouting or spying. Furthermore, when the spell effect ends, you are shunted 1d10x100 feet in a random horizontal direction from your desired endpoint. If this would place you within a solid object, you are shunted 1d10x1,000 feet in the same direction. If this would still place you within a solid object, you (and any creatures with you) are shunted to the nearest empty space available, but the strain of this activity renders each creature fatigued (no save).[lf][lf]Shadow walk can also be used to travel to other planes that border on the Plane of Shadow, but this usage requires the transit of the Plane of Shadow to arrive at a border with another plane of reality. The transit of the Plane of Shadow requires 1d4 hours.[lf][lf]Any creatures touched by you when shadow walk is cast also make the transition to the borders of the Plane of Shadow.[lf][lf]They may opt to follow you, wander off through the plane, or stumble back into the Material Plane (50% chance for either of the latter results if they are lost or abandoned by you). Creatures unwilling to accompany you into the Plane of Shadow receive a Will saving throw, negating the effect if successful.

Name: Shadow Well
Short Description: Target enters gloomy pocket plane and emerges frightened.

Name: Shadowblast
Short Description: Temporarily block access to the Plane of Shadow and deal damage to Shaow natives.

Name: Shadowfade
Effect: You and up to one touched creature/level
Short Description: Travel to the Plane of Shadow, must return using the portal generated or else find another way back.

Name: Shadowplay
Effect: Shadow of one Huge or smaller object or creature
Short Description: Manipulates the shape and movement of an existing shadow.

Name: Shadowy Grappler
Short Description: Shadowy force grapples subject.

Name: Shalantha's Delicate Disk
Short Description: Conjures disk that can store a single spell of up to 5th level and release it when broken.

Name: Shambler
Effect: Three or more shambling mounds, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart; see text
Short Description: Summons 1d4+2 shambling mounds to fight for you.
Long Descripton: The shambler spell creates 1d4+2 shambling mounds with 11 HD each. The creatures willingly aid you in combat or battle, perform a specific mission, or serve as bodyguards. The creatures remain with you for seven days unless you dismiss them. If the shamblers are created only for guard duty, however, the duration of the spell is seven months. In this case, the shamblers can only be ordered to guard a specific site or location. Shamblers summoned to guard duty cannot move outside the spells range, which is measured from the point where each first appeared. [lf][lf]The shamblers have resistance to fire as normal shambling mounds do only if the terrain is rainy, marshy, or damp.

Name: Shape Metal
Effect: Metal or metal object touched, up to 10 cu. ft. +1 cu. ft./level
Short Description: As stone shape, but affects metal.

Name: Shapechange
Short Description: Transforms you into any creature, and change forms once per round.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like polymorph, except that it enables you to assume the form of any single nonunique creature (of any type) from Fine to Colossal size. The assumed form cannot have more than your caster level in Hit Dice (to a maximum of 25 HD). Unlike polymorph, this spell allows incorporeal or gaseous forms to be assumed.[lf][lf]You gain all extraordinary and supernatural abilities (both attacks and qualities) of the assumed form, but you lose your own supernatural abilities. You also gain the type of the new form in place of your own. The new form does not disorient you. Parts of your body or pieces of equipment that are separated from you do not revert to their original forms.[lf][lf]You can become just about anything you are familiar with. You can change form once each round as a free action. The change takes place either immediately before your regular action or immediately after it, but not during the action. If you use this spell to create a disguise, you get a +10 bonus on your Disguise check.

Name: Shard Storm
Effect: One or more 20-foot radius bursts of force
Short Description: Creates a storm of shards.

Name: Share Husk
Short Description: See and hear through the senses of a touched animal.

Name: Shared Healing
Short Description: Subject creature can cure up to twice your caster level of its own hit points.

Name: Shark Bolt
Short Description: Summons sharks made of water to attack your enemies.

Name: Sharptooth
Short Description: One of your natural weapons deals damage as if you were one size larger.

Name: Shatter
Effect: 5-ft.-radius spread; or one solid object or one crystalline creature
Saving Throw: Will negates (object); Will negates (object) or Fortitude half; see text
Short Description: Sonic vibration damages objects or crystalline creatures.
Long Descripton: Shatter creates a loud, ringing noise that breaks brittle, nonmagical objects; sunders a single solid, nonmagical object; or damages a crystalline creature.[lf][lf]Used as an area attack, shatter destroys nonmagical objects of crystal, glass, ceramic, or porcelain. All such objects within a 5-foot radius of the point of origin are smashed into dozens of pieces by the spell. Objects weighing more than 1 pound per your level are not affected, but all other objects of the appropriate composition are shattered.[lf][lf]Alternatively, you can target shatter against a single solid object, regardless of composition, weighing up to 10 pounds per caster level. Targeted against a crystalline creature (of any weight), shatter deals 1d6 points of sonic damage per caster level (maximum 10d6), with a Fortitude save for half damage.

Name: Shatterfloor
Short Description: Deals 1d4 sonic/level plus damages floor surface 6 inches deep.

Name: Sheltered Vitality
Short Description: Subject gains immunity to fatigue, exhaustion, ability damage, and ability drain.

Name: Shield
Short Description: Invisible disc gives +4 to AC, blocks magic missiles.
Long Descripton: Shield creates an invisible, tower shield-sized mobile disk of force that hovers in front of you. It negates magic missile attacks directed at you. The disk also provides a +4 shield bonus to AC. This bonus applies against incorporeal touch attacks, since it is a force effect. The shield has no armor check penalty or arcane spell failure chance. Unlike with a normal tower shield, you can't use the shield spell for cover.

Name: Shield of Faith
Short Description: Aura grants +2 or higher deflection bonus.
Long Descripton: This spell creates a shimmering, magical field around the touched creature that averts attacks. The spell grants the subject a +2 deflection bonus to AC, with an additional +1 to the bonus for every six levels you have (maximum +5 deflection bonus at 18th level).

Name: Shield of Faith, Mass
Short Description: Allies gain +3 or higher AC bonus.

Name: Shield of Law
Effect: One creature/level in a 20-ft.-radius burst centered on you
Short Description: +4 to AC, +4 resistance, and SR 25 against chaotic spells.
Long Descripton: A dim, blue glow surrounds the subjects, protecting them from attacks, granting them resistance to spells cast by chaotic creatures, and slowing chaotic creatures when they strike the subjects. This abjuration has four effects.[lf][lf]First, each warded creature gains a +4 deflection bonus to AC and a +4 resistance bonus on saves. Unlike protection from chaos, this benefit applies against all attacks, not just against attacks by chaotic creatures.[lf][lf]Second, a warded creature gains spell resistance 25 against chaotic spells and spells cast by chaotic creatures.[lf][lf]Third, the abjuration blocks possession and mental influence, just as protection from chaos does.[lf][lf]Finally, if a chaotic creature succeeds on a melee attack against a warded creature, the attacker is slowed (Will save negates, as the slow spell, but against shield of laws save DC).

Name: Shield of the Archons
Short Description: Protective shield dissipates targeted magical attacks and grants +4 bonus on saving throws against magical areas and effects.

Name: Shield of Warding
Short Description: Shield grants +1 bonus on Reflex saves, +1 per five levels (max +5).

Name: Shield Other
Short Description: You take half of subjects damage.
Long Descripton: This spell wards the subject and creates a mystic connection between you and the subject so that some of its wounds are transferred to you. The subject gains a +1 deflection bonus to AC and a +1 resistance bonus on saves. Additionally, the subject takes only half damage from all wounds and attacks (including that dealt by special abilities) that deal hit point damage. The amount of damage not taken by the warded creature is taken by you. Forms of harm that do not involve hit points, such as charm effects, temporary ability damage, level draining, and death effects, are not affected. If the subject suffers a reduction of hit points from a lowered Constitution score, the reduction is not split with you because it is not hit point damage. When the spell ends, subsequent damage is no longer divided between the subject and you, but damage already split is not reassigned to the subject.[lf][lf]If you and the subject of the spell move out of range of each other, the spell ends.

Name: Shieldbearer
Short Description: Shield floats near subject to offer protection.
Medium Description: Shield floats nearby, giving subject a shield bonus to AC.

Name: Shifter Prowess
Short Description: Shifter racial bonuses to skills increase by +8.
Medium Description: Shifter racial bonuses to Balance, Climb, and Jump checks increase by +8

Name: Shifting Paths
Short Description: Illusion hides path, creates false new path.

Name: Shillelagh
Effect: One touched nonmagical oak club or quarterstaff
Short Description: Cudgel or quarterstaff becomes +1 weapon (1d10 damage) for 1 min./level.
Long Descripton: Your own nonmagical club or quarterstaff becomes a weapon with a +1 enhancement bonus on attack and damage rolls. (A quarterstaff gains this enhancement for both ends of the weapon.) It deals damage as if it were two size categories larger (a Small club or quarterstaff so transmuted deals 1d8 points of damage, a Medium 2d6, and a Large 3d6), +1 for its enhancement bonus. These effects only occur when the weapon is wielded by you. If you do not wield it, the weapon behaves as if unaffected by this spell.

Name: Shivering Touch
Short Description: Touch deals 3d6 Dex damage.

Name: Shivering Touch, Lesser
Short Description: Touch deals 1d6 Dex damage.

Name: Shock and Awe
Effect: 1 flat-footed creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart.
Short Description: Reduces a surprised creature's initiative roll.

Name: Shock Treatment
Short Description: A jolt of electricity damages and potentially stuns an opponent.

Name: Shocking Grasp
Short Description: Touch delivers 1d6/level electricity damage (max 5d6).
Long Descripton: Your successful melee touch attack deals 1d6 points of electricity damage per caster level (maximum 5d6). When delivering the jolt, you gain a +3 bonus on attack rolls if the opponent is wearing metal armor (or made out of metal, carrying a lot of metal, or the like).

Name: Shockwave
Short Description: Shockwave deals 1d4/level points of nonlethal damage to creatures within area and dazes them for 1 round.
Medium Description: Shockwave deals 1d4/level (max 10d4) points of nonlethal damage and dazes for 1 round. Fortitude save halves damage and negates daze.

Name: Shout
Saving Throw: Fortitude partial or Reflex negates (object); see text
Short Description: Deafens all within cone and deals 5d6 sonic damage.
Long Descripton: You emit an ear-splitting yell that deafens and damages creatures in its path. Any creature within the area is deafened for 2d6 rounds and takes 5d6 points of sonic damage. A successful save negates the deafness and reduces the damage by half. Any exposed brittle or crystalline object or crystalline creature takes 1d6 points of sonic damage per caster level (maximum 15d6). An affected creature is allowed a Fortitude save to reduce the damage by half, and a creature holding fragile objects can negate damage to them with a successful Reflex save.[lf][lf]A shout spell cannot penetrate a silence spell.

Name: Shout, Greater
Saving Throw: Fortitude partial or Reflex negates (object); see text
Short Description: Devastating yell deals 10d6 sonic damage; stuns creatures, damages objects.
Long Descripton: You emit an ear-splitting yell that deafens and damages creatures in its path. Any creature within the area is stunned for 1 round and deafened for 4d6 rounds and takes 10d6 points of sonic damage. A creature in the area of the cone can negate the stunning and halve both the damage and the duration of the deafness with a successful Fortitude save. Any exposed brittle or crystalline object or crystalline creature takes 1d6 points of sonic damage per caster level (maximum 20d6). An affected creature is allowed a Fortitude save to reduce the damage by half, and a creature holding fragile objects can negate damage to them with a successful Reflex save.

Name: Shrieking Blast
Short Description: 40-ft.-radius burst deafens and deals 8d6 sonic damage.

Name: Shrink Item
Effect: One touched object of up to 2 cu. ft./level
Short Description: Object shrinks to one-sixteenth size.
Long Descripton: You are able to shrink one nonmagical item (if it is within the size limit) to 1/16 of its normal size in each dimension (to about 1/4,000 the original volume and mass). This change effectively reduces the objects size by four categories. Optionally, you can also change its now shrunken composition to a clothlike one. Objects changed by a shrink item spell can be returned to normal composition and size merely by tossing them onto any solid surface or by a word of command from the original caster. Even a burning fire and its fuel can be shrunk by this spell. Restoring the shrunken object to its normal size and composition ends the spell.[lf][lf]Shrink item can be made permanent with a permanency spell, in which case the affected object can be shrunk and expanded an indefinite number of times, but only by the original caster.

Name: Shriveling
Short Description: Subject takes 1d4 damage per level.

Name: Shroud of Flame
Short Description: Target bursts into flames, taking 2d6 fire damage per round and shooting gouts of flame that deal 1d4 fire damage to creatures with 10 feet.

Name: Shroud of Undeath
Short Description: Negative energy shroud makes undead perceive you as undead.

Name: Sicken Evil
Short Description: Evil creatures are sickened by your presence.

Name: Sign
Short Description: Your initiative check result improves, and you know enemies' initiative check results.

Name: Sign of Sealing
Effect: One door, chest, or portal up to 30 sq. ft./level in size
Short Description: As Arcane Lock, except when portal is breached it deals 1d4/level (max 10d4) damage.

Name: Sign of Sealing, Greater
Effect: One door, chest, or portal up to 30 sq. ft./level in size
Short Description: This spell functions like sign of sealing, except that it can also be used to seal an open space and deals 1d6 (max 20d6) when breached.

Name: Silence
Effect: 20-ft.-radius emanation centered on a creature, object, or point in space
Saving Throw: Will negates; see text or none (object)
Short Description: Negates sound in 15-ft. radius.
Long Descripton: Upon the casting of this spell, complete silence prevails in the affected area. All sound is stopped: Conversation is impossible, spells with verbal components cannot be cast, and no noise what-so-ever issues from, enters, or passes through the area. The spell can be cast on a point in space, but the effect is stationary unless cast on a mobile object. The spell can be centered on a creature, and the effect then radiates from the creature and moves as it moves. An unwilling creature can attempt a Will save to negate the spell and can use spell resistance, if any. Items in a creature's possession or magic items that emit sound receive the benefits of saves and spell resistance, but unattended objects and points in space do not. This spell provides a defense against sonic or language-based attacks.

Name: Silent Image
Effect: Visual figment that cannot extend beyond four 10-ft. cubes + one 10-ft. cube/level (S)
Short Description: Creates minor illusion of your design.
Long Descripton: This spell creates the visual illusion of an object, creature, or force, as visualized by you. The illusion does not create sound, smell, texture, or temperature. You can move the image within the limits of the size of the effect.

Name: Silent Portal
Short Description: Negates sound from door or window.

Name: Silent Sound
Short Description: Ranged attack roll deals 1d6/level (max 5d6) sonic damage.

Name: Silver Dragonmail
Short Description: You create a shining silver +1 mithral breastplate around your body.

Name: Silverbeard
Short Description: You grow a hard silver beard that gives +2 bonus to armor.

Name: Silvered Claws
Short Description: One creature's natural attacks are treated as silvered weapons.

Name: Silvered Weapon
Short Description: Transforms a single weapon or projectile into a silvered weapon or silvered projectile

Name: Silvered Weapon, Alternate
Short Description: Transforms one weapon into a silvered weapon.

Name: Simbul's Skeletal Deliquescence
Short Description: Target becomes a soft-bodied oozelike creature.

Name: Simulacrum
Short Description: Creates partially real double of a creature.
Long Descripton: Simulacrum creates an illusory duplicate of any creature. The duplicate creature is partially real and formed from ice or snow. It appears to be the same as the original, but it has only one-half of the real creatures levels or Hit Dice (and the appropriate hit points, feats, skill ranks, and special abilities for a creature of that level or HD). You can't create a simulacrum of a creature whose Hit Dice or levels exceed twice your caster level. You must make a Disguise check when you cast the spell to determine how good the likeness is. A creature familiar with the original might detect the ruse with a successful Spot check (opposed by the caster's Disguise check) or a DC 20 Sense Motive check.[lf][lf]At all times the simulacrum remains under your absolute command. No special telepathic link exists, so command must be exercised in some other manner. A simulacrum has no ability to become more powerful. It cannot increase its level or abilities. If reduced to 0 hit points or otherwise destroyed, it reverts to snow and melts instantly into nothingness. A complex process requiring at least 24 hours, 100 gp per hit point, and a fully equipped magical laboratory can repair damage to a simulacrum.

Name: Sink
Short Description: Subject loses buoyancy.

Name: Sinsabur's Baleful Bolt
Short Description: Bolt of dark energy deals 1d3 Str and Con damage +1/four levels.

Name: Siphon
Short Description: Drain 5 or more charges from wand or staff to replace one or more cast spells.

Name: Sirellyn's Superior Magnetism
Short Description: Attract metalic objects and creatures to target creature or object.

Name: Siren's Call
Effect: One creature/2 levels, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Compel one creature/2 levels to submerse itself.

Name: Sirine's Grace
Short Description: Grants +4 to Cha and Dex.  Adds Cha Modifier deflection bonus to AC.  +8 to Perform checks.  1d4 Int touch attack.

Name: Skeletal Guard
Short Description: Creates one skeleton/level that is resistant to turning.

Name: Skill Enhancement
Short Description: Item bestows circumstance bonus on skill checks.

Name: Skin of the Cactus
Short Description: Grants natural armor, thorns, and resistance to dehydration.

Name: Skull of Secrets
Short Description: Intangible skull stores message and can be triggered to breathe fire.

Name: Skull Snare
Short Description: Animates a skull that guards a 10 area.
Medium Description: Animates a skull that guards a 10 area.

Name: Skull Watch
Short Description: Skull shrieks when creature enters warded area.

Name: Skyhurling
Short Description: Throw a creature up and let them take falling damage.  5-ft./level with yielding obstructions or 10-ft./level with no obstructions.

Name: Skyline Runner
Short Description: You can walk normally on any city surface.

Name: Skyrift
Short Description: Make a 1 mile radius area appear to be in perpetual night or dusk.

Name: Slapping Hand
Short Description: Hand makes creature provoke attacks of opportunity.

Name: Slash Tongue
Effect: One living creature with a tongue
Short Description: Subject takes -1 penalty on attacks, saves and checks for 1 round.

Name: Slashing Darkness
Short Description: Ray deals 1d8/two levels damage and heals undead the same amount.

Name: Slashing Dispel
Short Description: As dispel magic, but creatures take damage for spells dispelled.
Medium Description: As dispel magic but creatures take 2 damage/spell level for each spell dispelled.

Name: Slay Living
Short Description: Touch attack kills subject.
Long Descripton: You can slay any one living creature. You must succeed on a melee touch attack to touch the subject, and it can avoid death with a successful Fortitude save. If it succeeds, it instead takes 3d6 points of damage +1 point per caster level.

Name: Slaying Arrow
Short Description: Creates a projectile deadly to a specific creature type.
Medium Description: Projectile gains a +1 enhancement bonus and becomes deadly against a specified creature type. When hit, the creature must make a Fortitude save or die (or be destroyed). On a successful save, the target takes only normal damage from the

Name: Sleep
Effect: One or more living creatures within a 10-ft.-radius burst
Short Description: Puts 4 HD of creatures into magical slumber.
Long Descripton: A sleep spell causes a magical slumber to come upon 4 Hit Dice of creatures. Creatures with the fewest HD are affected first.[lf][lf]Among creatures with equal HD, those who are closest to the spells point of origin are affected first. Hit Dice that are not sufficient to affect a creature are wasted.[lf][lf]Sleeping creatures are helpless. Slapping or wounding awakens an affected creature, but normal noise does not. Awakening a creature is a standard action (an application of the aid another action).[lf][lf]Sleep does not target unconscious creatures, constructs, or undead creatures.

Name: Sleep Mote
Short Description: Dust devil of magic sand puts foes to sleep.

Name: Sleep, Greater
Effect: Several living creatures within a 15-ft. radiusburst
Short Description: As sleep, except that you roll 4d6 to see how many HD are affected: no creature with more than 10 HD is affected.

Name: Sleet Storm
Short Description: Hampers vision and movement.
Long Descripton: Driving sleet blocks all sight (even darkvision) within it and causes the ground in the area to be icy. A creature can walk within or through the area of sleet at half normal speed with a DC 10 Balance check. Failure means it can't move in that round, while failure by 5 or more means it falls (see the Balance skill for details).[lf][lf]The sleet extinguishes torches and small fires.

Name: Slide
Short Description: Move subject 5 feet.

Name: Slide, Greater
Short Description: Move subject 20 feet.

Name: Slime Hurl
Short Description: Hurl up to three globs of green slime.

Name: Slime Wave
Short Description: Creates 15-ft. spread of green slime.

Name: Slipping the Ranks
Short Description: Every 5 ft. set becomes a 10 ft. teleport.
Medium Description: Every 5 ft. set becomes a 10 ft. teleport.

Name: Slipsand
Short Description: Creates a volume of slipsand.

Name: Slow
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: One subject/level takes only one action/round, -2 to AC and attack rolls.
Long Descripton: An affected creature moves and attacks at a drastically slowed rate. A slowed creature can take only a single move action or standard action each turn, but not both (nor may it take full-round actions). Additionally, it takes a -1 penalty on attack rolls, AC, and Reflex saves. A slowed creature moves at half its normal speed (round down to the next 5-foot increment), which affects the creatures jumping distance as normal for decreased speed.[lf][lf]Multiple slow effects don't stack. Slow counters and dispels haste.

Name: Slow Burn
Short Description: Dims and slows natural fire burn rates, doubling fire life and halving damage.

Name: Slow Consumption
Short Description: Caster absorbs health and sustenance from helpless subject.

Name: Smell of Fear
Short Description: Target's aroma triples the chance of wandering encounters.

Name: Smite Heretic
Short Description: You gain a +2 sacred bonus on attack roll and deal extra damage with your smite evil ability when used against an evil creature that can cast divine spells.

Name: Smoke Ladder
Short Description: You create a misty ladder up to 10 feet long per caster level.

Name: Smoke Stairs
Short Description: Walk up a column of smoke as if it were solid.
Medium Description: Smoke from a 5' square fire becomes stairs. Every 5' upward costs 10' horizontal movement. Smoke can be dissipated by wind, causing a fall.

Name: Snake Darts
Short Description: Create two poisonous snakes.

Name: Snake's Swiftness
Short Description: Subject immediately makes one attack.

Name: Snake's Swiftness, Mass
Short Description: Allies each immediately make one attack.

Name: Snakebite
Short Description: Your arm turns into a poisonous snake you can use to attack.

Name: Snare
Effect: Touched nonmagical circle of vine, rope, or thong with a 2 ft. diameter + 2 ft./level
Short Description: Creates a magic booby trap.
Long Descripton: This spell enables you to make a snare that functions as a magic trap. The snare can be made from any supple vine, a thong, or a rope. When you cast snare upon it, the cordlike object blends with its surroundings (Search DC 23 for a character with the trap-finding ability to locate). One end of the snare is tied in a loop that contracts around one or more of the limbs of any creature stepping inside the circle.[lf][lf]If a strong and supple tree is nearby, the snare can be fastened to it. The spell causes the tree to bend and then straighten when the loop is triggered, dealing 1d6 points of damage to the creature trapped and lifting it off the ground by the trapped limb or limbs. If no such tree is available, the cordlike object tightens around the creature, dealing no damage but causing it to be entangled.[lf][lf]The snare is magical. To escape, a trapped creature must make a DC 23 Escape Artist check or a DC 23 Strength check that is a full-round action. The snare has AC 7 and 5 hit points. A successful escape from the snare breaks the loop and ends the spell.

Name: Snare Astral Traveler
Short Description: Captures one astral creature and holds it motionless.

Name: Snilloc's Snowball
Short Description: Touch attack (melee or ranged) deals 1d6 cold damage +1/level.

Name: Sniper's Eye
Short Description: Grants darkvision, ranged sneak attacks to 60 feet, death attack with ranged weapon, and +10 bonus on Spot checks.

Name: Sniper's Shot
Short Description: Swift. No range limit on next ranged sneak attack.

Name: Snow Walk
Short Description: Increase your speed and walk effortlessly on top of snow without leaving tracks or scent.

Name: Snow Wave
Saving Throw: Fortitude partial and Reflex partial; see text
Short Description: Knocks creatures prone and deals 4d6 crushing damage and 1d6 cold damage.

Name: Snowball Swarm
Short Description: Deals 1d6 cold/2 levels to a 10-ft. radius.

Name: Snowdrift
Effect: Snow touched, up to 10 cu. ft. +1 cu. ft./level
Short Description: Forms existing snow into another shape.

Name: Snowshoes
Short Description: Subject walks easily on ice and snow.
Medium Description: Gain a 10-foot enhancement bonus to speed and not required to make a Balance check or Reflex save to walk on ice and snow.

Name: Snowshoes, Mass
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: As snowshoes, affects one creature/level.

Name: Snowsight
Short Description: Normal vision in winter weather conditions.

Name: Snowsong
Short Description: Musical snowfall aids allies in within 30 ft. and hinders enemy spellcasters.

Name: Soften Earth and Stone
Short Description: Turns stone to clay or dirt to sand or mud.
Long Descripton: When this spell is cast, all natural, undressed earth or stone in the spells area is softened. Wet earth becomes thick mud, dry earth becomes loose sand or dirt, and stone becomes soft clay that is easily molded or chopped. You affect a 10-foot square area to a depth of 1 to 4 feet, depending on the toughness or resilience of the ground at that spot. Magical, enchanted, dressed, or worked stone cannot be affected. Earth or stone creatures are not affected.[lf][lf]A creature in mud must succeed on a Reflex save or be caught for 1d2 rounds and unable to move, attack, or cast spells. A creature that succeeds on its save can move through the mud at half speed, and it cant run or charge.[lf][lf]Loose dirt is not as troublesome as mud, but all creatures in the area can move at only half their normal speed and cant run or charge over the surface.[lf][lf]Stone softened into clay does not hinder movement, but it does allow characters to cut, shape, or excavate areas they may not have been able to affect before.[lf][lf]While soften earth and stone does not affect dressed or worked stone, cavern ceilings or vertical surfaces such as cliff faces can be affected. Usually, this causes a moderate collapse or landslide as the loosened material peels away from the face of the wall or roof and falls.[lf][lf]A moderate amount of structural damage can be dealt to a manufactured structure by softening the ground beneath it, causing it to settle. However, most well-built structures will only be damaged by this spell, not destroyed.

Name: Solid Fog
Effect: Fog spreads in 20-ft. radius, 20 ft. high
Short Description: Blocks vision and slows movement.
Long Descripton: A bank of fog billows out from the point you designate. The fog obscures all sight, including darkvision, beyond 5 feet. A creature within 5 feet has concealment (attacks have a 20% miss chance). Creatures farther away have total concealment (50% miss chance, and the attacker can't use sight to locate the target).[lf][lf]The solid fog is so thick that any creature attempting to move through it progresses at a speed of 5 feet, regardless of its normal speed, and it takes a -2 penalty on all melee attack and melee damage rolls. The vapors prevent effective ranged weapon attacks (except for magic rays and the like). A creature or object that falls into solid fog is slowed, so that each 10 feet of vapor that it passes through reduces falling damage by 1d6. A creature can't take a 5-foot step while in solid fog.[lf][lf]However, unlike normal fog, only a severe wind (31+ mph) disperses these vapors, and it does so in 1 round.[lf][lf]Solid fog can be made permanent with a permanency spell. A permanent solid fog dispersed by wind reforms in 10 minutes.[lf][lf]The spell does not function underwater.

Name: Solipsism
Short Description: Subject is convinced the world is fake.

Name: Song of Discord
Short Description: Forces targets to attack each other.
Long Descripton: This spell causes those within the area to turn on each other rather than attack their foes. Each affected creature has a 50% chance to attack the nearest target each round. (Roll to determine each creatures behavior every round at the beginning of its turn.) A creature that does not attack its nearest neighbor is free to act normally for that round.[lf][lf]Creatures forced by a song of discord to attack their fellows employ all methods at their disposal, choosing their deadliest spells and most advantageous combat tactics. They do not, however, harm targets that have fallen unconscious.

Name: Song of Festering Death
Short Description: Subject takes 2d6 damage per round while caster concentrates.

Name: Songbird
Duration: Performance + 1 hour or until discharged; see text
Short Description: Perform and gain +1 on your next Cha check.

Name: Sonic Blast
Effect: 5 ft. wide to close range (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)
Short Description: Deal 1d6/level damage (max 10d6) to each creature in the area.
Medium Description: This spell seems to be superceded by resonating bolt.  Use it instead.

Name: Sonic Ray
Short Description: Ray deals 1d3 sonic damage.
Long Descripton: You cause an invisible ray of sound to strike the target, requiring a successful ranged touch attack. The spell deals 1d3 sonic damage.

Name: Sonic Rumble
Short Description: Cone of sound deals damage or moves objects.
Medium Description: Cone of sound deals 1/two levels sonic damage or moves objects.

Name: Sonic Shield
Short Description: +4 deflection bonus to AC; 1d8 sonic damage and push back creatures that hit you in melee.
Medium Description: +4 deflection AC. Attackers get 1d8 sonic damage, and must Fort save to avoid knocked 5 ft back or take another 1d8 sonic damage.

Name: Sonic Slap
Short Description: Touch attack deals 1d6 sonic damage.
Long Descripton: Your hand transmits sonic vibrations to the target, requiring a successful melee touch attack. The spell deals 1d6 sonic damage.

Name: Sonic Snap
Short Description: Target takes 1 point of sonic damage and is deafened 1 round.

Name: Sonic Weapon
Short Description: Weapon touched deals +1d6 sonic damage with each hit.

Name: Sonic Whip
Short Description: Scares animals, normal whip in combat.

Name: Sonorous Hum
Short Description: Removes need to concentrate to maintain next spell cast.

Name: Sorrow
Short Description: Subject takes -3 penalty on attacks, saves, and checks.

Name: Soul Bind
Short Description: Traps newly dead soul to prevent resurrection.
Long Descripton: You draw the soul from a newly dead body and imprison it in a black sapphire gem. The subject must have been dead no more than 1 round per caster level. The soul, once trapped in the gem, cannot be returned through clone, raise dead, reincarnate, resurrection, true resurrection, or even a miracle or a wish. Only by destroying the gem or dispelling the spell on the gem can one free the soul (which is then still dead).[lf][lf]Focus note: While creatures have no concept of level or Hit Dice as such, the value of the gem needed to trap an individual can be researched. Remember that this value can change over time as creatures gain more Hit Dice.

Name: Soul Charge
Short Description: Target gains one negetive level, and you can use a crystal to power a wand or staff instead of a charge.

Name: Soul of the Waste
Short Description: Meld into surrounding sand.

Name: Soul Scour
Short Description: Touch deals 2d6 Cha damage and 1d6 Wis damage immediately, 1d6 Cha damage after 1 minute.

Name: Soul Shackles
Short Description: Imprison soul of dead creature in talisman from which you can question it.

Name: Soul's Treasure Lost
Short Description: Disintegrates subject's most valuable object.

Name: Sound Burst
Short Description: Deals 1d8 sonic damage to subjects; may stun them.
Long Descripton: You blast an area with a tremendous cacophony. Every creature in the area takes 1d8 points of sonic damage and must succeed on a Fortitude save to avoid being stunned for 1 round. [lf][lf]Creatures that cannot hear are not stunned but are still damaged.

Name: Sound Lance
Short Description: Sonic energy deals 1d8/level damage.

Name: Spark of Life
Short Description: Undead creature loses most immunities.

Name: Spawn Screen
Short Description: You resist being transformed into an undead spawn if slain.

Name: Speak To Allies
Effect: Any number of allied creatures, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Subjects can converse at distance without moving lips.

Name: Speak with Animals
Short Description: You can communicate with animals.
Long Descripton: You can comprehend and communicate with animals. You are able to ask questions of and receive answers from animals, although the spell doesn't make them any more friendly or cooperative than normal. Furthermore, wary and cunning animals are likely to be terse and evasive, while the more stupid ones make inane comments. If an animal is friendly toward you, it may do some favor or service for you.

Name: Speak with Dead
Short Description: Corpse answers one question/two levels.
Long Descripton: You grant the semblance of life and intellect to a corpse, allowing it to answer several questions that you put to it. You may ask one question per two caster levels. Unasked questions are wasted if the duration expires. The corpses knowledge is limited to what the creature knew during life, including the languages it spoke (if any). Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive. If the creatures alignment was different from yours, the corpse gets a Will save to resist the spell as if it were alive.[lf][lf]If the corpse has been subject to speak with dead within the past week, the new spell fails. You can cast this spell on a corpse that has been deceased for any amount of time, but the body must be mostly intact to be able to respond. A damaged corpse may be able to give partial answers or partially correct answers, but it must at least have a mouth in order to speak at all. [lf][lf]This spell does not let you actually speak to the person (whose soul has departed). It instead draws on the imprinted knowledge stored in the corpse. The partially animated body retains the imprint of the soul that once inhabited it, and thus it can speak with all the knowledge that the creature had while alive. The corpse, however, cannot learn new information.[lf][lf]Indeed, it can't even remember being questioned.[lf][lf]This spell does not affect a corpse that has been turned into an undead creature.

Name: Speak with Plants
Short Description: You can talk to normal plants and plant creatures.
Long Descripton: You can comprehend and communicate with plants, including both normal plants and plant creatures. You are able to ask questions of and receive answers from plants. A regular plants sense of its surroundings is limited, so it won't be able to give (or recognize) detailed descriptions of creatures or answer questions about events outside its immediate vicinity.[lf][lf]The spell doesn't make plant creatures any more friendly or cooperative than normal. Furthermore, wary and cunning plant creatures are likely to be terse and evasive, while the more stupid ones may make inane comments. If a plant creature is friendly toward you, it may do some favor or service for you.

Name: Speaking Stones
Effect: Two normal objects touched, weighing up to 1 lb. each
Short Description: Pass a 25-word message between two magically linked stones.

Name: Spear of Valarian
Short Description: Transforms normal weapon into +1 silvered spear (+3 against magical beasts, which take +2d6 points of damage).

Name: Spectral Hand
Short Description: Creates disembodied glowing hand to deliver touch attacks.
Long Descripton: A ghostly, glowing hand shaped from your life force materializes and moves as you desire, allowing you to deliver low-level, touch range spells at a distance. On casting the spell, you lose 1d4 hit points that return when the spell ends (even if it is dispelled), but not if the hand is destroyed. (The hit points can be healed as normal.) For as long as the spell lasts, any touch range spell of 4th level or lower that you cast can be delivered by the spectral hand. The spell gives you a +2 bonus on your melee touch attack roll, and attacking with the hand counts normally as an attack. The hand always strikes from your direction. The hand cannot flank targets like a creature can. After it delivers a spell, or if the hand goes beyond the spell range, goes out of your sight, the hand returns to you and hovers.[lf][lf]The hand is incorporeal and thus cannot be harmed by normal weapons. It has improved evasion (half damage on a failed Reflex save and no damage on a successful save), your save bonuses, and an AC of at least 22. Your Intelligence modifier applies to the hands AC as if it were the hands Dexterity modifier. The hand has 1 to 4 hit points, the same number that you lost in creating it.

Name: Spectral Stag
Short Description: Phantom stag can bull rush and be a mount.

Name: Spectral Touch
Effect: Creature or creatures touched (up to one/level)
Short Description: Your touch bestows one negative level per round.

Name: Spectral Weapon
Short Description: Creates a quasi-real weapon.

Name: Speechlink
Short Description: You and the target can verbally communicate at any distance.

Name: Speed Swim
Short Description: Target gains swim speed 30.

Name: Spell Engine
Short Description: Magical energy disk absorbs incoming spells.

Name: Spell Enhancer
Short Description: Lets you cast another spell in the same round at +2 caster level.

Name: Spell Flower
Short Description: Hold the charge on one touch spell per forelimb.

Name: Spell Immunity
Short Description: Subject is immune to one spell per four levels.
Long Descripton: The warded creature is immune to the effects of one specified spell for every four levels you have. The spells must be of 4th level or lower. The warded creature effectively has unbeatable spell resistance regarding the specified spell or spells. Naturally, that immunity doesn't protect a creature from spells for which spell resistance doesn't apply. Spell immunity protects against spells, spell-like effects of magic items, and innate spell-like abilities of creatures. It does not protect against super-natural or extraordinary abilities, such as breath weapons or gaze attacks.[lf][lf]Only a particular spell can be protected against, not a certain domain or school of spells or a group of spells that are similar in effect. [lf][lf]A creature can have only one spell immunity or spell immunity, greater spell in effect on it at a time.

Name: Spell Immunity, Greater
Short Description: As spell immunity, but up to 8th-level spells.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like spell immunity, except the immunity applies to spells of 8th level or lower.[lf][lf]A creature can have only one spell immunity or spell immunity, greater spell in effect on it at a time.

Name: Spell Immunity, Lesser
Short Description: As spell immunity, but only 1st and 2nd-level spells.

Name: Spell Matrix
Effect: Matrix that holds two of your spells
Short Description: Stores up to two spells of 3rd level or lower to be released later.

Name: Spell Matrix, Greater
Effect: Matrix that holds three of your spells
Short Description: Stores up to three spells of 3rd level or lower to be released later.

Name: Spell Matrix, Lesser
Effect: Matrix that holds one of your spells.
Short Description: Magical matrix stores a 3rd level or lower spell to be cast later as a quickened spell.

Name: Spell Phylactery
Short Description: Scroll activates upon you if conditions are met.

Name: Spell Resistance
Short Description: Subject gains SR 12 + level.
Long Descripton: The creature gains spell resistance equal to 12 + your caster level.

Name: Spell Resistance, Mass
Effect: Up to one creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: As spell resistance, but multiple targets.

Name: Spell Shield
Short Description: Target gains +3 resistance on saving throws against spells and spell-like abilities.

Name: Spell Snare
Short Description: Dragonshard absorbs a spell or spell-like ability of up to 3rd level.

Name: Spell Snare, Greater
Short Description: Dragonshard absorbs a spell or spelllike ability of up to 6th level.

Name: Spell Storing Item
Short Description: Store one spell in an item.

Name: Spell Theft
Short Description: Dispel spells on target and gain their benefit[lf][lf]for yourself.
Medium Description: Make dispel check (d20 + CL, max +15) vs DC 11 + spell's CL to steal any spell capable of being dispelled.

Name: Spell Turning
Short Description: Reflect 1d4+6 spell levels back at caster.
Long Descripton: Spells and spell-like effects targeted on you are turned back upon the original caster. The abjuration turns only spells that have you as a target. Effect and area spells are not affected. Spell turning also fails to stop touch range spells.  [lf]From seven to ten (1d4+6) spell levels are affected by the turning. The exact number is rolled secretly.  [lf]When you are targeted by a spell of higher level than the amount of spell turning you have left, that spell is partially turned. The subtract the amount of spell turning left from the spell level of the incoming spell, then divide the result by the spell level of the incoming spell to see what fraction of the effect gets through. For damaging spells, you and the caster each take a fraction of the damage. For nondamaging spells, each of you has a proportional chance to be affected.  [lf]If you and a spellcasting attacker are both warded by spell turning effects in operation, a resonating field is created.  [lf]Roll randomly to determine the result.    [lf]d%Effect  [lf]01-70  Spell drains away without effect.  [lf]71-80  Spell affects both of you equally at full effect.  [lf]81-97  Both turning effects are rendered nonfunctional for 1d4 minutes.  [lf]98-100  Both of you go through a rift into another plane.

Name: Spell Turning, Lesser
Short Description: As spell turning, except only 1d4+1 spell levels are affected by the turning.

Name: Spell Vulnerability
Short Description: Target takes penalty on spell resistance equal to caster level.

Name: Spellmantle
Short Description: As spell immunity, but negated spells triggers a helpful spell upon the target.

Name: Spellslayer Arrow
Short Description: Masterwork arrow or bolt deals extra damage to a creature with ongoing spells cast upon it.

Name: Spellstaff
Short Description: Stores one spell in wooden quarterstaff.
Long Descripton: You store one spell that you can normally cast in a wooden quarterstaff. Only one such spell can be stored in a staff at a given time, and you cannot have more than one spellstaff at any given time. You can cast a spell stored within a staff just as though it were among those you had prepared, but it does not count against your normal allotment for a given day. You use up any applicable material components required to cast the spell when you store it in the spellstaff.

Name: Spelltrap
Short Description: An intangible gem absobs spell and detonates if touched dealing 2d6/spell level absorbed in 20-ft.-spread.

Name: Sphere of Terror
Saving Throw: Will disbelief (if interacted with), then Fortitude half; see text
Short Description: Creates a 30-ft. radius of supernatural shadow filled with deadly shadowy illusions.

Name: Sphere of Ultimate Destruction
Short Description: Sphere disintegrates everything it touches.

Name: Spider Climb
Short Description: Grants ability to walk on walls and ceilings.
Long Descripton: The subject can climb and travel on vertical surfaces or even traverse ceilings as well as a spider does. The affected creature must have its hands free to climb in this manner. The subject gains a climb speed of 20 feet; furthermore, it need not make Climb checks to traverse a vertical or horizontal surface (even upside down). A spider climbing creature retains its Dexterity bonus to Armor Class (if any) while climbing, and opponents get no special bonus to their attacks against it. It cannot, however, use the run action while climbing.

Name: Spider Curse
Short Description: You turn a humanoid into a driderlike creature that obeys you.

Name: Spider Hand
Short Description: Your hand becomes a Small monstrous spider.

Name: Spider Leqs
Short Description: You grow long spider legs that have a speed of 30 ft. and move on vertical surfaces.

Name: Spider Plague
Short Description: Summons Large monstrous spiders to fight for you.

Name: Spider Poison
Short Description: Touch deals 1d6 Str damage, repeats in 1 minute.

Name: Spider Shapes
Effect: One willing creature/level, all within 30 ft. of each other
Short Description: As polymorph, except you change up to one willing creature/level into a Tiny to Huge monstrous spider.

Name: Spiderbind
Effect: One spider or spiderlike creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: An affected creature moves and attacks at a drastically reduced rate, as the slow spell.

Name: Spiderform
Short Description: You assume spider or drider form.

Name: Spiderskin
Short Description: Subject gains increasing bonus to natural armor bonus, saves against poison, and Hide checks.

Name: Spike Growth
Short Description: Creatures in area take 1d4 damage, may be slowed.
Long Descripton: Any ground-covering vegetation in the spells area becomes very hard and sharply pointed without changing its appearance.[lf][lf]In areas of bare earth, roots and rootlets act in the same way. Typically, spike growth can be cast in any outdoor setting except open water, ice, heavy snow, sandy desert, or bare stone. Any creature moving on foot into or through the spells area takes 1d4 points of piercing damage for each 5 feet of movement through the spiked area.[lf][lf]Any creature that takes damage from this spell must also succeed on a Reflex save or suffer injuries to its feet and legs that slow its land speed by one-half. This speed penalty lasts for 24 hours or until the injured creature receives a cure spell (which also restores lost hit points). Another character can remove the penalty by taking 10 minutes to dress the injuries and succeeding on a Heal check against the spells save DC.[lf][lf]Spike growth can't be disabled with the Disable Device skill.[lf][lf]Note: Magic traps such as spike growth are hard to detect. A rogue (only) can use the Search skill to find a spike growth. The DC is 25 + spell level, or DC 28 for spike growth (or DC 27 for spike growth cast by a ranger).

Name: Spike Stones
Short Description: Creatures in area take 1d8 damage, may be lowed.
Long Descripton: Rocky ground, stone floors, and similar surfaces shape themselves into long, sharp points that blend into the background.[lf][lf]Spike stones impede progress through an area and deal damage. Any creature moving on foot into or through the spells area moves at half speed.[lf][lf]In addition, each creature moving through the area takes 1d8 points of piercing damage for each 5 feet of movement through the spiked area.[lf][lf]Any creature that takes damage from this spell must also succeed on a Reflex save to avoid injuries to its feet and legs. A failed save causes the creatures speed to be reduced to half normal for 24 hours or until the injured creature receives a cure spell (which also restores lost hit points). Another character can remove the penalty by taking 10 minutes to dress the injuries and succeeding on a Heal check against the spells save DC.[lf][lf]Spike stones is a magic trap that can't be disabled with the Disable Device skill.[lf][lf]Note: Magic traps such as spike stones are hard to detect. A rogue (only) can use the Search skill to find spike stones. The DC is 25 + spell level, or DC 29 for spike stones.

Name: Spikes
Short Description: As brambles, except that the affected weapon gains a +2 enhancement bonus on its attacks, and its threat range is doubled.

Name: Spirit Binding
Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels); see text
Effect: Up to 16 HD worth of spirits, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart when they appear
Short Description: As spirit binding, lesser, except you can attempt to call and trap one or more spirit creatures of the same type whose Hit Dice total no more than 16.

Name: Spirit Binding, Greater
Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels); see text
Effect: Up to 24 HD worth of spirits, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart when they appear
Short Description: As spirit binding, lesser, except you can attempt to call and trap one or more spirit creatures of the same type whose Hit Dice total no more than 24.

Name: Spirit Binding, Lesser
Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels); see text
Effect: One spirit of up to 8 HD
Short Description: This spell functions as planar binding, lesser, except that it allows you to call and trap a single spirit creature of up to 8 Hit Dice.

Name: Spirit Needle
Short Description: Incorporeal creature is held in place and looses incorporeal benefits.  Also cannot use teleportation type magics.

Name: Spirit Self
Short Description: You can become incorporeal but must remain within 200 feet of your body.

Name: Spirit Steed
Short Description: Channels an ancient spirit into your steed, increasing its speed and granting other benefits.

Name: Spirit Worm
Short Description: Target takes 1 point of Con damage every round for 1 round/level.

Name: Spiritual Cavalry
Effect: Two or more magical horsemen of force
Saving Throw: None and Fortitude negates; see text
Short Description: Horsemen of force attack enemies.

Name: Spiritual Charger
Short Description: Horseman of force attacks enemy.

Name: Spiritual Chariot
Short Description: Creates ghostly chariot behind your mount.

Name: Spiritual Weapon
Short Description: Magic weapon attacks on its own.
Long Descripton: A weapon made of pure force springs into existence and attacks opponents at a distance, as you direct it, dealing 1d8 force damage per hit, +1 point per three caster levels (maximum +5 at 15th level). The weapon takes the shape of a weapon favored by your deity or a weapon with some spiritual significance or symbolism to you (see below) and has the same threat range and critical multipliers as a real weapon of its form. It strikes the opponent you designate, starting with one attack in the round the spell is cast and continuing each round thereafter on your turn. It uses your base attack bonus (possibly allowing it multiple attacks per round in subsequent rounds) plus your Wisdom modifier as its attack bonus. It strikes as a spell, not as a weapon, so, for example, it can damage creatures that have damage reduction. As a force effect, it can strike incorporeal creatures without the normal miss chance associated with incorporeality. The weapon always strikes from your direction. It does not get a flanking bonus or help a combatant get one. Your feats or combat actions do not affect the weapon. If the weapon goes beyond the spell range, if it goes out of your sight, or if you are not directing it, the weapon returns to you and hovers.[lf][lf]Each round after the first, you can use a move action to redirect the weapon to a new target. If you do not, the weapon continues to attack the previous rounds target. On any round that the weapon switches targets, it gets one attack. Subsequent rounds of attacking that target allow the weapon to make multiple attacks if your base attack bonus would allow it to. Even if the spiritual weapon is a ranged weapon, use the spell's range, not the weapons normal range increment, and switching targets still is a move action.[lf][lf]A spiritual weapon cannot be attacked or harmed by physical attacks, but dispel magic, disintegrate, a sphere of annihilation, or a rod of cancellation affects it. A spiritual weapons AC against touch attacks is 12 (10 + size bonus for Tiny object).[lf][lf]If an attacked creature has spell resistance, you make a caster level check (1d20 + caster level) against that spell resistance the first time the spiritual weapon strikes it. If the weapon is successfully resisted, the spell is dispelled. If not, the weapon has its normal full effect on that creature for the duration of the spell.[lf][lf]The weapon that you get is often a force replica of your deity's own personal weapon. A cleric without a deity gets a weapon based on his alignment. A neutral cleric without a deity can create a spiritual weapon of any alignment, provided he is acting at least generally in accord with that alignment at the time. The weapons associated with each alignment are as follows.[lf][lf]Chaos: Battleaxe[lf][lf]Evil: Light flail[lf][lf]Good: Warhammer[lf][lf]Law: Longsword

Name: Spiritwall
Effect: Wall whose area is up to one 10-ft. square/level or a sphere or hemisphere with a radius of up to 1 ft/level
Short Description: Creates a wall of wailing spirits that inspires fear; 1d10 points of damage and energy drain on contact.

Name: Splinterbolt
Effect: One or more streams of splinters
Short Description: Ranged Attack that deals 4d6 piercing damage per bolt (3-6:1, 7-10: 2, 11+: 3). Threatens 18-20, x3.  +4 damage, cold iron in forest.

Name: Spontaneous Search
Short Description: Searches a 30-foot cube area in 1 round.

Name: Spore Cloak
Short Description: Cloud of dense yellow mold spores provides 20% concealment and other benefits.

Name: Spore Field
Short Description: Mushrooms grow from ground, slowing movement and sickening living creatures.
Medium Description: Creatures sickened as if by poison. 1/2 normal movement, no charge or run, penalties -5 off Balance and Tumble, -2 off Move Silently.

Name: Spores of the Vrock
Short Description: All within 5 ft. take 1d8 damage and 1d2 damage each round thereafter for 10 rounds.

Name: Spread of Contentment
Short Description: Calms hostile creatures within 10-ft./level radius.

Name: Spread of Savagery
Short Description: Creatures within 10 ft./level become hostile and savage.

Name: Spring Sheath
Short Description: Automatically draws a weapon.

Name: Spymaster's Coin
Short Description: Hide a scrying sensor in a coin or other Tiny object for later activation.

Name: Srinshee's Spell Shift
Short Description: Instead of countering another's spell, you can apply a metamagic feat to it, manipulate one of its properties, or stun the caster.

Name: Stabilize
Short Description: Cures 1 point of damage to all creatures in area.

Name: Stalactite Trap
Short Description: A stalactite gains the ability to hurl itself at a foe.

Name: Stalking Brand
Short Description: Target marked with symbol you can see despite disguises.

Name: Stalking Spell
Short Description: As greater invisibility, but subject is silent and scentless.

Name: Stalwart Pact
Short Description: You gain combat bonuses automatically when reduced to half hit points or lower.

Name: Stand
Short Description: Subject stands up from prone.
Medium Description: Subject stands from prone, provoking no AoO.

Name: Standing Wave
Effect: Waves under a creature or object within range
Short Description: Magically propels boat or swimming creature.

Name: Starmantle
Short Description: Cloak of stars destroys nonmagical weapons on contact and allows wearer a DC 15 Reflex save to reduce damage from magic weapons by half.

Name: Stars of Arvandor
Effect: Up to one creature or object per round
Short Description: Tiny starbursts each deal 1d8 damage (half nonlethal), or 1d8 letal damage to evil creatures.

Name: Stars Of Mystra
Short Description: Creates stars that remove spell slots when they hit a target.
Medium Description: Creates one twinkling star per three levels (maximum five stars). You can launch one star as a swift action. You must make a ranged touch attack for each star. If hit, the creature loses a prepared spell slot.

Name: Stars Of Selune
Short Description: Creates stars that deal force damage and cold damage to the target.

Name: Starvation
Short Description: Hunger pangs deal 1d6 nonlethal damage/level, cause fatigue.
Medium Description: Hunger pangs deal 1d6 nonlethal damage/level (max 10d6), cause fatigue.

Name: Static Veil
Short Description: Scry DC increases by +1/level for targets within the area.

Name: Statue
Short Description: Subject can become a statue at will.
Long Descripton: A statue spell turns the subject to solid stone, along with any garments and equipment worn or carried. In statue form, the subject gains hardness 8. The subject retains its own hit points.[lf][lf]The subject can see, hear, and smell normally, but it does not need to eat or breathe. Feeling is limited to those sensations that can affect the granite-hard substance of the individual's body. Chipping is equal to a mere scratch, but breaking off one of the statue's arms constitutes serious damage.[lf][lf]The subject of a statue spell can return to its normal state, act, and then return instantly to the statue state (a free action) if it so desires, as long as the spell duration is in effect.

Name: Status
Effect: One living creature touched per three levels
Short Description: Monitors condition, position of allies.
Long Descripton: When you need to keep track of comrades who may get separated, status allows you to mentally monitor their relative positions and general condition. You are aware of direction and distance to the creatures and any conditions affecting them: unharmed, wounded, disabled, staggered, unconscious, dying, nauseated, panicked, stunned, poisoned, diseased, confused, or the like. Once the spell has been cast upon the subjects, the distance between them and the caster does not affect the spell as long as they are on the same plane of existence. If a subject leaves the plane, or if it dies, the spell ceases to function for it.

Name: Status (HoB), Greater
Short Description: Monitors condition, position of many allies.

Name: Status, Greater
Short Description: As status, but cast some spells through bond.

Name: Stay the Hand
Short Description: Change subject creature's attitude to helpful for 1 round.

Name: Steal Life
Short Description: You drain 1 ability score point per round and becomes younger.

Name: Steal Size
Effect: One humanoid creature larger than you
Short Description: Humanoid creature doubles in size as targeted humanoid halves in size.

Name: Steam Breath
Short Description: Cone of steam deals 1d6/level (max 10d6) fire damage.

Name: Steed of the Seas
Short Description: Make your special mount amphibious.

Name: Steeldance
Short Description: Daggers become Medium flying animated objects that attack foes.

Name: Stick
Effect: Nonmagical, unattended object weighting up to 5 lb.
Short Description: Glues an object weighing 5 pounds or less to a larger object.

Name: Sticks And Stones
Short Description: Create stone and wood skeleton with energy drain attack to fight for you.

Name: Sticky Fingers
Short Description: Gain +10 bonus to Sleight of Hand checks.

Name: Sticky Floor
Short Description: Entangles and immobilizes creatures in affected area.

Name: Sticky Saddle
Short Description: You become stuck to special mount, gain +10 Ride checks.

Name: Sting Ray
Short Description: Ray staggers enemies and disrupts spellcasters.

Name: Stinking Cloud
Effect: Cloud spreads in 20-ft. radius, 20 ft. high
Short Description: Nauseating vapors, 1 round/level.
Long Descripton: Stinking cloud creates a bank of fog like that created by fog cloud, except that the vapors are nauseating. Living creatures in the cloud become nauseated. This condition lasts as long as the creature is in the cloud and for 1d4+1 rounds after it leaves. (Roll separately for each nauseated character.) Any creature that succeeds on its save but remains in the cloud must continue to save each round on your turn.[lf][lf]Stinking cloud can be made permanent with a permanency spell. A permanent stinking cloud dispersed by wind reforms in 10 minutes.

Name: Stolen Breath
Effect: One living creature that breathes air
Short Description: Subject has wind knocked out of it.
Medium Description: Subject loses its breath and is considered sickened for 1 minute or until spending a full-round action to recover breath.

Name: Stone Body
Short Description: Your body becomes living stone.

Name: Stone Bones
Short Description: Corporeal undead gains +3 natural armor bonus.

Name: Stone Construct
Short Description: Construct gains DR 10/adamantine.

Name: Stone Fist
Short Description: Your fists become rocky bludgeoning weapons.

Name: Stone Metamorphosis
Effect: Stone object touched, up to 10 cu. ft + 1cu. ft/level.
Short Description: Changes type of stone.

Name: Stone Metamorphosis, Greater
Effect: Stone or stone objects touched, up to 10 cu. ft. + 10 cu. ft./level
Short Description: Changes 10 cu. ft. + 10 cu. ft./level of stone into another type of stone.

Name: Stone Shape
Effect: Stone or stone object touched, up to 10 cu. ft. + 1 cu. ft./level
Short Description: Sculpts stone into any shape.
Long Descripton: You can form an existing piece of stone into any shape that suits your purpose. While its possible to make crude coffers, doors, and so forth with stone shape, fine detail isn't possible. There is a 30% chance that any shape including moving parts simply doesn't work.

Name: Stone Shape, Greater
Effect: Stone or stone objects touched, up to 10 cu. ft. + 10 cu. ft./level.
Short Description: Sculps 10 cu. ft. + 10 cu. ft./level of stone into any shape.

Name: Stone Shatter
Saving Throw: Will negates (object) or Fortitude half; see text
Short Description: Shatter a stone object or creature.

Name: Stone Sphere
Short Description: 5-ft.-diameter stone sphere rolls over your enemies.

Name: Stone Spiders
Effect: 1d3 pebbles or 1d3 vermin, no two of whigh can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Transforms 1d3 pebbles into stone constructs that resemble spiders.

Name: Stone Tell
Short Description: Talk to natural or worked stone.
Long Descripton: You gain the ability to speak with stones, which relate to you who or what has touched them as well as revealing what is covered or concealed behind or under them. The stones relate complete descriptions if asked. A stones perspective, perception, and knowledge may prevent the stone from providing the details you are looking for.[lf][lf]You can speak with natural or worked stone.

Name: Stone to Flesh
Effect: One petrified creature or a cylinder of stone from 1 ft. to 3 ft. in diameter and up to 10 ft. long
Short Description: Restores petrified creature.
Long Descripton: This spell restores a petrified creature to its normal state, restoring life and goods. The creature must make a DC 15 Fortitude save to survive the process. Any petrified creature, regardless of size, can be restored.[lf][lf]The spell also can convert a mass of stone into a fleshy substance. Such flesh is inert and lacking a vital life force unless a life force or magical energy is available. (For example, this spell would turn a stone golem into a flesh golem, but an ordinary statue would become a corpse.) You can affect an object that fits within a cylinder from 1 foot to 3 feet in diameter and up to 10 feet long or a cylinder of up to those dimensions in a larger mass of stone.

Name: Stone Walk
Short Description: Linked areas allow multiple teleportations.

Name: Stonehold
Short Description: Stony arm trap grapples and damages creatures.

Name: Stonemantle
Effect: One tiny object per caster level.
Short Description: Object gets hardness set to 8 and 15 hit points per inch unless it already has a better hardness.

Name: Stoneskin
Short Description: Ignore 10 points of damage per attack.
Long Descripton: The warded creature gains resistance to blows, cuts, stabs, and slashes. The subject gains damage reduction 10/adamantine. (It ignores the first 10 points of damage each time it takes damage from a weapon, though an adamantine weapon bypasses the reduction.) Once the spell has prevented a total of 10 points of damage per caster level (maximum 150 points), it is discharged.

Name: Stony Grasp
Short Description: As earthen grasp, except the stony arm can appear from any natural surface, including unworked rock, earth, mud, grass, or sand.

Name: Stop Heart
Short Description: Touched living humanoid drops to -8 hitpoints.

Name: Storm Mote
Short Description: Dust devil of flensing sand.

Name: Storm of Elemental Fury
Effect: 40-ft.-radius storm cloud, 200 feet above the ground
Short Description: Magic cloud creates win-storm, then hail of stones, then rainstorm, then flame.

Name: Storm of Shards
Short Description: Evil creatures are blinded for 1 round; evil outsiders and undead also take 1d6 damage/level.

Name: Storm of Vengeance
Short Description: Storm rains acid, lightning, and hail.
Long Descripton: This spell creates an enormous black storm cloud. Lightning and crashing claps of thunder appear within the storm. Each creature beneath the cloud must succeed on a Fortitude save or be deafened for 1d4x10 minutes.[lf][lf]If you do not maintain concentration on the spell after casting it, the spell ends.  If you continue to concentrate, the spell generates additional effects in each following round, as noted below. Each effect occurs during your turn.[lf][lf]2nd Round: Acid rains down in the area, dealing 1d6 points of acid damage (no save).[lf][lf]3rd Round: You call six bolts of lightning down from the cloud. You decide where the bolts strike. No two bolts may be directed at the same target. Each bolt deals 10d6 points of electricity damage. A creature struck can attempt a Reflex save for half damage.[lf][lf]4th Round: Hailstones rain down in the area, dealing 5d6 points of bludgeoning damage (no save).[lf][lf]5th through 10th Rounds: Violent rain and wind gusts reduce visibility. The rain obscures all sight, including darkvision, beyond 5 feet. A creature 5 feet away has concealment (attacks have a 20% miss chance). Creatures farther away have total concealment (50% miss chance, and the attacker cannot use sight to locate the target). Speed is reduced by three-quarters.[lf][lf]Ranged attacks within the area of the storm are impossible. Spells cast within the area are disrupted unless the caster succeeds on a Concentration check against a DC equal to the storm of vengeances save DC + the level of the spell the caster is trying to cast.

Name: Storm Prison
Short Description: Deal 1d6/level (max 15d6) electricity damage to target and encase them in a wind and lightning prison.

Name: Storm Shield
Short Description: Glowing sphere absorbs 20 points per caster level of electricity damage from effects that pass within 30 ft.

Name: Storm Touch
Short Description: Touch deals 9d6 electricity damage and stuns victim for 1 round; usable a number of times equal to level.

Name: Storm Tower
Short Description: Tower of swirling clouds absorbs electricity, gives concealment, and prevents movement.

Name: Stormrage
Short Description: Fly, wind wall, protection from strong winds, and make electrical attacks.

Name: Stormrunner's Ward
Short Description: Add +4 (+1/4 levels) to ship's checks to weather storms.

Name: Stormwalk
Effect: You and up to one other creature for every two levels
Short Description: Teleport yourself and one creature/2 levels from a storm.

Name: Strategic Charge
Short Description: You gain the benefits of the Mobility feat.

Name: Strength of Stone
Short Description: Bull's strength that ends if you lose contact with the ground.

Name: Stretch Weapon
Short Description: Melee weapon gains 5 ft. of reach for one attack.

Name: Stun Ray
Short Description: Ray stuns target for 1d4+1 rounds.

Name: Stunning Breath
Short Description: Your breath weapon also stuns creatures for 1 round.

Name: Stunning Breath, Greater
Short Description: Your breath weapon also stuns creatures for 2d4 rounds.

Name: Stunning Screech
Short Description: All within 30 ft. are stunned for 1 round.

Name: Stupor
Short Description: One helpless subject is put in a state that allows him to be moved but take no other actions.

Name: Styptic
Short Description: Stop bleading, and stabilize a creature.

Name: Sublime Revelry
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Targets immune to pain and mind-influencing effects, and take half damage from melee and ranged attacks.

Name: Submerge Ship
