The falling mud and the ensuing cave-in deal 8d6 points of bludgeoning damage to anyone caught directly beneath the area, or half damage to those who succeed on Reflex saves.[lf][lf]Castles and large stone buildings are generally immune to the effect of the spell, since transmute rock to mud can't affect worked stone and doesn't reach deep enough to undermine such buildings foundations. However, small buildings or structures often rest upon foundations shallow enough to be damaged or even partially toppled by this spell.[lf][lf]The mud remains until a successful dispel magic or transmute mud to rock spell restores its substance-but not necessarily its form. Evaporation turns the mud to normal dirt over a period of days. The exact time depends on exposure to the sun, wind, and normal drainage.

Name: Transmute Sand to Glass
Short Description: Transforms two 10-ft. cubes per level.

Name: Transmute Sand to Stone
Short Description: Transforms two 10-ft. cubes per level.

Name: Transmute Stone to Sand
Short Description: Transforms two 10-ft. cubes per level.

Name: Transport via Plants
Effect: You and touched objects or other touched willing creatures
Short Description: Move instantly from one plant to another of the same kind.
Long Descripton: You can enter any normal plant (Medium or larger) and pass any distance to a plant of the same kind in a single round, regardless of the distance separating the two. The entry plant must be alive. The destination plant need not be familiar to you, but it also must be alive. If you are uncertain of the location of a particular kind of destination plant, you need merely designate direction and distance and the transport via plants spell moves you as close as possible to the desired location. If a particular destination plant is desired but the plant is not living, the spell fails and you are ejected from the entry plant.[lf][lf]You can bring along objects as long as their weight doesn't exceed your maximum load. You may also bring one additional willing Medium or smaller creature (carrying gear or objects up to its maximum load) or its equivalent per three caster levels. Use the following equivalents to determine the maximum number of larger creatures you can bring along: A Large creature counts as two Medium creatures, a Huge creature counts as two Large creatures, and so forth. All creatures to be transported must be in contact with one another, and at least one of those creatures must be in contact with you.[lf][lf]You can't use this spell to travel through plant creatures.[lf][lf]The destruction of an occupied plant slays you and any creatures you have brought along, and ejects the bodies and all carried objects from the tree.

Name: Trap the Soul
Short Description: Imprisons subject within gem.
Long Descripton: Trap the soul forces a creatures life force (and its material body) into a gem. The gem holds the trapped entity indefinitely or until the gem is broken and the life force is released, which allows the material body to reform. If the trapped creature is a powerful creature from another plane it can be required to perform a service immediately upon being freed. Otherwise, the creature can go free once the gem imprisoning it is broken.[lf][lf]Depending on the version selected, the spell can be triggered in one of two ways.[lf][lf]Spell Completion: First, the spell can be completed by speaking its final word as a standard action as if you were casting a regular spell at the subject. This allows spell resistance (if any) and a Will save to avoid the effect. If the creatures name is spoken as well, any spell resistance is ignored and the save DC increases by 2. If the save or spell resistance is successful, the gem shatters.[lf][lf]Trigger Object: The second method is far more insidious, for it tricks the subject into accepting a trigger object inscribed with the final spell word, automatically placing the creatures soul in the trap. To use this method, both the creatures name and the trigger word must be inscribed on the trigger object when the gem is enspelled. A sympathy spell can also be placed on the trigger object. As soon as the subject picks up or accepts the trigger object, its life force is automatically transferred to the gem without the benefit of spell resistance or a save.[lf][lf]Material Note: . If the gem is not valuable enough, it shatters when the entrapment is attempted. (While creatures have no concept of level or Hit Dice as such, the value of the gem needed to trap an individual can be researched. Remember that this value can change over time as creatures gain more Hit Dice.)

Name: Traveler's Mount
Short Description: Creature moves faster but can't attack.

Name: Treasure Scent
Short Description: You gain the Scent ability but only for precious metals and gems.

Name: Tree Healing, Lesser
Short Description: Meld with a tree and heal 5 hp/hour.

Name: Tree Shape
Short Description: You look exactly like a tree for 1 hour/level.
Long Descripton: By means of this spell, you are able to assume the form of a Large living tree or shrub or a Large dead tree trunk with a small number of limbs. The closest inspection cannot reveal that the tree in question is actually a magically concealed creature. To all normal tests you are, in fact, a tree or shrub, although a detect magic spell reveals a faint transmutation on the tree. While in tree form, you can observe all that transpires around you just as if you were in your normal form, and your hit points and save bonuses remain unaffected. You gain a +10 natural armor bonus to AC but have an effective Dexterity score of 0 and a speed of 0 feet. You are immune to critical hits while in tree form. All clothing and gear carried or worn changes with you.[lf][lf]You can dismiss tree shape as a free action (instead of as a standard action).

Name: Tree Stride
Duration: 1 hour/level or until expended; see text
Short Description: Step from one tree to another far away.
Long Descripton: You gain the ability to enter trees and move from inside one tree to inside another tree. The first tree you enter and all others you enter must be of the same kind, must be living, and must have girth at least equal to yours. By moving into an oak tree (for example), you instantly know the location of all other oak trees within transport range (see below) and may choose whether you want to pass into one or simply step back out of the tree you moved into. You may choose to pass to any tree of the appropriate kind within the transport range as shown on the following table.[lf][lf]Type of Tree, Transport Range[lf][lf]Oak, ash, yew, 3,000 feet[lf][lf]Elm, linden, 2,000 feet[lf][lf]Other deciduous, 1,500 feet[lf][lf]Any coniferous, 1,000 feet[lf][lf]All other trees, 500 feet[lf][lf]You may move into a tree up to one time per caster level (passing from one tree to another counts only as moving into one tree). The spell lasts until the duration expires or you exit a tree. Each transport is a full-round action.[lf][lf]You can, at your option, remain within a tree without transporting yourself, but you are forced out when the spell ends. If the tree in which you are concealed is chopped down or burned, you are slain if you do not exit before the process is complete.

Name: Trembling Horn Marker
Short Description: Marks target with an invisible horn, which sounds when near a Watchman's horn.

Name: Tremor
Short Description: Force casters and skill users to Concentrate as well as knock creatures prone.

Name: Tremorsense
Short Description: Grants tremorsense to a range of 30 feet.

Name: Triadspell
Short Description: Cast a prepared spell three times.

Name: Trip Vine
Short Description: Plants trip creatures entering area.

Name: True Casting
Short Description: You get a +10 to your next Casting Roll.
Long Descripton: Your next single casting roll (if it is made before the end of the next round) gains a +10 insight bonus. Additionally, you are not affected by the miss chance on a roll of a natural one.

Name: True Creation
Effect: Unattended, nonmagical object of nonliving matter, up to 1 cu. ft./level
Short Description: Create nonmagical, unattended object of any sort of matter.
Long Descripton: The caster creates a nonmagical, unattended object of any sort of matter. Items created are permanent and cannot be negated by dispelling magics or negating powers. For all intents and purposes, these items are completely real. The volume of the item created cannot exceed 1 cubic foot per caster level. The caster must succeed at an appropriate skill check to make a complex item.[lf][lf]Unlike the items brought into being by the lower-level spells minor creation and major creation, objects created by the casting of true creation can be used as material components.

Name: True Domination
Effect: One humanoid of Medium size or smaller
Short Description: As dominate person. but save at -4.

Name: True Resurrection
Short Description: As resurrection, plus remains aren't needed.
Long Descripton: You restore life to a deceased creature. You can raise a creature that has been dead for no longer than 10 years per caster level. In addition, the subject's soul must be free and willing to return. If the subject's soul is not willing to return, the spell does not work; therefore, a subject that wants to return receives no saving throw.[lf][lf]Upon completion of the spell, the creature is immediately restored to full hit points, vigor, and health, with no loss of prepared spells.[lf][lf]This spell can even bring back creatures whose bodies have been destroyed, provided that you unambiguously identify the deceased in some fashion (reciting the deceaseds time and place of birth or death is the most common method).[lf][lf]You can revive someone killed by a death effect or someone who has been turned into an undead creature and then destroyed. This spell can also resurrect elementals or outsiders, but it can't resurrect constructs or undead creatures.[lf][lf]Even true resurrection can't restore to life a creature who has died of old age.

Name: True Seeing
Short Description: Lets you see all things as they really are.
Long Descripton: You confer on the subject the ability to see all things as they actually are. The subject sees through normal and magical darkness, notices secret doors hidden by magic, sees the exact locations of creatures or objects under blur or displacement effects, sees invisible creatures or objects normally, sees through illusions, and sees the true form of polymorphed, changed, or transmuted things. Further, the subject can focus its vision to see into the Ethereal Plane (but not into extradimensional spaces). The range of true seeing conferred is 120 feet.[lf][lf]True seeing, however, does not penetrate solid objects. It in no way confers X-ray vision or its equivalent. It does not negate concealment, including that caused by fog and the like. True seeing does not help the viewer see through mundane disguises, spot creatures who are simply hiding, or notice secret doors hidden by mundane means. In addition, the spell effects cannot be further enhanced with known magic, so one cannot use true seeing through a crystal ball or in conjunction with clairaudience/clairvoyance.

Name: True Seeing, Mass
Effect: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart.
Short Description: As true seeing, but affects multiple creatures.

Name: True Strike
Short Description: +20 on your next attack roll.
Medium Description: +20 on your next attack roll made before the end of the next round.
Long Descripton: Your next single attack roll (if it is made before the end of the next round) gains a +20 insight bonus. Additionally, you are not affected by the miss chance that applies to attackers trying to strike a concealed target.

Name: Tsunami
Short Description: Massive wave deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage/level.
Medium Description: Each round victims caught in massive wave take 1d6 bludgeoning damage/level (max 20d6), Fortitude save for half. Escape requires DC 20 Swim check.

Name: Tune of the Dancing Weapon
Short Description: Sword animates and fights for you.

Name: Tunnel Swallow
Effect: Tunnel section up to 20 feet in diameter and up to 50 feet long.
Short Description: Tunnel's peristaltic convulsions deal 1d6 points of damage/level (max 15d6).

Name: Turbidity
Short Description: Water surrounding you becomes cloudy, granting concealment.

Name: Twilight Luck
Short Description: Target gains +1 luck bonus on all saving throws.

Name: Tyche's Touch
Short Description: Confers a decreasing sacred bonus or penalty on the subject's next four saving throws.
Medium Description: Confers a decreasing sacred bonus or penalty on the subject's next four saving throws, starting at +4 or -4.

Name: Unbinding
Short Description: Frees everyone in range from spells that constrain or bind.

Name: Undaunted Fixture
Short Description: Two objects cannot be separated except by a DC 30 strength check.  Objects may break first.

Name: Undead Bane Weapon
Short Description: Weapon gains the bane property and is aligned good.

Name: Undead Couduit
Short Description: Cast necromatic spells through your undead.
Medium Description: Cast necromatic spells through your undead.

Name: Undead Lieutenant
Short Description: Targeted undead can give orders to undead in your control.

Name: Undead Mask
Short Description: Subject's type changes to undead.

Name: Undead Torch
Short Description: Undead creature gains blue aura that gives +2d4 against living creatures.

Name: Undeath after Death
Short Description: -2 to Constitution, in exchange gaining the crypt spawn template at death.

Name: Undeath to Death
Effect: Several undead creatures within a 40-ft.-radius burst
Short Description: Destroys 1d4 HD/level undead (max 20d4).
Long Descripton: A circle of death snuffs out the life force of undead creatures, destroying them instantly.[lf][lf]The spell destroys 1d4 HD worth of undead creatures per caster level (maximum 20d4). Creatures with the fewest HD are affected first; among creatures with equal HD, those who are closest to the bursts point of origin are affected first. No creature of 9 or more HD can be affected, and Hit Dice that are not sufficient to affect a creature are wasted.

Name: Undeath's Eternal Foe
Short Description: Targets receive death ward and immunity to most undead special attacks.

Name: Undeniable Gravity
Short Description: Flying creature loses flying ability.

Name: Undeniable Gravity, Mass
Short Description: Flying creatures lose flying ability.

Name: Undermaster
Short Description: You gain earth-related spell-like abilities.

Name: Undersong
Short Description: Make Perform checks in place of Concentration checks.

Name: Understand Device
Short Description: You can make untrained Disable Device checks, or gives +10 bonus if you have the skill.

Name: Understand Object
Short Description: Determine the non-magical functions of an object or technological item.

Name: Undertow
Short Description: Cause water to splash out of containers or Stun creatures in large bodies of water for 1 round.

Name: Undetectable Alignment
Short Description: Conceals alignment for 24 hours.
Long Descripton: An undetectable alignment spell conceals the alignment of an object or a creature from all forms of divination.

Name: Undulant Innards
Short Description: Gain immunity to extra damage from critical hits and sneak attacks.

Name: Undying Aura
Short Description: Subject gains immunity to death effects, energy drain, and negative energy; can harm one undead or heal one deathless.
Medium Description: Subject gains immunity to death effects, energy drain, and negative energy. Can harm one undead or heal one deathless by making a melee touch attack for 1d6/level (max 15d6) positive energy damage.

Name: Unearthly Beauty
Short Description: As blinding beauty, but creatures must save or die.

Name: Unearthly Heat
Short Description: Target is subjected to unearthly heat for 1 round/level.

Name: Unfailing Endurance
Short Description: +4 bonus against weakness or fatigue, endurance bonuses.

Name: Unfettered Grasp
Short Description: Grappling creature immediately gains free attempt to escape.

Name: Unfettered Heroism
Short Description: Spend more than one action point per round plus gain one free action point per round.

Name: Unhallow
Effect: 40-ft. radius emanating from the touched point
Short Description: Designates location as unholy.
Long Descripton: Unhallow makes a particular site, building, or structure an unholy site. This has three major effects.[lf][lf]First, the site or structure is guarded by a magic circle against good effect.[lf][lf]Second, all turning checks made to turn undead take a -4 penalty, and turning checks to rebuke undead gain a +4 profane bonus. Spell resistance does not apply to this effect. (This provision does not apply to the druid version of the spell.)[lf][lf]Finally, you may choose to fix a single spell effect to the unhallowed site. The spell effect lasts for one year and functions throughout the entire site, regardless of its normal duration and area or effect. You may designate whether the effect applies to all creatures, creatures that share your faith or alignment, or creatures that adhere to another faith or alignment. At the end of the year, the chosen effect lapses, but it can be renewed or replaced simply by casting unhallow again.[lf][lf]Spell effects that may be tied to an unhallowed site include aid, bane, bless, cause fear, darkness, daylight, death ward, deeper darkness, detect magic, detect good, dimensional anchor, discern lies, dispel magic, endure elements, freedom of movement, invisibility purge, protection from energy, remove fear, resist energy, silence, tongues, and zone of truth.[lf][lf]Saving throws and spell resistance might apply to these spells effects. (See the individual spell descriptions for details.)[lf][lf]An area can receive only one unhallow spell (and its associated spell effect) at a time.[lf][lf]Unhallow counters but does not dispel hallow.

Name: Unheavened
Short Description: Subject gains +4 save bonus again powers of good outsiders.

Name: Unholy Aura
Effect: One creature/level in a 20-ft.-radius burst centered on you
Short Description: +4 to AC, +4 resistance, and SR 25 against good spells.
Long Descripton: A malevolent darkness surrounds the subjects, protecting them from attacks, granting them resistance to spells cast by good creatures, and weakening good creatures when they strike the subjects. This abjuration has four effects.[lf][lf]First, each warded creature gains a +4 deflection bonus to AC and a +4 resistance bonus on saves. Unlike the effect of protection from good, this benefit applies against all attacks, not just against attacks by good creatures.[lf][lf]Second, a warded creature gains spell resistance 25 against good spells and spells cast by good creatures.[lf][lf]Third, the abjuration blocks possession and mental influence, just as protection from good does.[lf][lf]Finally, if a good creature succeeds on a melee attack against a warded creature, the offending attacker takes 1d6 points of temporary Strength damage (Fortitude negates).

Name: Unholy Beast
Effect: One animal of up to 1 HD/level
Short Description: Target animal transforms into an unholy minion under your control.

Name: Unholy Blight
Short Description: Damages and sickens good creatures.
Long Descripton: You call up unholy power to smite your enemies. The power takes the form of a cold, cloying miasma of greasy darkness.[lf][lf]Only good and neutral (not evil) creatures are harmed by the spell.[lf][lf]The spell deals 1d8 points of damage per two caster levels (maximum 5d8) to a good creature (or 1d6 per caster level, maximum 10d6, to a good outsider) and causes it to be sickened for 1d4 rounds. A successful Will save reduces damage to half and negates the sickened effect. The effects cannot be negated by remove disease or heal, but remove curse is effective.[lf][lf]The spell deals only half damage to creatures who are neither evil nor good, and they are not sickened. Such a creature can reduce the damage in half again (down to one-quarter) with a successful Will save.

Name: Unholy Storm
Short Description: Evil-aligned rain falls in 20-ft. radius.

Name: Unity Wine
Effect: One pint of wine in touched container
Short Description: Drinking a glass of wine inspires +1 morale bonus on skill checks.

Name: Unliving Weapon
Short Description: Undead subject explodes for 1d6 damage/2 levels when struck or at a specific time.

Name: Unluck
Short Description: All actions involving random elements are rolled twice and the worse roll is used.

Name: Unnerving Gaze
Short Description: Subject takes -1 penalty on attacks.

Name: Unravel
Short Description: Unravels targets cloths, entangleing them.
Medium Description: Unravels targets cloths, entangleing them.

Name: Unseen Crafter
Short Description: Invisible force obeys your command and can use the Craft skill.

Name: Unseen Servant
Short Description: Invisible force obeys your commands.
Long Descripton: An unseen servant is an invisible, mindless, shapeless force that performs simple tasks at your command. It can run and fetch things, open unstuck doors, and hold chairs, as well as clean and mend. The servant can perform only one activity at a time, but it repeats the same activity over and over again if told to do so as long as you remain within range. It can open only normal doors, drawers, lids, and the like. It has an effective Strength score of 2 (so it can lift 20 pounds or drag 100 pounds). It can trigger traps and such, but it can exert only 20 pounds of force, which is not enough to activate certain pressure plates and other devices. It can't perform any task that requires a skill check with a DC higher than 10 or that requires a check using a skill that can't be used untrained. Its speed is 15 feet.[lf][lf]The servant cannot attack in any way; it is never allowed an attack roll. It cannot be killed, but it dissipates if it takes 6 points of damage from area attacks. (It gets no saves against attacks.) If you attempt to send it beyond the spell's range (measured from your current position), the servant ceases to exist.

Name: Unseen Servant, Mass
Short Description: As unseen servant except creates one servant/level.

Name: Unyielding Roots
Short Description: Creature grows roots that keep it stationary and heal it every round.

Name: Updraft
Short Description: Swift. You rise up to 90 feet but move slowly around by a strong column of air.

Name: Urban Shield
Short Description: City grants cover to you, not to enemies.

Name: Urchin's Spines
Short Description: Target grows spines that damage opponents.

Name: Utterdark
Short Description: 100-ft/level radius of darkness that evil creatures can see through.

Name: Valiant Fury
Short Description: Subject gains +4 to Str and Con, +2 to Will, and an extra attack per round.

Name: Valiant Steed
Short Description: Calls a pegasus or unicorn, which serves caster for up to 1 year.

Name: Vampiric Touch
Short Description: Touch deals 1d6/two levels damage; caster gains damage as HP.
Long Descripton: You must succeed on a melee touch attack. Your touch deals 1d6 points of damage per two caster levels (maximum 10d6). You gain temporary hit points equal to the damage you deal. However, you can't gain more than the subject's current hit points +10, which is enough to kill the subject. The temporary hit points disappear 1 hour later.

Name: Vanishing Weapon
Short Description: Weapons' touch dispels summoned or quasi-real creatures.

Name: Veil
Effect: One or more creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Changes appearance of group of creatures.
Long Descripton: You instantly change the appearance of the subjects and then maintain that appearance for the spell's duration. You can make the subjects appear to be anything you wish. The subjects look, feel, and smell just like the creatures the spell makes them resemble. Affected creatures resume their normal appearances if slain. You must succeed on a Disguise check to duplicate the appearance of a specific individual. This spell gives you a +10 bonus on the check.[lf][lf]Unwilling targets can negate the spells effect on them by making Will saves or with spell resistance. Those who interact with the subjects can attempt Will disbelief saves to see through the glamer, but spell resistance doesn't help.

Name: Veil of Shadow
Short Description: Darkness grants you concealment.

Name: Veil of Undeath
Short Description: You gain undead traits.

Name: Vengeance Halo
Saving Throw: None or Reflex half; see text
Short Description: Any creature that slays the spell's recipient takes 1d6/level (max 20d6) damage.

Name: Vengeful Mount
Short Description: Makes an animal more difficult to ride or handle.

Name: Venom Bolt
Saving Throw: Reflex half, Fortitude partial; see text
Short Description: All in beam take 2d8 acid damage; paralyzed.
Medium Description: All in beam take 2d8 acid damage, Reflex save halves damage. Paralyzed for 1d4+1 rounds or slowed for 1 round on successful Fortitude save.

Name: Venomfire
Short Description: Creature's venom deals an additional 1d6 acid damage/level.

Name: Ventriloquism
Short Description: Throws voice for 1 min./level.
Long Descripton: You can make your voice (or any sound that you can normally make vocally) seem to issue from someplace else. You can speak in any language you know. With respect to such voices and sounds, anyone who hears the sound and rolls a successful save recognizes it as illusory (but still hears it).

Name: Verraketh's Shadow Crown
Short Description: Your bardic music effects tap the Shadow Weave, granting +4 competence bonus to Perform.

Name: Vertigo
Short Description: Subject creature must succeed on a DC 10 Balance check to move each round.
Medium Description: Target checks DC 10 Balance to move. If fail by 5 or more, falls prone and takes -2 to attacks and saves.

Name: Vertigo (Sky)
Short Description: Creature believes it is at the top of a great fall and has nowhere it can move.  Takes non-lethal damage if it moves or is moved.

Name: Vertigo Field
Short Description: Creatures have 20% miss chance and possibly become nauseated.
Medium Description: Field of 20% miss chance and difficult terrain. Creatures nauseated for 1 round on failing save. CL number of designated allies unaffected.

Name: Vigor
Short Description: As vigor, lesser, but grants fast healing 2.

Name: Vigor, Greater
Short Description: As vigor, lesser, but grants fast healing 4 instead.

Name: Vigor, Lesser
Short Description: Creature heals 1 hp/round (max 15 rounds).

Name: Vigor, Mass Lesser
Effect: One creature/two levels, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart Duration
Short Description: Subjects gain fast healing 1.

Name: Vigorous Circle
Effect: One creature/two levels, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: As vigor, mass lesser, but grants fast healing 3.

Name: Vile Death
Short Description: Undead creature gains fiendish template.

Name: Vile Lance
Short Description: Creates +2 shortspear that deals vile damage.

Name: Vine Mine
Short Description: Vines grow rapidly, giving various effects.

Name: Vine Strike
Short Description: Swift. You can sneak attack plant creatures for 1 round.

Name: Vipergout
Short Description: You spit forth celestial or fiendish vipers that attack your foes.

Name: Virtue
Short Description: Subject gains 1 temporary hp.
Long Descripton: The subject gains 1 temporary hit point.

Name: Visage of the Dead
Short Description: Look like you are dead, gain some bonuses
Medium Description: Look like you are dead, gain some resistance bonuses and do not have to breath.

Name: Visage of The Deity
Short Description: As visage of the deity, lesser, but you become celestial or fiendish.

Name: Visage of the Deity, Greater
Short Description: As visage of the deity, lesser , except that you become half-celestial or half-fiend.

Name: Visage of the Deity, Lesser
Short Description: You gain +4 Charisma and resistance 10 to certain energy types.

Name: Viscid Glob
Short Description: Ranged touch attack hurls 5-ft.-diameter glob of glue at target.

Name: Vision
Short Description: As legend lore, but quicker and strenuous.
Long Descripton: This spell functions like legend lore, except that it works more quickly but produces some strain on you. You pose a question about some person, place, or object, then cast the spell. If the person or object is at hand or if you are in the place in question, you receive a vision about it by succeeding on a caster level check (1d20 +1 per caster level; maximum +25) against DC 20. If only detailed information on the person, place, or object is known, the DC is 25, and the information gained is incomplete. If only rumors are known, the DC is 30, and the information gained is vague.

Name: Vision of Fear
Short Description: You gain knowledge of the target's greatest or most recent fear.

Name: Vision of Glory
Short Description: Subject gains morale bonus equal to your Cha modifier to one saving throw.

Name: Vision of Heaven
Short Description: Evil creature is dazed for 1 round.

Name: Vitrify
Short Description: Melts sand into glass.

Name: Vitriolic Sphere
Short Description: Potent acid deals 6d6 acid damage plus possible damage in following 2 rounds.

Name: Voice of the Dragon
Short Description: +10 on Bluff, Diplomacy, and Intimidate checks; can use one suggestion.

Name: Volcanic Storm
Short Description: Wind, Rocks, and lava sweep an area.

Name: Vortex of Teeth
Effect: Hollow cylinder (40-ft. radius, 20 ft. high, with a 5-ft.-radius safe zone at the center)
Short Description: 3d8 points of damage due to force per round to all creatures in the area.

Name: Vulnerability
Short Description: Reduces an opponent's damage reduction.

Name: Wages of Sin
Short Description: Evil creatures attack other evil creatures.

Name: Wail of Doom
Short Description: Deal 1d4 damage/level in 30-ft. cone, plus targets panicked or shaken.

Name: Wail of the Banshee
Effect: One living creature/level within a 40-ft.-radius spread
Short Description: Kills one creature/level.
Long Descripton: You emit a terrible scream that kills creatures that hear it (except for yourself). Creatures closest to the point of origin are affected first.

Name: Wake Trailing
Short Description: You can track a ship across the sea.

Name: Walk the Mountain's Path
Short Description: You gain the agility of a mountain goat.

Name: Wall of Bones
Effect: Wall whose area is up to one 10-ft. square/level
Short Description: Creates a bone wall.

Name: Wall of Chains
Effect: A wall whose area is up to one 5-ft. square/level (S); see text
Short Description: Creates barrier of woven chains that has 20 hp/4 caster levels.

Name: Wall of Chaos
Effect: Wall whose area is up to one 10-ft. square/level or a sphere or hemisphere with a radius of up to 5 ft./2 caster levels
Short Description: As magic circle against law, except as once-sided wall.

Name: Wall of Coldfire
Effect: Opaque sheet of coldfire up to 20 ft. long/level or a ring of coldfire with a radius of up to 5 ft. per two levels; either form 20 ft. high
Short Description: Deals 2d4 of cold damage out to 10 ft. and 1d4 out to 20 ft. Passing through wall deals 2d6 frostburn damage +1/level.

Name: Wall of Deadly Chains
Effect: A wall whose area is up to one 5-ft. square/level (S); see text
Short Description: Creates barrier of woven chains that has 20 hp/4 caster levels and deals 3d6 damage to all within 5 ft.

Name: Wall of Dispel Magic
Effect: A plane of dispel magic whose area is up to 10-ft. square/level.
Short Description: Creatures passing through a transparent wall becomes subject of targeted dispel magic.

Name: Wall of Evil
Effect: Wall whose area is up to one 10-ft. square/level or a sphere or hemisphere with a radius of up to 5 ft./2 caster levels
Short Description: As magic circle against good, except as once-sided wall.

Name: Wall of Eyes
Effect: A wall whose area is up to one 5-ft. square/level (S); see text
Short Description: Creates barrier that you can see through and that paralyzes and consumes those that touch it.

Name: Wall of Fire
Effect: Opaque sheet of flame up to 20 ft. long/level or a ring of fire with a radius of up to 5 ft. per two levels; either form 20 ft. high
Short Description: Deals 2d4 fire damage out to 10 ft. and 1d4 out to 20 ft. Passing through wall deals 2d6 damage +1/level.
Long Descripton: An immobile, blazing curtain of shimmering violet fire springs into existence. One side of the wall, selected by you, sends forth waves of heat, dealing 2d4 points of fire damage to creatures within 10 feet and 1d4 points of fire damage to those past 10 feet but within 20 feet. The wall deals this damage when it appears and on your turn each round to all creatures in the area. In addition, the wall deals 2d6 points of fire damage +1 point of fire damage per caster level (maximum +20) to any creature passing through it. The wall deals double damage to undead creatures.[lf][lf]If you evoke the wall so that it appears where creatures are, each creature takes damage as if passing through the wall. If any 5-foot length of wall takes 20 points of cold damage or more in 1 round, that length goes out. (Do not divide cold damage by 4, as normal for objects.)[lf][lf]Wall of fire can be made permanent with a permanency spell. A permanent wall of fire that is extinguished by cold damage becomes inactive for 10 minutes, then reforms at normal strength.

Name: Wall of Force
Effect: Wall whose area is up to one 10-ft. square/level
Short Description: Wall is immune to damage.
Long Descripton: A wall of force spell creates an invisible wall of force. The wall cannot move, it is immune to damage of all kinds, and it is unaffected by most spells, including dispel magic. However, disintegrate immediately destroys it, as does a rod of cancellation, a sphere of annihilation, or a mage's disjunction spell. Breath weapons and spells cannot pass through the wall in either direction, although dimension door, teleport, and similar effects can bypass the barrier. It blocks ethereal creatures as well as material ones (though ethereal creatures can usually get around the wall by floating under or over it through material floors and ceilings). Gaze attacks can operate through a wall of force.[lf][lf]The caster can form the wall into a flat, vertical plane whose area is up to one 10- foot square per level. The wall must be continuous and unbroken when formed. If its surface is broken by any object or creature, the spell fails.[lf][lf]Wall of force can be made permanent with a permanency spell.

Name: Wall of Gears
Effect: Wall of moving gears whose area fills one 5-ft. square/2 levels; see text
Short Description: Creates wall of moving gears that deals 1d8 damage/2 levels to creatures within 10 ft.

Name: Wall of Gloom
Effect: Semiopaque sheet of darkness up to 40 ft. long, or a ring of darkness with a radius of up to 15 ft.; either form 20 ft. high
Short Description: A shadowy wall deters passage.

Name: Wall of Good
Effect: Wall whose area is up to one 10-ft. square/level or a sphere or hemisphere with a radius of up to 5 ft./2 caster levels
Short Description: As magic circle against evil, except as once-sided wall.

Name: Wall of Greater Dispel Magic
Effect: A plane of greater dispel magic whose area is up to one 10-ft. square/level
Short Description: Creatures passing through a transparent wall become subjects of targeted dispel magic, greater.

Name: Wall of Ice
Effect: Anchored plane of ice, up to one 10-ft. square/level, or hemisphere of ice with a radius of up to 3 ft. + 1 ft./level
Short Description: Ice plane creates wall with 15 hp +1/level, or hemisphere can trap creatures inside.
Long Descripton: This spell creates an anchored plane of ice or a hemisphere of ice, depending on the version selected. A wall of ice cannot form in an area occupied by physical objects or creatures. Its surface must be smooth and unbroken when created. Any creature adjacent to the wall when it is created may attempt a Reflex save to disrupt the wall as it is being formed. A successful save indicates that the spell automatically fails. Fire can melt a wall of ice, and it deals full damage to the wall (instead of the normal half damage taken by objects). Suddenly melting a wall of ice creates a great cloud of steamy fog that lasts for 10 minutes.[lf][lf]Ice Plane: A sheet of strong, hard ice appears. The wall is 1 inch thick per caster level. It covers up to a 10-foot-square area per caster level (so a 10th-level wizard can create a wall of ice 100 feet long and 10 feet high, a wall 50 feet long and 20 feet high, or some other combination of length and height that does not exceed 1,000 square feet). The plane can be oriented in any fashion as long as it is anchored. A vertical wall need only be anchored on the floor, while a horizontal or slanting wall must be anchored on two opposite sides.[lf][lf]Each 10-foot square of wall has 3 hit points per inch of thickness. Creatures can hit the wall automatically. A section of wall whose hit points drop to 0 is breached. If a creature tries to break through the wall with a single attack, the DC for the Strength check is 15 + caster level.[lf][lf]Even when the ice has been broken through, a sheet of frigid air remains. Any creature stepping through it (including the one who broke through the wall) takes 1d6 points of cold damage +1 point per caster level (no save).[lf][lf]Hemisphere: The wall takes the form of a hemisphere whose maximum radius is 3 feet + 1 foot per caster level. The hemisphere is as hard to break through as the ice plane form, but it does not deal damage to those who go through a breach.

Name: Wall of Iron
Effect: Iron wall whose area is up to one 5-ft. square/level; see text
Short Description: 30 hp/four levels; can topple onto foes.
Long Descripton: You cause a flat, vertical iron wall to spring into being. The wall inserts itself into any surrounding nonliving material if its area is sufficient to do so. The wall cannot be conjured so that it occupies the same space as a creature or another object. It must always be a flat plane, though you can shape its edges to fit the available space.[lf][lf]A wall of iron is 1 inch thick per four caster levels. You can double the walls area by halving its thickness. Each 5-foot square of the wall has 30 hit points per inch of thickness and hardness 10. A section of wall whose hit points drop to 0 is breached. If a creature tries to break through the wall with a single attack, the DC for the Strength check is 25 + 2 per inch of thickness.[lf][lf]If you desire, the wall can be created vertically resting on a flat surface but not attached to the surface, so that it can be tipped over to fall on and crush creatures beneath it. The wall is 50% likely to tip in either direction if left unpushed. Creatures can push the wall in one direction rather than letting it fall randomly. A creature must make a DC 40 Strength check to push the wall over. Creatures with room to flee the falling wall may do so by making successful Reflex saves. Any Large or smaller creature that fails takes 10d6 points of damage. The wall cannot crush Huge and larger creatures.[lf][lf]Like any iron wall, this wall is subject to rust, perforation, and other natural phenomena.

Name: Wall of Law
Effect: Wall whose area is up to one 10-ft. square/level or a sphere or hemisphere with a radius of up to 5 ft./2 caster levels
Short Description: As magic circle against chaos, except as once-sided wall.

Name: Wall Of Light
Effect: A straight wall whose area is up to one 10-ft. square/level or a sphere or hemisphere with a radius of up to 5 ft./2 levels
Short Description: Creates wall of light, can dazzle creatures.
Medium Description: Creates wall of light that dazzle creatures who pass through.

Name: Wall Of Limbs
Effect: A wall of whirling limbs up to 20 ft. long/level, or a ring of whirling limbs with a radius of up to 5 ft./2 levels, either form 20 ft. high
Short Description: Whirling limbs deal 5d6 damage and grab creatures passing through.

Name: Wall of Magma
Effect: Wall of molten stone whose area is up to one 5-ft. square/level (S)
Short Description: Deals 2d6 fire damage out to 10 ft. and 1d6 out to 20 ft. Passing through wall deals 5d6 damage +1/level.

Name: Wall of Ooze
Effect: A wall whose area is up to one 5-ft. square/level (S); see text
Short Description: Creates barrier that has 50 hp/4 levels that paralyzes and deals 2d6 damage to all that touch it.

Name: Wall of Salt
Effect: Salt wall whose area is up to one 5-ft. square/level (S)
Short Description: Wall of salt that can be shaped.

Name: Wall of Sand
Effect: Sand wall whose area is up to one 5-ft. square/level (S)
Short Description: Swirling sand blocks ranged attacks, slows movement through.

Name: Wall of Sand 2
Effect: Sand wall whose area is up to one 10-ft. square/level (S)
Short Description: Wall impedes movement, obscures vision, and blocks some attacks.

Name: Wall of Scales
Effect: Dragonhide wall whose area is up to one 5-ft. square per level (S)
Short Description: Create a barrier of dragonhide.

Name: Wall of Smoke
Effect: Two 5-ft. squares/level that are 5 ft. thick (S)
Short Description: Simple wall of smoke to block vision.  Breathing causes nausea for 1 round (Fort save).

Name: Wall of Stone
Effect: Stone wall whose area is up to one 5-ft. square/level (S)
Short Description: Creates a stone wall that can be shaped.
Long Descripton: This spell creates a wall of rock that merges into adjoining rock surfaces. A wall of stone is 1 inch thick per four caster levels and composed of up to one 5-foot square per level. You can double the walls area by halving its thickness. The wall cannot be conjured so that it occupies the same space as a creature or another object.[lf][lf]Unlike a wall of iron, you can create a wall of stone in almost any shape you desire. The wall created need not be vertical, nor rest upon any firm foundation; however, it must merge with and be solidly supported by existing stone. It can be used to bridge a chasm, for instance, or as a ramp. For this use, if the span is more than 20 feet, the wall must be arched and buttressed. This requirement reduces the spells area by half. The wall can be crudely shaped to allow crenellations, battlements, and so forth by likewise reducing the area.[lf][lf]Like any other stone wall, this one can be destroyed by a disintegrate spell or by normal means such as breaking and chipping. Each 5-foot square of the wall has 15 hit points per inch of thickness and hardness 8. A section of wall whose hit points drop to 0 is breached. If a creature tries to break through the wall with a single attack, the DC for the Strength check is 20 + 2 per inch of thickness.[lf][lf]It is possible, but difficult, to trap mobile opponents within or under a wall of stone, provided the wall is shaped so it can hold the creatures. Creatures can avoid entrapment with successful Reflex saves.

Name: Wall of Thorns
Effect: Wall of thorny brush, up to one 10-ft. cube/level (S)
Short Description: Thorns damage anyone who tries to pass.
Long Descripton: A wall of thorns spell creates a barrier of very tough, pliable, tangled brush bearing needle-sharp thorns as long as a humans finger. Any creature forced into or attempting to move through a wall of thorns takes slashing damage per round of movement equal to 25 minus the creatures AC. Dexterity and dodge bonuses to AC do not count for this calculation. (Creatures with an Armor Class of 25 or higher, without considering Dexterity and dodge bonuses, take no damage from contact with the wall.)[lf][lf]You can make the wall as thin as 5 feet thick, which allows you to shape the wall as a number of 10-by-10-by-5-foot blocks equal to twice your caster level. This has no effect on the damage dealt by the thorns, but any creature attempting to break through takes that much less time to force its way through the barrier.[lf][lf]Creatures can force their way slowly through the wall by making a Strength check as a full-round action. For every 5 points by which the check exceeds 20, a creature moves 5 feet (up to a maximum distance equal to its normal land speed). Of course, moving or attempting to move through the thorns incurs damage as described above. A creature trapped in the thorns can choose to remain motionless in order to avoid taking any more damage.[lf][lf]Any creature within the area of the spell when it is cast takes damage as if it had moved into the wall and is caught inside. In order to escape, it must attempt to push its way free, or it can wait until the spell ends. Creatures with the ability to pass through overgrown areas unhindered can pass through a wall of thorns at normal speed without taking damage.[lf][lf]A wall of thorns can be breached by slow work with edged weapons. Chopping away at the wall creates a safe passage 1 foot deep for every 10 minutes of work. Normal fire cannot harm the barrier, but magical fire burns it away in 10 minutes.[lf][lf]Despite its appearance, a wall of thorns is not actually a living plant, and thus is unaffected by spells that affect plants.

Name: Wall Of Vermin
Effect: Wall of pests whose area is up to four 5-ft. squares (S)
Short Description: Wall of biting pests provides concealment, attacks anyone passing through.
Medium Description: Wall provides concealment, deals 2d6 damage to passers-through, and nauseates if Fort save fails.

Name: Wall of Water
Effect: Wall of water 1 ft. thick whose area is up to one 10-ft. Square/level (S)
Short Description: Wall impedes movement and can drown creatures.

Name: Wand Modulation
Short Description: Temporarily change wand to cast another, weaker spell.

Name: War Cry
Short Description: Swift. Gain +2 morale bonus on attack and damage rolls, or +4 if you charge, for 1 round/level. Any opponent you damage must save or become panicked for 1 round.

Name: Warcry
Short Description: Creatures within 30-foot cone cower for 1d4 rounds.

Name: Ward, Minor
Effect: Object touched or up to 20 sq. ft.
Short Description: See Text

Name: Warding Gems
Short Description: Creates gems that store healing energy, encircle the target, and release their healing power on command.

Name: Warning Shout
Short Description: All living creatures within half a mile hear your shout.

Name: Warp Destiny
Short Description: Reverse failed save or hit in combat.

Name: Warp Wood
Effect: 1 Small wooden object/level, all within a 20-ft. radius
Short Description: Bends wood (shaft, handle, door, plank).
Long Descripton: You cause wood to bend and warp, permanently destroying its straightness, form, and strength. A warped door springs open (or becomes stuck, requiring a Strength check to open, at your option). A boat or ship springs a leak. Warped ranged weapons are useless. A warped melee weapon causes a -4 penalty on attack rolls.[lf][lf]You may warp one Small or smaller object or its equivalent per caster level. A Medium object counts as two Small objects, a Large object as four, a Huge object as eight, a Gargantuan object as sixteen, and a Colossal object as thirty-two.[lf][lf]Alternatively, you can unwarp wood (effectively warping it back to normal) with this spell, straightening wood that has been warped by this spell or by other means. Make whole, on the other hand, does no good in repairing a warped item.[lf][lf]You can combine multiple consecutive warp wood spells to warp (or unwarp) an object that is too large for you to warp with a single spell. [lf][lf]Until the object is completely warped, it suffers no ill effects.

Name: Waste Strider
Short Description: Move through the wasteland without penalties.

Name: Watchful Ancestors
Short Description: Spiritual manifestations prevent you from being flanked and grant insight bonus on one Reflex save.
Medium Description: Spiritual manifestations prevent you from being flanked as if you had the improved uncanny dodge barbarian ability. Grants an insight bonus equal to your caster level on one Reflex save.

Name: Watchware
Short Description: You know when target object is touched.

Name: Water Breathing
Short Description: Subjects can breathe underwater.
Long Descripton: The transmuted creatures can breathe water freely. Divide the duration evenly among all the creatures you touch.[lf][lf]The spell does not make creatures unable to breathe air.

Name: Water to Acid
Short Description: Transforms 1 cu. ft./level of water into acid.

Name: Water to Poison
Short Description: Converts water into an ingestion poison with a DC of the spell for 1 Con and 1d8 Con damages, Will negates each.

Name: Water Walk
Short Description: Subject treads on water as if solid.
Long Descripton: The transmuted creatures can tread on any liquid as if it were firm ground. Mud, oil, snow, quicksand, running water, ice, and even lava can be traversed easily, since the subjects feet hover an inch or two above the surface. (Creatures crossing molten lava still take damage from the heat because they are near it.) The subjects can walk, run, charge, or otherwise move across the surface as if it were normal ground.[lf][lf]If the spell is cast underwater (or while the subjects are partially or wholly submerged in whatever liquid they are in), the subjects are borne toward the surface at 60 feet per round until they can stand on it.

Name: Waterball
Short Description: Splash does subdual damage.

Name: Waterspout
Effect: A cylinder 10 ft. wide and 80 ft. tall
Short Description: Creates waterspout that moves, damages creatures, sucks creatures upward.

Name: Wave Blessing
Effect: One Medium or smaller object or creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Keeps one creature/level from sinking.

Name: Wave of Grief
Short Description: Cone imposes -3 penalty on attacks, checks, and saves.

Name: Wave of Pain
Short Description: Stuns all within cone for 1 round/2 levels.

Name: Waves of Cold
Short Description: Fire creatures become shaken and cold creatures lose immunity to cold.

Name: Waves of Exhaustion
Short Description: Several targets become exhausted.
Long Descripton: Waves of negative energy cause all living creatures in the spell's area to become exhausted. This spell has no effect on a creature that is already exhausted.

Name: Waves of Fatigue
Short Description: Several targets become fatigued.
Long Descripton: Waves of negative energy render all living creatures in the spell's area fatigued. This spell has no effect on a creature that is already fatigued.

Name: Weapon Augmentation
Effect: One weapon or fifty projectiles, all of which must be in contact with each other at the time of casting
Short Description: Weapon gains special ability with up to +3 bonus market price modifier.

Name: Weapon Augmentation, Greater
Effect: One weapon or fifty projectiles, all of which must be in contact with each other at the time of casting
Short Description: Weapon gains special ability with up to +5 bonus market price modifier.

Name: Weapon Augmentation, Lesser
Effect: One weapon or fifty projectiles, all of which must be in contact with each other at the time of casting
Short Description: Weapon gains special ability with +1 bonus market price modifier.

Name: Weapon Augmentation, Personal
Short Description: Your weapon gains special ability with +1 bonus market price modifier.

Name: Weapon Of Energy
Short Description: Weapon deals extra energy damage.

Name: Weapon of Impact
Effect: One weapon or fifty blunt projectiles, all of which must be in contact with one another at the time of casting.
Short Description: As keen edge, but aids blunt weapons.

Name: Weapon of the Deity
Short Description: Gives your weapon magical powers appropriate to your patron.

Name: Weapon Shift
Effect: One melee weapon of up to 15 lb.
Short Description: Touched weapon changes form.

Name: Weather Eye
Effect: 1 mile radius + 1 mile/level, centered on you
Short Description: You accurately predict weather up to one week ahead.

Name: Web
Short Description: Fills 20-ft.-radius spread with sticky spiderwebs.
Long Descripton: Web creates a many-layered mass of strong, sticky strands. These strands trap those caught in them. The strands are similar to spider webs but far larger and tougher. These masses must be anchored to two or more solid and diametrically opposed points or else the web collapses upon itself and disappears. Creatures caught within a web become entangled among the gluey fibers. Attacking a creature in a web won't cause you to become entangled.[lf][lf]Anyone in the effects area when the spell is cast must make a Reflex save. If this save succeeds, the creature is entangled, but not prevented from moving, though moving is more difficult than normal for being entangled (see below). If the save fails, the creature is entangled and cant move from its space, but can break loose by spending 1 round and making a DC 20 Strength check or a DC 25 Escape Artist check. Once loose (either by making the initial Reflex save or a later Strength check or Escape Artist check), a creature remains entangled, but may move through the web very slowly. Each round devoted to moving allows the creature to make a new Strength check or Escape Artist check. The creature moves 5 feet for each full 5 points by which the check result exceeds 10.[lf][lf]If you have at least 5 feet of web between you and an opponent, it provides cover. If you have at least 20 feet of web between you, it provides total cover.[lf][lf]The strands of a web spell are flammable. A magic flaming sword can slash them away as easily as a hand brushes away cobwebs. Any fire can set the webs alight and burn away 5 square feet in 1 round. All creatures within flaming webs take 2d4 points of fire damage from the flames.[lf][lf]Web can be made permanent with a permanency spell. A permanent web that is damaged (but not destroyed) regrows in 10 minutes.

Name: Webfoot
Short Description: Target gains +4 on Swim and is less hindered by bog terrain.

Name: Weighed in the Balance
Effect: Creatures in a 30-ft.-radius spread centered on you.
Short Description: Harms or heals creatures within 30 feet of you.

Name: Weird
Effect: Any number of creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Saving Throw: Will disbelief (if interacted with), then Fortitude partial; see text
Short Description: As phantasmal killer, but affects all within 30 ft.
Long Descripton: You create a phantasmal image of the most fearsome creatures imaginable to the subjects simply by forming the fears of the subjects' subconscious mind into something that their conscious minds can visualize: these most horrible beasts. Only the spell's subjects can see the phantasmal killers. You see only vague shapes. The targets first gets a Will save to recognize the images as unreal. If that save fails, the phantasms touch their subject, and the subjects must succeed on a Fortitude save or die from fear. Even if the Fortitude save is successful, the subjects takes 3d6 points of damage and is stunned for 1 round. The subject also takes 1d4 points of temporary Strength damage.[lf][lf][lf][lf]If a subject of a Weird attack succeeds in disbelieving and is wearing a helm of telepathy, the beast can be turned upon you. You must then disbelieve it or become subject to its deadly fear attack.

Name: Were-Doom
Short Description: 1d4 creatures infected with lycanthropy.

Name: Whelm
Short Description: Deal 1d6 nonlethal damage +1d6/2 levels above 1st (max 5d6).

Name: Whelm, Mass
Short Description: 1d6 nonlethal damage/level (max 10d6) to 1 creature/level.

Name: Whelming Blast
Short Description: 15-foot cone deals 1d6 nonlethal damage /2 levels (max 5d6).

Name: Whip of Thorns
Duration: 1 round/level or until discharged, whichever comes first
Short Description: Create a thorny whip that can damage or entangle opponents.

Name: Whirl of Fangs
Effect: Wall or plane of darting jaws up to 20 ft. long/level, or a ringed wall of whirling jaws with a radius up to 5 ft./2 levels; either form 20 ft. high
Short Description: Passing through wall deals 12d4 damage.

Name: Whirling Blade
Short Description: Make an attack on a line of foes with your slashing weapon.

Name: Whirlwind
Effect: Cyclone 10 ft. wide at base, 30 ft. wide at top, and 30 ft. tall
Short Description: Cyclone deals damage and can pick up creatures.
Long Descripton: This spell creates a powerful cyclone of raging wind that moves through the air, along the ground, or over water at a speed of 60 feet per round. You can concentrate on controlling the cyclones every movement or specify a simple program. Directing the cyclones movement or changing its programmed movement is a standard action for you. The cyclone always moves during your turn. If the cyclone exceeds the spells range, it moves in a random, uncontrolled fashion for 1d3 rounds and then dissipates. (You can't regain control of the cyclone, even if comes back within range.)[lf][lf]Any Large or smaller creature that comes in contact with the spell effect must succeed on a Reflex save or take 3d6 points of damage. A Medium or smaller creature that fails its first save must succeed on a second one or be picked up bodily by the cyclone and held suspended in its powerful winds, taking 1d8 points of damage each round on your turn with no save allowed. You may direct the cyclone to eject any carried creatures whenever you wish, depositing the hapless souls wherever the cyclone happens to be when they are released.

Name: Whirlwind of Teeth
Short Description: Creates moving 5-ft./level cylinder that deals 1d8 damage/2 levels each round.

Name: Whirlwind, Greater
Effect: 20-ft.-radius tornado, up to 5ft./caster level tall, centered on a point in space
Short Description: As whirlwind, but larger and more destructive.

Name: Whispercast
Short Description: Swift:  You can cast a 5th level or lower spell and ignore any Somatic or cheap Material components.

Name: Whispering Sand
Short Description: Sand delivers your message.

Name: Whispering Wind
Duration: No more than 1 hour/level or until discharged (destination is reached)
Short Description: Sends a short message 1 mile/level.
Long Descripton: You send a message or sound on the wind to a designated spot. The whispering wind travels to a specific location within range that is familiar to you, provided that it can find a way to the location. A whispering wind is as gentle and unnoticed as a zephyr until it reaches the location. It then delivers its whisper-quiet message or other sound. Note that the message is delivered regardless of whether anyone is present to hear it. The wind then dissipates.[lf][lf]You can prepare the spell to bear a message of no more than twenty-five words, cause the spell to deliver other sounds for 1 round, or merely have the whispering wind seem to be a faint stirring of the air. You can likewise cause the whispering wind to move as slowly as 1 mile per hour or as quickly as 1 mile per 10 minutes.[lf][lf]When the spell reaches its objective, it swirls and remains in place until the message is delivered. As with magic mouth, whispering wind cannot speak verbal components, use command words, or activate magical effects.

Name: Whiteout
Effect: Cloud centered on target spreads 120 ft. and is 20 ft. high
Short Description: Snow and wind obscure sight; creatures affected may become lost.

Name: Wieldskill
Short Description: Target gains +10 to one skill, or can use it untrained, or gains a weapon or armor proficiency.

Name: Wild Instincts
Short Description: You gain +10 bonus on Listen and Spot checks and retain Dex bonus to AC when flat-footed.

Name: Wild Runner
Short Description: Change into centaur, gain some abilities

Name: Wind at Back
Effect: One creatures/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Short Description: Doubles overland speed of targets for 1 day.

Name: Wind Tunnel
Short Description: Ranged weapons gain +10 bonus and double range increment.

Name: Wind Walk
Effect: You and one touched creature per three levels
Short Description: You and your allies turn vaporous and travel fast.
Long Descripton: You alter the substance of your body to a cloudlike vapor (as the gaseous form spell) and move through the air, possibly at great speed. You can take other creatures with you, each of which acts independently.[lf][lf]Normally, a wind walker flies at a speed of 10 feet with perfect maneuverability. If desired by the subject, a magical wind wafts a wind walker along at up to 600 feet per round (60 mph) with poor maneuverability. Wind walkers are not invisible but rather appear misty and translucent. If fully clothed in white, they are 80% likely to be mistaken for clouds, fog, vapors, or the like.[lf][lf]A wind walker can regain its physical form as desired and later resume the cloud form. Each change to and from vaporous form takes 5 rounds, which counts toward the duration of the spell (as does any time spent in physical form). As noted above, you can dismiss the spell, and you can even dismiss it for individual wind walkers and not others.[lf][lf]For the last minute of the spells duration, a wind walker in cloud form automatically descends 60 feet per round (for a total of 600 feet), though it may descend faster if it wishes. This descent serves as a warning that the spell is about to end.

Name: Wind Wall
Effect: Wall up to 10 ft./level long and 5 ft./level high (S)
Short Description: Deflects arrows, smaller creatures, and gases.
Long Descripton: An invisible vertical curtain of wind appears. It is 2 feet thick and of considerable strength. It is a roaring blast sufficient to blow away any bird smaller than an eagle, or tear papers and similar materials from unsuspecting hands. (A Reflex save allows a creature to maintain its grasp on an object.) Tiny and Small flying creatures cannot pass through the barrier. Loose materials and cloth garments fly upward when caught in a wind wall. Arrows and bolts are deflected upward and miss, while any other normal ranged weapon passing through the wall has a 30% miss chance. (A giant-thrown boulder, a siege engine projectile, and other massive ranged weapons are not affected.) Gases, most gaseous breath weapons, and creatures in gaseous form cannot pass through the wall (although it is no barrier to incorporeal creatures).[lf][lf]While the wall must be vertical, you can shape it in any continuous path along the ground that you like. It is possible to create cylindrical or square wind walls to enclose specific points.

Name: Wind's Favor
Effect: Area of wind 10 ft. wide by 10 ft. high by 100 ft. + 10 ft./level long
Short Description: Create strong wind for 1 hr./level.

Name: Winding Alleys
Short Description: Trap foe in phantasmal maze.

Name: Wingbind
Short Description: A net of force entangles the target, preventing it from charging, running, or flying.

Name: Winged Mount
Short Description: Your mount grows wings and flies at speed of 60 ft.

Name: Winged Watcher
Short Description: Take the form of a bird.

Name: Wings of Air
Short Description: Target's flight maneuverability improves by one step.

Name: Wings of Air, Greater
Short Description: Target's flight maneuverability improves by two steps.

Name: Wings of Bounding
Short Description: Get a +20 circumstance bonus on a Jump check.

Name: Wings of Cover
Short Description: Grant cover against a specific attack.

Name: Wings of Flurry
Short Description: Your wings of force can attack all foes within 30 ft.
Medium Description: Your wings of force can attack all foes within 30 ft for 1d6 damage/level and dazed for 1 round. Reflex halves damage and avoids daze.

Name: Wings of Swift Flying
Duration: 1 hour/level or until underlying flight effect lapses; see text
Short Description: Increase your temporary fly speed by 30 ft.

Name: Wings of The Sea
Short Description: +30 ft. to subject’s swim speed.

Name: Winter Chill
Short Description: Creature takes 1d6 cold damage and is fatigued.

Name: Winter's Embrace
Short Description: Subject takes 1d8 damage/round; can cause fatigue.

Name: Wish
Short Description: As limited wish, but with fewer limits.
Long Descripton: Wish is the mightiest spell a wizard or sorcerer can cast. By simply speaking aloud, you can alter reality to better suit you.[lf][lf]Even wish, however, has its limits.[lf][lf]A wish can produce any one of the following effects.[lf][lf] Duplicate any wizard or sorcerer spell of 8th level or lower, provided the spell is not of a school prohibited to you.[lf][lf] Duplicate any other spell of 6th level or lower, provided the spell is not of a school prohibited to you.[lf][lf] Duplicate any wizard or sorcerer spell of 7th level or lower even if its of a prohibited school.[lf][lf] Duplicate any other spell of 5th level or lower even if its of a prohibited school. [lf][lf] Undo the harmful effects of many other spells, such as geas/quest or insanity.[lf][lf] Create a nonmagical item of up to 25,000 gp in value.[lf][lf] Create a magic item, or add to the powers of an existing magic item.[lf][lf] Grant a creature a +1 inherent bonus to an ability score. Two to five wish spells cast in immediate succession can grant a creature a +2 to +5 inherent bonus to an ability score (two wishes for a +2 inherent bonus, three for a +3 inherent bonus, and so on). Inherent bonuses are instantaneous, so they cannot be dispelled. Note: An inherent bonus may not exceed +5 for a single ability score, and inherent bonuses to a particular ability score do not stack, so only the best one applies.[lf][lf] Remove injuries and afflictions. A single wish can aid one creature per caster level, and all subjects are cured of the same kind of affliction. For example, you could heal all the damage you and your companions have taken, or remove all poison effects from everyone in the party, but not do both with the same wish. A wish can never restore the experience point loss from casting a spell or the level or Constitution loss from being raised from the dead.[lf][lf] Revive the dead. A wish can bring a dead creature back to life by duplicating a resurrection spell. A wish can revive a dead creature whose body has been destroyed, but the task takes two wishes, one to recreate the body and another to infuse the body with life again. A wish cannot prevent a character who was brought back to life from losing an experience level.[lf][lf] Transport travelers. A wish can lift one creature per caster level from anywhere on any plane and place those creatures anywhere else on any plane regardless of local conditions. An unwilling target gets a Will save to negate the effect, and spell resistance (if any) applies.[lf][lf] Undo misfortune. A wish can undo a single recent event. The wish forces a reroll of any roll made within the last round (including your last turn). Reality reshapes itself to accommodate the new result. For example, a wish could undo an opponent's successful save, a foe's successful critical hit (either the attack roll or the critical roll), a friend's failed save, and so on. The reroll, however, may be as bad as or worse than the original roll. An unwilling target gets a Will save to negate the effect, and spell resistance (if any) applies.[lf][lf]You may try to use a wish to produce greater effects than these, but doing so is dangerous. (The wish may pervert your intent into a literal but undesirable fulfillment or only a partial fulfillment.)[lf][lf]Duplicated spells allow saves and spell resistance as normal (but save DCs are for 9th-level spells).[lf][lf]XP Cost: The minimum XP cost for casting wish is 5,000 XP. When a wish duplicates a spell that has an XP cost, you must pay 5,000 XP or that cost, whichever is more. When a wish creates or improves a magic item, you must pay twice the normal XP cost for crafting or improving the item, plus an additional 5,000 XP.

Name: Wither
Short Description: Deals 1d6 dessication damage/level (max 10d6) and causes dehydration.

Name: Wither Limb
Short Description: Cause enemy's limbs to wither.

Name: Withering Palm
Short Description: Touch attack deals 1/2 levels (max 10) Str and Con damage. A crit drains instead.

Name: Wolfskin
Short Description: You take the shape of a normal wolf as if you had the wild shape ability of a 5th-level druid.

Name: Wood Rot
Effect: One nonmagical wooden object or a volume of wood; or one plant creature
Short Description: Destroy wooden objects or plants.

Name: Wood Shape
Effect: One touched piece of wood no larger than 10 cu. ft. + 1 cu. ft./level
Short Description: Rearranges wooden objects to suit you.
Long Descripton: Wood shape enables you to form one existing piece of wood into any shape that suits your purpose. While it is possible to make crude coffers, doors, and so forth, fine detail isnt possible. There is a 30% chance that any shape that includes moving parts simply doesn't work.

Name: Wood Wose
Short Description: Nature spirit does simple tasks for you.

Name: Woodland Veil
Effect: One or more creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 feet apart
Short Description: Blend unobtrusively into natural surroundings, along with your friends.

Name: Woodwisp Arrow
Short Description: Enables a masterwork arrow or bolt to pass through wood.

Name: Word of Balance
Effect: Creatures in a 30-ft.-radius spread centered on you.
Short Description: Kills, paralyzes, weakens, or nauseates nonneutral creatures.

Name: Word of Binding
Effect: One Medium or smaller humanoid or monstrous humanoid
Short Description: Magical manacles restrain foe.

Name: Word of Chaos
Effect: Nonchaotic creatures in a 40-ft.- radius spread centered on you
Saving Throw: None or Will negates; see text
Short Description: Kills, confuses, stuns, or deafens nonchaotic subjects.
Long Descripton: Any nonchaotic creature within the area who hears the word of chaos suffers the following ill effects.    [lf]HD  Effect  [lf]Equal to caster level  Deafened  [lf]Up to caster level -1  Stunned, deafened  [lf]Up to caster level -5  Confused, stunned, deafened  [lf]Up to caster level -10  Killed, confused, stunned, deafened    [lf]The effects are cumulative and concurrent. No saving throw is allowed against these effects.  [lf]Deafened: The creature is deafened for 1d4 rounds.  [lf]Stunned: The creature is stunned for 1 round.  [lf]Confused: The creature is confused, as by the confusion spell, for 1d10 minutes. This is a mind-affecting enchantment effect.  [lf]Killed: Living creatures die. Undead creatures are destroyed.  [lf]Furthermore, if you are on your home plane when you cast this spell, nonchaotic extraplanar creatures within the area are instantly banished back to their home planes. Creatures so banished cannot return for at least 24 hours. This effect takes place regardless of whether the creatures hear the word of chaos. The banishment effect allows a Will save (at a 4 penalty) to negate.  Creatures whose HD exceed your caster level are unaffected by word of chaos.

Name: Word of Recall
Effect: You and touched objects or other willing creatures
Short Description: Teleports you back to designated place.
Long Descripton: Word of recall teleports you instantly back to your sanctuary when the word is uttered. You must designate the sanctuary when you prepare the spell, and it must be a very familiar place. The actual point of arrival is a designated area no larger than 10 feet by 10 feet. You can be transported any distance within a plane but cannot travel between planes. You can transport, in addition to yourself, any objects you carry, as long as their weight doesn't exceed your maximum load. You may also bring one additional willing Medium or smaller creature (carrying gear or objects up to its maximum load) or its equivalent per three caster levels. A Large creature counts as two Medium creatures, a Huge creature counts as two Large creatures, and so forth. All creatures to be transported must be in contact with one another, and at least one of those creatures must be in contact with you. Exceeding this limit causes the spell to fail.[lf][lf]An unwilling creature can't be teleported by word of recall. Likewise, a creature's Will save (or spell resistance) prevents items in its possession from being teleported. Unattended, nonmagical objects receive no saving throw.

Name: Wounding Whispers
Short Description: Sonic aura damages foes that strike you.

Name: Wrack
Short Description: Renders creature helpless with pain.

Name: Wracking Touch
Short Description: Deal 1d6 damage +1/level; you also deal sneak attack damage if you have any.

Name: Wraithstrike
Short Description: Swift. Your melee attacks strike as touch attacks for 1 round.

Name: Wrathful Castigation
Short Description: Target dies or may be dazed and -4 on all saves for 1 round/level.

Name: Wretched Blight
Short Description: Deals 1d8 damage/level in 20-ft. radius and stuns foes for 1d4 rounds.

Name: Xorn Movement
Short Description: Touched creature swims through earth like a xorn.

Name: Yoke of Mercy
Short Description: Target deals nonlethal damage.

Name: Zajimarn's Avalanche
Short Description: Wave of slush deals 1d4 cold/level and moves targets.

Name: Zajimarn's Field of Icy Razors
Short Description: Creatures in area take normal and cold damage, may be slowed.

Name: Zeal
Short Description: You move through foes to attack the enemy you want.

Name: Zealot Pact
Short Description: You automatically gain combat bonuses when you attack someone of opposite alignment.

Name: Zone of Glacial Cold
Short Description: Deals 1d6 cold damage to all creatures in area.

Name: Zone of Natural Purity
Short Description: Aberrations in area become weaker, fey and plants become stronger.

Name: Zone of Respite
Short Description: Prevents teleportation and similar effects from functioning in the area

Name: Zone of Revelation
Effect: 5-ft.-radius/level emanation centered on a point in space
Short Description: Makes invisible and ethereal creatures visible.

Name: Zone of Silence
Short Description: Keeps eavesdroppers from overhearing conversations.
Long Descripton: By casting zone of silence, you manipulate sound waves in your immediate vicinity so that you and those within the spells area can converse normally, yet no one outside can hear your voices or any other noises from within, including language-dependent or sonic spell effects. This effect is centered on you and moves with you. Anyone who enters the zone immediately becomes subject to its effects, but those who leave are no longer affected. Note, however, that a successful Spot check to read lips can still reveal whats said inside a zone of silence.

Name: Zone of Speed
Short Description: Nothing moves faster than the speed you choose within the area.

Name: Zone of Truth
Short Description: Subjects within range cannot lie.
Long Descripton: Creatures within the emanation area (or those who enter it) can't speak any deliberate and intentional lies. Each potentially affected creature is allowed a save to avoid the effects when the spell is cast or when the creature first enters the emanation area. Affected creatures are aware of this enchantment. Therefore, they may avoid answering questions to which they would normally respond with a lie, or they may be evasive as long as they remain within the boundaries of the truth. Creatures who leave the area are free to speak as they choose.
